story: Once upon a time, there was a little car named Red. Red loved to zoom around the house and play with his toy friends. One day, it was very hot outside and Red could feel the heat on his shiny red paint. He decided to stay inside and play with his friends instead. But when Red went to play with his friend Blue, Blue was being rude and wouldn't share his toys. Red felt sad and didn't know what to do. Suddenly, Red had an idea. He zoomed over to his toy box and grabbed his favorite toy. He went back to Blue and offered to share his toy. Blue was surprised and felt bad for being rude. They both played together and had a great time. From that day on, they were the best of friends and always shared their toys.

Once upon a time, there was a white bunny. The bunny loved to hop and play in the big green field. In the field, there was a lot of tall corn. The bunny liked to hide in the corn and play with his friends. One day, the bunny heard about a big race. All the animals in the field wanted to see who was the fastest. The bunny thought he could win. He practiced running every day, and his friends would clap and applaud for him. The day of the race came, and all the animals lined up. The bunny was very excited. When the race started, the bunny ran as fast as he could. He remembered the corn and had an idea. He hopped through the corn and came out ahead of all the other animals. The bunny won the race, and all his friends cheered and applauded for him.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a toy car that was hers, and she loved it very much. One day, Lily's friend, Timmy, came over to play. Timmy saw Lily's car and wanted to play with it, but Lily said, "No, it's mine!" Timmy got upset and started to cry. Lily felt bad that Timmy was sad, so she tried to think of a way to make him happy. She remembered that she had another toy car that was just like hers. She went to get it and gave it to Timmy. He was so enthusiastic and happy to have his own car to play with. But then, Lily realized that her toy car wouldn't fit in the toy garage that she had. She started to get upset because she loved her car too. Timmy saw that Lily was sad and asked her what was wrong. Lily explained the problem, and Timmy had an idea. He suggested that they build a bigger garage together so that both of their cars could fit. Lily thought it was a great idea, and they worked together to build a new garage. In the end, they were both happy and had fun playing with their cars.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who really wanted to sail. She had a great big boat with lots of toys and snacks.  She had a delicious picnic every day before she left to sail around the ocean. Every day she would sail farther and farther away. One day while she was sailing, she sailed all the way to an island. She explored the island and found an exam! She was so excited and wanted to take it. She took the exam and did her very best. When she finished, the exam congratulated her and told her that she passed!  She was so happy and thanked the exam. Then she sailed back home. Along the way, she stopped to eat a delicious dinner of her favorite foods.  When she finally arrived home, her friends and family congratulated her on passing the exam and proudly said, "You did it!"

One day, a mommy and her little girl went to the mall. The mommy had something important to do. But the little girl was very stubborn and wanted to go to the toy store. She begged and begged, so the mommy put her in charge of the shopping cart and said she could go do what she wanted. The little girl was so excited, she ran straight to the toy store. But once she was inside, the mommy gave her a lecture. The mommy said she needed to be careful and not buy anything without asking. The mommy also said if the little girl was still stubborn, she had to put the cart back at the front of the store before she left. The little girl was sad to have to put the cart back. But she was also very excited to go into the toy store. So she listened to her mommy's lecture and put the shopping cart back up front. Then she ran inside the toy store and had lots of fun.

One day, little Sam was walking through the village. He was very excited to explore all the new places. Everywhere he looked he saw beautiful orange flowers, little blue houses and all sorts of animals. But then, as he got closer to the center of the village, he heard something. It sounded like someone was trembling. Little Sam looked around and saw a frightened little kitten trembling under a bush. He was sad for the kitty and wanted to help. He kneeled down and softly said: "Why are you trembling little kitty?" The scared kitty answered: "I am afraid of humans. If I get closer, they will hurt me". Little Sam was so sad to hear this. He gently picked the kitty up and said: "I won't hurt you, I just want to be your friend".  The kitty was still trembling, but slowly she started to trust Sam. The two of them became the best of friends.  This story teaches us that it's important to be kind and understanding to all living creatures, even if they are scared of us at first. With time and patience, we can make even the most trembling creatures our friends.

One day, a young girl named Jane was walking in the park. She saw a banana on the ground and wanted to pick it up and eat it. When she tried, it slipped out of her hand and dropped to the ground. Jane was so sad, she tried picking it up again, but she was too weak. So she just looked at the banana and started crying. Suddenly, an old man came along. He had seen what happened, so he bent down and picked up the banana. He gave it to Jane and said, "Here you go! This banana is all yours!" Jane was so happy! She gave the old man a big hug and said, "Thank you." Jane put the banana in her pocket and went on her way, feeling much better about things.

Once upon a time, there was a friendly horse named Brownie. Brownie lived in a big field with lots of other animals. One day, Brownie got stuck in a big puddle of mud. He tried to get out, but he couldn't.  Luckily, a boy named Timmy saw Brownie and wanted to save him. Timmy ran to get his dad, who came with a big rope. They put the rope around Brownie and pulled him out of the mud. Brownie was so happy to be free!  From that day on, Brownie and Timmy became good friends. They would play and run around the field together. Brownie was grateful that Timmy had saved him, and Timmy was happy to have a new friend. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a young bird. It had just hatched from its egg and was very delicate. Its mommy bird took care of it and taught it how to fly. The young bird felt very happy when it finally learned how to fly. One day, the young bird saw a big and juicy worm on the ground. It felt very hungry and wanted to eat the worm. But the mommy bird warned it that the worm might be dangerous. The young bird didn't listen and ate the worm anyway. After a while, the young bird started to feel sick. It regretted not listening to its mommy bird. It realized that it should have been more careful and not eaten something that looked suspicious. From then on, the young bird promised to always listen to its mommy bird and be more careful in the future.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. One day, Timmy was playing with his toy truck when he accidentally pulled off one of its wheels. He tried to put it back on, but he couldn't do it by himself. Timmy's mom called the doctor, who was a very nice man. The doctor came over and saw Timmy's toy truck. He said that it was a rare truck and that he would fix it for Timmy. The doctor pulled out his tools and fixed the wheel in no time. Timmy was very happy that his truck was fixed and he thanked the doctor. From that day on, Timmy always made sure to be careful with his toys so that he wouldn't have to call the doctor again.

Molly was a 3 year old who had a lemon tree in her garden. One day, she decided to pick a lemon from the tree. She was so excited. As she grabbed the lemon, juice started to drip from it. Molly quickly wiped the juice away with her sleeve. Molly then asked her mom if she could make a lemonade. Her mom agreed and gave her a recipe. It included lemon juice and sugar. Molly got to work and started to squeeze the lemon. She was having a great time.  Molly started to worry when she noticed that her hands had become sticky from the lemon juice. She asked her mom: “How do I stop my hands from getting sticky?” Her mom replied: “You need to wipe your hands. That’s perfectly normal.” Molly took a cloth and wiped her hands until they were clean and nice again. After that, she finished making her lemonade. She couldn’t wait to take a sip and show the lemonade to all of her friends!

Once upon a time there were two best friends, John and Paula. One day they were walking through the park when they stopped to look at something big. John said, "What's that?" Paula pointed and said, "It's a big cone." John said, "What's included in the cone?" Paula smiled and said, "Lots of ice cream. We should get one." John and Paula got a big cone each and started eating it. They enjoyed it so much they kept going back for more.  John and Paula loved the big cone so much they kept going back to the park and eating it. They even learned to share the big cone, which made them the best of friends!

Lily and Ben are going to visit Grandma and Grandpa. They are very happy. Mom says they need to pack their bags. She gives them each a big cloth bag. Lily puts her doll, her book, and her pink hat in her bag. She also puts in a red cloth for her doll's bed. She zips her bag and smiles. She is ready. Ben puts his car, his ball, and his blue hat in his bag. He also puts in a green cloth for his car's garage. He zips his bag and laughs. He is ready. Mom looks at their bags and shakes her head. She says they need to pack some serious things too. She says they need clothes, shoes, and toothbrushes. She helps them take out some toys and put in some serious things. She zips their bags again and hugs them. She says they are ready. Lily and Ben take their bags and go to the car. They are very excited. They can't wait to see Grandma and Grandpa. They wave to Mom and say thank you. They are going to have fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a big book called a dictionary. Tim loved to look at the pictures in the dictionary. He liked to learn new words. One day, Tim was very hungry. He wanted to eat a cookie. But his mom said, "No, Tim, you cannot eat a cookie now. It is almost time for dinner." Tim was sad. He did not want to wait for dinner. Tim had an idea. He went to his dictionary and found a picture of a cookie. He thought that if he put the picture in front of his face, it would prevent him from being hungry. So, he tried it. But it didn't work. Tim was still hungry. He knew he had to wait for dinner. And when dinner came, it was delicious. Tim was happy, and he learned that sometimes, it is good to wait.

Once upon a time, there was a funny penguin. He liked to play in the snow and eat ice cream with his friends. One day, the penguin was walking in the snow when he noticed something strange. The snow seemed to be melting!  The penguin called out to his friends, "Oh no! Something is happening to the snow!" One of his friends replied, "What do you mean?" "The snow is melting!" the penguin replied. The other penguin said, "Oh no! That's not very fun! What should we do?" The funny penguin thought for a moment, then said, "Let's go find the North Pole and see if we can help stop the melting." So the two penguins began their journey to the North Pole. Along the way, they made more friends, and when they finally reached the North Pole, they worked together to stop the melting snow.  Thanks to the team of penguins, the snow was saved! From that day on, they all enjoyed lots of fun in the snow. The End.

Once upon a time there was a girl called Lucy. She loved to swing all day long. One summer she decided to visit a special park. It was a maze and in the middle she found a swing. Lucy was so excited and hopped on the swing right away. As she was swinging Lucy noticed a bitter smell in the air. She wondered what could be making a smell like that. Looking around she spotted a big tree in the corner of the maze and she decided to go and see it. When she got close to the tree Lucy was surprised. She saw that there were lots of tiny little fruit growing from the branches. They were so bitter that it made her eyes water. Lucy decided to take one home and planted it in her garden. Every day Lucy would swing and watch her little tree grow until it was full of bitter fruit. She would pick the fruit and make a delicious tart with them. Lucy enjoyed the tart every day and she was able to swing and play in the maze more than ever.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Tom. Tom loved to play and have adventures in the forest near his home. One day, as he was walking through the forest he heard a soft voice. He stopped to listen and the voice said, "Hello Tom! I am a magical fairy". Tom was so excited and asked, "What can you do?" The fairy smiled and said, "I can do lots of things, but I'm very intelligent so I can make special things happen." Tom asked the fairy if it could make him fly. The fairy thought for a moment then said, "Yes, I can make it happen. But you have to stop for a minute. Can you do that?" Tom stopped and the fairy waved his wand. Tom felt himself start to float and smiled with delight. He waved goodbye to the fairy and flew away feeling very lucky to have a magical fairy friend.

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Emily and Joe.  Joe said to Emily, "Let's pretend that we are going on a trip."  Emily smiled. "Ok! What should we bring with us?"  "Let's take the toy luggage," said Joe.  So Emily and Joe went to the playroom and grabbed the wide toy luggage.  They pretended that each of them had their own suitcase and imagined a wonderful trip. They had so much fun that day!

Ben and Mia like to play in the park. They run and jump and slide and swing. They have fun with their friends and their toys. But sometimes they get hot and thirsty. Then they look for a place to rest and drink. One day, they find a big rock under a tree. The rock is cool and smooth. They sit on the rock and pause. They drink some water from their bottles. They feel better. They talk and laugh and watch the birds and bugs. But then they hear a loud noise. It is a big truck. The truck comes to the park. It has a big shovel and a big bucket. It digs up the dirt and the grass. It makes a big hole. Ben and Mia are scared. They wonder what the truck is doing. They see a man get out of the truck. He has a hat and a vest and a tool. He walks to the rock. He puts the tool on the rock. He pushes a button. The tool makes a loud noise. It breaks the rock. Ben and Mia are sad. They like the rock. They do not want the rock to break. They run to the man. They shout and wave. They ask him to stop. They tell him the rock is their friend. They tell him the rock is cool and smooth. They tell him they sit on the rock and pause. They tell him they drink water on the rock. They tell him they love the rock. The man hears them. He looks at them. He smiles. He stops the tool. He puts it down. He walks to them. He kneels. He talks to them. He tells them he is sorry. He tells them he did not know. He tells them he needs the rock. He tells them the rock is hot. He tells them the rock has fire inside. He tells them he uses the fire to make things. He tells them he makes things for people. He tells them he makes things for them. Ben and Mia listen. They are curious. They ask him questions. He answers them. He shows them the truck. He shows them the shovel and the bucket. He shows them the hole. He shows them the rock. He shows them the fire. He shows them the things. He tells them stories. He makes them laugh. Ben and Mia are happy. They learn new things. They make a new friend. They understand why he needs the rock. They say goodbye to the rock. They thank the rock for being cool and smooth. They thank the rock for letting them sit and pause. They thank the rock for giving them fire. They hug the rock. They hug the man. They run back to the park. They play some more. They have fun. They are hot and thirsty. They look for a new place to rest and drink. They find a new rock. They hope the truck does not come.

Once upon a time there was a family who had been given a box by an old wise man. Inside the box was a bag of gold coins. They were so excited when they saw the bag. They opened it feeling reliable and happy.  One of the coins was shiny and solid gold. The family wanted to keep it as it was a very special coin. So they removed the gold coin from the bag and placed it safely in their pocket. From then on, the family was reliable. They always had the gold coin with them wherever they went. Whenever times were tough, the gold coin reminded the family that they had something to be thankful for.  The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big box. The box had many toys inside. It also had a fake button. The button was red and shiny. A little boy named Tim found the box. He was very happy. Tim showed the box to his friend, Sue. "Look what I found!" he said. Sue looked at the button. "What does it do?" she asked. "I don't know," said Tim. "Let's find out!" They pressed the button. Nothing happened. They pressed it again. Still nothing. They were sad. They wanted the button to do something fun. But it was a fake button. So, it did not work. Tim and Sue played with the other toys in the box. They had fun for a little while. But they kept thinking about the button. They wished it was real. They wished it could do something amazing. In the end, they put the toys back in the box. They closed the lid. They walked away feeling sad. The fake button had made them feel bad. They wished they had never found the box.

Sara and Tom like to play in the park. They have a big board that they use to slide down the hill. They take turns to hold the board and run to the top of the hill. Then they sit on the board and slide down fast. They laugh and have fun. One day, they see a small dog in the park. The dog is alone and looks sad. Sara and Tom want to pet the dog, but the dog is nervous. He runs away from them and goes to the pond. The pond has water and ducks. The dog sees a duck and barks. He jumps into the water and tries to catch the duck. But the dog is not good at swimming. He sinks and splashes. He is scared and cries. Sara and Tom hear the dog and run to the pond. They see the dog in the water and want to help him. They look for something to rescue the dog. They see their board and have an idea. They put the board in the water and push it to the dog. The dog sees the board and climbs on it. He is wet and cold, but he is safe. Sara and Tom pull the board to the shore and hug the dog. The dog licks their faces and wags his tail. He is happy and grateful. Sara and Tom are happy and proud. They have rescued the dog. They decide to take the dog home and ask their mom if they can keep him. They hope she will say yes. They love the dog and the dog loves them. They are friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Bongo. Bongo loved to play with his friends in the forest. One day, he saw a funny looking razor on the ground. He picked it up and showed it to his friend, a little bunny named Benny. Benny said, "What is that?" Bongo said, "I don't know, but it looks funny." Benny said, "Be careful, it looks sharp." Bongo said, "I won't touch it. Let's go play." As they were playing, Bongo saw a beautiful butterfly. He wanted to kiss it, but it flew away too fast. Benny said, "Don't worry, Bongo. Maybe you can kiss it next time." Bongo smiled and said, "Thanks, Benny. You're a good friend." And they continued to play in the forest, happy and carefree.

Lily and Ben were playing on the beach. They liked to make sand castles and dig holes. They also liked to wave at the boats and the birds. Sometimes they found shells and stones and put them in their buckets. One day, they saw a big boat with a wide sail. It was white and blue and had a flag on it. Lily and Ben waved at the boat and hoped it would wave back. But the boat did not wave back. It came closer and closer to the shore. "Look, Ben, the boat is coming to us!" Lily said. "Maybe they have sugar for us!" Ben said. He liked sugar very much. He wanted to eat some sugar with his sand cake. But when the boat reached the land, Lily and Ben saw that it was not a nice boat. It was a pirate boat! The pirates had swords and hooks and eye patches. They jumped off the boat and ran to the beach. They saw Lily and Ben and their buckets. "Arrr, what have we here? Some little landlubbers with treasure!" one pirate said. "Give us your buckets, or we'll make you walk the plank!" another pirate said. Lily and Ben were scared. They did not want to give their buckets. They did not want to walk the plank. They did not want to see the pirates. They wanted to run away. "Help, help!" they cried. But no one heard them. The pirates grabbed their buckets and laughed. They dumped the shells and stones on the sand and looked for gold and jewels. But they did not find any. They only found sand and more sand. "These buckets are full of sand! Where is the treasure?" one pirate said. "Maybe they hid it somewhere else!" another pirate said. "Let's find it! Come on, mates, let's search the beach!" the first pirate said. The pirates left the buckets and ran to look for treasure. They did not see Lily and Ben, who were hiding behind a big rock. They waited until the pirates were far away. Then they ran to their buckets and picked them up. They ran to their mom and dad, who were sitting on a blanket. They told them what happened. "Mom, dad, the pirates took our buckets and looked for treasure, but they only found sand!" Lily said. "They were mean and scary and they did not wave back!" Ben said. Mom and dad hugged them and said they were brave and smart. They said they were sorry that the pirates took their buckets, but they were glad that they were safe. They said they would buy them new buckets and more shells and stones. They said they would also buy them some sugar for their sand cake. Lily and Ben smiled and said thank you. They were happy to have their mom and dad. They did not like the pirates. They hoped they would never see them again. They ate some sugar and made a new sand castle. They waved at the boats and the birds. And they hoped that someone would wave back.

Tom is sick. He has a bad cough and a hot head. Mom says he needs to lie down and rest. She gives him a pill and some water. She says the pill will make him feel better. But Tom does not like the pill. It is big and bitter. He spits it out when Mom is not looking. He hides it under his pillow. He thinks Mom will not know. Mom comes back to check on Tom. She sees his pillow is wet. She lifts it up and finds the pill. She is angry and sad. She says to Tom, "Why did you spit out the pill? It is good for you. Do you want to be sick forever?" Tom is scared. He says, "I'm sorry, Mom. I don't like the pill. It is yucky. Can I have something else?" Mom sighs. She says, "No, Tom. You have to take the pill. It is the only thing that can help you. If you don't take it, you might get worse. You might lose your voice or your hearing. Do you want to be deaf?" Tom shakes his head. He does not want to be deaf. He likes to hear Mom's voice and the birds and the music. He says, "OK, Mom. I will take the pill. But can you stay with me and read me a story?" Mom smiles. She says, "Of course, Tom. I love you. I want you to be well. Come on, let's try again. Swallow the pill and I will read you your favorite story." Tom nods. He takes the pill and drinks some water. He makes a face, but he does not spit it out. He lies down and cuddles with Mom. Mom reads him a story about a brave knight and a friendly dragon. Tom feels a little better. He closes his eyes and listens to Mom's voice. He falls asleep.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny. He was hopping around in the meadow, looking for something fun. He saw a big, shiny slide and hopped over to it. As he put his paw on it, he heard a soft voice say, “Be careful! I’m very fragile.” Startled, the little bunny jumped back and saw a butterfly on a flower near the slide. The bunny said, “Oh, I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to hurt you!” The butterfly replied, “It’s okay. I just want you to be careful when you go down the slide. It’s very fragile and I don’t want it to break.” The bunny was very careful as he slid down the slide and then hopped around in the meadow. He made sure to be gentle with the slide and the butterfly. The bunny had a lot of fun exploring and playing in the meadow.

Once upon a time, in a small house, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big toy box filled with many toys. One day, her friend Tim came over to play. "Can I borrow your toy car?" Tim asked Lily. Lily said, "Yes, you can borrow my toy car, but you must be nice to it." Tim played with the toy car, but he was not nice. He threw the car on the floor, and it broke. Lily was sad, and Tim felt bad. Later, they went to the kitchen for a snack. Lily's mom gave them apples to eat. But Tim's apple was spoiled. "Yuck! My stomach hurts," said Tim. Lily's mom told them, "It's important to check your food before you eat it." After that day, Tim learned to be more careful with toys and food. He promised to be nice to Lily's toys and to always check his food. Lily and Tim played together every day, and they became the best of friends.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Abby who was very small and only three years old. She loved the color white and always wished she could see a white unicorn. One day, she decided to go for a walk in the woods near her home. As she walked, she saw a white unicorn in the distance! She wanted to go closer, but was scared and unsure. Then, the unicorn spoke to her softly, saying “you have the sight to heal my broken heart, I've been alone a long time.” Abby was surprised and asked the unicorn: “how can I help you?” The unicorn replied: “by seeing me with your heart and not your eyes. Believe that I'm here and that I can be the friend you need.”  Abby nodded and closed her eyes. Her heart was filled with a warmth that spread through her whole body. She opened her eyes and the unicorn was there. She hugged it and its broken heart healed. Abby and the white unicorn became best friends. She stayed in the woods with it each and every day, and together they created magical memories.

Once upon a time there was a gifted stack of little blocks. The stack was made up of different shapes and colors, and the little blocks could do amazing things.  One day, a curious 3 year old crept over to the stack, and decided to poke it gently. But to her surprise, the stack started to move! It quivered and shifted, growing before her eyes. The little girl was too scared to move, and watched in amazement as the stack rearranged itself into a beautiful tower. When the tower was complete, the little girl clapped her hands in delight, and then carefully hugged the stack.  The gifted stack was so happy to have made the little girl happy, it rewarded her with a special gift - a bright and shiny ball of twine.  The little girl thanked her new friend for the wonderful gift and took the twine off to play, leaving the stack of blocks peacefully in the room.

Once there was a little boy who was feeling very miserable. He had been playing outside all day and was feeling so very tired.  He walked into a big room with a big fireplace in it. All of a sudden, he heard a strange popping sound coming from inside the fireplace. He peeked inside and there was a tiny, sparkly fairy! The fairy wanted to thank the little boy for discovering her and said to him, "I want to pay you for being so brave, young one". The fairy waved her wand and tiny stars appeared all around him. She then said, "It's all yours now, my little buddy". The little boy smiled and was so excited. He thanked the fairy and told her that he would never forget her. The fairy then flew away and the little boy waved goodbye. He was so happy that he had made a new, magical friend.  He carried the tiny stars with him everywhere he went and never felt miserable again.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys all day long. He had a big, red ball that he liked to throw and catch. One day, Timmy's ball disappeared! He looked and looked, but he couldn't find it anywhere. Timmy started to feel a pain in his tummy. He was sad because he loved his ball so much. His mommy came to see what was wrong and Timmy told her about his lost ball. She said not to worry and that they would find it together. They searched high and low, but the ball was nowhere to be found. Timmy thought it was stupid that his ball had disappeared. Just when he was about to give up, his mommy spotted something red in the bushes. It was Timmy's ball! Timmy was so happy and the pain in his tummy disappeared. He hugged his mommy and thanked her for helping him find his ball.

Once upon a time, there was a big farm with lots of animals. The farmer had a dog named Max. Max was a very obedient dog who always listened to the farmer. One day, the farmer told Max to fill up a bucket with water from the well. Max ran to the well and filled up the bucket. Suddenly, a tornado came and started spinning around the farm. The farmer and the animals were scared. Max barked and ran around the farm to protect everyone. He was very brave. After the tornado passed, the farmer saw that Max had filled up all the animal's water troughs before the tornado came. The farmer was so happy and gave Max a big bone as a reward. From that day on, Max was known as the hero of the farm.

Ben and Mia were playing in the park. They liked to run, slide and swing. They saw a big tree with many colors. It had green, yellow, red and brown leaves. They ran to the tree and looked at it. "Wow, this tree is so pretty!" Mia said. "I like the colors. They are different from the other trees." "Yes, they are," Ben said. "The tree is changing. It is getting ready for winter. Soon, the leaves will fall and the tree will have no colors." "Will the tree be sad?" Mia asked. "No, the tree will not be sad," Ben said. "The tree will rest and wait for spring. Then, it will grow new leaves and flowers. The tree is strong and brave." Ben and Mia admired the tree. They wanted to be like the tree. They picked some leaves and made a strip of them. They put the strip around their heads like a crown. "Look, we are the king and the queen of the park!" Ben said. "We are!" Mia said. "And we are different and beautiful, like the tree!" They laughed and played with their crowns. They felt happy and proud. They loved the tree and each other.

Andy and Jane were playing in the living room. Suddenly, Andy heard a noise coming from behind the curtain. He shouted "What is that?" Jane was scared and ran away. Andy didn't know what to do, so he decided to take a peek. He bravely opened the curtain and his heart felt hurt when he saw a mouse. He didn't know how to deal with this and he started to shout and scream. Jane, who had been hiding, came back to help him and she shouted too, which scared the mouse away. Andy and Jane hugged each other and they were relieved that there was no more conflict.

A soldier was walking around the park when he saw a cool playground. He smiled as he remembered when he was a little boy and used to play in the same playground. He sat down on the swing and looked around. Suddenly, he noticed something big next to him. It was a big, cool dragonfly! He was very surprised to see it and he didn't know what to do. The soldier reached out to touch the dragonfly but it quickly flew away! He was sad that the dragonfly was gone but he knew he had made a friend. He was sure that when he came back to the park, the dragonfly would be back too. The soldier smiled and decided to take a walk around the park. He heard some children playing and laughing. He waved at them and they waved back. He felt happy knowing that they all had made a cool new friend.

The waves were crashing against the shore and the tide was coming in. John and his dog, Rover, went running to the beach to enjoy the day. The sand was hot and the sun was shining.  John and Rover played in the waves. John loved feeling the coolness of the water as it touched his toes. He kicked and splashed around with his dog. Rover always made John laugh when he got dizzy from spinning and running around in circles. John and Rover collected stones and shells. They laughed as they found the prettiest ones to take home. They threw sticks in the water and had a race to see who could fetch them back first. When the sun was setting, they were sad to leave the beach. But they filled their bags with the wonderful treasures they collected, knowing they could come back and enjoy the beach again.

Once upon a time, there was a package. It was a special package full of surprises. One day, the package started to increase. It got bigger and bigger as it filled with more and more stuff. At first, the package was very happy. The things inside were sweet and nice. But then one day, something sour arrived. It made the package sad. The sour was so strong that it made the package worry. The package didn't know what to do. The sourness was increasing, and it was scared. But then one day, it felt something inside it. It was small, but happy. It couldn't be sour! The package realized it was a smile. The package was excited and happy. The smile made the sour go away. The package was happy again, and the smile stayed with it always. No matter what, it always increased the package's happiness.

Lily and Sam liked to go to the park with their mom. They liked to play on the swings, slide down the slide, and run on the grass. Sometimes, they also liked to buy ice cream from the vendor. The vendor was a nice man who had a big cart with many flavors of ice cream. One day, they went to the park and saw the vendor. They ran to him and asked for ice cream. But there was a problem. There was a big dog next to the cart. The dog was barking and growling. It did not let anyone get close to the cart. It wanted to eat all the ice cream. The vendor was scared of the dog. He tried to shoo it away, but it did not listen. He tried to call for help, but no one heard him. He did not know what to do. The dog was preventing him from selling ice cream. Lily and Sam were sad and impatient. They really wanted ice cream. They did not like the dog. They wished it would go away. They looked around and saw a stick. They had an idea. They picked up the stick and threw it far away. The dog saw the stick and ran after it. It forgot about the ice cream. The vendor was happy and relieved. He thanked Lily and Sam for their help. He gave them each a big scoop of ice cream. They chose their favorite flavors. They licked their ice cream and smiled. They were glad they could prevent the dog from ruining their fun. They enjoyed their ice cream and their day at the park.

Lily liked to ride her motorcycle. It was red and shiny and made a loud noise. She felt independent when she rode it, like she could go anywhere she wanted. She did not like to share her motorcycle with anyone. One day, she took her motorcycle to the park. She saw a boy playing with a ball. He looked at her motorcycle and smiled. He ran over to her and said, "Hi, I'm Ben. Can I try your motorcycle?" Lily shook her head. "No, this is mine. Go away." Ben frowned. He did not like her answer. He reached for her motorcycle and tried to pull it away from her. Lily got angry. She bit his hand hard. "Ow!" Ben cried. He let go of the motorcycle and ran away. He had a red mark on his hand where Lily bit him. Lily felt proud. She had defended her motorcycle. She got on it and rode away. She did not care about Ben or his ball. She only cared about her motorcycle. She was independent.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play outside. One day, she saw a pretty butterfly and wanted to catch it. She tried to take it, but it flew away. She felt frustrated and sad. Lily went to her friend Timmy's house to play. They decided to play hide and seek. Timmy hid behind a fence and Lily tried to find him. She looked everywhere but couldn't find him. She felt frustrated again. Suddenly, Timmy jumped out from behind the fence and scared Lily. She laughed and felt happy again. They played together until it was time to go home. Lily realized that even though she couldn't take the butterfly or find Timmy at first, she still had fun playing with her friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who loved picking berries in the woods. One day, she went to pick berries but found something even better- an incredible berry bush! It was loaded with huge, juicy berries and the little girl was so excited! She couldn't believe what she was seeing!  The little girl paused while filling her basket. Suddenly, she heard a noise. A baby bear was walking up to her from the woods! She froze in fear. The bear came closer and closer until it stopped in front of her. "Would you like to eat some of these delicious berries with me?" it asked with a smile.  The little girl was so surprised that she could barely answer. Finally, she said, "Yes, I would love to!" She and the baby bear shared the incredible berries together, talking and laughing until the sun went down.  The little girl said goodbye to her new friend and ran home, happy and full of the most delicious berries. She couldn't wait to come back and pick berries with the baby bear again!

Once upon a time, there was a big, strong man. He wanted to protect his house, so he got a big bag of nails. He hammered the nails into the walls of his house to make it safe. Next day, the man got up and saw that his house was looking clean and safe. He smiled and thanked the nails for protecting his house. But the man had a problem. Some of the nails were sticking out of the wall. They looked sharp and dangerous. The man was worried that someone might get hurt.  The man thought and thought and finally came up with an idea. He took some big pieces of cloth and made sure they covered all the sharp nails. Now his house would look clean and also be safe. The man was happy. He had found a way to protect his house and keep everyone safe too. He learned that it's important to always think about safety when building something.

Once upon a time there lived an adorable little spider called Steve. One day Steve was walking in the garden and saw something exciting. He decided to take a closer look. Steve got closer and saw a big rock. He started to rub the rock with his tiny little legs. Suddenly, the rock started to move.  Steve was so surprised that he jumped back. He saw something emerge from underneath the rock. It was a little rabbit. The rabbit said, "Hi there! What are you doing?"  Steve replied, "Hi! I'm just rubbing this rock." The rabbit said, "Ah, that's nice" and they both went back to rubbing the rock.  They had so much fun that they both forgot to stop. After a while, Steve realized how late it was and said goodbye to the rabbit and went home. Steve was so happy that he made a new friend! He knew that this would be an adventure he would never forget.

Once upon a time there was an old man. He liked sausages very much. Every day he knelt down near a bush to look for the sausages hidden there. One day the old man found a sausage, but it was bitter! He tried to eat it but he didn't like it. So he knelt down again and found another. This time the sausage was much better and it was not bitter. The old man was so happy! He ate his sausage with a smile on his face. The end.

Max and his Mom were standing in the park. It was a bright and sunny day. They were looking for a secret. It was a delicate secret and no one knew where it was. "Mommy, do you know where the secret is?" asked Max.  "Not yet, Max. We'll have to look around," said Mom. So they walked around the park, looking in the trees, on the grass and behind the benches. Finally, they found the secret. It was a delicate little blue flower. Max smiled. "It's so pretty, Mommy!"  Mom smiled too. "Yes, it is," she said. "This tiny flower is our secret."  Max was so happy. He had found a delicate secret in the park with his Mom.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a loyal dog. The dog was very smart and had a big brain. He loved to play with his friends, the rabbit and the bird. One day, while they were playing, the rabbit's toy ball vanished. The rabbit was very sad. The loyal dog wanted to help find the ball. He used his big brain to think of where it could be. The dog, the rabbit, and the bird looked everywhere. They looked under the trees, in the bushes, and near the river. At last, they found the ball behind a big rock. The rabbit was so happy to have his ball back. The friends learned that if they work together, they can solve any problem. The loyal dog, the rabbit, and the bird were always there for each other. And they lived happily ever after.

Lila and Ben were friends who liked to play in the garden. They saw many flowers, bugs and birds. They also saw a big plant with green beans. Lila liked beans and wanted to pick some. "Look, Ben, beans!" Lila said and pointed to the plant. "Let's get some for lunch." Ben shook his head. "No, Lila, we can't. Those are not our beans. They belong to Mr. Fox. He is very mean and will be angry if we take his beans." Lila did not listen to Ben. She thought Mr. Fox was not home and would not know. She ran to the plant and pulled some beans. "Come on, Ben, these beans are great. Don't be scared." Ben was scared. He saw Mr. Fox coming back from the woods. He had a big basket of food. He also had sharp teeth and claws. He saw Lila and Ben near his plant. He was very angry. "Hey, you little thieves! What are you doing with my beans?" Mr. Fox shouted and ran to them. "Give them back or I will eat you!" Lila and Ben were very sorry. They dropped the beans and tried to run away. But Mr. Fox was faster and caught them. He put them in his basket and took them to his house. He cooked them with his beans and ate them for lunch. The moral of the story is: Do not take what is not yours. Listen to your friends who warn you. Or you may end up in a bad place.

Once there was a girl who loved to talk. Whenever she talked, everyone around her listened with great attention. One day, she was feeling brave and decided to go on an adventure. Her parents agreed and she went to the beach. She talked to a lobster and asked it about the beach. The lobster was very friendly and started to talk about a strange looking shrimp. He said it was very unusual, not like the normal shrimp. The girl was intrigued so she looked for the strange shrimp. After looking for a while, she finally found one. It was tall and green, nothing like the other shrimp. The girl was fascinated and asked the shrimp where it had come from. The shrimp told her it came from a magical place on the other end of the beach. The girl was very excited. She thanked the shrimp and ran off in search of this magical place she had heard about. She ran and she ran until she found the entrance to a secret beach filled with magical creatures. From that day forward, the girl and the shrimp were the best of friends and she often visited the secret beach with her shrimp.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who loved to skip. Every day she would go outside and skip down the street. She was always so happy. One day she noticed something strange. In the neighbor’s garden, there was a crop of corn growing. The little girl was curious and wanted to try it. So she went into the garden and tried the corn. It was so sweet and delicious. Suddenly, she felt guilty. She hadn’t asked the neighbor if she could take the corn. She knew it was wrong and she had to tell the neighbor. So she quickly ran over to the neighbor’s house and told her what she had done. The neighbor said it was alright but asked her to never do it again. The little girl was relieved and promised that she wouldn't do it again. After that, she kept skipping down the street, happier than ever.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was feeling scared as it was suddenly very dark outside. The wind was so cold that it made her shiver. Suddenly she heard a strange noise in the air. It was like something big was flying towards her. She wrote and hid behind a tree. But then what she saw was amazing! A huge purple dragon had come to give her a big surprise! She was so happy and waved her hands to give it a welcome. The dragon stepped down from the sky and gave the little girl a big hug. She didn't shiver anymore. She knew she was safe. The dragon said its goodbyes, flapped its huge purple wings and flew away into the night. The little girl was never scared anymore. She felt safe and happy and knew that the purple dragon was always looking out for her.

Once upon a time, there was a dry river. It had been dry for a long, long time. One day, a big truck was struggling to go up a steep hill. The truck got stuck and went over the side of the hill, crashing and becoming a wreck. The driver of the truck was struggling to get out of the wreck and into the dry river. He had to climb until he found a way out. After a long time of struggling, the driver finally made it out of the wreck and into the dry river. He walked down the dry river and eventually reached the other side. He was thankful he made it out safely - but he never wanted to go through that struggle again!

One day, Steve was playing in his room when he saw a switch on the floor. He immediately got very curious and asked his mother what it was. "It's a switch, sweetheart," his mother said. "Now why don't you go play with the other toys in your room." Steve didn't listen and kept looking at the switch. He wanted to know what it did. His mother smiled and said, "Let's gather some other toys, and you can use the switch to turn them on and off. That way, you can practice being patient until the toys do what you want them to do." Steve was very excited. He grabbed some of his favorite toys, like his car and stuffed animal, and waited for the switch to work. He pressed the switch and watched as the car started to move. "Yay," Steve shouted. He was so pleased that he wanted to keep pressing the switch, so he started to turn each toy on and off. The switch made Steve happy, and he was so patient while he waited for the toys to do what he wanted them to. He just kept pressing the switch until it was time for bed.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny was very cute and everyone thought he was adorable. One day, Benny wanted to go to the other side of the hall to get some carrots. But the hall was very long and Benny struggled to get to the other side. As Benny was struggling, he saw a little bird that had fallen from its nest. The bird was in trouble and needed help. Benny knew he had to help the bird, even though it was hard for him to move in the hall. Benny hopped over to the bird and helped it back into the nest. Benny learned that even though things can be hard and you might struggle, it's important to help others in need. And that's what makes you a good friend. From that day on, Benny always looked out for his friends and helped them whenever they needed it.

Mum and Dad took Daisy to the shop. Daisy was very excited. When they got to the shop, they could see lots of things. Mum said to Dad,"What should we get for Daisy?" Dad said,"Let's get her something important!" Mum and Dad decided to get Daisy a special toy. Daisy was so happy! She wanted to go and get it straight away. Mum said, "Not so fast, Daisy. We still have to tell the shop lady what we want!" Daisy told the shop lady what she wanted. Then the shop lady gave Daisy her toy. Mum and Dad were very proud of Daisy. They said,"It was important that you told the shop lady what you wanted. Now you have your special toy!" Daisy smiled really big and said,"Yay! I love my special toy."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Sarah who loved puzzles. One day, her mommy and daddy bought her a big, expensive puzzle.  Sarah was so excited and quickly opened the box. She wanted to start doing the puzzle right away. She carefully took out all the pieces and scattered them around the floor.  Her mommy looked at her and said, "Sarah, do you know what puzzles are for?"  Sarah nervously nodded as her eyes lit up.  "That's right," said her mommy. "Puzzles are for putting together, not scattering. Can you help me put it together?"  Sarah smiled and quickly got to work.  Together, Sarah and her mommy put the pieces into place one by one, until the expensive puzzle was finally completed. Sarah proudly looked at her puzzle and smiled.  The end.

Once upon a time, there was a great big fish named Bob. He lived in a pond near a pretty park. Bob loved to swim and play with his friends all day long. One day, Bob saw a shiny hook hanging in the water. He didn't know what it was, so he swam closer to take a look. His friend, Sam the turtle, saw him and said, "Bob, be careful! That hook is not a toy. It can hurt you!" Bob looked at Sam and gave a little shrug. He said, "I just want to see what it is." Sam replied, "Okay, but please be safe." So, Bob swam closer to the hook, but he didn't touch it. He saw that it was sharp and decided to swim away. Bob told all his friends about the shiny hook and how it could be dangerous. They all listened and promised to be careful around it. In the end, they all played together safely and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a big dog named Max. Max had a task to do. His task was to spray water on the flowers. Max loved flowers and he loved his task. Max would run around and spray the flowers with water. The flowers grew big and beautiful because of Max's task. Max was happy because he loved to help.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play by the river and watch the boats go by. One day, Timmy saw a big, dependable boat that he really liked. He thought to himself, "I want to ride on that boat!"  Timmy went to his mommy and asked if they could ride on the boat. Mommy said yes and they went to the boat. Timmy was so happy to be on the boat and he thought it was the best boat ever.  As they rode on the boat, Timmy saw lots of fish in the water and he thought they were funny. He also saw some birds flying in the sky and he thought they were pretty. Timmy was having so much fun on the boat that he didn't want to get off when they got back to the shore.  From that day on, Timmy always thought about the dependable boat and how much fun he had riding on it. He couldn't wait to go back and ride on it again. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a lazy cat named Mittens. Mittens liked to sleep all day and didn't like to play. One day, Mittens saw a big stack of boxes and decided to climb on them.  "Mittens, stop climbing on those boxes! You might fall and hurt yourself," said the little girl who owned Mittens.  But Mittens didn't listen and kept climbing. Suddenly, the stack of boxes started to wobble and Mittens fell off!  "Mittens, are you okay?" asked the little girl.  Mittens meowed and rubbed against the little girl's leg. From that day on, Mittens stopped being so lazy and started playing more with the little girl instead of climbing on boxes.

One day, a boy named Tim went to the park with his mom. They saw a big pitch with kids playing on it. Tim was very happy and wanted to play too. His mom said, "Go and have fun!" Tim ran to the pitch and saw a wild dog. The dog was running and playing with a ball. Tim admired the dog and wanted to play with it. He said, "Hi dog! Can I play with you?" The dog wagged its tail and barked, "Yes, let's play!" Tim and the wild dog played on the pitch all day. They had so much fun together. Tim's mom watched them play and smiled. At the end of the day, Tim said goodbye to the dog and went home with his mom. They had a great day at the park.

Tom and Lily were playing in the garden. They saw a big box with a hole in it. Lily wanted to look inside, but Tom said no. "That is a trap. Someone put food in there to catch animals. If you go in, you will be stuck and scared," Tom said. Lily did not listen to Tom. She was curious and hungry. She ignored Tom and ran to the box. She smelled cheese and bread inside. She crawled into the hole and ate the food. Tom heard a loud snap. He turned around and saw that the box had closed on Lily. He ran to the box and tried to open it, but it was too heavy and hard. He shouted for help, but no one heard him. Lily was crying inside the box. She was sorry that she ignored Tom. She wished she had listened to him. She was afraid of the dark and the noise. She felt fragile and alone. Tom and Lily hoped that someone would come and save them soon. They learned a lesson: traps are dangerous and friends are important.

Once there was a little girl who parted ways with her family in the morning. She loved to explore new things and found herself in a big forest. The forest looked very different and it was new to her. She adventured around the forest, discovering new things as she went. She saw a lot of trees and animals that she had never seen before. She was mesmerised by the new sights and sounds. After some time exploring, the little girl had worked up an appetite. She found some juicy berries to munch on and took a rest.  When she felt rested and full, she slowly parted ways with the forest and made her way home. She was excited to tell her family about her amazing day in the new forest!

One day, Anthonny and his mommy went to the woods. It was so green and unique with different kinds of trees and animals. The sun was shining, and Anthony was having so much fun. "Look! It's starting to rain!" Mommy said. "Rain?" Anthony asked, wondering what rain was. "Yes," Mommy smiled. "It's when little drops of water fall from the sky." But Anthony didn't want to leave the woods, so he and Mommy stayed. They ran between the trees, getting  wet from the raindrops. The rain made the ground soft, and even more unique. Suddenly, Anthony's mommy started to make something out of the wood. She made a little house! Anthony was amazed at how his mommy turned the wood into something so cool. When the house was done, both Anthony and his mommy took cover from the rain. They were both so proud of the unique little house they built together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she was playing with her toys when she heard a loud noise outside. She looked out the window and saw an ambulance with flashing lights and a loud siren. Lily ran to her mommy and asked, "What's that noise, mommy?" Her mommy said, "Oh, that's an ambulance. It's like a big car that helps people who are hurt or sick." Lily thought that was really smart and said, "I want to be like the ambulance when I grow up and help people too!" Her mommy smiled and said, "That's a great idea, Lily. You can increase the number of people who are helped in the world." From that day on, Lily played with her toy ambulance and pretended to be a smart doctor who helped people in need. She knew that one day, she would be just like the real ambulance and help even more people.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and collect rocks. One day, she found a big rock that made her very excited. She wanted to keep it forever and show it to all her friends. But as time passed, Lily noticed that the rock started to shrink. It became smaller and smaller until it was just a tiny pebble. Lily was sad because she realized that everything in life eventually shrinks or goes away. From that day on, Lily learned to appreciate the things she had while she had them. She knew that even though things may shrink or disappear, the memories and joy they brought would always stay with her.

Once there was a hungry girl called Amy. She saw a path, so she followed it. It was a winding path that was full of exciting things to explore. Amy came across a big tree and she touched it with her hand. The bark was smooth and sharp. Amy got hungrier and hungrier. Suddenly she saw a big, juicy strawberry growing on the tree. She climbed up the tree and picked it. It was so sweet! She enjoyed it very much and then carried on down the path. At the end of the path, there was a big lake. Amy saw some fishes swimming in the water, so she decided to try to catch them. She went to the shore and threw in a pebble. The fishes got sharp and started to swim away. Amy was so happy to see them. She sat by the lake with her strawberry and watched the fishes. It was a beautiful day. And best of all, she was no longer hungry.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to visit her grandma's house. One day, she asked her mom if she could go see her grandma. Her mom said yes and they went on their way. When they got there, Lily's grandma gave her a coloring book. Lily loved to color and she picked out her favorite colors to use. She colored the pages with red, blue, and green. After a while, Lily's mom said it was time to go home. When they stepped outside, Lily noticed that the ground was icy. She said, "Mommy, the ground is icy!" Her mom said, "Yes, be careful so you don't slip." They walked slowly to the car and drove home. Lily was happy to have visited her grandma's house and colored with her favorite colors.

Once upon a time there was an ancient hook. It was sitting all by itself and no one knew where it had come from. One day, a little boy came across the hook and he asked, "Where did you come from?". The hook didn't answer, so the boy asked again, "What do you do?". Again, nothing happened, so the little boy decided to take the hook home and see what it could do.  When the little boy got back home, the hook began to sparkle. He put it on the wall, and it didn't take long before the hook had turned into a magical coat hanger. The little boy was so amazed and he asked the hook, "What can I put on you?". The hook answered by singing out loud, "Hang your jackets and sweaters, your hats and your gloves, hang your scarves, and your raincoats - they'll fit on our curves!". The little boy was delighted to see the hook had come to life and he put all his clothes on the hook. It made his room look much tidier and he was so pleased that he had asked the hook where it had come from. The end.

Once upon a time there were two kids, Vera and Ben. They wanted to know how an egg was made, so they asked their mom. Mom smiled and explained that eggs were laid by hens. She showed the kids the henhouse and let them watch the hens come out to lay their eggs. Vera was amazed. She asked her mom why the eggs were so organized, and her mom said that the hens cared for their eggs. She explained that the hens would protect and clean their eggs, so they stayed neat and tidy. Ben and Vera laughed with delight. Ben said that he wanted to have a pet hen so they could have their very own eggs! Their mom thought it was a great idea and they went off to find a perfect pet hen. They looked everywhere and finally found the perfect bird - a friendly and organized hen that loved to lay beautiful eggs. Ben and Vera now had an egg-laying pet that kept their eggs neat and tidy!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys and run around outside. But one day, he lost his favorite toy car. He looked and looked, but he couldn't find it anywhere. Timmy started to worry that he would never find his toy car again. His mother saw that Timmy was worried and she tried to help him look for the toy car. But she couldn't find it either. Timmy's mother told him not to worry and that they would keep looking for the toy car together. Timmy was still worried, but he knew his mother would help him find his toy car. He felt impatient and wanted to find it right away. But he remembered what his mother said and decided to be patient. Together, Timmy and his mother kept searching until they finally found the toy car under the couch. Timmy was so happy and gave his mother a big hug.

Once upon a time there was an ancient tree. It was an old tree, but it was very strong. Every morning, a little girl would come and grab its leaves. She would use them to make a special tea. One day, the little girl noticed something strange about the tree's leaves. Instead of being soft and green, they felt like paper! When she looked more closely, the little girl saw that the leaves had writing on them! She was so excited. She quickly grabbed the leaves, and ran home with them. She boiled some water and made the tea. When she tasted it, the little girl could not believe her luck! The tea tasted like nothing she had ever tasted before. The little girl was so pleased with her discovery. She kept the ancient leaves, so she could make the special tea over and over again.  Every day she would go to the tree and grab its leaves. She was so happy that the ancient tree had given her such a special treat.

Once upon a time, there was a morning sun. It shone down on a small kitchen where two little friends were busy. "Let's cook some breakfast!" said one. "Sure!" said the other. The two got to work. One friend put an iron in some water, and the other took some food from the fridge. "I'll make some eggs!" said the first friend. "But I need something to cook them on!" The second friend went to the closet and took out a flexible pan. "This pan is perfect!" he said. "Let's cook!" So the two friends cooked some eggs. They stirred them up with a spoon until they were ready.  Finally, they both sat down to eat. It was a delicious breakfast that they had cooked together!

Once upon a time, there was an old man who loved to observe dolphins. One day, he went to the beach to watch them swim. He saw a little girl playing in the water and asked her, "Have you ever seen a dolphin?"  The little girl shook her head and said, "No, what's a dolphin?"  The old man smiled and pointed to the sea. "Look out there, see that animal jumping? That's a dolphin!"  The little girl's eyes widened with excitement. "Wow! Dolphins are so cool!"  The old man chuckled and said, "Yes, they are. They're very smart too. They can do tricks and even talk to each other."  The little girl watched the dolphins with wonder and said, "I want to be friends with a dolphin one day."  The old man smiled and said, "Who knows, maybe one day you will be."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends. One day, Lily's mom told her that it was important to wear a helmet when riding her bike. "It will keep you safe," her mom said. Lily's friend, Jack, came over to play. He didn't have a helmet on. Lily said, "I recommend you wear a helmet like me. It's safe and fine." Jack listened to Lily and went home to get his helmet. Later that day, Lily and Jack rode their bikes together. They both wore their helmets and had a fun time playing outside. Lily was happy that she could recommend something that kept her friend safe.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was only three years old. But the girl was very helpful. Every day, she found ways to provide help to her family. One day, the girl got an exciting idea. She wanted to provide a special surprise for her family. So every day, she worked very hard. She made little gifts and put them aside. When the end of the year arrived, the girl was ready. She gave all the gifts to her family. They were so happy! From then on, the little girl was always looking for ways to provide kindness and happiness to the people she loved.

Once there was a little boy who was playing outside with his friends. He had a rope and his friends started to play a game. They decided to pass the rope around in a circle, and everyone got to take a turn.  Once the rope came back around to the little boy, he noticed something. It was a furry string that was hanging from the rope! Everyone was excited and tried to guess what it was.  The little boy touched the furry string and suddenly realized what it was. It was a hairy caterpillar! The little boy and his friends were amazed and started asking lots of questions about the caterpillar.  It was a fun game and the little boy felt happy as he watched the hairy caterpillar crawl away. He waved goodbye as he passed the rope to his friends and they continued to play the game.

Mia was looking out the window. She was wearing her favorite dress, and she loved to twirl around in it. In her hand was a special makeup stick, her mom had given it to her. She stood there and gazed out at the garden gate, it was so long and tall.  Suddenly, Mia got an idea. She ran to get her box of colored markers, and quickly went back to the window. She began to draw on the glass - adding eyes, a mouth and bright colors! Mia had made a beautiful face - and it was looking back at her.  Mia smiled and then went back to her makeup box. She quickly grabbed her purple lipstick and squeezed it onto her lips. Mia looked at her reflection in the window and admired the artwork she had made and the long beautiful dress that twirled around her.  Mia giggled and admired her look. She was so happy with her design and the way it made her feel - beautiful and confident. Mia smiled and raced off to show all her friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play catch with his red ball. One day, Tim saw a big, open door in his house. He had never seen this door open before. He was very curious. Tim went to the open door and looked inside. He saw a room full of fun things to touch. There were soft pillows, fluffy toys, and colorful buttons. Tim knew he should not go in, but he really wanted to touch everything. Tim took his red ball and went inside the room. He threw the ball up high and tried to catch it. But the ball hit a big green button on the wall. Suddenly, the open door closed! Tim was scared. He touched the green button again and the door opened. Tim ran out of the room and promised never to go in there again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Amy. She was three years old and loved to do tricks. She was always looking for something new to show her mummy and daddy. One day, Amy saw a big mirror in a park. She decided to play with it and try a balancing trick. She jumped up on top of the mirror, feeling brave and adventurous. But when she tried to balance on top of it, she wobbled and fell down. Amy felt frustrated. She wanted to finish the trick, but she just couldn't keep her balance. She tried a few more times, but nothing seemed to work. At that moment, her daddy came over to help. He held her hand and helped her balance on the mirror. Amy smiled and thanked him. Together, they finished the trick and everyone clapped. Amy was so happy. She had learned a new trick, even if it did take a little bit of help. From then on, Amy was determined to practice balancing and improve her skills.

Anna likes to print pictures with her crayons. She has many colors and papers. She prints flowers, stars, and animals. She shows her pictures to her mom and dad. They say, "Wow, Anna, you are very good at printing!" One day, Anna wants to print a fork. She thinks forks are funny and shiny. She finds a fork in the kitchen and puts it on a paper. She tries to print the fork with a crayon, but it does not work. The fork is too hard and the crayon is too soft. Anna pushes harder and harder, but the paper rips and the crayon breaks. Anna is sad and angry. She picks up the fork and throws it on the floor. She says, "Bad fork! You are a mean fork! You do not let me print you!" But the fork bounces back and hits Anna on the leg. Anna feels a sharp pain. She cries out, "Ow, ow, ow! The fork hurt me! The fork hurt me!" Her mom hears her cry and runs to the kitchen. She sees Anna holding her leg and the fork on the floor. She says, "Oh, Anna, what happened? Why did you throw the fork?" She picks up Anna and hugs her. She looks at her leg and sees a small cut. She says, "It's okay, Anna, it's just a little cut. I will put a band-aid on it and it will heal soon. But you should not throw forks, Anna. Forks are not toys. Forks are for eating, not for printing. They can hurt you and others." Anna nods and says, "I'm sorry, mom. I was mad at the fork. I wanted to print it, but it did not work. I will not throw forks again. I will only print with crayons and papers." Her mom smiles and says, "That's good, Anna. I love your prints. They are very pretty and creative. But next time, if you want to print something else, ask me first. I can help you find a better way." Anna hugs her mom and says, "Thank you, mom. You are the best mom. Can I print you a picture of a fork?" Her mom laughs and says, "Sure, Anna. But only with crayons and papers."

Once upon a time there was a boy and he loved to write. He wrote about different lands and he had big dreams to be able to travel to them. One day, he decided to write a letter to each of the different lands. He wrote about all the different things he wanted to do when he travelled there. He posted his letters to the different lands and waited patiently to hear back. After a few weeks of waiting, he was so excited to find out that he had heard back from each of the lands!  Each land had invited him to come and explore. He was so excited to be able to explore all the different lands. So he packed his bags and travelled to each land to explore and write about all the wonderful things he discovered.  The end.

Once upon a time, there was a lovely sailor who sailed the seas. He loved to travel and explore the world. Every day, the sailor found something that he valued. He found seashells, fish and coral, and he valued them all. One day, the sailor found something extra special. He spotted a little island with a white sand beach and smiles from the friendly people. He quickly realized that this island was most special and that it was valuable to him. The sailor visited the island often and he made many friends. He realized that people, time, and memories were some of the most valuable things in life. Every time he left the island, the sailor felt so happy and thankful. He knew that this island and his friends had given him something he could treasure forever.

Once upon a time, there was a small boy named John. John wanted to go on an adventure. He stepped out of his house and started walking. He went through the big park and saw some birds singing in the trees. He stepped through the grass and felt the sun on his face. John wanted to go somewhere quieter. He started walking and soon came to a lake. He stepped carefully on the rocks so as not to make too much noise. At the lake, he saw some helpful ducks swimming around. He waved at them and they waved back. John had a lovely time by the lake. The quiet was very peaceful and he enjoyed taking some time to relax. He looked up at the sky and watched the clouds. Eventually, he felt ready to go back home.  John thanked the ducks for being so helpful. As he stepped back through the park, he knew he had made a wonderful journey. He was excited to share his adventure with his family that night.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to see the bright and pretty fireworks in the sky. One day, her mommy and daddy said they would allow her to see the fireworks show at the park. Lily was so jolly and excited! She put on her favorite dress and ran to the park with her parents. When they arrived, the sky was dark and the stars were shining. Suddenly, the fireworks started to light up the sky with beautiful colors. Lily clapped her hands and laughed with joy. She was so happy that her mommy and daddy allowed her to see the fireworks. From that day on, every time there was a fireworks show, Lily would remember that jolly night at the park.

Tom and Amy were friends. They liked to play in Tom's room. Tom's room was enormous. It had many toys and books and games. Amy liked to look at Tom's things and ask him their names. One day, Tom and Amy were playing in Tom's room. They saw a big box in the corner. Tom said, "That is my new toy. It is a robot. It can talk and move and do things. Do you want to see it?" Amy said, "Yes, please. What is its name?" Tom said, "Its name is Rex. It is a very smart robot. Watch this." He opened the box and took out the robot. It was shiny and metal and had red eyes and claws. Tom pressed a button and the robot came to life. "Hello, Tom," the robot said. "I am Rex. I am your friend. Who is this?" It pointed at Amy. Tom said, "This is Amy. She is my friend too. Say hello, Rex." The robot said, "Hello, Amy. I am Rex. I am not your friend. You are in my room. Go away." Amy was scared. She said, "Tom, this robot is not nice. It is mean. It does not like me. Can we play with something else?" Tom said, "No, Amy. Rex is my toy. He is nice to me. He does what I say. You are not my friend. You are in his room. Go away." Amy was sad. She said, "Tom, why are you being mean to me? We are friends. We always play together. Don't you like me anymore?" Tom said, "No, Amy. I don't like you anymore. Rex is my only friend. He is better than you. He is smarter and stronger and cooler. You are boring and stupid and ugly. Go away." Amy was hurt. She started to cry. She said, "Tom, you are being very mean. You are hurting my feelings. You are not a good friend. I don't want to play with you anymore. I am going away." She ran out of Tom's room and went to her home. She told her mom what happened. Her mom hugged her and said, "I am sorry, Amy. Tom was very mean to you. He was not a good friend. You deserve better friends. You are a good and kind and beautiful girl. I love you very much." Amy felt a little better. She said, "I love you too, mom. Thank you for being my friend." The end.

Once upon a time, there was a quiet little boat. The boat wanted to sail on a big tour. The boat was very excited. One day, the boat started its tour. It sailed on the water. The boat went far away from home. The boat was very happy. But then, the boat sailed into a big storm. The storm was very scary. The boat tried to sail back home, but the storm was too strong. The quiet little boat did not make it back home. The end.

Once upon time there was a little girl named Grace. Grace was a very happy child and always smiled. One day Grace did something wrong and made her mommy very angry. Grace's mommy yelled at her and said, "Grace you shouldn't have done that, why did you?" Grace felt very sad, she wanted to make her mommy happy again. She looked up to her mommy and said, "I'm sorry Mommy, I wasn't thinking. I'm sorry." Her mommy smiled. She reached down and gave Grace a big hug. She said, "It's okay Grace, I forgive you. Now let's put on your sunglasses and go outside and play." Grace smiled and put on her sunglasses. She and her mommy went to the park. Grace saw some of her friends running around. They had so much fun playing. After a while, they all got a bit sleepy. Grace's mom said, "Let's go home, it's time for bed." So they said goodbye to their friends and went back home. Grace's mom tucked her into bed and gave her a kiss. She said "Good night, sweetie. I forgive you and I love you." Grace smiled and closed her eyes. She was so thankful to have a mommy like hers who would always forgive her. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a reindeer named Rudolph. He had a red nose that shone bright at night. One day, Rudolph went for a walk in the forest. He saw a mysterious shadow behind the trees. Rudolph was scared, but he wanted to see what it was.  When he got closer, he saw two other reindeer fighting. They were angry and making loud noises. Rudolph knew he had to do something to help. He used his strong antlers to stop the fight. The two reindeer stopped and looked at Rudolph.  "Thank you for stopping us," they said. "We were fighting over who gets to eat the best grass." Rudolph smiled and said, "There's enough grass for everyone. Let's share!" From that day on, the three reindeer were friends and always shared their food.

Once upon a time, there was an impatient little boy. He had to close the door each time his mom asked him to.  It was the law in his house. He didn't like closing the door, but he had to. One day, he tried to find a way around the law. But his mom was watching, and she said he must close the door. So, the little boy sadly closed the door. Then, he had an idea. He asked his mom if he could wear a cape and play like he was a super hero. His mom said yes and he put on his cape. The little boy was no longer impatient. Instead, he eagerly went to close the door each time. He thought of himself as a super hero who kept his house safe by making sure the door was always closed.  The end.

Sammy was at the beach with his parents. He watched as the waves rocked against the shore. He was amazed at how lively the ocean was.  His parents put him on a surfboard and told him to catch a wave. He was scared at first but when he tried it, he felt a rush of excitement. He rocked back and forth with the surf. He felt alive, like he could do anything.  As he rode the fish, he smiled and laughed. He kept riding the waves, going up and down. More and more surfers started to join him and before he knew it, the beach was filled with people.  Sammy had a great time. He couldn't believe he got to surf on such a lively beach day. He had never had so much fun in his life. He couldn't wait to come back and rock the waves again!

Once upon a time there was a little bunny. His name was Jack and he loved to rock. Every day he would hop around the garden looking for different things to rock on.  One day Jack found a hidden door. He was very excited to see where it would lead! He jumped through and ended up in the veterinarian's office.  Jack looked around and saw all kinds of animals. He even saw a puppy getting a bath! He knew he was in the right place.  Suddenly a voice said, "Hello there! How can I help you?" Jack looked up to see the vet smiling at him.  Jack said, "Hi! Could you help me rock?" The vet said, "Why of course! Let's go find something fun to rock on!"  The vet showed Jack a big rocking chair that he could enjoy. Jack happily began to rock. He had an amazing time. He thanked the vet and hopped out of the office.  Jack knew he had found a great place to rock and he would be back again soon.

Once upon a time there was a lonely little rabbit, called Tony. He was feeling very sad because he was all alone. He had no friends to play with.  One day he was out looking for something to do. He stumbled across a tall tree. When he got closer, he noticed that there was something about the tree that was strange. The bark on the tree appeared to be faded and worn away. Tony wanted to restore the tree so he tried to think of what he could do. Suddenly Tony had a brilliant idea. He decided to use his bunny ears to make music to restore the tree. He hopped back a few steps, and started hopping to make beats and rhythms. The music he made was so lovely that soon birds, foxes and other animals started appearing to listen. Soon enough, Tony had some friends to play with. They all started to dance and make music together.
