At the end of the day, Tony and his friends had a great score of restoring the tree and they were all very proud. From then on, Tony was never lonely again.

Once upon a time, there was a playful puppy named Max. Max loved to play with his toys and run around in the yard. One day, Max's owner gave him a new toy axe to play with. Max was so happy and ran around with it in his mouth. Max's owner said, "I permit you to play with the axe, but you must be careful." Max wagged his tail and continued to play with the axe. Suddenly, Max accidentally hit a rock with the axe and it broke into pieces. Max's owner was sad that the axe was broken, but he was happy that Max was okay. From that day on, Max played with his toys and ran around in the yard, but he never played with an axe again.

Tommy skipped in the park. His mum watched him from nearby. He smiled as he skipped from one side of the park to the other. Suddenly, Tommy saw something in the grass. It was a ladybug! It had wings that were open and he slowly moved a finger towards it.  Just as he was about to touch it, the ladybug flew away. Tommy gasped with mazement. "Well done Tommy," said his mum. "Can you remember what the ladybug wings were like?"  Tommy thought for a moment. "Open!" he shouted, jumping up and down.  Tommy's mum smiled and hugged him. "That's right!" she said. "Now let’s go and keep skipping!"

Once there was a girl called Mandy. She liked to keep everything very tidy. One day Mandy went for a walk in the dark woods, despite everyone saying it was unsafe. She said she wanted to go explore. Suddenly, Mandy heard a voice say, "Can you help me?". Mandy looked around but there was no one there. She shrugged and kept walking in the dark.  She heard the voice again and this time she spotted a little boy. He asked Mandy to help him find his way home. Mandy agreed, but she had no idea where the boy lived.  They walked in the dark for a long time but Mandy couldn't find the boy's home. Suddenly, it got very dark and a storm appeared. Mandy lost the little boy and she had to find her own way home.  Mandy never saw the boy again and she felt very sad. She vowed to never go into the dark woods again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily went outside to gather some pretty flowers for her mommy. She saw lots of colorful flowers, like red roses and yellow daisies. She picked them all and put them in a big vase. Later that day, it started to rain and the ground got very icy. Lily's mommy asked her to help mop up the water that came inside. Lily got a big mop and started to clean up the floor. She was very careful not to slip on the icy water.  After they finished mopping, Lily's mommy thanked her for helping. Lily felt happy that she could do something nice for her mommy. She looked at the pretty flowers she gathered earlier and smiled.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine and pick flowers. One day, she found a big envelope on the ground. It was white and had a stamp on it. Lily was curious about what was inside the envelope. She wanted to open it right away, but her mom told her to wait until they got home. Lily was impatient and couldn't wait to see what was inside. When they got home, Lily's mom let her open the envelope. Inside, there was a beautiful picture of a rainbow. Lily was so happy and excited. She wanted to show her friends the picture, but she knew she had to be careful not to cover it with her fingerprints. Lily put the picture up on her wall where she could see it every day. She was so happy that she found the envelope and got to see the pretty picture inside.

Tom and Sue were brother and sister. They liked to play in the house, but they also liked to go outside. One day, they saw a big box in the yard. They wanted to see what was inside. They tried to open the box, but it was locked. They looked for a key, but they could not find one. They asked their mom, but she said no. She said the box was not for them. She said it was for dad. She said he would be mad if they touched it. Tom and Sue did not listen. They wanted to see what was inside. They waited until mom was busy. Then they sneaked out to the yard. They found a tool in the shed. They used it to unlock the box. They opened the lid and looked inside. They saw a lot of dishes. They were shiny and pretty. They had flowers and birds on them. They were dad's gift for mom. He wanted to surprise her. He wanted to make her happy. Tom and Sue did not know that. They thought the dishes were toys. They took them out of the box. They played with them. They threw them in the air. They smashed them on the ground. They made a lot of noise and a lot of mess. Mom heard the noise. She came out to the yard. She saw the broken dishes. She saw Tom and Sue. She was very sad and very angry. She scolded them. She said they were naughty and selfish. She said they ruined dad's gift for mom. She said they had to say sorry and help clean up. Tom and Sue felt bad. They realized they did a bad thing. They said sorry to mom. They said sorry to dad. They helped clean up. They learned a lesson. They learned to respect other people's things. They learned to listen to their mom. They learned to be good and kind.

Lily was excited to go to the party. She put on her pink dress and her shiny shoes. She wanted to look pretty. She ran to the bathroom and looked in the mirror. "Wow, you look so nice!" said Mommy, who followed her. "Do you want me to help you with your hair?" "Yes, please!" said Lily. She sat on a small stool and Mommy brushed her hair. She made two braids and tied them with ribbons. Lily smiled in the mirror. She liked her braids. "Thank you, Mommy!" she said. "Can we go now?" "Sure, honey. Let's go." Mommy took her hand and they walked to the car. Lily was excited to see her friends and have fun at the party. She hoped there would be cake and balloons. She loved parties.

Tom and Lily were twins who liked to play with their toys. They had many toys, but they always wanted more. They were spoiled children who did not share or say thank you. One day, their mom brought home a new blanket for them. It was soft and warm and had colorful animals on it. "Wow, look at this blanket!" Tom said. "It is so nice. I want it for myself!" "No, I want it!" Lily said. "It is mine! You have enough toys already!" They both grabbed the blanket and pulled hard. They did not care that they were hurting the blanket or each other. They only wanted to have it all. "Stop it, you two!" their mom said. "This blanket is for both of you to share. If you cannot play nicely, I will take it away!" But Tom and Lily did not listen. They kept fighting and yelling. They seemed very angry and mean. They did not notice that the blanket was tearing apart in their hands. Suddenly, the blanket ripped in half. The animals fell off and the stuffing came out. The blanket was ruined. Tom and Lily looked at the broken blanket and cried. "Look what you did!" Tom said. "You ruined the blanket!" "No, you did!" Lily said. "You started it!" They blamed each other and did not say sorry. Their mom was very sad and disappointed. She took away the blanket and their toys. She said they had to learn to be kind and grateful. She said they could not have any more new things until they changed their ways. Tom and Lily had no blanket and no toys. They had no fun and no friends. They were cold and lonely. They wished they had shared the blanket and played nicely. But it was too late. They had spoiled everything.

One day, a loud bird sat on a tree. The bird liked to tease the little ant. The little ant did not like the loud bird. The ant said, "Stop teasing me, loud bird! I will find a way to stop you." The little ant thought and thought. He had an idea. He went to his ant friends and told them his plan. The ants all agreed to help. They knew the loud bird was mean to the little ant. They wanted to teach the loud bird a lesson. The next day, the loud bird came back to tease the little ant. But this time, the little ant was ready. He and his ant friends all climbed up the tree. They tickled the loud bird's feet. The loud bird laughed and laughed. He could not tease the little ant anymore. The bird said, "I am sorry, little ant. I will not tease you anymore." The little ant and his friends were happy. They had stopped the loud bird from teasing them.

Once upon a time, in a big green forest, there lived a large, friendly bear. The bear had a large mouth and he loved to give hugs to his friends. He was always happy and liked to play with his friends, the little birds and the small rabbits. One sunny day, the large bear went for a walk. He saw a little girl who was lost and scared. The little girl had a big red ball. The bear wanted to help, so he used his large mouth to give the ball a gentle push. The ball rolled away and the girl followed it, finding her way back home. The little girl was so happy that the large bear had helped her. She gave the bear a big hug, and they became good friends. From that day on, the large bear, the little girl, and all their friends in the forest played together, and they were always happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his blocks. He had a big pile of blocks that he would stack up and knock down. One day, Timmy received a new set of blocks from his grandma. He was so excited to play with them! Timmy started building a tall tower with his new blocks. But then, his little sister came over and accidentally knocked it down. Timmy got very mad and threw his blocks all over the room. His mom came in and told him he couldn't play with his blocks anymore because he was being too rough. Timmy was sad that he couldn't play with his blocks anymore. He realized that he should have been more careful and not let his anger take over. From then on, he tried to be more patient and gentle with his toys.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play in the mud and get very dirty. His mom would always tell him to wash his hands and face, but Timmy didn't like to.  One day, Timmy got very sick because he didn't wash his hands and face. His mom took him to the doctor, who said he had caught a bad germ. The germ made Timmy's whole body feel very bad.  The doctor told Timmy's mom that the germ was spreading to other people in the nation. Timmy felt very sad and sorry for not washing his hands and face. He promised to always wash from then on.  Sadly, the germ spread all over the nation and many people got very sick. Timmy learned that it is important to wash to keep yourself and others healthy.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a unique theater. Many people went there to see shows. One day, a boy named Tim went to the theater with his friends. They were very excited. At the theater, Tim saw a big box. He asked his friend, "What do you think we can use this for?" His friend replied, "I don't know, but we should not touch it." Tim did not listen and opened the box. Inside the box, there was a big mess. Paint spilled everywhere, and the theater was ruined. Everyone was sad and angry at Tim. The show could not happen because of the mess. Tim learned that he should have listened to his friend and not touched things that were not his.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park with their dolls. They liked to pretend that their dolls were going on adventures in the woods, the sea, or the moon. They made up stories and acted them out with their dolls. One day, a big boy came to the park. He saw Lily and Ben and their dolls. He wanted to play with them, but he did not ask nicely. He said, "Give me your dolls. They are mine now. They are too babyish for you." Lily and Ben were scared of the big boy. He was much taller and stronger than them. He looked mean and angry. They did not want to give him their dolls. They loved their dolls very much. The big boy grabbed Lily's doll. It was a soft pink bunny with a leather jacket. Lily had made the jacket herself with her mom's help. She cried, "No, please, don't take my bunny. She is my best friend. She is not babyish. She is cool and brave." The big boy laughed. He said, "A bunny with a leather jacket? That is silly. Bunnies are not cool or brave. They are weak and scared. This is a dangerous jacket. It is only for tough guys like me. You can have this doll instead." He threw a dirty rag doll at Lily. Lily did not accept the rag doll. She threw it back at the big boy. She said, "No, thank you. I don't want your doll. She is not my friend. She is dirty and ugly. You can keep her. Give me back my bunny. She is not dangerous. She is kind and sweet." Ben saw that Lily was brave. He decided to be brave too. He said, "Yeah, give us back our dolls. They are ours. You are not nice. You are mean and rude. Go away and leave us alone." The big boy was surprised. He did not expect Lily and Ben to stand up to him. He felt ashamed and scared. He said, "Fine, fine, take your dolls. I don't want them anyway. They are stupid and boring. I have better toys at home." He ran away from the park. Lily and Ben hugged their dolls. They were happy and proud. They said, "We did it. We saved our dolls. We are cool and brave. We are best friends." They continued to play with their dolls and have fun. They did not let the big boy bother them again.

Once upon a time, there were two best friends called Lucy and Joe. They were so excited because they were going on a picnic.  Joe said, "I can't wait to show you the beautiful waffle I made!"  Lucy smiled. "Oh, I can't wait to see it! What will it look like?" Joe grinned. "It's going to be so cool. It's shaped like a diamond, with lots of delicious toppings!" When they reached the park, Joe put the waffle down on a table for them both to see. Lucy gasped in amazement. "Wow, it looks so beautiful!" Joe was so proud of himself. He smiled and said, "Yes, I made it all by myself!" They enjoyed their picnic and the delicious waffle. It was the best day ever!

Once upon a time, there was a selfish dog. He liked to order others around. He always wanted his own way. One day, the dog saw a bubble. It was so pretty and sparkly! He wanted it very much. He ordered the bubble to come to him, but the bubble just floated away. So the dog chased the bubble. He ran and he ran but he could not catch it. Everywhere the bubble went, the dog followed. He wanted the bubble for himself. At last, the bubble disappeared. The selfish dog was very sad. He learnt a lesson that day - being mean and selfish doesn't get you very far.

Once upon a time, there was a small youth named Lucy. She was very happy and full of life. One day she decided to take a walk in the nearby park, so she wandered off to explore.  Lucy soon came to a clearing with a big tree in the center. As she went closer, she saw a small stream running nearby. She was mesmerised by the sights and sounds of the place.  Suddenly something caught her eye. There was a sparkle in the water. She bent down and found a golden bracelet. This gave her hope and she reached out, but the stream was strong and it kept trying to take the bracelet away.  Lucy refused to give up, however. She was determined to get the bracelet and so she kept trying until, finally, the stream yielded to her efforts. She was so excited and happy to have her surprise.  From that day onwards, Lucy visited the stream every day with her friends. They loved to see her bracelet sparkle and they all appreciated the small acts of determination which led to the stream’s yielding.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. He was just 3 years old, and one day he noticed that some of the clouds in the sky were doing something strange. They were shooting all sorts of different colours of water into the air! Jack was very curious, so he asked his mom what was happening. His mom smiled and said: "Those are called rainbows! It's when the sun shines on the water droplets in the sky and they spray into colours. It's like a paintbrush! Jack was so excited. He loved rainbows! That day it was raining, and he kept looking up, hoping to see another one. But then he noticed something else. The rain was dripping down to the earth and making little puddles, but then he saw something completely different. Some of the puddles were spraying up into the air! They were spraying in different directions like little fountains! Jack was amazed. He asked his mom what had happened, and she laughed and said "That's called evaporation! The water heats up and turns into a gas, and when that happens, it sprays up into the air!" Jack couldn't believe it. He'd learned something new about the earth, and he loved it!

Tom and Lily are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they find a shiny thing in the grass. It is a red diamond. Tom and Lily are very happy. They take the red diamond to their tree house. "Look at our red diamond!" Tom says. "It is so pretty and bright!" "Yes, it is!" Lily says. "We are very lucky to find it!" They put the red diamond in a box. They hide the box under a blanket. They go to play some more. But a bad man sees them. He follows them to the tree house. He waits until they are gone. He sneaks into the tree house. He finds the box. He takes the red diamond. He runs away. Tom and Lily come back to the tree house. They want to see their red diamond. But the box is empty. The red diamond is gone. "Where is our red diamond?" Tom asks. "Who took it?" "I don't know!" Lily says. "Maybe someone saw it and wanted it!" Tom and Lily are very sad. They miss their red diamond. They cry and hug each other. "Maybe we can find another red diamond!" Tom says. "Maybe!" Lily says. "But we will always remember our first red diamond!" They go to look for another red diamond. They hope to find one. They hope to be happy again.

One day, a lazy cat named Tom found a trumpet in the park. Tom was very happy and wanted to play it. He tried to blow into the trumpet, but no sound came out. Tom was sad and didn't know what to do. Tom saw his friend, a duck named Dina, swimming in a pond. "Dina, can you help me play the trumpet?" Tom asked. Dina thought for a moment and said, "You need to bathe the trumpet first. It might be dirty." Tom took the trumpet to the pond and bathed it. He washed it very well. Then, he tried to play it again. This time, a beautiful sound came out. Tom and Dina danced and laughed as Tom played the trumpet. They had a fun day at the park with their new trumpet.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went to the park with her mom. They had a picnic and played on the swings. Suddenly, a boy came up to them and demanded that they give him their snacks. Lily's mom said no and the boy ran away. Later that day, Lily and her mom went to the library. Lily saw a book with a boring cover, but her mom said they should still check it out. When they got home, Lily's mom started to read the book to her. Lily thought it was going to be a boring story, but she was wrong! It was about a princess who went on an adventure and saved her kingdom. Lily was so happy that they picked that book to print out from the library. She asked her mom to read it again and again. From that day on, Lily learned that sometimes things that seem boring can turn out to be really exciting.

Once upon a time, there was a little duck who loved to play in the pond. One day, the little duck saw a shiny rock in the pond and wanted to play with it. But when the little duck tried to pick up the rock, it slipped out of its beak and sank to the bottom of the pond. The little duck was sad and wanted its shiny rock back. But then, a kind frog saw the little duck crying and offered to help. The frog dove into the pond and retrieved the shiny rock for the little duck. The little duck was so happy to receive its shiny rock back and thanked the frog. From that day on, the little duck learned to be careful with its toys and not to take things for granted. It also learned to be grateful and say sorry when it made a mistake.

Once upon a time, there was a large bird. Its name was Bob. Bob had a special license. With this license, he was allowed to walk wherever he wanted.  One day, Bob decided to go for a walk. He was so excited about it. He spread his wings, flapped them and soared up into the sky.  Just when he was about to start his walk, he suddenly heard something. It was a voice. "Hey Bob! Where are you going?" He looked around and saw a small bird flying beside him.  "Oh hello there! I'm going on a walk!", he said to the small bird.  "Can I come with you?", the small bird asked.  "Yes, of course you can, but you'll need a license. Do you have one?", Bob asked. The small bird sadly shook its head.  "Don't worry, I can help you get one. Just follow me and I'll show you the steps to get your own special license", said Bob.  The small bird was so excited and followed Bob on the walk. In the end, both Bob and the small bird had their own licenses and were allowed to walk wherever they wanted!

Once upon a time there was a boy called Tom. Tom was only three years old, but he already knew his name was important. One day Tom went to play in the park.  When he got there he saw lots of new friends playing together. He wanted to join in, but he was too shy.  A girl with a big smile walked up to him. She said, “Hi! What’s your name?”  Tom was a bit hesitant at first, but he eventually said, “My name is Tom.”  The girl smiled and said, “That’s a great name! I’m sure all your new friends will love to know it.” Tom was very happy and he mind his new friend's advice. He ran around the park introducing himself to everyone. He knew his name was important and he was proud to say it.  The other kids were happy to meet Tom and they all played together and had lots of fun. Tom was glad he listened to that girl's advice and he knew it was important to always mind your name.

Yesterday, Amy went to the park. She found a new toy there. It was a splitting toy she had never seen before. She asked her mom if she could have it. Mom said yes and Amy was very happy. She hugged the new splitting toy and went home. At home, Amy couldn't wait to try the toy. She put it on the table and tried it out. She laughed when it split into two pieces. She said "look! It splits!" She thought it was the most amazing thing ever.  Then Amy showed the toy to her friend Billy. He was just as excited and they both took turns splitting it. They did it until it was getting late, then they said goodbye.  Amy was so proud of her new splitting toy. She said to herself "I will play with it tomorrow too!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very patient and kind. One day, she found a big package near her house. She was so excited to see what was inside. But the package was too heavy for her to carry. Lily tried to push the package to her house. She pushed and pushed, but it was still very hard. Then, her friend Tom came to help her. They both pushed the package together. It was still hard, but they did not give up. They kept pushing and pushing until they got the package inside the house. When they opened the package, they found many toys inside. They were so happy to play with the new toys. They shared the toys with their friends in the neighborhood. Everyone had a great time playing together. And they all learned that being patient and working together can help solve problems.

Anna and Ben are playing catch with a ball. They are having fun and laughing. They throw the ball high and low, near and far. They are good at catching the ball. But then, the ball goes too far. It flies over the fence and lands in the yard of Mr. Lee. Mr. Lee is an old man who does not like children. He is always grumpy and mean. He does not let anyone play in his yard. Anna and Ben are scared. They want their ball back, but they do not want to talk to Mr. Lee. They look around and see a cloth hanging on the fence. It is a big and colorful cloth. It looks like a flag. Anna has an idea. She says to Ben, "Let's use the cloth to get the ball. We can tie it to a stick and reach over the fence. Then we can hook the ball and pull it back. Mr. Lee will not see us." Ben thinks it is a good idea. He says, "OK, let's do it. But we have to be quick and quiet." They find a stick and tie the cloth to it. They lift the stick and try to get the ball. But they are not careful enough. The cloth makes a lot of noise as it flaps in the wind. Mr. Lee hears the noise and comes out of his house. He sees Anna and Ben with the cloth and the stick. He sees the ball in his yard. He is very angry. He shouts, "Hey, you kids! What are you doing with my cloth? That is my flag! It is very special to me. And why are you stealing my ball? Get away from my fence!" Anna and Ben are very sorry. They drop the stick and the cloth. They say, "We are sorry, Mr. Lee. We did not mean to take your cloth or your ball. We were just playing catch and the ball went over the fence. We wanted to get it back. We did not know the cloth was your flag. Please forgive us." Mr. Lee is still angry, but he sees that Anna and Ben are honest. They are not lying or running away. He calms down a little. He says, "Well, you should have asked me first. You should not touch other people's things without permission. That is rude and wrong. But I see that you are sorry and honest. I will give you your ball back, but you have to promise me something." Anna and Ben nod. They say, "What do you want us to promise, Mr. Lee?" Mr. Lee says, "You have to promise me that you will respect my flag and my yard. You have to promise me that you will not play catch near my fence again. You have to promise me that you will be more careful and polite. Can you do that?" Anna and Ben say, "Yes, we can do that, Mr. Lee. We promise. Thank you for giving us our ball back. And we are sorry for taking your flag. It is very beautiful." Mr. Lee smiles a little. He says, "You are welcome. And thank you for being honest. Honesty is a good thing. Maybe you are not so bad after all. Maybe we can be friends. But remember your promise. And now, go and play somewhere else. And be safe." Anna and Ben say, "OK, Mr. Lee. We will. And we are glad to be your friends. Goodbye." They take their ball and run away. They are happy to have their ball back, but they are also happy to have a new friend. They learned a lesson today. They learned to be honest and respectful. And they learned that sometimes, old and grumpy people can be nice and kind.

Ana was walking along the beach one evening. She looked down and she saw something in the sand. She bent down to look more closely. It was a palm! She had never seen one before. Ana picked up the palm and held it in her hand. All of a sudden, it spoke to her! "Hello Ana," the palm said. "I'm so happy to meet you. My name is Albert. I used to live on this beach but now I'm very lonely." Ana was so surprised to hear the palm speak that she gasped. She scooped him up and hugged him close. "Don't worry Albert," she said. "You won't be lonely anymore! I'm going to take care of you and visit you every day. We can go for regular walks along the beach." Albert was very happy. Ana smiled and she knew that she and Albert were going to be best friends forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little baby named Timmy. Timmy was very naughty and he loved to jump on his crib. His mommy always told him to stop, but he never listened. One day, Timmy's mommy went to the store and left him with his big sister, Lily. Lily told Timmy to stop jumping on his crib, but he didn't listen. Suddenly, Timmy fell off his crib and started crying. Lily helped him up and asked him if he learned his lesson. Timmy nodded his head. When their mommy came back from the store, Lily told her what happened. Their mommy was happy that Timmy learned his lesson. She hugged him and they all laughed together. The moral of the story is to always listen to your family when they tell you to stop doing something naughty.

Anna and Ben are playing in the kitchen. They see a big bowl on the table. It is full of something white and sticky. They do not know what it is. "Let's touch it!" says Ben. He puts his hand in the bowl and feels the white stuff. It is cold and wet. He laughs and pulls his hand out. He has white stuff on his fingers. "Me too!" says Anna. She also puts her hand in the bowl and feels the white stuff. She thinks it is funny and makes a face. She has white stuff on her hand. They look at each other and smile. They have a new game. They slap each other's hands and make the white stuff fly. They giggle and slap harder. The white stuff goes everywhere. It lands on their hair, their clothes, their faces. It also lands on the floor, the walls, the chairs. They do not hear Mom coming. She opens the door and sees the mess. She is very angry. She shouts at them. "What are you doing? That is my cake mix! You ruined it! You are very naughty! Go to your room now!" Anna and Ben are scared. They drop their hands and look at Mom. They see her red face and her big eyes. They feel sorry. They did not know it was cake mix. They did not know it was bad. They just wanted to play. They say "Sorry, Mom" in a small voice. They run to their room. They cry. They do not like to make Mom angry. They do not like to slap. They do not like the unknown bowl.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends, but one day she got lost. She cried and cried until her aunt found her.  "Auntie, I was so scared!" Lily said. "It's okay, sweetie. You're safe now," her aunt replied, giving her a big hug. "But next time, you need to hurry and tell an adult where you're going." Lily nodded and promised to be more careful. From that day on, she always made sure to stay close to her aunt or tell her where she was going. She learned that it's important to be safe and to ask for help when she needed it.

Once upon a time, there was a lazy dog who lived in a small house. The dog didn't like to do anything except lie around the house all day. One day, the dog spotted a cherry tree in the garden. The tree had lots and lots of ripe, juicy cherries. The dog quickly got to work and started picking the cherries one by one.  Pretty soon, the dog had a basket full of cherries. On his way back inside, he bumped into a small girl who was looking for something. The girl had a surprised look on her face and asked: "What are those?" The dog answered with a happy voice: "Cherries!" The girl smiled and gave the dog a big hug. Then she asked him: "If I give you a hug, can you give me one cherry?". The dog just nodded, and the girl gave him a hug. As promised, the dog gave the girl one cherry.  The girl was very happy and thanked the lazy dog. She said goodbye and left with a cherry in hand, a smile on her face. The dog stayed in the garden, happily watching the girl as she walked away.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max loved to play and run outside. One sunny day, Max was playing in his yard when he saw a big, red ball. Max was eager to play with the ball. He ran and jumped to catch the ball with his mouth. He was so happy and wagged his tail all around. Max played with the ball all morning. After playing, Max was hungry. He went inside his house and saw a yummy snack on the floor. Max ate the snack and felt full. He was very happy and went back outside to play with his red ball some more.

Once upon a time, there was a girl. She was very happy. One day, she wanted to go for a walk. As she was walking, she heard something yummy. It was a purple ice-cream truck. She couldn't believe it. She quickly came to the truck. When she arrived, she saw lots of yummy ice-creams. She asked for one. The ice-cream man gave her the yummiest purple ice-cream ever. She was so happy. She enjoyed her ice-cream as she continued her walk. She was so happy she wanted to come back to the truck later. She wanted more ice-cream.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was three years old. One day she went to the hospital with her mommy. She was very scared and her mommy held her tight.  At the hospital, she saw a lot of doctors and nurses wearing white clothes. She wondered what they were doing. She wanted to see some of the toys in the hospital, but her mommy said they had to stay in the waiting room.  The little girl kept wondering. She thought it was strange to see everyone in white clothes and to stay in one place. Then, her mommy told her that the hospital was a special place with lots of sick children who needed help.  The little girl felt happy when she heard this. She looked around and smiled, feeling very lucky to have her mommy there to keep her tight and safe. The hospital wasn't scary after all!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She had a favorite vest that she wore every day. It was red and had a picture of a fierce lion on it. Mia thought the lion was very cool. One day, Mia's vest got dirty from playing outside. She was sad and didn't want to take it off. Her mommy said, "Mia, we need to clean your vest so it looks nice again." Mia agreed and gave her vest to her mommy. While the vest was being cleaned, Mia played with her toys. She pretended her teddy bear was a fierce lion, just like the one on her vest. When her mommy brought the clean vest back, Mia was so happy. She put it on and said, "Thank you, Mommy! Now my lion can be fierce and clean!" Mia and her mommy smiled and hugged each other.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys and he had a big toy box where he put them all. One day, Timmy's mom told him that they were going to clean the house. Timmy didn't like cleaning, but he knew it was important to help his mom. While they were cleaning, Timmy's mom told him a story about a big war that happened long ago. She said that people fought with each other and it was very scary. Timmy didn't like the sound of that, but he listened carefully to his mom's story. After they finished cleaning, Timmy was very tired. He went to his toy box and put all his toys away. As he was putting them away, he thought about his mom's story and how he didn't want to fight with anyone. Timmy decided that he would always try to keep things clean and peaceful, just like his toy box.

Once upon a time, there was a big ocean. In the ocean lived a jellyfish. The jellyfish was very pretty and had long tentacles. One day, the jellyfish saw a little fish swimming by. The jellyfish wanted to say hello, so it nodded its head. The little fish was happy and swam closer to the jellyfish. The jellyfish was very obedient and didn't move around too much. It wanted to be friends with the little fish. The little fish liked the jellyfish and they swam together for a while. Suddenly, a big wave came and the little fish got scared. But the jellyfish was brave and stayed close to the little fish. The little fish felt safe and thanked the jellyfish for being a good friend. From that day on, they swam together every day and had lots of fun in the big ocean.

Emma was walking through the woods by herself one day when she noticed something bright in the bushes. She walked closer and saw that it was a clay pot. She reached and picked it up. It felt cold and made her shiver. The pot was filthy and Emma was sure that there must be something special inside. She used her hands to scrape away the dirt and mud and quickly discovered that it was full of coins. Excited, she carefully looked through the coins, but she couldn't help her hands from shaking and she dropped some of them in the dirt. She quickly put the coins away and shivered. She knew that she couldn't keep the coins, so she carefully put them back in the clay pot and placed the pot back in the bushes. She smiled and skipped away, happy to have made such a wonderful, yet filthy, discovery.

Once there was a noisy alligator. He liked to cause a lot of commotion and he frequently made loud noises. One day, he was walking through the swamp, loudly singing and causing a ruckus. He came across a duck who said to him, “Please be quiet! You’re being very noisy.” But the alligator refused to listen and kept singing. He walked a bit further and came across a frog who said the same thing to him. “Please don’t be so noisy!” But the alligator continued to sing and be disruptive. Finally, the alligator came across a wise old turtle and she said to him, “It’s nice to be happy, but it’s not nice to be too loud. You’d be better off if you kept your voice down and behaved more politely.” The alligator heeded the turtle’s advice and from then on he made sure to stay quiet and not be too disruptive. He learned that sometimes it’s better to be polite than to be too noisy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to talk a lot, especially to her toys. One day, she was playing with her doll when she heard her mommy say, "I need to cut some vegetables for dinner."  Lily wanted to help her mommy, so she asked if she could cut something too. Her mommy said no because the knife was too sharp for her. But Lily was persistent and kept asking.  Finally, her mommy gave her a plastic knife and some play dough to cut. Lily was so happy and started cutting the play dough into little pieces. She talked to her doll all about it and showed her the pieces she cut.  After dinner, Lily's mommy praised her for being such a good helper and for being persistent in wanting to help. Lily felt proud of herself and went to bed with a big smile on her face.

One day, a little dancer named Lily went to the park. She saw a big, crazy bird near a tree. The bird was jumping up and down and making a lot of noise. Lily thought it was funny and wanted to play with the bird. She walked closer and said, "Hi, bird! Do you want to play with me?" The bird looked at Lily and said, "Oh, I'm too heavy to play. I can't fly or dance like you. I need help to weigh less." Lily felt sad for the bird and wanted to help. She said, "Don't worry, bird. I will help you. We can eat healthy food and exercise together." Lily and the bird started to eat fruits and vegetables. They also danced and played in the park every day. After some time, the bird weighed less and could fly again. The bird was so happy and said, "Thank you, Lily! Now I can fly and play with you." Lily and the bird became best friends. They played and danced together in the park all the time. The other kids saw them and wanted to join in the fun. Everyone learned that eating healthy and exercising can make you feel great and have more fun. The moral of the story is that helping others can make you feel happy and make new friends. Also, eating healthy and exercising is important for everyone.

Once upon a time, there was a cat. He was gentle and loved to play. One day, he decided to go for a walk. He walked and he walked until he came across an old tree. Inside the tree he found a jar of jam. He was so happy! He put the jam in his pocket and continued walking until it was time to go home. On the way back, he heard a noise. He turned around and saw a little bird. The bird was scared so the cat was very gentle. He moved slowly and spoke softly to the bird. The bird decided to come with him and they began to walk back together. They arrived home and the cat set the jar of jam down on the table. He remembered the bird and said goodbye. The bird thanked him and flew away. The cat thought about the bird all night and the next day he decided to return to the old tree. He looked everywhere but the bird was nowhere to be seen. He left some of the jam for the bird and then he gently walked back home.

Max was a fine three-year-old, and he was very tired. He had been playing all day, so he yawned. Max's mother said to him, "Time to get ready for bed, Max. Let's start by putting on your pajamas! Come over here, let's do the zipper." Max was annoyed and he frowned. "No!" He shouted. "I don't want to go to bed yet!" Max's mother sighed. "Max, you have to go to bed soon. Otherwise, you won't feel fine for tomorrow. Now come over here and let me do the zipper on your pajamas." Reluctantly, Max trudged over to his mother. Together they pulled the zipper up. Max's mother gave him a big hug. "Good job, Max," she said. "Now it's time for bed!" Max yawned, and he knew it was time for bed. Even though he was tired, at least now he was feeling fine.

Lily was a little girl who liked to play with her toys. She had a lot of toys, but her favorite was a soft bunny. She always hugged her bunny and took it with her everywhere. One day, Lily was playing in the living room with her bunny. She saw the fireplace and wanted to see the fire. She knew that fire was hot and dangerous, but she was curious. She left her bunny on the couch and walked to the fireplace. She reached out her hand to touch the fire, but it was too hot. She felt a pain in her hand and pulled it back. She started to cry and ran to her mommy. Her mommy saw her hand and put some cold water on it. She hugged Lily and told her that fire was not for playing. She said that Lily should never reach for the fire again, or she could get hurt. Lily said she was sorry and that she learned her lesson. She asked her mommy where her bunny was. Her mommy said that her bunny was still on the couch. Lily ran to the couch and picked up her bunny. She felt its soft fur and kissed it. She was happy to have her bunny and said that she would always listen to her mommy. The moral of the story is that fire is dangerous and children should not play with it. They should listen to their parents and be careful. They should also appreciate their toys and not leave them behind.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing in the park and looking at the fountain. The fountain was big and had water that went up and down. Timmy liked to watch the water go up and down slowly. One day, Timmy saw a girl at the park. She looked sad and lonely. Timmy wanted to be her friend, but she didn't want to play with him. She ignored him and walked away. Timmy felt sad too. Later that day, Timmy was playing near the fountain when he saw the girl again. She was trying to throw a coin in the fountain, but she couldn't reach. Timmy remembered how she ignored him earlier, but he still wanted to help her. He went over and helped her throw the coin in the fountain. The girl smiled and said thank you. Timmy felt happy that he helped her and they became friends.

The little girl was so happy. She moved around the room, looking for something to do. Suddenly, she found something that made her even happier - her mommy's laundry basket! It was full of colorful, clean clothes and she couldn't help but smile. She moved closer to the basket and started taking out the clothes. She put them on the bed and waved her hands in the air, enjoying the feeling of the soft fabrics between her fingers. Suddenly, her mommy appeared in the room. Smiling, she said, "What a delicious surprise! You're helping mommy with the laundry." She moved closer and sat next to the little girl. Together, they folded the clothes and put them in neat piles. The little girl was so proud of herself for helping her mommy.  When they were finally done, her mommy took out a delicious snack for the little girl. Together, they enjoyed the snack and drank some cool lemonade while they talked about what they were going to do next.  The little girl had a great day - first helping with the laundry, then eating a delicious snack!

Once upon a time, a young snake was living in the woods. He was a friendly snake and loved to explore the wild areas. Every day he would slither around the forest, looking for new and exciting things. But one day, he saw a big, scary monster! He was so frightened he quickly ran away. He ran back to a log and hid under it. He was panting and scared when a voice said, "Young snake, I see you! You must be careful; there is danger in these woods. You must heed my warning.” The little snake was so surprised that someone was talking to him! He looked carefully and saw a friendly squirrel. The squirrel said, “I wanted to warn you because there are many predators in the woods. You must be careful and stay far away from them.” The little snake thanked the friendly squirrel and promised to be extra careful. He slowly crawled away, keeping an eye out for anything dangerous. He learned his lesson: always listen to warnings!

George was really excited. He was getting a new armchair! It was a special fancy one and he couldn't wait to sit in it. Soon, it arrived. It was huge and his dad had to carry it into the house. George ran circles around his dad as he held out his arms, trying to help him. Finally, the armchair was in the living room. His dad looked at George and said, "Ready to try it out?" "Yes!" yelled George, jumping into the armchair. It was so comfortable. He squished up into it and said, "This is the best armchair ever!"  His dad smiled and said, "I'm glad you like it, George."  George was so proud of his new fancy armchair. He knew it would be the most comfortable chair in the house.

Once upon a time, there was a rich boy called Tim. He loved to go outside and move around. One day, Tim went to the roof of his house and he saw something amazing – a bouncy castle! It was so big and colourful, Tim couldn't believe his eyes.  He ran back inside to find his parents. When he found them, he asked them: "Can I go play on the bouncy castle?" His parents smiled and agreed to take him. When Tim got to the castle, he jumped and moved around like never before. He had so much fun, that he didn't want to leave. His parents had to call him several times to get him to come home. From that day onwards, Tim knew that the roof of his house contained amazing surprises. He loved to come up there and move around. Even now, as a grown-up, he always goes to the roof of his house whenever he needs some time to enjoy the beautiful view and simply move around.

Once upon a time, there was a girl called Maisy. Maisy loved to play outside and have fun. One day, Maisy's mommy said they were all going to the movies. Maisy was very excited, because she loved going to the movies. When they got there, Maisy and her family went into the theater. It was very dark and Maisy couldn't see anything. Maisy looked around and started to guess what movie was playing. Then, the lights in the theater changed and became very light. Maisy guessed right away that the movie was her favorite - a movie about ponies! Maisy and her family all enjoyed the movie. She was glad she guessed right and could watch her favorite movie. The end.

Anna and Ben were playing in the park. They saw a big bird with many feathers. Anna wanted to touch the feathers. She ran after the bird. "Anna, stop!" Ben said. "The bird does not like that. It will fly away." But Anna did not listen. She was persistent. She insisted on touching the feathers. She got closer and closer to the bird. The bird saw Anna. It was scared. It flapped its wings and made a loud noise. It flew up in the air. But one feather fell down. Anna saw the feather. She was happy. She picked up the feather. "Look, Ben!" Anna said. "I got a feather!" Ben was not happy. He was worried. He saw something else. He saw a big dog. The dog saw the feather. The dog liked the feather. The dog ran after Anna. "Anna, watch out!" Ben said. "The dog wants your feather. It will bite you." But Anna did not hear Ben. She was proud. She held the feather high. She did not see the dog. The dog got closer and closer to Anna. What do you think will happen next?

Once upon a time there was a new statue. The statue was made of shiny stone and stood very tall. People came from far away to see the beautiful statue. The statue was so tall that it reached the sky!  One day, the wind started to blow. It blew harder and harder. The statue tried to resist the wind but it was too strong. The statue swayed back and forth until it fell down. Everyone was very sad. They didn't know how to fix the statue. But then a magical bird came and flew around the statue. The bird waited until the wind stopped and used its beak to put the pieces back together. Once the statue was rebuilt, it was even more beautiful than before. Everyone cheered with joy. And from then on, the statue stood tall and strong, and never had to resist the wind again.

Mia and her mommy were in the bedroom. Mia was painting a big picture for her mommy. It was a beautiful painting with lots of colors. "Mommy, do you like it?" Mia asked. "Oh, Mia, it's so beautiful! You used lots of colors," her mommy said. Mia was very proud of her painting. She put the painting on her mommy's dress hanger. It was so tidy and pretty. But then, Mia's sister came into the bedroom. She did not mind the painting at all. She just wanted to take the hanger. She grabbed it and started to run away. Mia tried to get it back but it was too late. Her sister ran away and kept the hanger. Mia was very sad. Her painting was no longer tidy and pretty. She wanted to keep it and show it off to all her friends, but it was gone. Mia was so sad that she did not feel like painting anymore. She learned a lesson that day: always mind your things and take care of them.

One day, Arnold and his family were on their way to the park. Arnold was so excited, he could barely wait to get there. He knew it was going to be perfect. As they drove along in their family vehicle, Arnold noticed an old tractor in the field next to them. He asked his Mom if they could part and go see it. But his Mom said no, they were running late, so they had to keep going. Arnold was really disappointed. He really wanted to see the old tractor and he knew it was perfect. But they just couldn't part and go see it. So, Arnold decided to do something. He asked his Dad if they could at least drive by slowly and take a look at it. His Dad smiled and agreed. So, as they drove along, Arnold was so happy, as he was able to catch a glimpse of the tractor. It was perfect!

Once upon a time, there was a charming little girl named Lily. She had a pretty skirt that she loved to wear. It was her favorite skirt. Lily wanted to show her skirt to her best friend, Tim. One sunny day, Lily put on her pretty skirt and went to Tim's house. Tim saw Lily's skirt and said, "Wow, your skirt is so nice!" Lily felt very happy that Tim liked her skirt. Lily and Tim played all day in the park, showing their friends the pretty skirt. Everyone thought Lily's skirt was very charming. At the end of the day, Lily and Tim went home, tired but happy. They had a great day showing off the pretty skirt.

Once upon a time there was a mouse who liked to jump. One day, the mouse saw a print and thought it looked fun. So, he stepped on top of it and jumped. "Wheeee!" yelled the mouse. The mouse then looked at the print more closely. It had strange lines on it that looked disgusting. The mouse called out, "Hey buddy! What is this?" A frog that was nearby spoke up. "That's a bug," croaked the frog. "It's not a good thing." The mouse said, "Oh, yuck! I'm jumping away fast!" So, the mouse ran away and never looked back at that disgusting bug. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his friends. One day, Timmy's friend Billy came to visit him. "Hey Timmy, do you want to go kayaking with me?" asked Billy. Timmy thought for a moment and said, "Yes! I want to choose the blue kayak." Billy smiled and said, "That's a great choice! The blue kayak is very fast." So, Timmy and Billy went kayaking on the river. They saw many fish and birds along the way. Timmy felt very happy and rich because he had such a good friend like Billy.

Once upon a time, there was a big race. The racers ran fast and tried to win. One racer was very quick and won the race. He was happy and proud. After the race, the racers went to a big structure. It was a tall building with lots of floors. They went inside and saw the clear windows. They could see everything outside. The winner looked out the window and felt happy. He had won the race and now he could see the world from the clear structure. It was a good day for him.

Once upon a time there was a small girl named Suzy. She was sad all the time because nobody ever wanted to be her friend. She tried to talk to the other kids but they would never listen. One day, Suzy decided to make a present for everyone in her town. She used colorful things and big smiles to make it. When she showed them the present, they weren't very nice. They said harsh things and made fun of her.  Suzy was so upset, she wanted to hide. But then she remembered something her mom had once told her - to forgive people, even when it's hard. So she opened her heart and forgave the mean kids for being so harsh.  In the end, the other kids realized how kind Suzy was and soon, she had lots of friends. Everyone in town was so happy and Suzy was too. She knew then that remembering to forgive is the best present of all.

Once upon a time, in a big town, there was a wise nurse. She helped many people feel better when they were sick. She was very kind and everyone loved her. One day, the wise nurse met a little girl who was sad. The little girl had lost her toy. The nurse wanted to help the little girl find her toy. So, they went on a walk to look for it. As they walked, they saw a man wave at them. He had found the little girl's toy! The wise nurse and the little girl were very happy. They thanked the man and waved back. The little girl hugged her toy and the wise nurse knew she had made a new friend.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who wanted to buy a new top. She went to the shop and looked around. Suddenly, she saw a nice pink blouse. She liked it so much, so she chose it. The little girl went to the cashier and paid for it. She was so excited and couldn't wait to wear it. When she got home, she put the blouse on. She twirled around and around, feeling so happy. The pink color looked so pretty and bright. She smiled and knew it was a good choice.  The end!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved to play with his toy train. The train had a long rail that Tim could put together. He was very happy when he played with his train. One day, Tim wanted to pour water on the rail to make it slippery for the train. He thought it would be fun to watch the train go fast. But it was a stupid idea because the train could not go on the wet rail. The train slipped and fell off the rail. Tim was sad that his train fell off the rail. He learned that pouring water on the rail was not a good idea. Next time, he decided to keep the rail dry and play with his train the right way. And Tim and his train lived happily ever after.

John was playing in the park when he saw something in the grass. It was the biggest bug he had ever seen! He was so excited to pick it up and take it home.  But his mummy warned him not to touch it. She said it could be dangerous. John was embarrassed to listen to his mummy in front of his friends.  He decided to ignore her warning and he reached out to pick up the bug. Suddenly it flew up and buzzed around his head! It flew away to the shade of a nearby tree.  John was embarrassed again. He knew now that he should have listened to his mummy's warning.  He sadly walked home with his head down.

Once upon a time, there was a beautiful pink bird. The bird had soft feathers and always seemed to be smiling. One day, the bird flew away with a friendly wave. The bird flew to a little girl's house. When the bird arrived, the girl was very excited.  "Hello bird!" she said.  The bird greeted the girl with a friendly chirp. The girl smiled, and she said, "Would you like to stay with me for a while?" The bird tucked its head and nodded. The girl smiled and said, "I accept you and all the beautiful color of your feathers." The bird and the little girl became very good friends. The bird made the little girl's house brighter and more cheerful. Everywhere the bird went, the room lit up with beautiful pink.  The bird stayed with the girl and was very happy in her home. They laughed together, and the little girl loved her new friend. The bird had finally found someone to accept it, and it never wanted to go away.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She went to the park with her mom and dad. At the park, there was a big slide. Lily loved the slide and wanted to go on it. Her mom and dad said it was okay, but Lily had to be careful. Lily climbed up the ladder to the top of the slide. She was so excited to slide down. But then, she saw another slide that looked even more fun. She had to choose which one to go on. She decided to go on the new slide. But the new slide was not reliable. It broke when Lily went down it. She fell and hurt herself. Her mom and dad took her to the hospital. Lily learned that it is important to be careful and choose things that are safe.

Once upon a time, there was a group of youth who liked to play together. They had a lot of fun, but sometimes they didn't agree on what game to play. One day, they wanted to play hide-and-seek, but one of the youth, named Timmy, wanted to play tag instead.  The other youth didn't want to play tag because they thought it was too chaotic and not organized. Timmy was upset and didn't understand why they didn't want to play his game. He started to cry and ran away.  The other youth felt bad and went to look for Timmy. They heard him crying from behind a tree and went to comfort him. They apologized for not wanting to play tag and said they would play it next time. Timmy stopped crying and smiled, happy that they heard him and wanted to be friends again. From then on, they made sure to take turns choosing games so everyone was happy.

Lily and Ben were playing in the snow. They made a big snowman with a hat and a scarf. They gave him a carrot nose and two rocks for eyes. They were very happy. "Let's go inside now," said Lily. "It is cold and Mommy made hot cocoa for us." "No, I want to play more," said Ben. He was stubborn. He did not want to stop. "But you are wet and shivering," said Lily. "You need to wear a coat. Mommy will be angry if you get sick." "I don't care," said Ben. He threw a snowball at Lily. It hit her in the face. She cried. "Ben, that is not nice!" said Lily. She ran to the house. She opened the door and entered. She took off her wet gloves and boots. She saw Mommy in the kitchen. "Mommy, Ben is mean!" she said. "He threw a snowball at me and he does not want to come inside." Mommy hugged Lily and wiped her tears. She gave her a cup of hot cocoa. She looked out the window and saw Ben still playing in the snow. "Ben, come inside now!" she shouted. "You will catch a cold. Put on your coat and come here." Ben heard Mommy. He did not listen. He was stubborn. He made another snowball and threw it at the snowman. He missed. He slipped and fell. He hurt his knee. He cried. "Mommy, help!" he said. He wanted Mommy to come and hug him. He was sorry. Mommy heard Ben. She put down her cup and ran to the door. She opened it and entered the snow. She picked up Ben and carried him inside. She took off his wet clothes and put on his coat. She kissed his knee and gave him a band-aid. She gave him a cup of hot cocoa. "Ben, you were stubborn," she said. "You should have listened to Lily and me. You could have had fun and stayed warm. Next time, wear a coat and come inside when I call you." "I'm sorry, Mommy," said Ben. "I'm sorry, Lily. I love you." "I love you too, Ben," said Lily. She smiled and hugged him. They drank their hot cocoa and ate some cookies. They were happy.

Once upon a time in the wild forest, there was a little girl. She had an axe, and she loved to number the trees. She would count them one by one as she walked. Every day, she found a new and exciting thing in the forest. She saw wild animals and furry bunnies, and she even saw a big bear! One day, she found an old tree with a huge axe stuck in it. The little girl tried to pull the axe out, but it was too heavy! She kept trying and trying and eventually, the axe was free. She was so excited! She thought it was really cool! The little girl took the axe home with her, and she was so happy to show it to her family. She had found a real, wild axe in the forest! She couldn't believe it, and neither could her family. From that day on, the little girl and her axe were inseparable! She went on all sorts of adventures together, numbering trees, finding wild animals and exploring the secrets of the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a girl. She was called Emma. Every day, Emma went to school. She always looked very attractive. One day, Emma was in school and was doing a quiz. Suddenly, she felt a tickle in her nose. She started to sneeze. She sneezed and sneezed and sneezed. Her teacher told her to go and blow her nose. Emma put her handkerchief to her nose, blew and then felt much better. She was so happy that she could continue with her quiz. The end.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a big, red cross in his toy box. He thought it was brilliant and wanted to show it to his best friend, Sam. So, he picked it up and went to Sam's house. When Tim got to Sam's house, he showed the red cross to Sam. Sam liked it too! Sam said, "Wow, that's a brilliant cross! Let's see if it can fit in my toy box." They tried to put the cross in the toy box, but it was too big. Tim and Sam thought hard about how to make the cross fit. Then, Sam had an idea. He said, "Let's break it into smaller pieces, so it can fit in the toy box." They carefully broke the cross into smaller pieces and put them in the toy box. After that, they were very happy because they made the brilliant cross fit in the toy box. They played with the cross and other toys all day long. And from that day on, Tim and Sam always found fun ways to play together with their toys.

Lila was a little lamb who liked to jog. She jogged in the morning, she jogged in the afternoon, and she jogged in the evening. She jogged with her mom, she jogged with her dad, and she jogged with her friends. She loved to feel the wind in her wool and the sun on her face. One day, Lila decided to jog by herself. She wanted to be independent and explore new places. She said to her mom, "Mom, can I jog alone today? I want to see what is over the hill." Her mom said, "Lila, you are too little to jog alone. It is not safe. There are big animals and bad people who might hurt you. You should stay with me or your dad or your friends." But Lila did not listen. She said, "No, mom, I am big enough. I can take care of myself. I will be back soon. Bye!" And she jogged away. Lila jogged over the hill and saw a big forest. She thought it looked fun and exciting. She jogged into the forest and saw many trees and flowers and birds. She jogged deeper and deeper into the forest, until she got lost. She could not see the hill or the sun or her home. She felt scared and lonely. She wished she had listened to her mom. She heard a loud roar and saw a big lion. The lion had sharp teeth and claws and hungry eyes. He wanted to eat Lila. Lila ran as fast as she could, but the lion was faster. He caught up with her and pounced on her. Lila screamed for help. Luckily, her mom heard her scream. She had followed Lila's tracks and found her in the forest. She ran to Lila and fought the lion. She bit his tail and kicked his nose and scared him away. She hugged Lila and said, "Lila, are you okay? I was so worried about you. You should never jog alone. It is too dangerous. You need to stay with me or your dad or your friends. We love you and we want to protect you." Lila cried and said, "I'm sorry, mom. I was wrong. I was not independent. I was foolish. I will never jog alone again. I love you and I need you. Thank you for saving me." Her mom said, "It's okay, Lila. I forgive you. You are my brave and beautiful lamb. Come on, let's go home." They jogged back to their home, where Lila's dad and friends were waiting for them. They were happy to see them and gave them hugs and kisses. Lila learned her lesson and never jogged alone again. She jogged with her mom, she jogged with her dad, and she jogged with her friends. She still loved to feel the wind in her wool and the sun on her face, but she also loved to feel the love in her heart.

Once upon a time, there was a mule named Jack. Jack was a big animal with long ears and a brown coat. One day, Jack went for a walk in the forest. It was dark and he felt scared. Suddenly, he saw a light and he felt better. The light came from a house. Jack went closer to the house and he saw a man. The man gave Jack some food and water. Jack felt happy and he changed his mind about being scared. From that day on, Jack visited the man every time he felt scared in the dark forest.

Once upon a time, there was a penguin. He had a big task to do, but he was feeling very nervous. He had to pass something very important to another penguin. The nervous penguin walked slowly and carefully. He wanted to make sure he did not trip or drop the item. He was almost at the other penguin when suddenly he heard a loud noise. He was so scared that he dropped the thing and it fell all the way down to the bottom of a deep hole! The nervous penguin was so sad and he felt like he had failed his task. He sat down and started to cry, but then he had an idea. He waddled over to the edge of the hole and stretched his neck as far as he could. He was able to reach the thing, and he carefully passed it up to the other penguin. The other penguin was so pleased. He thanked the nervous penguin and they both hugged. Everything was alright in the end.

One day, a little girl named Sue was in the kitchen with her mom. Her mom was making a cake. Sue saw the cream and it reminded her of ice cream. She asked her mom, "Can I have some ice cream, please?" Her mom said, "Not now, Sue. We need to eat dinner first. We will have a healthy meal with veggies and then we can have ice cream." Sue was sad, but she knew her mom was right. They needed to eat healthy food before having treats. She helped her mom cook dinner and set the table. They had a yummy meal with lots of veggies. After dinner, Sue and her mom cleaned up the kitchen. Sue was excited, because she knew it was almost time for ice cream. She could see the cream on the counter, waiting to be used. Finally, her mom said, "Okay, Sue. It's time for ice cream!" They made big bowls of ice cream with the cream and enjoyed their treat together. Sue was happy that she had listened to her mom and eaten her healthy dinner first.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny was very weak and he always felt tired. One day, Benny met a wise old owl who lived in a tree in the east. The owl asked Benny, "Why do you look so weak, little bunny?"  Benny replied, "I don't know. I just feel tired all the time."  The owl said, "Maybe you need some exercise. Why don't you try running around and playing with your friends?"  Benny nodded and said, "Okay, I'll try that."  As Benny was playing with his friends, they found a toy gun and started pretending to shoot each other. Benny didn't like the idea of shooting, so he said, "Let's play something else. How about we race to the east and back?"  His friends agreed and they all ran as fast as they could to the east. Benny felt much better after running and playing with his friends. From that day on, Benny made sure to exercise every day and he never felt weak again.

Once upon a time there was a boy who loved to listen to the birds sing in the sky. But one day he heard something different. It was like the sound of water pouring out of a pipe. He thought it was interesting but he couldn't figure out where it was coming from. So he started to listen harder as he walked around his neighborhood. He looked under bushes and in the trees, but he couldn't find the sound. Finally, he looked up in the sky and spotted it! High up in the sky was a pipe spraying water from one end. As he watched the water danced through the air. He thought it was the most interesting thing he had ever seen. So each day he would make sure to listen for the sound of the pipe and watch the water twirl around in the sky.

Once upon a time, there was a man who was very famous. He was always on TV and in the newspaper. One day, he went to the store to buy some candy. When he got to the store, he realized that he forgot his wallet. He was sad because he really wanted some candy. Luckily, a kind lady saw him and reminded him that he forgot his wallet. He was very happy and said thank you to the lady. He went back to his car to get his wallet and then he went back to the store to buy some candy. He was so happy that he could buy his candy and he didn't have to go home without it.  From that day on, the man always remembered to check if he had his wallet with him before he left the house. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a shiny red bicycle that he loved to ride. One day, Timmy's friend Billy came over to play. Billy saw Timmy's bicycle and felt jealous because he didn't have one.  Timmy let Billy ride his bicycle and they had fun together. They rode around the block and marked their path with chalk on the ground. Billy felt happy to ride the bicycle and forgot about feeling jealous.  After they finished riding, Timmy and Billy went inside to have some snacks. Timmy's mom gave them cookies and milk. They talked about how much fun they had riding the bicycle together. Billy realized that he didn't need to be jealous because he had a good friend like Timmy.

Tom and Lily were twins who liked to play in the garden. One day, they saw a big tree with red fruits on it. They were cherries, and they looked yummy. "Let's pick some cherries and eat them," Tom said. "OK, but be careful. Mom said not to climb too high," Lily said. They ran to the tree and started to pick the cherries. They ate some and put some in a basket. They were sweet and juicy. "Look, there is a big cherry up there. I want it," Tom said. He pointed to a branch that was very high. "No, Tom, don't go there. It's too high and dangerous. You might fall," Lily said. But Tom did not listen. He wanted the big cherry. He climbed higher and higher, until he reached the branch. He stretched his hand to grab the cherry. "Got it!" he shouted. But then, the branch broke. Tom lost his balance and fell to the ground. He hit his head on a rock and did not move. "Tom! Tom!" Lily screamed. She ran to him and shook him. But he did not wake up. He did not repeat her name. He did not open his eyes. He was gone. Lily cried and cried. She wished she could have the little cherry back and give it to Tom. She wished he would wake up and play with her again. But it was too late. She was alone.

Once upon a time, there was a funny monkey named Max. Max loved to joke around with his friends in the jungle. One day, Max decided to play a joke on his friend, the elephant. He hid behind a big stack of bananas and waited for the elephant to walk by.  When the elephant got close, Max jumped out and scared him! The elephant was surprised, but then he laughed and said, "Max, you're such a jokester!" Max was happy that his friend liked his joke.  Later that day, Max saw a nosy bird peeking into his tree. Max didn't like when others were nosy, so he asked the bird to leave. The bird flew away, and Max went back to playing with his friends. From then on, Max made sure to only joke around with friends who weren't too nosy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy who was three years old. She liked to take care of things, like her toys and her pet dog Spike. One day, Lucy was very sad. Her mom had given her a sour lemon to eat, and she didn't like it. Lucy started to cry, and Spike looked so sad too. But Spike had a plan to make Lucy feel better. He ran to the kitchen and grabbed a few yummy snacks. He ran back to Lucy and gave them to her. Lucy smiled and hugged Spike, feeling very happy and cared for. They finished the snacks, and Spike went back to the kitchen to get more. Lucy hugged him again and saw how much he cared for her. From then on, Lucy and Spike were the best of friends. Even when things were sour, Lucy knew that Spike was always there to take care of her.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing with his toy cars, but he always wanted more. One day, he saw a toy store and ran inside to see what they had.  He saw a toy missile and wanted it so badly, but it was too expensive. The store owner saw Timmy's sad face and said, "I have a cheap toy missile in the back, would you like to see it?"  Timmy followed the store owner to the back and saw the cheap missile. It wasn't as cool as the expensive one, but he still wanted it. He asked the store owner, "Can I sell my old toy cars to buy it?"  The store owner smiled and said, "Sure, I'll give you a good deal." Timmy was so happy he could hardly contain himself. He sold his old toy cars and bought the cheap missile.  As he left the store, he saw a group of kids playing with their toy cars. Timmy showed them his new missile and they all wanted to play with it. Timmy was happy to share and they all had fun playing together.

Little Sam was out of the house taking a walk with his mom. As they walked, they heard a scurrying sound behind them. Mom turned around and saw a rat running away. "Mom, what's that?" Little Sam asked. "That was a rat, sweetie," Mom said kindly. After a few minutes, they stopped in front of an old store. It was an elderly store with a big sign on the roof. Little Sam pointed at the sign and asked, "What does it say, Mom?" Mom smiled and said, "It says 'Welcome to Sam's Store'. Sam's Store is a very special place. It's a store for old things." Little Sam was curious, so he asked, "What kind of old things do they sell here?" "All kinds of things," Mom said. "From vintage toys to antiques."  Little Sam was excited and couldn't wait to explore the store. He grabbed his mom's hand and they both headed inside Sam's Store.

Once upon a time, there was a playful dog named Spot. Spot loved to run and jump all day long. He had a red ball that he liked to chase and catch. Spot was very happy. One day, Spot saw a cart. The cart had many toys in it. Spot wanted to play with the toys, but he did not know if they belonged to him. He looked around to see if anyone was there. Then, a little girl named Sue came running to the cart. Sue said, "These toys belong to me, but I like to share. Do you want to play with me, Spot?" Spot wagged his tail and played with Sue and the toys. They had lots of fun together.

Once upon a time there was a beautiful log in the forest. Every day a little squirrel kept visiting the log. He used to keep a close watch on it because he loved it. One day the little squirrel was overjoyed to see the log and hugged it. At that moment, he did not notice the big, scary bear. The bear did not like how the squirrel was hugging the log and he started to growl. The little squirrel got scared and said, “Please don’t hurt me! I’m just trying to keep the log safe.”  But the bear didn’t care. He roared loudly and snatched the log away from the squirrel. The poor little squirrel was sad and helpless and he ran away, never to see the beautiful log again.

Sammy went to class to store her fat book. His teacher said, "It needs to go on the shelf!" Sammy looked around the class, but he didn't see any shelves. Suddenly, he spotted a big, fat shelf right in the corner. He grabbed his book and quickly stored it on the shelf.  Sammy was happy and said, "I'm so glad that I found a place to store my fat book!" Then, he ran back to his friends, who were playing in the corner. They cheered and said, "Way to go, Sammy!" Sammy smiled and he knew that his book was safe.  The next day, Sammy visited his class again, but this time he was carrying two fat books. He stored both of the fat books on the shelf and felt proud of himself. He had put them on the shelf all by himself!  Sammy was very happy. He carried his books to the corner and played with his friends. They continued to play until it was time to go home. Sammy and his friends waved goodbye and said, "See you tomorrow!"

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. They have a ball, a bike and a bell. The bell is on the bike. Lily likes to ring the bell. Ben likes to ride the bike. One day, they go to the park. Lily says, "Can I ring the bell?" Ben says, "Yes, you can. But be careful. Do not ring it too loud. Some people do not like loud noises." Lily nods. She takes the bell and rings it softly. It makes a nice sound. Ben gets on the bike. He pedals fast. He feels the wind on his face. He smiles. He sees a big hill. He wants to go down the hill. He thinks it will be fun. But he is careless. He does not look where he is going. He does not see a dog. The dog is sleeping on the grass. Ben rides the bike over the dog. The dog wakes up. The dog is angry. It barks and chases Ben. Lily hears the dog. She sees Ben. She is scared. She rings the bell loud. She hopes the dog will stop. But the dog does not stop. It runs faster. Ben hears the bell. He looks back. He sees the dog. He is scared too. He tries to pedal faster. But he loses his balance. He falls off the bike. He hurts his knee. He cries. Lily runs to Ben. She drops the bell. She hugs Ben. She says, "I am sorry. I wanted to help you. Are you okay?" Ben says, "I am okay. But my knee hurts. And the bike is broken. And the dog is still here." They look at the dog. The dog is not angry anymore. It is wagging its tail. It licks Ben's knee. It wants to play. Lily and Ben learn a lesson. They learn to be careful. They learn to look where they are going. They learn to respect the dog. They also learn to share. They give the dog the ball. The dog is happy. They are happy too. They are still friends.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Beth. Beth was always very comfortable and loved the earth. Every day, she took time to appreciate nature and the beauty of her surroundings. One day, Beth decided to go to a special place where she could shake and tremble the earth. She put her hands in the dirt and started to shake. Beth shook and shook until the whole earth trembled. At first, Beth was scared. But then she noticed the earth was also shaking with happiness. Everywhere she looked, little plants were swaying and birds were singing their own special song. Beth was so happy she kept shaking and shaking with the earth until nightfall. When it was finally dark, Beth felt so comfortable, like she was lying in the softest of beds. She said good night to the earth and the world around her, sure that tomorrow would be just as special.

Once upon a time, there was a fancy turkey. Every morning, the turkey would roll around in the green field. He loved to run around and have fun. One day, when the turkey was out in the field rolling around, a sweet smell filled the air. The turkey stopped and sniffed the air. What was it? He followed the smell and found a big oven. Inside the oven was a big fancy turkey, all nicely cooked and golden brown. The turkey was so excited and started to run around in circles! He was so happy he even started to do a funny dance - he rolled from side to side. The turkey decided he wanted to be as fancy as the one in the oven. He ran back out into the field and rolled around to make himself look nice and fancy. Then he ran back to the oven to show it off. The turkey was so happy that the oven turkey was impressed.
