The two of them rolled around in the green field all day until it was time for the sun to set. The next day, the turkey was even more fancy, and he rolled around in the green field all morning until he found more oven turkeys to show off to. It was a perfect day!

Bob and Sue were together on an adventure. They were on a journey to discover something new and exciting. Sue was so excited to explore and find out what was around the corner. Bob was the leader of the journey and he tried his best to stay organized. He made sure that all the items they needed were packed and ready.  However, just as they were about to get started, Bob suddenly began to feel overwhelmed by the task in front of him. He started to feel very nervous and unsure. Sue noticed this and try to encourage him. She said, “It’s okay Bob! We can do this! Let’s just stay organized and have fun!” Bob smiled and nodded. He took a deep breath and yelled “Let’s go!” The two friends smiled and began their journey. They had a wonderful time discovering new things and learning about the world around them.

Once upon a time, there lived two friends in a small village. Their names were Paul and Matt. They were very good friends and they loved to play football together. One day they got into a quarrel and decided to play a game of football to decide who was right.  Paul kicked the ball really hard and it flew really high in the air. But Matt was too slow and the ball went over his head. The ball flew so high, it landed in a deep river.  The two friends were not able to get the ball out. They tried and tried but the river was too deep. They were both very sad and promised each other to never quarrel again.

Once upon a time there was a fragile baby named Jane. Jane loved discovering new things and exploring the world around her. One day, while she was playing outside, she discovered a secret. It was hidden in a tree and she was so excited. She had never seen anything like it before. When Jane opened the secret up, she saw a beautiful shining star! She was amazed. She ran to tell her mommy about her discovery. Her mommy smiled and said it was a very special star. She said it was a star that would bring Jane luck. Jane was so happy! After that day, Jane kept an eye out for the star. She wanted to recognize it wherever she saw it. Whenever she found the star, she would collect it and put it in her pocket for luck. Jane loved to find the star because it made her feel special. Soon, Jane's collection of stars grew bigger and bigger. She would show them to all of her friends and teach them how to recognize the special star. The star became a secret symbol of friendship, something special and fragile that Jane shared with her friends.

Once upon a time, there was a chubby bunny named Betsy. Betsy loved to eat pastries, especially ones with sprinkles on top. One day, Betsy saw a little bird trying to build a nest in a tree.  But Betsy didn't like the bird because it made too much noise. She decided to ignore the bird and keep eating her pastry. But the bird didn't give up and kept chirping louder and louder.  Betsy got angry and tried to scare the bird away, but it wouldn't budge. She realized that ignoring the bird wasn't the right thing to do. So, she decided to share her pastry with the bird as a peace offering.  The bird happily accepted the pastry and Betsy learned that sometimes it's better to be kind and not ignore others. From that day on, Betsy and the bird became good friends and Betsy even helped the bird build its nest. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Katie. She had a hammer that her father gave her. It was tough, made of metal and very shiny. It was Katie's favourite toy. One day, Katie was in her garden picking flowers when she saw a big tree. She decided to try and make a bow with her hammer, so she began to bash the tree trunk. She hit it as hard as she could but the tree was very tough and nothing happened.  Suddenly, there was an unexpected rumble. The tree trunk split right open, revealing a secret room hidden inside. Katie was so excited that she rushed inside the room and was amazed at what she saw. Inside were bows and arrows!  Katie was so pleased that she had managed to open the room with her hammer. She quickly grabbed the bows and arrows and ran outside to show her father. He was very impressed and praised Katie for her strong hammering!  Katie was very proud of what she had achieved and from then on she used her hammer to make bows whenever she needed to.

Once upon a time, there were two friends named Tom and Sue. Tom wanted to go on a tour, but Sue was being stubborn. Tom kept trying to talk to Sue about why he wanted to go on a tour. But Sue still didn't want to go. Even though she wasn't sure why, Sue just didn't want to go. Finally, Tom said to Sue, "Come on, let's go for a tour and have lots of fun!" Tom's words were so persuasive that Sue agreed to go on the tour. They ended up having a wonderful day seeing lots of new places and meeting lots of new people. Sue was so glad that she chose to follow Tom's suggestion and go on the tour.

Ben and Sam were brothers. They liked to play in the dark with their flashlight. They pretended they were spies and looked for clues. One night, they went to the basement to play. "Look, I found a big box!" Ben said. He opened it and saw many old things. "Wow, this is great! There are books and toys and clothes!" Sam came over and looked inside. He saw a shiny ball. He wanted to play with it. He reached for it, but Ben stopped him. "No, that's mine!" Ben said. He grabbed the ball and held it tight. "You can have something else!" Sam was angry. He wanted the ball too. He tried to take it from Ben, but Ben pushed him away. Sam fell on the floor and hit his head. He started to cry. "Stop crying, you baby!" Ben said. He turned on the flashlight and shone it in Sam's face. "You can't have the ball! It's mine!" Sam was hurt and scared. He wanted to get away from Ben. He kicked Ben's leg hard. Ben dropped the ball and the flashlight. The flashlight broke and the light went out. The basement was dark and quiet. Ben and Sam were alone in the dark. They could not see anything. They could not find the stairs. They could not call for help. They were very sorry. They wished they had shared the ball and the flashlight. They wished they had been nice to each other. They wished they had not played in the dark.

Once upon a time there was a battery in a gloomy forest. It was a big battery, and it liked to go on adventures. One day the battery decided to go explore. It hopped and skipped through the forest and came across a cool pond. It gleamed in the light and the battery wanted to go and have a splash.  As the battery stepped into the water, it noticed something sparkling in the corner. Wondering what it could be, the battery slowly approached. To its surprise it was a little toy boat! The battery carefully grabbed the boat and made its way back home. When the battery got home, it put the boat to good use and raced around the pond all day. It was lots of fun and everyone that watched had smiles on their faces. The battery went on many more adventures and always kept the boat close by for when it needed it. The battery was never gloomy again and even shared its joy around the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was walking in the park, but she got lost. She felt very scared and sad. Suddenly, a kind lady saw her and said, "Welcome little one, are you lost?" Lily nodded her head and started to cry. The lady picked her up and hugged her tightly to comfort her.  After a while, Lily stopped crying and the lady asked her name. Lily told her and the lady said, "That's a serious situation, but don't worry, we will find your mommy." They walked around the park together, and soon they found Lily's mommy. She was very happy to see her little girl and hugged her tightly.  From that day on, Lily always remembered the kind lady who welcomed her and comforted her when she was lost. She knew that if she ever got lost again, she could always find someone to help her.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat candy, but her mommy said she could only have a little bit. One day, Lily snuck into the kitchen and ate a whole bag of candy.  Soon after, Lily's stomach started to hurt. She felt really upset and wished she had listened to her mommy. Suddenly, the candy she ate started to disappear from her tummy.  Lily was surprised and happy that the candy was disappearing, but she knew she shouldn't eat too much candy again. From that day on, Lily listened to her mommy and only had a little bit of candy.

One day, it was a lovely day, and so the family decided to go on a picnic. They packed up their things and went to a hill near their house. When they got there, they saw a wonderful sight. The sky was a bright blue and there were pretty flowers everywhere. The family spread out their picnic blanket in front of a big tree and started to eat. After a while, the wind started to blow. It moved the blanket around and the family laughed as they chased it. The blanket spread around the hill like a big blanket of love. The family stayed for a while, looking at the lovely sight, until it started to get dark. They packed up their things and went home, happy that they had spent the day together.

Once there was a little boy. He always wanted to find something special. So, one day he decided to search. He searched everywhere he could think of. He looked high and low and in between. The little boy searched and searched, but he could not find what he was looking for. At last, he stopped looking and sat down, feeling a bit cold. But then he saw something - a big smile! It was coming from the clouds and it filled him with warmth and happiness. He knew he had found what he was looking for.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park with their dolls. They liked to pretend that their dolls were having a tea party. They had a small table, some cups and plates, and a cake that Lily's mom had made for them. A man with a big mustache walked by. He smiled at them and said hello. He looked friendly and kind. Lily and Ben gazed at his mustache. They had never seen such a big mustache before. It was black and curly and covered his mouth. "Wow, what a big mustache!" Lily said. "Can I touch it?" The man laughed and nodded. He bent down and let Lily touch his mustache. It felt soft and tickly. Lily giggled. "Can I touch it too?" Ben asked. The man nodded again and let Ben touch his mustache. Ben smiled. "It's like a fuzzy caterpillar!" Ben said. The man smiled and said, "Thank you. I like my mustache. It keeps me warm and makes me happy." Lily and Ben liked the man with the big mustache. They asked him if he wanted to join their tea party. The man said yes and sat down with them. They gave him a cup of tea and a slice of cake. They talked and laughed and had fun. The man with the big mustache was their new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a big purple wrap. The wrap was very special because it could protect all the things inside of it. One day, a handsome prince found the wrap and he wanted to take it for himself. So he grabbed it and ran all around the kingdom, looking for a place to hide the wrap. When the prince got to the palace, he noticed a tall tower rising into the air. He decided the wrap would be safe at the top, so he climbed all the way up the stairs until he reached the top. Then he put the wrap down on the ground and protected it with a magic spell. Finally, the prince returned to the kingdom and told all the people about the wrap and it's magical powers. When the people heard this, they all went to the palace to try the wrap. Everyone loved the purple wrap and they used it to keep their special things safe and sound. From then on, the purple wrap was a symbol of protection. Everyone knew that it would always keep their important items safe and secure. And that's the legend of the magic purple wrap!

Lily likes peaches. She likes to eat them when they are sweet and juicy. She likes to feel the fuzz on the skin. She likes to spit out the pit. One day, Lily goes to the park with her mom. She sees a big tree with many peaches on it. She wants to pick one, but they are too high. She asks her mom to help her, but her mom says no. She says the peaches belong to someone else. Lily is sad. She walks around the park and plays on the swings. She sees a dog and a cat. She sees a flower and a bee. She sees a bird and a worm. She forgets about the peaches. Then, she sees something shiny on the grass. She runs to it and picks it up. It is a coin. It has a picture of a man and a number. Lily does not know what it means, but she thinks it is pretty. She shows it to her mom. Her mom says it is a lucky coin. She says Lily can buy something with it. Lily is happy. She thinks of what she can buy. She sees a man with a cart. He has many fruits on it. He has apples and bananas and oranges. And he has peaches. Lily runs to the cart and gives the man the coin. He gives her a peach. Lily says thank you and smiles. Lily eats the peach. It is sweet and juicy. She feels the fuzz on the skin. She spits out the pit. She thinks she is lucky. She lies on the grass and looks at the sky. She sees a cloud that looks like a peach. She closes her eyes and dreams of more peaches.

Jack and his twin, Jill, were walking home from the playground one day. Jack noticed a thin branch on the ground and decided to remove it from their path. He looked over to Jill and asked, "Jill, want to help me remove that thin branch?" Jill smiled and said, "Yes! Let's remove it together!"  Jack and Jill both grabbed the thin branch and carefully started to pull it up. Suddenly, the branch snapped in two and the twins were left with two thin pieces. Jack smiled and said, "Jill, I think we should keep the thin branches!" Jill was surprised but agreed. She picked up one piece while Jack held the other and they both ran home.  Once inside, Jack and Jill brought the thin branches over to their toy box. They carefully arranged the thin branches so that the two pieces made a great bridge for their toy cars to drive over. Now, the twins smile every time they play and remember how they worked together to remove the thin branch from their path.

Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Bobby. Bobby loved honey very much. He would always go to the forest to find some honey. One day, Bobby saw a beehive in a tree. He climbed up the tree and took some honey from the beehive. But he did not know that he was stealing from the bees. The bees saw what Bobby did and they got very angry. They chased him and stung him many times. Bobby was very weak and he fell from the tree. He was hurt very badly and could not move. The bees took back their honey and flew away. Bobby learned that stealing is not good and that he should always ask before taking things that do not belong to him. He was very sad that he got hurt and could not have any honey. From that day on, Bobby always asked before taking anything.

Lily and Ben are friends. They like to play in the park. They have a big box. They use the box to make a car. They pretend to drive to the west. But the park is not flat. There are hills and holes. It is difficult to push the box up and down. Lily and Ben get tired. They stop and drink some water. They see a slide. It is shiny and smooth. They have an idea. They take the box to the slide. They put the box on the slide. They sit in the box. They hold hands. They slide down very fast. They laugh and scream. They feel the wind in their hair. They have fun. They use the box to make a car and a slide. They are happy.

Lily and Tom were playing with their toys in the living room. They liked to share and have fun together. But then Lily saw a shiny car that Tom had. She wanted to play with it too. "Tom, can I have the car?" Lily asked. "No, it's mine. You have your own toys," Tom said. Lily felt angry and sad. She tried to grab the car from Tom, but he held it tight. They started to pull and push each other. They both began to cry. Mom heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. She saw Lily and Tom fighting over the car. She was not happy. "Stop, stop! What are you doing?" Mom said. "Why are you crying?" "Lily wants my car, but it's mine!" Tom said. "I want the car, but Tom won't let me!" Lily said. Mom sighed. She took the car from them and put it on the shelf. She hugged Lily and Tom and said, "Listen, my loves. You have many toys to play with. You don't need to fight over one car. Fighting makes you cry and hurts your feelings. Sharing makes you happy and friends. Do you want to be happy and friends?" Lily and Tom nodded. They wiped their tears and said, "Sorry, Mom. Sorry, Lily. Sorry, Tom." Mom smiled and said, "That's OK. I love you both. Now, why don't you play something else together? How about this puzzle? It has many pieces, so you can help each other." Lily and Tom agreed. They took the puzzle and went to the floor. They started to fit the pieces and make a picture. They talked and laughed and helped each other. They felt happy and friends. They forgot about the car. They had peace.

One day, a hammer was playing in the park. It was a very bossy hammer, so it told all the other toys what to do. Suddenly, one of the other toys had an idea. It said it could make the hammer vanish. Everyone was excited about this idea. All the toys huddled in a circle, holding hands. Then the toy said a magic spell and the hammer vanished! Everyone was so surprised. They started to look around for the hammer, but it was nowhere to be seen. It had truly vanished! All the toys were very proud of themselves. They had made the bossy hammer vanish with their very own magic.

Once there was a bright bird. She sat in the tree singing a beautiful song. As she sang, she was looking out for her best friend. All of a sudden, she heard a voice coming from far away. "What's the truth?" The voice asked. The little bird was so happy to see who was talking. It was her friend! She flew down from the tree and quickly sat by her friend. "Friend, I know the truth!" The little bird said with a smile. "What is it?" Her friend asked. "I know that the world is a wonderful place and that we should be kind to all the living creatures."  Her friend nodded with agreement and then the two happily flew off together into the bright sky.

Jack was very angry. He had been playing outside for hours and he was hot and thirsty. He couldn't find any juice, so he asked his Daddy for help.  Daddy thought for a minute and then he recommended a cooler. He said it was a good way to keep drinks cold on hot days. Jack was very excited and he ran to the cooler. He reached inside and found a yummy cold drink.  Jack took a big sip and smiled. It was the best cold drink he had ever had. He thanked his Daddy and then he ran outside to play some more. Daddy smiled and was glad that he had been able to recommend something that had made Jack so happy.

Once upon a time, there was a big party. Everyone was happy and excited. Suddenly, there was a loud noise in the sky. It was a firework! Everyone looked up and saw the bright lights. They were so pretty.  A famous clown named Bozo came to the party. He was very funny and made everyone laugh. He had a big red nose and wore colorful clothes. Bozo loved to chew bubblegum and blew big bubbles.  After the firework show, Bozo decided to do a trick. He put a firework in his mouth and chewed it! Everyone was scared, but Bozo was okay. He just wanted to make them laugh. The party was a lot of fun and everyone went home happy.

Once there was a girl called Emma. She was only three years old. She saw a cup on the kitchen table. It was very thick, so she knew it was a special cup. She wanted to take a closer look at it.  As she studied the cup, she thought she recognized it! It was the cup her mom used all the time! She was so excited, she danced around the kitchen with the cup.  Emma looked around to see if her mom was watching. But she was too busy doing the dishes. Emma was so happy, she couldn't help giving the cup a big hug. At last, Emma recognized the cup, and she knew it was special because it was so thick. She was happy to have made her discovery. She put the cup carefully back where it belonged, feeling proud of herself.

Ben and his dad went to the stadium to see a big game. Ben was very excited. He liked to watch the players run and kick the ball. He also liked to cheer with the crowd. His dad told him to be obedient and stay close to him. "Look, Ben, there is our team. They are wearing red shirts. Can you observe them?" his dad said, pointing to the field. "Yes, dad, I can see them. They are very fast and strong. I hope they win!" Ben said, clapping his hands. "Me too, son. But remember, it is just a game. We have to be nice to the other team too. They are wearing blue shirts. Can you observe them?" his dad said, showing him the other side. "Yes, dad, I can see them. They are also fast and strong. But I like our team more!" Ben said, sticking out his tongue. "Ha ha, that's okay. But don't be rude, okay? Maybe we can make some friends with the blue team fans. They are here to have fun too," his dad said, smiling. Ben nodded. He wanted to be a good boy. He looked around the stadium. He saw many people wearing different colors. He saw some flags and banners. He saw some snacks and drinks. He saw some cameras and speakers. He saw a lot of things. He was very curious. "Dad, can I go and see that?" he asked, pointing to a big screen. "Sure, Ben, but only for a little while. And don't go too far. I will observe you from here. And come back when I call you, okay?" his dad said, letting him go. "Okay, dad, I will be obedient. Thank you!" Ben said, running to the screen. He did not know that the screen was showing a replay of a very important moment in the game. He did not know that everyone was watching it with great attention. He did not know that he was about to do something that would make everyone laugh and cheer. He did not know that he was about to become a star.

Once upon a time, a big yoga class were in a park. They were all mixing and stretching. The teacher showed them how to bend and twist their bodies in different ways. All the children were having lots of fun. Next, the yoga teacher spread out some big mats. She told everyone that it was time to mix. Everyone got busy and began mixing up the colors. Some red and blue, some yellow and green. All the colors made the mats seem like a rainbow. Finally, when all the mats were finished, everyone got into the first yoga pose. They all looked so big and strong. The yoga teacher was so proud of her students. They all looked like real yogis. At the end of the class everyone said bye. They all had so much fun mixing yoga. It was time to go home and rest.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jack who loved to follow his friends everywhere they went. One day, Jack saw his friends wearing charming pants that he wanted to wear too. Jack begged his mom to buy him the same pants, but she said no. Feeling sad, Jack decided to take the pants from his friends when they weren't looking. But when Jack put on the pants, he found out they were too big for him. He tripped and fell, tearing the pants and hurting himself. Jack learned that it's not right to take things that don't belong to him. He apologized to his friends and his mom and promised to never do it again. The moral of the story is to always ask before taking something and to be content with what you have.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a shy little bunny named Tim. Tim loved to play near the river with his friends. They would splash in the water and have lots of fun. One sunny day, Tim and his friends saw a big storm coming. They were scared that the storm would destroy their homes. So, they all worked together to make their homes strong and safe. The storm came and went, and their homes were safe. The river was still there, and they could play again. Tim and his friends were very happy. They learned that when they work together, they can keep their homes safe and have fun by the river.

Lily and Ben were playing in the garden. They liked to look at the flowers and the bugs. They saw a butterfly with yellow and black wings. It was very pretty. "Wow, look at the butterfly!" Lily said. "Can we catch it?" Ben nodded. He ran to get a net. He wanted to keep the butterfly in a jar. He thought it would be fun. But Lily did not want that. She knew the butterfly needed to fly and find food. She did not want to make it sad. She wanted to prevent Ben from catching it. She ran after him and shouted, "No, Ben, stop! The butterfly does not want to go in the jar. It will be cold and lonely. Let it go!" Ben did not listen. He swung the net at the butterfly. He almost caught it. But Lily was faster. She jumped in front of the net and blocked it. The butterfly flew away. "Hey, why did you do that?" Ben asked. He was angry. He wanted the butterfly. "Because it is not nice to catch the butterfly," Lily said. "It is not a toy. It is a living thing. It has feelings. It wants to be free." Ben looked at Lily. He saw that she was right. He felt sorry. He put down the net. "Sorry, Lily," he said. "You are a good friend to the butterfly. I did not think about that. Can we still be friends?" Lily smiled. She hugged Ben. "Of course we can," she said. "We can still play in the garden. But we have to be gentle with the bugs. They are our friends too." They held hands and went to look for more flowers and bugs. They saw the butterfly again. It was flying happily. They waved at it and said, "Bye, butterfly!"

Once upon a time there lived a little girl named Jane. Jane was only three years old and she loved going to the park with her mom. One day, Jane and her mom went to the park to play. There, Jane found a dirty tape on the ground. She picked it up and showed it to her mom. "What is it, Mommy?" asked Jane, excitedly. Her mom smiled and said, "It looks like a tape, Jane. Let's keep it." They took the tape home and Jane kept it in her room. She would look at it and remember playing in the park. One day, when Jane came home from school, she found the tape on the floor of her room. It was very dirty and it didn't work. Jane was sad because she wanted to remember the wonderful time she had in the park. Suddenly, Jane remembered what her mom had said. She smiled and ran to the kitchen to get a cloth and some water. She cleaned the tape and it worked again! Jane smiled and thought to herself, "Remember to always take care of your things!"

One night the lightning arrived. It was a big flash across the sky. Everyone saw it and was afraid.  Then an elderly man arrived. He had a big smile on his face and waved to everyone. Everyone stopped being scared. The elderly man said that the lightning was here to help make the world a better place.  He said that lightning brings new ideas and hope to make the world brighter. Everyone smiled and felt happy. They all thanked the elderly man for his words and he smiled back.  The next day, the sky was brighter and everyone knew the lightning had arrived to help them.

Once upon a time, a little boy named Timmy wanted to climb a big tree. He tried and tried, but he couldn't do it. His mommy said, "Don't worry, Timmy. Keep trying and you will succeed." One day, Timmy climbed the tree all the way to the top! He was so happy and proud of himself. Suddenly, he heard a loud sound. It was thunder! Timmy was scared, but his mommy said, "Don't worry, Timmy. Thunder is just a loud noise in the sky." Timmy climbed back down the tree and ran inside with a smooth feeling of success. He knew he could do anything if he kept trying.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the park with her mommy and daddy. One day, they went to the park and saw a big line for the slide. Lily was very excited to go on the slide, but the line was very long. Lily asked her mommy, "When can we go on the slide?" Her mommy said, "We have to wait in line, but it will be worth it." Lily waited patiently in the line with her mommy and daddy. Finally, it was their turn to go on the slide. As they were climbing up, Lily saw a sign that said, "Dangerous slide. Only for big kids." She was scared, but her mommy and daddy said it was okay. They went down the slide together and it was so much fun! When they got off the slide, Lily said, "Thank you for taking me on the slide. I feel welcome here." Her mommy and daddy smiled and hugged her. They had a great day at the park.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Jane. Jane liked to do fun things! One day she decided to explore an old garden she had heard about. When she arrived she saw a bright light shining from the window of a charming little house. Jane wanted to go inside so she opened the door. She was amazed at the beautiful things she saw, like the colorful flowers and friendly birds. There were also pretty decorations made of glass and metal. Jane then saw something even more magical. In the center of the room was a bright light that kept changing colors. It was so beautiful and Jane couldn't help but smile. She decided to do a dance around the light and as she did, the light changed even more! Jane was so happy that she stayed in the charming garden all day. When it was time to go home, she waved goodbye and promised to come back soon.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play dress-up. One day, she saw a big, shiny mask in a store window and wanted it very much. She asked her mommy if she could have it, but her mommy said no because it was too expensive. Lily was sad and didn't know what to do. She decided to invite her friend Timmy over to play. When Timmy arrived, Lily showed him the mask and told him how much she wanted it. Timmy had an idea and said, "Let's make our own masks!" Lily was excited and they spent the whole day making masks out of paper and glitter. They had so much fun and forgot all about the big, expensive mask in the store window. When it was time for Timmy to go home, he said, "I had so much fun today. Thanks for inviting me over, Lily." Lily smiled and said, "Thank you for helping me make my own mask. I don't need the big, expensive one anymore." And they both lived happily ever after, playing dress-up and making masks together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who went to school every day. She loved her classroom because it was full of toys and books. One day, Lily was playing with her friends when she accidentally touched something sharp. She cried out in pain and her teacher came over to see what happened. "Are you okay, Lily?" asked the teacher, who was a little bit nosy. Lily nodded and said, "I hurt my finger on something sharp." The teacher looked around and found a pencil with a broken tip. She threw it away and gave Lily a band-aid for her finger. From then on, Lily always made sure to be careful in the classroom and watch out for sharp things.

Once upon a time, there was a baby who was crying. The baby's mom was trying to calm the baby down, but nothing seemed to work. Suddenly, a helpful neighbor came over and asked what was wrong.  "The baby won't stop crying," said the mom.  "I can help," said the neighbor. "Let's hurry and make a silly face to make the baby laugh."  The neighbor made a silly face and the baby stopped crying. "Thank you for being so helpful," said the mom.  "No problem," said the neighbor. "I love babies."

Once upon a time there was a healthy bee. She flew over to a park to explore. When she arrived, she was so excited! She saw people running and playing and having fun. She flew across the park to see what she could find. She flew past the swings and the slides, the trees and the flowers. Eventually, she found a big pond filled with ducks and fish. She loved it! She decided to stay and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere of the park for the rest of the day. When it was time to go home, she happily flew away.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his ball. One day, he went outside to play with his ball, but he accidentally rolled it too far. It rolled all the way to the moon! Timmy was sad because he couldn't play with his ball anymore. He asked his friend, a little girl named Sally, if she could help him get his ball back. Sally said, "Of course, I'll help you!" They both went to the moon and found Timmy's ball. But then, they saw a selfish alien who wanted to keep the ball for himself. Timmy and Sally told the alien that sharing is important and it's not nice to be selfish. The alien realized that they were right and gave the ball back to Timmy. Timmy and Sally were happy and grateful for each other's help.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the spring. One day, she saw a young bird in a nest. "Hello little birdie," said Lily. "I notice you are very young." The bird chirped back, "Yes, I was just born a few days ago. My mommy takes care of me." Lily smiled and watched the bird for a while. "Spring is a great time for new babies like you," she said. "I love to see all the flowers and animals come out to play." The bird agreed, "Yes, spring is very beautiful. Thank you for noticing me, Lily." Lily waved goodbye to the bird and went back to playing. She loved the spring and all the new life it brought.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a big problem. Her toy was broken and she didn't know how to fix it. She asked her mommy for help.  "Mommy, can you help me solve my toy?" Lily asked.  "Yes, let's have a meeting with Daddy and see what we can do," Mommy said.  So, they had a meeting with Daddy. Daddy said that the toy was expensive and they couldn't buy a new one.  "Don't worry, we can still fix it," Daddy said.  Together, they found a way to fix the toy and Lily was very happy. She learned that sometimes, when there's a problem, you can solve it with the help of others.

Lily and Ben liked to play pirates in the garden. They had a big box that was their ship, and a stick that was their sword. They also had a hook that they found in the shed. It was shiny and sharp, and they pretended it was a treasure. One day, they decided to go on an adventure to find more treasure. They put on their hats and scarves, and took their ship, sword and hook with them. They walked around the garden, looking for clues. They saw a bird, a flower, a rock, but no treasure. Then, they saw something shiny under a bush. They ran towards it, hoping it was gold or jewels. But when they got closer, they saw it was a frozen pond. It was very cold and slippery, and they could see fish and plants under the ice. "Wow, look at that!" Lily said. "Maybe there is treasure under the ice!" "Let's find out!" Ben said. He took the hook and tried to break the ice with it. He hit the ice hard, but it did not crack. He hit it again, and again, but nothing happened. "Be careful, Ben!" Lily said. "You might fall in!" Ben did not listen. He wanted to find the treasure. He hit the ice harder and harder, until he made a small hole. He looked inside, and saw something shiny. He reached for it with his hook, but he lost his balance. He slipped and fell into the pond. Lily screamed. She saw Ben go under the water. She was very scared. She did not know what to do. She wanted to help Ben, but she did not want to fall in too. She looked around, and saw a big stick. She grabbed it, and ran to the pond. She lay down on the ice, and reached for Ben with the stick. "Ben, Ben, grab the stick!" she shouted. "I'll pull you out!" Ben heard Lily's voice. He was very cold and wet. He saw the stick, and grabbed it. Lily pulled him out of the pond. He was shivering and coughing. He dropped the hook, and hugged Lily. "Thank you, Lily!" he said. "You saved me!" "I'm sorry, Ben!" Lily said. "I should have been more polite. I should have let you have the hook. It was your treasure." Ben shook his head. He smiled at Lily. He said, "No, Lily, you are my treasure. The hook was just a hook. It was not worth it. You are my best friend." They hugged each other, and walked back to their ship. They decided to play pirates another day, when it was warmer and safer. They learned their lesson. They learned to be careful, and to share, and to be polite. They were happy.

Anna likes to play the flute. She has a small flute that makes nice sounds. She plays the flute for her friends and family. They clap and smile when she plays. One day, Anna goes to the park with her mom. She sees a big stage with many chairs. She asks her mom what it is. Her mom says it is a concert. A concert is when people play music for other people. Anna wants to see the concert. She and her mom sit in a chair and wait. Soon, many people come to the stage. They have different things to play music with. Some have flutes like Anna, some have drums, some have violins, and some have trumpets. The people start to play music. Anna likes the music. It is mild and pretty. She listens and watches. She sees one person who plays the flute very well. He has a big flute that makes loud sounds. He plays fast and slow, high and low. He makes the flute sing. When he finishes, everyone claps and cheers. He smiles and bows. He bows to say thank you and goodbye. Anna thinks he is very nice. She wants to be like him. She claps and bows too. She bows to say hello and I like you. He sees her and smiles. He waves to her and gives her his flute. He says she can play it. Anna is very happy. She hugs the flute and says thank you. She plays the flute for him and everyone. They clap and smile when she plays.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to wear her yellow dress with flowers on it. One day, Lily went to the park to play with her friends. She saw a big dog with a yellow pattern on its fur. Lily's friend, Tommy, asked her if she was scared of the big dog. "No," said Lily. "I trust that the dog is friendly." Tommy was surprised that Lily wasn't scared of the big dog. "Why do you trust the dog?" he asked. Lily replied, "I can see a pattern in the dog's behavior. It wags its tail and licks its lips. That means it wants to play with us." Tommy was amazed by Lily's observation and they both played with the big dog happily. From that day on, Lily and Tommy trusted each other's instincts and became the best of friends.

Judy was very sad and she began to cry. Her tears flowed down her cheeks and she felt so lonely. She wanted to be with her Mommy, who had gone to get a special license. Judy looked around. Everywhere she looked was very filthy. There was dirt on the floor and the walls had cobwebs. This made Judy cry even more. But then, Judy heard the sound of car wheels on the road outside. She ran to the window and saw Mommy driving up in her car. Judy was so happy that she wiped away her tears, opened the door, and ran to Mommy. Mommy held her tightly and said everything was going to be okay. Judy knew, deep down, that Mommy was right. She felt so much better, and was soon smiling again. She was happy to be with Mommy, and even happier that she was now the proud owner of her very own license!

Lily is a daughter who likes to play in the mud. She makes mud pies and mud castles and mud animals. She gets very dirty and her clothes get very dirty too. But Lily does not like to bathe. She thinks bathing is boring and cold and wet. She runs away when her mom calls her to the bathroom. She hides under the bed or behind the sofa or in the closet. Her mom is patient. She does not get angry or yell at Lily. She waits and waits and waits. She says, "Lily, it is time to bathe. Bathing is good for you. It makes you clean and fresh and happy. You can play with your toys in the water. You can make bubbles and splash and sing. Please come to the bathroom, Lily." Lily hears her mom and feels a little sorry. She knows her mom loves her and wants her to be healthy and comfortable. She also knows her mom will not give up. She decides to give bathing a try. She comes out of her hiding place and goes to the bathroom. Her mom is happy to see her. She helps her take off her dirty clothes and puts them in the hamper. She fills the tub with warm water and adds some soap and shampoo. She gives Lily a rubber duck and a boat and a sponge. She says, "Lily, you can bathe now. Have fun and be careful. I will be right here if you need me." Lily gets into the tub and feels the water on her skin. She likes how it feels. She plays with her toys and makes bubbles and splash and sing. She lets her mom wash her hair and body with the sponge. She rinses off the soap and shampoo with the shower head. She feels clean and fresh and happy. She says, "Mom, thank you for bathing me. I like bathing now. It is not boring or cold or wet. It is fun and warm and nice. Can I bathe again tomorrow?" Her mom smiles and hugs her. She says, "Lily, you are welcome. I am proud of you for trying something new. You can bathe again tomorrow, but only after you play in the mud."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to pick flowers in her garden. One day, she saw a beautiful red flower. She wanted to pick it, but it was too high for her. Lily asked her friend, Tom, "Can you help me pick the flower?" Tom said, "Yes, I can help!" So, he tried to pick the flower with his hand. But, the flower was still too high. They both felt uncomfortable because they couldn't reach it. Then, Lily had an idea. She said, "Let's stand on a chair!" They found a chair and stood on it. This time, they could reach the flower. Tom picked it with his hand and gave it to Lily. They both smiled and were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and pick flowers. One day, she went to the ice cream truck to get a treat. She looked at all the flavors and tried to decide which one she wanted.  The man in the truck was very rude and told her to hurry up and order. Lily felt sad and didn't know what to do. She looked down at her hand and saw a pretty flower she had picked. She decided to give the flower to the man and ask him to be nicer.  The man smiled and said thank you. He realized he had been rude and promised to be kinder to everyone. Lily was happy she could make a difference with just a simple flower. She enjoyed her ice cream and went home with a big smile on her face. The end.

Tom and Anna are friends. They go to the same school. They have an exam tomorrow. The exam is about shiny things. They have to know the names of shiny things and how to polish them. Tom is wealthy. He has many shiny things at home. He has a big car, a silver watch, a gold ring, and a shiny trophy. He polishes them every day with a soft cloth. He thinks he will do well on the exam. Anna is not wealthy. She has few shiny things at home. She has a small bike, a copper coin, a brass button, and a glass bead. She polishes them sometimes with a rag. She is not sure if she will do well on the exam. "Can I come to your house and study with you?" Anna asks Tom. "Sure, you can come," Tom says. "But you have to bring your own shiny things. I don't want you to touch mine. They are very precious." Anna feels sad. She thinks Tom is not a good friend. She thinks he is selfish and greedy. She decides to study by herself. She reads her book and looks at the pictures of shiny things. She learns their names and how to polish them. The next day, they take the exam. The teacher gives them a paper with questions and a box with shiny things. They have to write the names of the shiny things and polish them with a cloth. Tom is confident. He knows all the names of the shiny things. He polishes them quickly and neatly. He thinks he will get a good grade. Anna is nervous. She does not know all the names of the shiny things. She polishes them slowly and carefully. She thinks she will get a bad grade. When the teacher collects the papers and the boxes, she smiles at Anna. She says, "You did a very good job, Anna. You polished the shiny things very well. You made them sparkle and glow. You have a good eye and a gentle hand. You get a high grade." She frowns at Tom. She says, "You did a poor job, Tom. You polished the shiny things very badly. You made them dull and dirty. You have a bad eye and a rough hand. You get a low grade." Anna is happy. She thinks she did better than she expected. She thinks she learned something new and useful. Tom is angry. He thinks he did worse than he deserved. He thinks he knew everything and wasted his time. Anna and Tom are friends. But they are not the same. They have different things, different skills, and different attitudes. They have to learn from each other and respect each other.

Once upon a time there was a sleepy boy named Thomas. One night, he took his flashlight and went outside to explore. He was so excited. He wanted to go on a great adventure.  Thomas walked in the dark and saw a pond. He spotted something shiny in the water. He thought it must be treasure! Thomas yelled out, "What is it? What is it?" His mom said, "It's a rock! You can't get it." Thomas didn't want to give up. He said, "I'm going to dive in and get it." His mom said, "No, it's too dark and too deep. You could get hurt." But Thomas was brave. He put his flashlight in his pocket and jumped into the water. He grabbed the rock and held it tightly.  When he came out of the water, his mom said, "I'm so proud of you for being brave. Now let's go inside and celebrate your great adventure."  That night, Thomas went to sleep with a smile, happy that he had gone on a great dive with his flashlight.

Tommy was happy playing in the garden. He saw a big stone and picked it up. He thought it would be fun to show his mum. He ran inside and said, “Look!” Mum smiled and said, “That’s a big stone. Well done Tommy!” She gave him a hug. Suddenly, Tommy heard his dad shout, “Put that stone down now Tommy!” Tommy felt ashamed and put it back in the garden. Dad said, “That stone is special. You can't pick it.” Tommy said he was sorry and dad gave him a hug. He said it was ok, but Tommy must never pick the stone again. Tommy nodded, looked down and smiled.

One day, a fast red car was driving down the road. The car had a very important job. It had to go to the hospital for an operation. The car was very nervous, but it knew it had to be brave. As the car drove, it started to rain. The road became wet and slippery. The car tried to be careful, but it began to slip and slide. It was scared it would not make it to the hospital on time. The car saw a big truck coming. The truck saw the car slip and knew it needed help. The truck helped the car get back on the right path. They went to the hospital together. The car got its operation and was very thankful for the truck's help.

Lily and Tom were friends who liked to play with words. They made poems with rhymes and sounds and wrote them on paper. They were proud of their poems and wanted to show them to everyone. One day, they had a very naughty idea. They decided to hang their poems on the walls of the school, where the teacher and the other children could see them. They thought it would be funny and clever, but they did not ask for permission. They sneaked into the school at night, with a roll of tape and their poems. They hung them on the windows, the doors, the blackboard, and even the teacher's desk. They giggled and whispered as they did it, and then ran away. The next morning, the teacher and the other children were very surprised and angry when they saw the poems. They were not nice poems, but rude and mean ones. They made fun of the teacher's nose, the children's names, and the school rules. They hurt the feelings of many people and broke the trust of the teacher. The teacher was very smart and soon found out who did it. She called Lily and Tom to her office and scolded them. She made them take down all the poems and apologize to everyone. She also gave them a lot of extra homework and no recess for a week. Lily and Tom felt very ashamed and sorry for what they did. They learned that hanging poems without permission was not funny or clever, but naughty and wrong. They also learned that words can be powerful and hurtful, and that they should use them with care and respect.

Once upon a time, there were two best friends, Lucy and Jack. They loved playing together every day. One day, Jack decided to share a brilliant idea. Jack said, “Let’s go to the barn and share some fun." Lucy smiled and said, "Let’s go!" So they ran to the barn and they discovered lots of new things. They saw a box with some squirmy worms and a barn full of hay. Jack said, “Let’s share the worms together.” And so they did. They shared the worms and played with them until they were worn out. Then they shared some of the hay and jumped on it. Once they had enough fun, Jack looked at Lucy and said, “That was a brilliant idea.” Lucy smiled and said, "Yes, it was! Let's do it again soon.” And so they did. For many days to come, they would go to the barn and share the brilliant fun.

Once upon a time there was a boy called Tom who was three years old. He loved paper. Whenever he saw a piece of paper he would insist on having it. One day his mum took him to the library. When they arrived, Tom was so excited. He saw many interesting books. He wanted to touch each and every one of them. “Can I please have a piece of paper?” Tom asked his mum. “Oh Tom, you can’t take paper from the library,” his mum said. But Tom was persistent. He insisted and insisted until his mum finally gave in. She gave him one piece of paper. Tom was happy. He used the paper to draw a beautiful picture. His mum was so proud of him.  The two of them went home, with Tom holding onto his piece of paper. He promised himself that he would never let go of it.

The woman was enthusiastic. She wanted to relax and so thought of an idea. She said to the little three year old, “Let’s do a fun game.” The child was excited. She asked, “What kind of game?” The woman said, “Let’s play hide and seek. You go hide and I’ll come find you.” The little girl was so happy. She clapped her hands and grinned from ear to ear. She asked, “How do I play?” The woman smiled, “Go find a spot to hide and don’t let me find you too soon. I must count to ten first. Then I’ll come look for you.” The child ran away and searched for her hiding spot. After she was done, she relaxed. She waited patiently until the woman called out, “Ready or not, here I come. Where are you hiding?” The little girl laughed as the woman came searching for her. They both had a great time.

Once upon a time, in a messy room, lived a little girl named Lucy. Lucy loved to sort her toys and eat mint candies. One day, her mom came into her room and said, "Lucy, your room is very messy. Can you sort your toys and clean up?" Lucy looked around her room and said, "Yes, Mom. I will sort my toys and make my room clean." So, Lucy started to sort her toys. She put her dolls in one box, her cars in another box, and her blocks in a third box.  While Lucy was sorting her toys, she found a mint candy under her bed. She was very happy and said, "Yummy! I found a mint candy!" Lucy ate the mint candy, finished sorting her toys, and her room was clean. Her mom came back into the room and said, "Good job, Lucy! Your room looks nice and clean now." Lucy smiled and said, "Thank you, Mom. I love sorting my toys and finding mint candies!"

Once there was a boy named Josh who loved to play baseball. He had a big blue baseball hat and he was very careful with it. Every day, Josh would take his hat outside and he'd practice hopping while holding it. He'd jump up and down as he hopped around the yard. He'd even hop all the way to the end of the street, and then all the way back! He had so much fun. One day, Josh was hopping and he accidentally dropped his hat. He quickly picked it up and examined it to make sure it was okay. To his relief, it was still in one piece! He put his baseball hat back on and kept hopping. The next day, Josh was extra careful as he hopped around. He jumped over puddles and hopped around trees. After an hour of hopping, he looked down and saw his baseball hat! He was so glad he had been careful enough to keep it safe. From then on, Josh kept jumping and hopping around, always being careful with his baseball hat.

Anna and Ben were best friends. They liked to play in the park, read books, and share toys. One day, they decided to play pretend. They put on their parents' clothes and hats and pretended to be grown-ups. "Let's get married!" Ben said. He gave Anna a ring made of paper. "You are my wife now." "Okay!" Anna said. She smiled and put the ring on her finger. "You are my husband now. What do we do next?" "We have a party!" Ben said. He ran to the kitchen and brought back a big cake. It was purple and had white frosting and sprinkles. "This is our dessert. We can eat it after we dance." Anna and Ben danced around the living room, holding hands and laughing. They were very happy. They cut the cake and ate a big slice each. It was yummy and sweet. But then, they heard a loud noise. It was their parents, coming home from work. They saw the mess in the living room and the cake on the table. "Anna! Ben! What have you done?" they asked. They were angry and surprised. Anna and Ben looked at each other. They knew they were in trouble. They quickly took off their parents' clothes and hats and hid the paper ring. "We were just playing pretend," they said. "We're sorry." Their parents sighed and shook their heads. They were not happy, but they loved their children. They hugged them and said they had to clean up the mess and share the cake with them. Anna and Ben said they were sorry again and helped to clean up. They still liked to play pretend, but they never tried to get married again. They learned that being grown-ups was not as easy as it seemed.

Once there was a strong man who loved to catch animals. He was always looking for animals to catch, but one day he caught something special. The man was so surprised when he saw it, for it was a skeleton! It was not an ordinary skeleton - it was an ancient skeleton from long ago. The man was so excited that he quickly put the skeleton in his pocket, and decided to take it home. When he arrived home he showed the skeleton to his little 3 year old daughter. The girl was so amazed that she immediately wanted to catch her own skeleton. The man was happy to help his daughter and so he took her to the forest. They searched and searched, but they couldn't find any skeletons in the forest. But then, they heard a noise coming from a tree and when they looked closer, they discovered a small, strong skeleton! The girl was so happy and she quickly grabbed the skeleton and put it in her pocket. Now she had her own skeleton, and she loves it very much!

Lila and Tom were playing with a ball in the park. They liked to kick the ball to each other and see how far it could go. Sometimes they pretended the ball was magic and could do amazing things. "Look, I can make the ball fly over the tree!" Lila said, kicking the ball hard. "Wow, that's so cool!" Tom said, running after the ball. "Can I try?" "Sure, here you go!" Lila said, passing the ball to Tom. Tom kicked the ball with all his might, but he missed the tree and hit a man who was sitting on a bench. The man was angry and shouted at Tom. "Hey, you ignorant kid, watch where you kick that ball! You could have hurt me!" Tom was scared and sorry. He did not mean to hit the man. He ran back to Lila and hugged her. "Lila, I'm sorry, I didn't see the man. He was very mean to me. He called me ignorant. What does that mean?" Lila hugged Tom back and said, "It means he doesn't know you. He doesn't know you are a good and smart kid who likes to play with magic. He is the ignorant one, not you." Tom felt better and smiled. He said, "Thank you, Lila. You are a good and smart friend. Can we play with the ball some more?" Lila nodded and said, "Yes, let's play. But let's be careful not to hit anyone else. Maybe we can find a bigger space where we can kick the ball higher and farther." They took the ball and ran to a bigger space. They kicked the ball and laughed and had fun. They forgot about the angry man and enjoyed their magic.

Lily and Ben were having dinner with their mom and dad. They had steak, potatoes and peas on their plates. Lily liked steak, but Ben did not. He thought it was too hard and chewy. "Ben, eat your steak, please. It's good for you," said mom. "No, I don't want it. It's yucky," said Ben. He pushed his plate away and made a face. Mom was not happy. She frowned and said, "Ben, don't be rude. You have to try new things. You can't just eat pizza and ice cream every day." "But I don't like steak. It's ugly and brown and smells bad," said Ben. He looked at Lily and saw that she was eating her steak with a big smile. She liked it a lot. She said, "Ben, you're silly. Steak is yummy and juicy and makes you strong. Look, I can lift my fork with one hand. See?" She lifted her fork high in the air and waved it around. She was trying to show Ben how strong she was. But she was not careful. She dropped her fork and it landed on dad's head. It made a loud clink and dad jumped. He had steak and peas in his hair. Everyone looked at dad and started to laugh. Lily was embarrassed. She said, "Oops, I'm sorry, dad. I didn't mean to do that." Dad smiled and said, "It's okay, Lily. It was an accident. But maybe next time, you can be more gentle with your fork." He took the fork and the steak and the peas off his head and put them on his plate. He said, "Now, who wants some more steak?" Lily and mom raised their hands. Ben shook his head. He still did not like steak. He said, "No, thank you. I'll have some more pizza and ice cream, please." Mom and dad looked at each other and sighed. They hoped that one day, Ben would learn to like steak. But for now, they let him have his pizza and ice cream. They did not want to embarrass him more.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there lived a creative bird named Tim. Tim loved to fly high in the sky and look at the beautiful world below. He was not like other birds, he liked to make maps of the places he saw. One sunny day, Tim decided to make a new map. He flew up, up, up into the sky. He saw a big tree, a red house, and a blue lake. Tim drew them on his map using his beak. When Tim was done, he showed his map to his bird friends. They were so happy to see the map. Now, they could fly to new places too. Tim felt proud and knew that being creative was a good thing.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Jerry and Susan. They loved the outdoors, and especially enjoyed going for long walks and picking strawberries. One day when Jerry and Susan were out picking strawberries, Jerry found the biggest one he’d ever seen. He said to Susan, “Look! This strawberry is fit for us! Let’s move it back home!” But Susan said, “No! I found it first, so I should get to move it!”  Jerry said, “No, no that’s not fair!”  After a lot of arguing and disagreeing, they decided to take turns carrying the strawberry. Jerry moved the strawberry first and then Susan moved it too. They finally made it back home and shared the giant strawberry.  Friends may argue, but in the end, there’s always a way for them to be happy.

Once upon a time there was a wise missile. It's mission was to speed across the sky. The missile zoomed and flew higher and higher. It was going so fast! Suddenly, it started to rain. The missile didn't want to get wet. So it bounced up and down to try and avoid the drops. Finally, it made it to the other side of the clouds and could see the sun again. The sun made it so much happier and it couldn't help but smile! The missile sped off again, it was so brave and so fast that nothing could stop it. Time soon came to an end and the missile had to go home. He said goodbye to the sky with a happy heart and zipped away. All of his friends were so proud of him and cheered him on. He had been so wise and so fast!

Once upon a time, there was a seal named Sammy. Sammy always swam in the ocean with his friends and had the most fun. One day, Sammy's friends asked him to come to try the weird ice. He was a bit scared, but he was courageous and decided to join them. They all went to the ice and played around, having fun. Suddenly, the sun came out and heated up the ice. It started to melt and soon enough Sammy was stuck in a big puddle. He tried to get out, but his flippers could not reach the edge of the ice. Sammy's friends started to laugh at him and made fun of him. Sammy became very sad and started to cry.  Then, one of Sammy's friends stepped forward and said, "It's okay, Sammy. We will help you." Together, they all worked hard and eventually managed to get Sammy out of the ice. Sammy was so happy and grateful that he hugged all of his friends. He never forgot that day and always showed kindness to his friends.

Mama was lying on the couch. She was tired after a busy day at the office. Suddenly, she heard a gentle tapping at the door. She looked to see who it was and saw Nick, her three-year-old son. Mama smiled and asked Nick, “What are you doing, my sweet?”  Nick walked in with a big smile on his face and said, “I brought you something!” He was holding a jar of jam.  Mama smiled and said, “Thank you so much, my love. It looks so delicious.” She gently opened the jam and spread it on a piece of toast. She took a bite and it tasted so yummy.  Nick was overjoyed. He said, “Mama, I love you so much!” Mama laughed and said, “I love you too, sweetheart.”  Mama and Nick enjoyed the jam together. It was a special moment they would never forget.

Mommy and Jackie were excitedly packing their suitcases for a big trip to the other side of the world. Jackie asked what was in the thick envelope Mommy held in her hands. "It's my passport so I can go on the big trip with you", Mommy said. "We will have a lot of fun!" Jackie took out her own thin passport and compared it to Mommy's. "It's so thick!", she exclaimed with admiration. On the day of the trip, Mommy and Jackie arrived at the airport. They saw the long lines of people waiting to board the long international flights. Mommy opened her thick passport to show the officer and Jackie did the same. But suddenly the officer's face went from friendly to stern. Mommy's passport was no good. It had expired two months ago! The moral of this story is that it's important to take care of important documents like passports or any other type of IDs. Always remember to check the expiration date!

One day, a boy named Jack went for a jog. He ran as fast as he could, and felt the warm sun on his back.  When he arrived at the park, he saw a strange pitch. It was covered in green grass and had a big fence around the edge. It looked very expensive. Jack stood and watched the pitch. Suddenly, he heard a loud noise, and he looked up. Someone was playing with a ball, hitting it against the fence. Jack jumped over the fence and started to play too. He ran around and chased the ball. He laughed and smiled as he jogged around the pitch. He had so much fun. When he got tired, he went home with a big smile on his face.

Tommy and his friends were playing in the garden. Suddenly, Tommy saw a laser! He ran towards it and he was so excited to get it that he forgot to be careful.  Tommy’s friend Lisa said, “You should be careful, Tommy. You don’t know if it’s safe.”  He was too anxious to listen to her. So he started running around the garden with the laser in his hand. Suddenly the laser made a loud noise and Tommy dropped it. He was so scared that he started to cry.  Lisa came to Tommy and said, “See Tommy, I told you that you should be careful. Now it’s broken.” Tommy learned his lesson and nodded. From that day on he always listened to his friends and was careful whenever he was playing with something new.  The moral of the story is that it's important to always listen to your friends and be careful with things that you don't know.

Once upon a time, there was a lady who was very lonely. She wanted to get married and she wanted a rod to go fishing. But she was helpless and had no way of getting what she wanted. One day, she went out for a walk and saw a man walking down the street. She asked him if he wanted to marry her and he said yes! She was so happy. The man said he would get her a rod for fishing. She went looking for a rod but the shop was closed. She was feeling helpless and didn't know what to do. Suddenly, the man appeared out of nowhere! He had managed to find a rod and he gave it to her with a smile. She was so happy that she hugged him and they got married. And they both lived happily ever after - fishing with their rod!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack who was very hungry. He looked around the kitchen and noticed a tube sitting on the countertop. He didn't know what was inside the tube, so he opened it up. To his surprise, there were some yummy snacks inside! Jack quickly grabbed a snack and started eating it. The snack was delicious, and Jack was very happy. The next day, Jack had more snacks from the tube. He was so excited that he started sharing them with his friends. The friends were so thankful and enjoyed the delicious snacks.  Jack was happy that he could serve his friends to make them feel better. From then on, whenever Jack or his friends felt hungry, they always knew that the tube would be there to save the day.

Josh and his dad were walking in the park. The sun was so warm and bright that Josh was feeling very happy. Suddenly, his dad pointed to a rotten apple on the ground and said to him, "Josh, look at this apple. You see how important it is to do your work?" Josh understood what his dad meant. He looked at the apple and nodded, saying, "Yes Dad." His dad nodded too and they kept walking. But Josh did not like his dad's lesson. So the next day, when it was time to start his work, he decided to do something else. He did not do his work and the day passed by in leisure. Later that night, his dad came home from work. He had a sad look on his face. Josh wanted to know what had happened. His dad told him, "The apple was rotten because you did not do your work. That is why it is so important to always finish your work." Josh felt very sad. He wished he had done what his dad had said. He did not like the bad ending that had happened.

John was a big rabbit who loved to explore the forest. He jumped through the trees and hopped around in the grass, looking for interesting things. One day, he spotted a pattern on the ground and he wanted to get closer and have a look. He started hopping towards it, but then he saw something big and scary in the distance - a bear! John was scared and wanted to escape, so he quickly hopped away. He hopped faster and faster, running away from the bear. He kept running until he couldn't run anymore, but he was still far away from the pattern he had been looking at. He was safe, but he couldn't get to the pattern. Sadly, John had to give up and go home. He never got to explore the pattern and he was disappointed. He knew he had been brave to try, but he couldn't escape the bear.

Lily was 3 years old and loved spending time in the classroom. She liked to investigate the shelves and explore the toys that were neatly lined up. Every day, Lily and her friends would go to the classroom and spend time playing together. The classroom was very clear and everything was put in its place. Lily always made sure to put all of her toys back before she left. She was so proud of always cleaning up! One day while they were in the classroom, they decided to make a surprise for their teacher. Everyone worked hard to make the room look extra special. They moved around the furniture and decorated the walls with colourful drawings. When the teacher arrived she was so happy to see all of their hard work. She thanked them for making the classroom look so clear and happy. Lily and her friends were happy to spend the day in the classroom.

Once upon a time, there was a famous baby. His name was Jake and he was a curious little fellow. One day, he wanted to explore the world beyond his house. So he began to crawl on the ground. He smelled something funny, like coal burning in the fireplace. He kept crawling and crawling, until he found a big pile of coal. He reached out to touch it and started to giggle, because the coal was so soft and cold. He kept playing with the coal until he heard his mother calling him for dinner. Jake waved goodbye to the coal and crawled back to his house, feeling very happy and famous for being a brave explorer.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Beth. On a sunny day, Beth decided to go for a walk in the park. As she walked, she looked up and saw a beautiful ceiling twinkling in the sunshine. Then suddenly, something strange happened. Everything froze! Everyone and everything stopped moving, apart from Beth. Beth shouted in surprise, “What’s happening?” From across the park, a kindly voice said, “You have magical power Beth! You have frozen everything!” Beth looked to see who was talking and saw the smooth trunk of a big tree. She asked the tree, “How do I unfreeze them?” The tree replied, “Think of the most wonderful thing and wish it to be true.” So Beth thought of the most wonderful thing, and wished everyone could move again. As soon as she did, everything came alive, and everybody returned to their business. The tree said, “See what you can do! Just keep looking up at that beautiful ceiling!” Beth thanked the tree and went on her way. She looked up at the twinkling ceiling and she knew that, with a little bit of magical thinking, she could make whatever she wished for true.

Once upon a time, there was a small girl named Daisy. Daisy was three years old and very clever. Everyone who knew her said that she was reliable.  Every day, Daisy's mum would give her a challenge to help her learn and grow. One day mum said, "Daisy, can you manage to bring me a vegetable from the garden?" Daisy smiled and said, "Yes!" Daisy went to the garden and looked around. She found tomatoes, peppers, and carrots. She tried to pick a tomato, but it was too heavy. Eventually, she managed to pick up a carrot. She took it back to her mum and said, "I found a vegetable".  Mum smiled and said, "Well done Daisy, you did a great job. You are such a reliable little girl". Daisy smiled and said, "Thank you, mum!".

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim and a little girl named Jill. They were the best of friends and loved to play together all day long. One day, the two of them decided to play a game. Tim introduced Jill to a game that involved circles. The aim of the game was to move along a track of circles, while Jill tried to catch him.  At first, the game was quite peaceful, as they both moved along the circle track together. But soon, Tim's competitive streak took over, and he decided to run away from Jill as fast as he could. Jill was heartbroken that Tim was no longer trying to have a peaceful time, so she started to cry.  After a while, Tim felt guilty and decided to stop running around and to introduce Jill to a different game. This game was much more peaceful and allowed the two of them to enjoy each other's company. They had lots of fun, laughed and played until the sun set and it was time to go home.  The two of them were best friends once again, and continued to play their circle game together whenever they were together.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Jane. Jane wanted to do something very special. She wanted to succeed. So one day, she went out into the valley. Everywhere she looked, she could see ordinary things. But Jane didn't give up. She kept walking until she found something special. It was a big rock with lots of sparkly spots! Jane was so happy. She picked up the rock and called it her success stone. She kept it with her always. Whenever she felt like she couldn't make it, she looked at the stone and remembered that anything was possible. And before long, Jane did succeed! She did something no one else had done. Jane had made her dreams come true!

Once there was a naughty girl named Rose. She never stopped giggling and running around the house. Every day the family would go for a stroll in the park, but Rose would always be in a naughty mood. One day, something special arrived. It was an invitation for Rose's parents to a marriage. Rose was very excited and asked her parents what a marriage was. They told her that it was a special event where two people decided to live together in love. The day of the marriage arrived, and Rose got ready to join her parents. They all dressed up nicely and everyone at the marriage was so happy. Rose couldn't stop laughing and clapping with joy.  At the end of the day, Rose hugged her parents and told them this was the best day ever. She was so happy at the marriage, and promised that she would always be a good girl.

Jim was a little bug. He loved to crawl. He was on a mission to find the tallest waffle. So he crawled on and on. He saw many waffles, but none of them were high enough. Then, he saw it! The tallest waffle ever! He was so excited and he started to crawl really quickly. He got so close to reaching the top until he slipped! He fell down and down until he landed on the ground. But Jim was still determined to reach the tallest waffle. So he got up and started to crawl again. This time, he made it all the way to the top! He reached his goal and he was so proud of himself. Now Jim will always remember his journey and his goal of reaching the highest waffle.

There was a young boy who was very gifted. He was always asking questions about the world around him and was eager to learn. One day, the boy discovered a mysterious triangle on the ground in front of his house. He was curious about what it could be, so he picked it up and took it home. At home, the boy decided to try to understand what the triangle was. He looked at it very carefully and eventually discovered that it could be split in two pieces. When he opened it, he was surprised to find a secret message inside. This revealed to him the meaning of the triangle. The triangle symbolized understanding and learning, and that knowledge can come from anywhere. The boy was so pleased to have discovered this why and share the information with his friends. He was motivated to continue to learn more and use his gifts to discover the unknown. This experience taught the boy an important lesson about being curious and using his gifts to reveal the secrets around him.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Jenny. She was always very curious and loved exploring. Every night she would stay up late unlocking all sorts of doors with special keys. One night, Jenny was in an old abandoned house. As she was unlocking the door, she noticed a cool gear in the keyhole. She removed it and put it in her pocket. The next day, Jenny went to her dad's garage with the gear. She told her dad all about the gear and he said it could be very useful. He told her he would give it to a special man who would know what to do with it. When Jenny returned to the house, she found a strange secret door. She tried to unlock it but no matter what she did the door wouldn't budge. Then she remembered the gear. She pulled it out of her pocket and put it in the keyhole. Suddenly the door unlocked! Jenny entered the room and found it full of magical gadgets. With the gear, she had unlocked a world of adventures. Without it, she would never have found the mysterious room and its useful treasures. Jenny realized that this was the perfect gear to bring her many more adventures.

Billy was so excited to go to the fair. He went to the area where drums were being sold. He saw a very big, orange drum and ran to it. He started banging it like he was in a real band. But then he saw a fake drum. He looked closely at it and realized it was made of plastic. He was disappointed and said, "It’s not real.” His dad said, “Don’t worry, Billy. We can use it to make noise at home.” Billy was happy and wanted to buy it. His dad paid for the fake drum and Billy dropped it in the cart. He was so excited to make noise with it at home.

Mummy and daddy took Anna to a big building. Anna had never been in such a big place before. Inside the building there were lots of people in rooms doing different things.  Mummy said to Anna, "It's time for your piano lesson." They went to one of the rooms, where Anna saw a piano!  Anna was very excited, so she clapped her hands. Mummy said, "It's time to study the piano." Anna was a bit confused, but then she sat down at the piano.  Mummy said, "Let's start with the scale. Do you remember how to play the scale?" Anna tried very hard to remember, but she just couldn't do it. She was getting frustrated.  Mummy said, "It's OK if you don't remember. Just try your best, Anna". Anna tried again and she finally played the scale correctly. She was so happy!  Mummy said, "Well done, Anna! With a bit of practice, you'll be an amazing piano player!"

Lily and Max were playing with their toy boats in the bathtub. They pretended they were pirates and sailors, and had fun making waves and noises. Lily had a big boat with a shiny anchor, and Max had a small boat with a flag. "Look at my boat, it's so fast and strong!" Max said, zooming his boat around the tub. "Your boat is slow and heavy, because of your anchor!" Lily felt sad and angry. She liked her anchor, it was her favorite part of her boat. She thought Max was being mean and rude. She grabbed his boat and threw it out of the tub. "Hey, that's not fair!" Max shouted, jumping out of the tub to get his boat. "You can't do that, give me back my boat!" Lily crossed her arms and stuck out her tongue. "No, I won't! You hurt my feelings, and you don't deserve your boat!" Max felt hurt and mad. He liked his boat, it was his favorite toy. He thought Lily was being selfish and mean. He grabbed her boat and threw it in the toilet. "Ha, take that!" Max said, flushing the toilet. "Now your boat is gone, and you can't get it back!" Lily gasped and cried. She couldn't believe what Max did. She loved her boat, it was her special gift. She thought Max was being cruel and nasty. She ran out of the bathroom, sobbing. Mom heard the commotion and came to see what was wrong. She saw the wet floor, the empty tub, and the flushed toilet. She asked Lily and Max what happened, and they both told her their side of the story. Mom shook her head and sighed. She was disappointed and upset. She thought Lily and Max were being unkind and foolish. She told them to sit on the couch and think about what they did. Lily and Max sat on the couch, feeling ashamed and sorry. They realized they had made a big mistake, and they had hurt each other and their toys. They wished they could take back what they did, and have their boats back. They looked at each other, and felt sorry for each other. They remembered how much they liked playing together, and how much they cared for each other. They decided to say sorry, and to forgive each other. Lily hugged Max and said, "I'm sorry, Max. I shouldn't have thrown your boat out of the tub. That was mean of me. I forgive you for throwing my boat in the toilet. That was mean of you." Max hugged Lily and said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I shouldn't have thrown your boat in the toilet. That was cruel of me.
