I forgive you for grabbing my boat and throwing it out of the tub. That was rude of you." Mom heard them and smiled. She was proud and happy. She thought Lily and Max were being kind and wise. She told them she was glad they apologized and forgave each other. She said she had a surprise for them. She brought them two new boats, one for Lily and one for Max. They were bigger and better than their old boats, and they had both an anchor and a flag. Lily and Max were overjoyed and grateful. They thanked Mom and hugged her. They went back to the bathroom, and filled the tub with water. They put their new boats in the tub, and played with them together. They pretended they were pirates and sailors, and had fun making waves and noises. They shared their boats, and complimented each other's boats. They were happy and friendly. The moral of the story is: Don't be mean or rude to your friends, or you might lose them and your toys. Be kind and forgiving to your friends, and you might gain them and new toys.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Mia. She was very happy, for she had a very special place to go. That place was the harbor, a beautiful place where the ocean was very quiet and blue. Mia would go to the harbor and sit on the sand. She would watch the boats go by, each one more charming than the last. She liked to watch the seagulls too, they were always so loud when they flew by. One day Mia brought a camera to the harbor and took lots of pictures. Whenever something beautiful caught her eye, she'd snap a photo! Each one she captured was so wonderful that it was almost like a dream. Mia went to the harbor nearly every day and she'd lose herself in the beauty of it all. She loved being there so much, and it made her feel so happy. In the harbor, she was safe and content, so much so that she never wanted to leave.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very nervous to go on a big airplane ride with her mommy and daddy. When they got on the airplane, Lily sat in her seat and held onto her mommy's hand very tight. She hoped that the airplane ride would be over soon. As the airplane took off, Lily's tummy felt funny, but she tried to be brave. She looked out the window and saw the clouds and the sun. It was very pretty! Lily's mommy gave her a snack and some juice, which made her feel better. She hoped that the airplane ride would be fun after all. After a little while, the airplane landed safely and Lily was so happy! She had a great time on her first airplane ride and she wasn't nervous anymore. She hoped that she could go on another airplane ride soon! The end.

One day, a gifted girl walked along the beach. She looked around and saw the beautiful palms all around her. She stopped to take it all in and suddenly wondered a question. "Where did all these beautiful palms come from?" she asked. She walked around, examining the palms with her eyes, until she came to an old man. He told her that every palm tree was planted by a special baby many years ago! He said that the baby was so gifted, that all it had to do was touch the ground with its palm and a palm tree would grow. The girl couldn't believe what she was hearing. She thanked the old man and looked around in wonder. She had never seen of gift like this before, and she wondered what else was possible if you were gifted!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim was a normal boy who lived in a small house with his mom, dad, and dog, Spark. Spark was a happy dog who loved to play with Tim all day long. One day, Tim and Spark were playing outside when they saw a big tree. Tim wanted to climb the tree, but he needed help. "Spark, I need help," said Tim. Spark wagged his tail and helped Tim climb the tree. They both felt very happy. As they climbed higher, they saw a little bird who was sad. "Why are you sad?" asked Tim. The bird replied, "I need a friend." Tim and Spark smiled and said, "We can be your friends!" From that day on, Tim, Spark, and the little bird were the best of friends. They played together every day, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sally. Sally was only three years old and she loved to play games. One day, when she was playing in the park, she met a funny old man. The man said to her, "Hello little one, what is your name?". Sally said, "My name is Sally." The old man said, "Hello Sally, I am Mr. Smith. Do you want to play a game with me?". Sally thought it sounded like fun so she said yes. Mr. Smith gave her a funny looking box with a lid. He said, "Place your hand on the lid and then rub it". Sally did as she was told and the box made a funny sound. She quickly opened it and inside she found a silly looking toy. The old man said, "This is a magical toy. When you speak to it, it talks back". Sally thought this was the funniest thing ever. She spoke to the toy and it began to move and talk to her. It spoke funny words and Sally laughed and laughed. Suddenly it said something stupid which made her laugh even more. The old man said, "Now, let's put the toy back in the box and seal it. That way the magic will stay inside". So Sally put the toy in the box and rubbed the lid, and the magic was sealed away inside. Sally thanked the old man and they both went on their way.

Ben and Lily went to the zoo with Mom and Dad. They saw many animals, like lions, monkeys, and giraffes. But Ben's favorite was the ostrich. He liked its long neck and big eyes. "Can I touch it?" Ben asked Mom. "No, Ben, you can't. The ostrich is behind a fence. It might bite you or kick you. It is very strong," Mom said. But Ben did not listen. He ran to the fence and reached his hand to the ostrich. The ostrich saw Ben and got angry. It pecked at Ben's hand and made him cry. "Ow, ow, ow!" Ben shouted. "It broke my skin! It hurts!" Mom and Dad ran to Ben and took him away from the fence. They put a band-aid on his hand and hugged him. "I'm sorry, Ben. You should have listened to Mom. The ostrich is not a toy. It is a wild animal. You are lucky it did not hurt you more," Dad said. Ben felt bad. He was sorry for being naughty. He learned his lesson. He said sorry to Mom and Dad and to the ostrich. He decided to be more careful and respectful of the animals. He also decided to use his words and not his hands when he wanted something. He was still a little weak, but he was also brave and smart. He enjoyed the rest of the zoo trip with his family.

Once upon a time, there was a player named Jack. Jack loved to play outside in the snow. One day, Jack slipped on some icy ice and fell down. He hurt his knee and had to pause playing for a little while.  While Jack was resting, he saw a bird flying in the sky. The bird was so pretty and Jack wanted to play with it. But he knew he had to wait until his knee felt better.  After a few days, Jack's knee felt better and he went back outside to play. He saw the bird again and this time he ran after it. The bird flew away, but Jack had fun chasing it. And he learned to be careful of icy ice so he wouldn't get hurt again. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play by the river. One day, while she was playing, she saw a charming otter swimming in the water. Lily was so happy to see the otter and she said, "Hello, Mr. Otter! You are so charming!" The otter replied, "Hello, Lily! I need your help. My home is in trouble and I don't know what to do." Lily asked, "What's wrong with your home, Mr. Otter?" The otter said, "My dam is broken and the water is flooding my home. Can you help me solve this problem?" Lily thought for a moment and said, "I have an idea! Let's build a new dam together!" So, they worked together and built a new dam to stop the water from flooding the otter's home. The otter was so happy and said, "Thank you, Lily! You are my hero!" From that day on, Lily and the charming otter became the best of friends.

One day, there was a dog who was very fast. He loved to speed around and play. He always wanted to go faster and faster. The little dog had a special bubble around him when he ran. The bubble made him even faster and the other animals couldn't catch him. One day, the little dog met his friend, a big, hairy bear. The bear was so big and strong, but he was also very slow. The bear asked the little dog if he could join him in his bubble and run with him. The little dog was excited and said yes. They started running around together, faster and faster. The bear was getting faster and faster, just like the little dog. They had so much fun. Soon, the hairy bear was running just as fast as the little dog. The little dog was so happy that he had made a new, fast friend. From then on, they ran together all the time, never stopping and always running at top speed.

Once there was a brown wagon. It was in the meadow filled with sun and birdsong. The wheels of the wagon were sparkling in the warm sun. Suddenly, the wind blew, and the air around the wagon got cold. It started snowing, and everything around the wagon started to freeze! The cold snowflakes made the wagon ice cold. The sound of the children's laughter was replaced by the sound of their shivering. But then, a kind, magical creature came to help. He blew his warm breath on the wagon, and a wave of warmth and light spread across the meadow. All the snow melted away and the wagon was warm again! The wagon, filled with the children's laughter and joy, was rolling across the meadow once more. What a wonderful day it was, thanks to the creature!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He loved to play ball with his friends. One sunny day, they all went to the park to play a game. Tim wanted to gain a good score for his team. Tim's friend, Max, said, "We can do it! Let's get a brilliant score today!" They were excited to play and have fun. They played and played. Tim kicked the ball very hard. The ball went far away. His friends clapped and cheered. "Good job, Tim!" they said. In the end, Tim's team won the game. They were so happy to gain a brilliant score. They all went home with big smiles on their faces.

Tom and Lily liked to jog in the park. They liked to see the trees, the flowers and the birds. They also liked to look for bugs. They had a jar to keep the bugs they found. One day, they saw a big, shiny bug on a leaf. It had many colors and wings. Tom wanted to catch it and put it in the jar. Lily said, "No, Tom, that is a cheap thing to do. The bug is happy on the leaf. It does not want to be in the jar. Let it be free." Tom did not listen to Lily. He ran to the leaf and grabbed the bug. He put it in the jar and closed the lid. He was proud of his catch. He said, "Look, Lily, I have the best bug ever. It is so pretty and rare. You are just jealous." Lily was sad and angry. She said, "Tom, you are not nice. You are selfish and mean. The bug is not happy in the jar. It is scared and sad. You should let it go. It is not yours to keep." Tom did not care. He said, "No, Lily, this is my bug. I caught it fair and square. I will not let it go. It is mine." But then, something bad happened. The bug was not a bug at all. It was a bee. And it was very angry. It stung Tom through the jar. Tom screamed and dropped the jar. The jar broke and the bee flew away. Tom cried and held his hand. It hurt a lot. Lily ran to Tom and helped him. She said, "Tom, I am sorry you are hurt. But you should have listened to me. You should not take things that are not yours. You should respect the life of others. That is the right thing to do." Tom nodded and said, "Lily, you are right. I was wrong. I was cheap and greedy. I should have let the bee be. I am sorry. Can you forgive me?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, Tom, I forgive you. You are my friend. But next time, please be more careful and kind. And maybe we should look for other bugs. Bees are not fun to play with." Tom agreed and said, "Yes, Lily, you are right. Bees are not fun to play with. They are better to watch from far away. And there are many other bugs to find. Let's go and jog some more. Maybe we will see a butterfly or a ladybug. They are pretty and gentle. And they do not sting." Lily and Tom hugged and jogged away. They learned a lesson that day. They learned to be respectful and not cheap. And they had more fun with the bugs that did not hurt them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and watch her favorite TV show. One day, Lily's mom bought her a fragile watch. Lily was very happy and said, "I own a watch now!" Her little brother, Max, came into the room and asked, "Can I see your watch, Lily?" Lily replied, "Sure, but be careful, it's fragile." Max looked at the watch and said, "Wow, it's so pretty!" Later that day, Lily's friend came over to play. They were having so much fun, but then Lily's friend accidentally knocked over the watch. Lily was upset and said, "My watch is broken now." Her friend apologized and said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I didn't mean to break it." Lily forgave her friend and said, "It's okay, accidents happen. Let's play with our toys instead."

Tom and Anna liked to play in the museum. They liked to look at the old things and make up stories about them. But they had to behave, or the museum lady would be angry. She always said, "This is history, not a playground. Don't touch anything or you will break it." One day, Tom and Anna saw a big dinosaur bone. It was very long and white and had sharp teeth. They wanted to touch it and pretend to be dinosaurs. They looked around and saw that the museum lady was busy talking to some people. They thought she would not see them. They ran to the dinosaur bone and started to play. Tom roared like a dinosaur and Anna laughed. They did not see the sign that said, "Do not touch. Fragile." They did not see the rope that was around the bone. They did not see the other museum lady who was watching them. The other museum lady saw them and shouted, "Stop! You are not allowed to touch that!" She ran to them and tried to pull them away. But she was too late. Tom and Anna were too clumsy. They tripped over the rope and bumped into the bone. The bone wobbled and fell to the floor. It broke into many pieces. Tom and Anna were scared. They heard a loud noise and saw the museum lady's face. She was very angry. She said, "What have you done? You have ruined history! You are in big trouble!" She took them to the office and called their parents. Tom and Anna learned a lesson. They learned that they should behave in the museum. They learned that history is important and fragile. They learned that playing with dinosaur bones is not a good idea.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play in the jungle near his house. One day, Timmy heard someone shouting in the jungle. He went to see who it was. When he got there, he saw a monkey who was stuck in a tree. The monkey was shouting for help. Timmy was honest and knew he needed to help the monkey. Timmy climbed up the tree to rescue the monkey. The monkey was very happy and said, "Thank you, Timmy!" Timmy was happy too because he had helped someone in need. From that day on, Timmy and the monkey became good friends and played together in the jungle every day.

Once upon a time, two friends named Ned and Chris wanted to go on an adventure. They looked around and saw a team of horses and men. The horses were big, but Ned and Chris made them feel brave. The team marched to a big, scary cave. They looked all around, but they didn't see anything. That's when they heard a spooky noise. It was so loud and scary, they were scared. Ned and Chris didn't want to go in the cave, but they had to. They held hands so they wouldn't be scared. Finally, they went inside. It was dark and cold, but underneath it all, there was something magical about the cave. The friends looked around and to their amazement, the cave was filled with candy and toys! Ned and Chris had a wonderful time. They left the cave feeling happy and safe. They said goodbye to the team and decided to go back to their adventure another day.

Lily and Tom were going to the park with Mom. They wanted to play on the swings and slide. Mom said they had to prepare first. She gave them a backpack with snacks and water. She also gave them hats and sunglasses to protect their eyes from the sun. "Are you ready?" Mom asked. "Yes, Mom!" Lily and Tom said. They put on their hats and sunglasses. They looked very cool. They walked to the park. It was a mild day. The sun was shining, but not too hot. The sky was blue and the birds were singing. Lily and Tom smiled and held Mom's hand. They reached the park. There were many other children playing. Lily and Tom ran to the swings. They took turns pushing each other. They laughed and shouted. "Look at me, Mom!" Lily said. "I'm flying!" "You're doing great, Lily!" Mom said. "Be careful, Tom!" Tom was swinging too high. He lost his balance and fell off the swing. He landed on the grass. He cried and rubbed his knee. "Ow, ow, ow!" Tom said. Mom ran to him. She hugged him and checked his knee. It was not bleeding, but it was red and sore. "I'm sorry, Tom," Mom said. "Are you OK?" Tom nodded. He sniffled and wiped his tears. He looked at his sunglasses. They were broken. "My sunglasses!" Tom said. "They're ruined!" Mom took the sunglasses. She saw the crack and the missing lens. "I'm sorry, Tom," Mom said. "We'll get you new ones later. Do you want to go home?" Tom shook his head. He wanted to play more. He was brave. "No, Mom," Tom said. "I want to stay. Can I have a snack?" Mom smiled. She was proud of Tom. She opened the backpack and gave him a cookie and some water. "Here you go, Tom," Mom said. "You're a good boy. Do you want to try the slide?" Tom nodded. He ate his cookie and drank his water. He felt better. He put on his hat and followed Mom to the slide. Lily was waiting for them. "Are you OK, Tom?" Lily asked. "I'm OK, Lily," Tom said. "Let's play!" They played on the slide. They had fun. They forgot about the broken sunglasses. They were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Seth. Seth was tired so he decided to go for a walk in the dark. He grabbed his flashlight and started to walk outside. He came to a clearing so he decided to sit down. Seth heard a noise. He shined his flashlight into the darkness. He saw a big bear! The bear was poking around with its big nose. Seth was scared so he got up quickly and ran away. The bear heard him and started to chase him. Seth was scared so he ran as fast as he could. He ran until he could not run anymore. He was so tired but he had made it to safety. Seth thanked his flashlight for keeping him safe.

Once upon a time, there was a dog named Browny. Browny was a good dog but he was very impatient. Every day he played in the garden with his tail wagging.  One day, Browny's tail was not wagging as much as it usually did. He thought it would be better if he had a longer tail. So Browny decided to practice to improve his tail wagging. First, Browny tried to wag his tail slowly. Then he tried to wag it faster. But no matter how hard he tried, he couldn't make his tail longer.  Browny was frustrated. He asked his mom, "Mommy, how can I make my tail longer?" Mommy replied, "Ah, my darling - you can't make your tail longer. But you can still practice and improve your tail-wagging. With enough practice, you will get better!" Browny was happy. He went back to practicing, and soon he was able to wag his tail faster and better than before.  Moral of the story: With patience and practice, you can improve your skills.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a shiny iron that she loved to use to make her clothes smooth. One day, while she was ironing her dress, her favorite toy, a little bear, vanished! She looked everywhere but couldn't find it. She was sad and cried a lot.  Suddenly, she heard a noise coming from her toy box. She opened it and there was her little bear! It had been hiding there all along. She was so happy and hugged it tightly. She realized that sometimes things can vanish but they can also reappear just as quickly. From then on, she made sure to keep her little bear close by and never let it vanish again.

Lily and Sam liked to play in the snow. They made a big snowman with a hat and a scarf. They gave him a carrot nose and two rocks for eyes. They named him Bob. One day, it was very sunny and warm. Lily and Sam saw that Bob was melting. His hat was falling off and his nose was drooping. They were very worry. They did not want to lose their friend. They ran to the house and asked their mom for help. Mom gave them a big bowl of ice. She said they could put some ice on Bob to keep him cold. Lily and Sam thanked their mom and ran back to the snowman. They put some ice on Bob's head, nose and body. They fixed his hat and scarf. They hoped he would be okay. They told him they loved him and gave him a hug. Bob looked at them with his rock eyes. He smiled with his carrot mouth. He was very happy. He had the perfect friends.

Once upon a time there was a little fish. He was so happy to swim in the pond. One day, he swam further away from his pond than usual and he saw a big bowl with clear, tasty water. He wanted to take a dip and he quickly jumped in. The fish was so excited to be swimming in the bowl of tasty water that he stayed in for a very long time. He was having so much fun splashing around that he did not realise that the water was slowly soaking into his skin.  Suddenly the bowl started to get smaller and smaller. The fish tried to jump out, but he couldn’t. He was stuck! He cried out, “Help me! Please help me!” Desperate, the fish shouted to his friends in the pond, “Do not jump in the bowl! Stay in the pond!” The fish’s friends listened and stayed away. Sadly, the bowl shrunk so much that the poor fish died. This story’s moral is important: always listen to your friends’ advice, even though it might seem fun not to.

Once upon a time, there was a clever rabbit named Benny. Benny liked to eat carrots and cauliflower. One day, Benny's friend, a mouse named Mickey, came to visit him. Mickey said, "Benny, can we play together?" Benny replied, "Sure, but first let's eat some cauliflower." Mickey said, "I don't like cauliflower. Can we eat something else?" Benny said, "No problem. Let's eat carrots instead." Mickey said, "Okay, that sounds good." After they finished eating, Mickey said, "Benny, I'm tired. Can we quit playing now?" Benny said, "Sure, let's rest and play again later."

Once there was a little girl called Lucy. She was three years old and loved to explore the world around her. One day, she went outside with her family and saw a new watch lying on the grass. Lucy paused for a moment to take a look at the watch. She thought it was so beautiful! The watch had a bright blue face and golden hands. Lucy wanted to take it home with her. So she asked her dad if she could keep it. Daddy thought it was a great idea and said yes. Lucy was so excited to have a new watch! She put it on her wrist and went to play in the garden. She would pause often to look at her watch and admire it. She felt so grown-up wearing it! Finally, it was time to go home. Lucy was so happy she had found a beautiful new watch. She was very lucky. From that day onwards, her watch was always with her.

Toby was a happy three year old. He loved to explore new places and play with his friends. One day, Toby's parents suggested he go for a picnic in the park. Toby couldn't wait! He excitedly packed up his backpack and headed off. At the park Toby played tag with his friends and rode his bike. Later, his parents found him lying peacefully on a patch of grass. He had decided to relax. He laid on his back and looked up at the clouds, feeling the light breeze against his cheeks.  Suddenly, he heard a voice. It was a wise old man standing by a tree. “Why don't you take a moment and relax?” the old man said. Toby was confused and wondered why he should relax. “Relaxation can give you wisdom and make you feel happy,” the man explained. Toby liked the idea so he closed his eyes and let his worries drift away. Soon he felt calm and content.  When Toby opened his eyes, the old man was gone. Toby felt different, he had learned a special lesson. He could be happy by taking moments to relax.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was three years old and loved to learn new things. One day, she wanted to learn a new song.  She asked her mom if she could learn her favourite song and her mom said yes. The little girl was excited and started to practice. She sang the song until she knew all the words.  Every day, the little girl kept singing her song and soon she could sing it without any mistakes. When she felt she knew it perfect, she asked her mom if she could perform it for the family.  The little girl was so proud when everyone clapped and cheered. She had learned a new song and now her family had heard it. She was very happy.

Once there was a person who was very weak. They were too weak to walk very far or play in the park. So, the person decided to do something different.  The person started to balance different things on their head! First, the person balanced a book. It was wobbly at first, but the person managed to balance it for a few seconds. Then, the person balanced a pile of ten pencils. The person kept balancing more and more things. Soon, the person was balancing cans, balls, and even a big chair! Everyone was so amazed that the person could balance all of these things. Other people tried, but they weren't very good at it.  The person was very proud and everyone was happy to see the person getting stronger and stronger. The weak person had become strong by balancing all sorts of things!

Once upon a time there was a man who loved tea. Every day he would grab his cup and drink some. He was so fond of it that he always kept a kettle of tea on the stove. One day, the man grabbed a cup to put some of his pale tea in, and took a sip. But the tea was sour! He tried again and it still tasted awful. He realized that he had left the tea on the stove so long that it had gone bad. The man thought about the mistake he had made. He realized that if he had been more careful and checked the tea, he would have been able to enjoy a nice hot cup. The moral of the story is: don't leave your tea alone too long, or it won't be any good to drink.

Sara and Ben are playing outside in the snow. They make a big snowman with a hat and a scarf. They give him a carrot nose and two coal eyes. They are very happy with their snowman. "Look, our snowman is smiling!" Sara says. "Yes, he is. He likes the snow," Ben says. They hear a loud noise. It is a big gray dog. He is running towards them. He looks angry and hungry. He barks and growls. "Help! A dog!" Sara screams. "Run! Run to the house!" Ben shouts. They drop their snowballs and run as fast as they can. The dog chases them. He is faster than them. He is almost near them. "Freeze!" a voice says. It is Dad. He is holding a stick. He is alert and brave. He stands between the kids and the dog. He waves the stick and yells at the dog. "Go away! Leave us alone!" The dog stops. He is scared of Dad. He turns around and runs away. "Are you okay, kids?" Dad asks. "Yes, Dad. Thank you, Dad. You saved us," Sara and Ben say. They hug Dad. They are safe and warm. "Let's go inside and have some hot chocolate," Dad says. They nod and smile. They follow Dad to the house. They leave their snowman behind. He is still smiling. He is happy in the snow.

Today, Jake was playing in his room. He grabbed a small top from his toy box. Jake held the top and spun it around. He watched in amazement as it twirled, going faster and faster. Jake's mom came in the room and smiled at him. "That looks like fun," she said. "Yes! Look Mom! It spins!" Jake said. Mom laughed. "Yes, it sure does! But it's getting late. Time for bed!" Jake groaned. "Aww, just a few more minutes?" Mom smiled and shook her head. "No, it's time for bed. Maybe tomorrow you can play with your top again." Jake sighed. "Okay, Mom." He put the small top back in the box and walked to his bed. As he climbed in, he though about how much fun he had spinning his top today.

The boy was weak so he couldn't do much. He sat outside of his house and watched the clouds. He watched them float by, big and small. He had lots of fun watching them as they moved around in the sky. He watched a little ant march across the ground. It was so small and fast, but never stopped. He watched it until it disappeared.  He saw a bird sitting on a nearby tree. He wanted to go closer, but he was too weak. He just watched from far away as the bird sang a beautiful song. The boy watched the sun set and the stars come up. He saw them twinkle and sparkle in the night sky. Finally, he had to go back inside his house for the night. But he knew he would be back out watching again soon.

Lila likes to wear her panda hat. It is soft and warm and has two black ears. She wears it every day when she goes to play with her friends. But one day, a big boy sees her panda hat and wants it. He runs to Lila and tries to take it from her head. He says, "Give me your hat, it is mine now!" Lila is scared and sad. She does not want to lose her panda hat. She holds it tight and says, "No, it is not yours, it is mine! Go away, big boy!" The big boy is angry and pulls harder. He says, "You are a baby, you do not need a hat. I am bigger and stronger, I can have what I want!" Lila cries and screams. She does not know what to do. She needs help. Then, she sees her friend Tom. Tom is light and fast. He runs to Lila and the big boy. He says, "Stop, big boy, you are mean and bad! Leave Lila alone, she is my friend!" Tom pushes the big boy away from Lila. He says, "Lila, are you okay? Do you have your panda hat?" Lila nods and hugs Tom. She says, "Thank you, Tom, you are brave and good! I have my panda hat, it is still mine!" Tom smiles and says, "You are welcome, Lila, I am glad you are safe. I like your panda hat, it is cute and nice!" Lila and Tom walk away from the big boy. They hold hands and wear their hats. They are happy and proud. They are friends.

Ben and his dad went to the farm to see the animals. Ben liked the cows, the pigs, and the chickens, but his favorite was the mule. The mule had big ears, a long nose, and a funny voice. Ben wanted to pet the mule and feed him some carrots. "Can I go to the mule, dad?" Ben asked. "Sure, son, but be careful. The mule can be stubborn and kick sometimes," dad said. Ben ran to the mule and held out a carrot. The mule sniffed the carrot and took a bite. Ben smiled and stroked the mule's fur. He felt happy and brave. "Hello, mule. You are my friend. Do you like carrots?" Ben said. The mule nodded and made a loud sound. He sounded like he was laughing. Ben laughed too. He gave the mule another carrot and hugged his neck. Suddenly, the mule sneezed. He sneezed so hard that he blew the carrot out of his mouth and onto Ben's face. Ben felt something wet and sticky on his cheek. He looked at the carrot and saw that it was covered with mule snot. "Yuck!" Ben cried. He dropped the carrot and wiped his face with his sleeve. He felt embarrassed and gross. The mule looked at Ben and made another loud sound. He sounded like he was teasing. Ben felt angry and sad. "Stop it, mule. That's not nice. You are not my friend. You are mean," Ben said. He ran away from the mule and back to his dad. He hugged his dad and told him what happened. "I'm sorry, son. The mule didn't mean to hurt you. He was just playing. He likes you," dad said. "Really?" Ben asked. "Really. He's just a silly mule. He doesn't know how to behave. He needs to learn some manners," dad said. "Can we leave now, dad? I don't want to see the mule anymore," Ben said. "Okay, son. Let's go home. We can come back another day and see the other animals. Maybe the mule will be nicer then," dad said. Ben nodded and held his dad's hand. They walked to the car and left the farm. Ben hoped the mule would say sorry next time. He still liked the mule, but he didn't like his snot.

One day, Jim and his dad decided to go out for a drive. They drove around the lively city and looked at all the busy traffic. Jim thought it was so exciting to be able to look at all the cars and watch who was at the street signs. While they were stopped at a red light, they noticed something funny. Two birds were stuck in a cage that had been left behind. Jim's dad said they should help the birds, so he looked around for something to release the latch on the cage. Thankfully, he found something small enough that he could use to open the latch. He slowly and carefully opened the cage, and the two birds flew free. Jim was so happy he clapped his hands and shouted for joy. Jim and his dad both waved goodbye as the birds flew away. Jim felt proud that he and his dad could help the birds and released them from the cage. It was a great feeling to do something good in the world!

Once upon a time, there was a hunter named Jack. Jack loved to hunt for animals in the forest. One day, Jack went out to hunt and he saw a little rabbit. Jack wanted to catch the rabbit, but the rabbit was too fast and ran away. Jack was upset because he couldn't catch the rabbit. Suddenly, Jack heard a little voice saying, "What's wrong, Mr. Hunter?" Jack turned around and saw a little girl with a basket of apples. Jack replied, "I wanted to catch that rabbit, but it was too fast for me." The little girl said, "Don't be upset. I can supply you with some apples instead." Jack was happy and said, "Thank you, little girl. You are very kind." From that day on, Jack and the little girl became friends. Jack would go out to hunt and the little girl would supply him with apples. They would always have a nice chat and Jack would forget about being upset. The end.

John loaded his truck with zero bananas. He was fearful he wouldn't be able to sell them all. He drove to the market and began to yell, “Bananas for sale!” Suddenly he heard a voice behind him. It was Jenny, a three year old girl. Jenny said, “I want five bananas!” John smiled and gave her five bananas. Jenny was so happy and grateful. She thanked John and ran to find her mommy. John was surprised. He had sold five bananas! He was not so fearful anymore. He continued to yell and soon more people bought his bananas.  By the end of the day, John had sold all of his bananas and was feeling very proud. He had loaded the truck with zero and now it was full!

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Jack and Jill. They were both so excited to play together outdoors. They looked up and saw a beautiful white bird soaring in the sky. “Wow, look at that bird soar!” shouted Jack.  Jill replied, “Let’s be like the bird and soar too!” Jack saw a broken branch on the ground, so he picked it up and said, “Let’s pretend this branch is like a plane.” So Jack and Jill hugged the branch, closed their eyes and imagined they were soaring in the sky. They hummed and soared around each other, pretending to make plane noises. They had so much fun pretending to be a plane, but it was time for them to go home. They hugged the branch one last time, thanked it for the fun, and said goodbye.

John was walking through the park one day when he suddenly noticed an enormous brown box sitting on the bench. He was curious and decided to carry it back home. When he opened it up he was surprised to find a napkin inside. He picked it up and asked his mum, "What is this enormous napkin?" She smiled and said, "It's special. It can carry all the goodies you put inside it!" John was amazed. He had never seen anything like it before. He carefully put some sweets and other snacks inside the enormous napkin and carried it back to the park. He was so proud of his special new napkin and couldn't wait to show it off to all his friends.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a thin cat named Kitty. She had many friends, like Doggy, Birdy, and Fishy. They all liked to play and have fun together. They were very happy. One day, Kitty saw a sign near a big tree. The sign said, "Save the park." Kitty did not want her park to go away, so she asked her friends to help. Doggy barked, Birdy sang, and Fishy splashed in the water. They all wanted to save the park. Kitty and her friends worked together to clean the park. They picked up trash and put it in the bin. Soon, the park was clean and pretty. The people in the town saw what Kitty and her friends did. They were very proud of them. They all learned that if they work together, they can save the things they love. And they all lived happily ever after.

Tom and Sam are friends. They like to play in the park. But today it is raining a lot. The park is wet and muddy. There is a lot of water on the ground. "Let's go home," Tom says. "It is not fun to play in the rain." "No, let's stay," Sam says. "We can make boats with sticks and leaves. We can sail them in the water." Tom and Sam disagree. They do not want the same thing. They are not happy. They see a big puddle. It looks like a lake. The water is deep and fast. It is a flood. "Wow, look at that!" Sam says. "Let's put our boats in there. They will go very fast." "No, that is dangerous," Tom says. "The water can take our boats away. It can take us away too. We can fall and get hurt." Sam does not listen. He runs to the puddle. He puts his boat in the water. He laughs. "See, it is fun!" he says. Tom is scared. He sees Sam's boat go away. He sees Sam slip and fall. He hears Sam cry. "Help, help!" Sam says. "I am wet and cold. I want to go home." Tom runs to Sam. He helps him get up. He hugs him. "I am sorry, Sam," he says. "Are you okay?" "I am sorry, Tom," Sam says. "You were right. It was not a good idea. It was not fun." Tom and Sam are friends again. They agree. They want to go home. They want to be warm and dry. They want to play in the park another day. They hope the rain will stop and the flood will go away. They think the sun is good. They think the park is good. They think they are good.

One day, little Lisa was walking in the forest when she discovered a lion. She was so excited and couldn't believe her eyes. The lion was mighty and powerful looking. Lisa was a bit scared but she was also curious. She tiptoed slowly up to the lion, but the mighty beast quickly spotted Lisa and shifted his gaze directly towards her. Lisa froze in place while the lion roared at her. Then, he asked her in a deep, gruff voice “What are you doing here, little one?”  Lisa took a deep breath and replied bravely “I was just exploring and I discovered you!” The lion seemed impressed with Lisa’s courage and softened his expression. He said “Well, you better get back home now. Don’t come out here in the forests alone anymore.” Lisa thanked the lion and quickly ran back home. She never forgot the mighty lion that she had discovered in the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a big building with an elevator. The elevator was gray and went up and down. One day, Lily wanted to measure how tall she was. She asked her mommy for help. Her mommy took out a tape measure and measured Lily. Lily was very happy to find out how tall she was!

Anna liked to play with clay. She could make shapes and animals with her hands. She liked the soft texture of the clay. It felt nice and smooth. One day, she found a new kind of clay in the art room. It was green and shiny. She wanted to try it. She took a piece and started to roll it. But it did not feel nice and smooth. It felt sticky and slimy. It made her hands dirty and wet. She did not like the green clay. She wanted to quit. She tried to put it back in the box. But it stuck to her fingers. She pulled and pulled. But it did not come off. She felt frightened. She thought the green clay would never leave her. She started to cry. She called for her teacher. Her teacher came and saw her. She smiled and said, "Don't worry, Anna. It's not clay. It's slime. It's a toy. It's supposed to be sticky and slimy. It's fun to play with. But if you don't like it, you can wash it off with water and soap. It's easy. Do you want to try?" Anna nodded. She followed her teacher to the sink. She washed her hands with water and soap. The slime came off. Her hands were clean and dry. She felt better. She thanked her teacher. She decided to play with the soft clay again. She liked the soft texture of the clay. It felt nice and smooth.

Sara and Ben were twins who liked to play together. One day, their mom gave them a big purple gift to share. She said, "This is a special gift for both of you. You have to yield and take turns with it, okay?" Sara and Ben nodded and thanked their mom. They opened the gift and saw a shiny purple bike. They both wanted to ride it first. Sara said, "I want to go first, I am older by two minutes." Ben said, "No, I want to go first, I am bigger by two inches." They started to fight and pull the bike. Their mom heard them and came back. She said, "Stop fighting, you two. You have to yield and take turns with the bike, or I will take it away." Sara and Ben said, "Sorry, mom." They decided to flip a coin to see who would go first. Sara won the coin toss and got to ride the bike first. She put on her helmet and rode the bike around the yard. She felt happy and proud. She did not want to yield and let Ben have a turn. She said, "This is my bike, I won the coin toss. You can wait." Ben felt sad and angry. He said, "That is not fair, you have to yield and let me have a turn. Mom said so." Sara said, "No, I don't. Go away." She rode the bike faster and faster. She did not see the big rock in her way. She hit the rock and fell off the bike. She hurt her knee and cried. The bike was broken too. Ben ran to help her. He said, "Are you okay, Sara?" Sara said, "No, I am not. I hurt my knee and the bike is broken. Mom will be mad at us." Ben said, "I am sorry, Sara. I wish you had yielded and let me have a turn. Maybe we could have avoided the rock." Sara said, "I am sorry too, Ben. I was selfish and greedy. I should have yielded and let you have a turn. Maybe we could have enjoyed the bike together." Their mom came and saw what happened. She said, "Oh, no. What did you do, Sara and Ben? You broke the bike and hurt yourselves. You did not yield and take turns with the gift, did you?" Sara and Ben said, "No, mom. We did not. We are sorry, mom." Their mom said, "I am sorry too, Sara and Ben. You have to learn to yield and share with each other, or you will lose what you have and hurt yourselves and others. The bike was a gift, not a prize. You have to be grateful and generous, not selfish and greedy. Do you understand?" Sara and Ben said, "Yes, mom. We understand. We will try to do better next time." The moral of the story is: You have to yield and share with others, or you will lose what you have and hurt yourselves and others.

Lily and Ben are pupils in the same class. They like to play together, but they do not like the same food. Lily likes spicy food, like curry and chili. Ben likes sweet food, like cake and candy. One day, their teacher brings a big pot of soup for lunch. She says it is a special soup, with many different flavors. She tells the pupils to try some and share with their friends. Lily takes a big spoon of soup and puts it in her mouth. She smiles and says, "Yum, this soup is spicy and good. I like it a lot." She gives some soup to Ben and says, "Here, try some. You will like it too." Ben takes a small sip of soup and makes a face. He says, "Yuck, this soup is spicy and bad. I do not like it at all." He gives some soup to Lily and says, "Here, take it back. You can have it all." Lily and Ben start to argue. They say, "My food is better than your food. Your food is gross and icky. You have no taste. You are not my friend." Their teacher hears them and comes over. She says, "Stop, stop, stop. Why are you fighting? You are both pupils in the same class. You are both friends. You do not have to like the same food. You can like different food and still be kind and share. That is what makes the soup special. It has many different flavors, like you have many different likes. Can you unite and try to understand each other?" Lily and Ben look at each other. They feel sorry for being mean. They say, "Sorry, sorry, sorry. You are right, teacher. We do not have to like the same food. We can like different food and still be friends. We can unite and try to understand each other." They hug and make up. They decide to try some other food from the pot. They find some food that they both like, like noodles and cheese. They say, "This food is yummy and good. We both like it a lot." They smile and eat together. They are happy and united. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big, hot sun in the sky. The sun made everything feel warm and nice. One day, a little rat appeared from behind a tree. The rat was small and brown, with a long tail. It looked around and saw some cheese on the ground. The rat was hungry, so it ran over to the cheese and ate it all up. Then, the rat disappeared back behind the tree. The sun kept shining and everything was happy. The end.

Anna liked to play with her toys. She had a lot of toys, but her favorite was a brown telephone. She liked to pretend she was talking to her friends and family. She also liked to measure things with her ruler. She measured her toys, her books, her bed, and even her cat. One day, Anna's mom asked her to help with baking a cake. Anna was excited. She wanted to measure the flour, the sugar, and the eggs. She followed her mom to the kitchen and saw a big bowl, a spoon, and a scale. Her mom said, "We need to measure the ingredients carefully, or the cake will not be good. Can you help me?" Anna nodded. She wanted to help. She saw her mom put some flour on the scale and read the number. Then she put some sugar on the scale and read the number. Then she put some eggs on the scale and read the number. Anna thought it looked easy. She wanted to try. When her mom went to get the butter, Anna saw her brown telephone on the table. She had an idea. She picked up the telephone and put it on the scale. She wanted to measure how heavy it was. She looked at the number. It was very big. She was happy. She thought her telephone was the best toy ever. But then, something bad happened. The telephone was too heavy for the scale. The scale broke. It made a loud noise. Anna was scared. She dropped the telephone. It also broke. It made another loud noise. Anna was sad. She broke her favorite toy and her mom's scale. Her mom came back and saw the mess. She was angry. She said, "Anna, what did you do? You broke the scale and the telephone. You did not listen to me. You did not help me. You made a big problem. You are in trouble." Anna felt sorry. She said, "I'm sorry, mom. I wanted to measure my telephone. I thought it was fun. I did not mean to break anything. Please don't be mad at me." Her mom sighed. She said, "Anna, measuring things is fun, but you have to be careful. You have to use the right tools for the right things. You can't measure a telephone with a scale. You can't use a toy for baking. You have to follow the rules and respect other people's things. Do you understand?" Anna nodded. She said, "I understand, mom. I was wrong. I will be more careful next time. I will follow the rules and respect other people's things. I will help you fix the scale and the telephone. I will help you bake the cake. I love you, mom." Her mom smiled. She said, "I love you too, Anna. I'm glad you learned your lesson. Now, let's clean up this mess and finish the cake. Maybe we can find another way to measure your telephone later." The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max loved to run and play. One day, Max saw a big, red ball. The ball was amazing! It was the most amazing ball he had ever seen. Max knew he had to get that ball. Max ran and ran to catch the ball. He ran to the west, where the sun goes to sleep. As he ran, he saw a big tree. Max knew he had to pause and rest. He was very tired. But he did not forget about the amazing ball. After his rest, Max ran some more. He ran and ran until he found the amazing ball. He was so happy! He played with the ball all day long. And from that day on, Max and the amazing ball were always together.

Molly was so excited. Today was her first day of preschool! As she arrived she noticed a big picture on the wall. She wanted to take a closer look but she slipped on the way there. She felt embarrassed and a bit scared. She didn't know anybody yet, so she felt ignorant and alone.  Suddenly she felt a gentle hand touch her shoulder. It was her teacher. She was so kind and understanding. She helped Molly get up and brought her closer to the picture. It was a painting of a big rainbow. Molly looked around and saw that everyone was enjoying the picture. She started to feel better and soon made friends with some of the other children.  Molly realized that nobody was ignorant; they were all just getting to know each other! She was glad she decided to come to preschool and was even more excited to learn more!

Once there was a little girl who was excited to go to the beach. As she ran onto the sand, she looked out and admired the sparkling blue sea. She saw a big boat on the horizon and she was amazed. She clapped her hands together and smiled with glee.  The little girl spotted a lady walking along the beach. The lady was carrying a big basket and the little girl wondered what was inside. She skipped up to the lady and asked if she could take a peek.  The lady grinned and said yes, so the little girl peered inside to find lots of beautiful shells. The lady said each one was unique and special, just like a person's heart. The little girl felt special too and was excited to find the special shell of her own. She looked around and admired the different shells until she found one with a pretty pattern. The little girl hugged it close and said thank you to the lady. The little girl was excited to have her special shell. As she walked home along the beach, she kept admiring and admiring her precious shell and feeling the specialness in her heart.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going on picnics with her family. One day, her mom packed a yummy lunch and they went to the park. Lily saw a big, dirty puddle and wanted to jump in it.  Her mom said, "Lily, don't jump in that puddle, you'll get your clothes dirty."  Lily replied, "But I want to jump and jog in it!"  Her mom said, "No, Lily. It's not good to get dirty. Let's have our picnic and then we can play on the swings."  Lily learned that it's important to listen to her mom and not always do what she wants. She had a fun picnic and played on the swings, feeling happy and clean.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jake. Jake was very smart and always looking for something fun to do. He one day decided to play a game. As he played, he noticed something special. Each time he played the game, he got better and better. Jake's game skills increased and he was having a good time. He kept at it day after day and with each playing, his skills grew. Pretty soon, Jake was the best game player in the whole town. Everyone talked about how good Jake had become. One day, a friend of Jake's asked him how he had gotten so good. Jake smiled and said, "I just kept playing until I became the best!" Ever since then, Jake has continued to play games and his skills keep increasing. The end!

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Daisy. One day, Daisy was hungry so she decided to eat some honey. She opened the jar and found that it was full of sweet, yellow honey. She was very excited and began licking the honey off the spoon. Suddenly, she noticed something that made her tremble. It was a shiny razor blade in the honey! "Mommy," she said in a trembling voice, "Look what I found in the honey!" Her mommy quickly came to investigate. She carefully looked at the razor blade and told Daisy, "Don't worry, I'll take care of it."  She then took the razor blade away and Daisy felt much better.  The next day, Daisy had a big smile on her face. She knew that if she always listened to her mommy, she would always be safe.  The end.

One day, a small cat named Kitty was walking by a big wall. She saw a ball stuck on top of the wall. Kitty wanted to get the ball down, but the wall was very hard to climb. She tried and tried, but she could not reach the ball. Then, a dog named Buddy walked by. Kitty asked, "Can you help me get the ball?" Buddy said, "I will try!" He jumped and jumped, but the ball was still too high. They both felt sad. Suddenly, a bird named Chirpy saw them. Chirpy asked, "What happened?" Kitty and Buddy told Chirpy about the ball. Chirpy said, "I can help!" She flew up, took the ball, and gave it to Kitty. They all became friends and played with the ball together.

Once upon a time there was a clumsy spring. She rolled around, bumping into things and was always getting tangled up. One day she decided she wanted to measure how far she could go. She asked her friend, a tree, if he could help. "How can I measure?" she asked. The tree laughed. He said, "Go out into the field and count your steps." The spring felt excited! She wobbled out of the forest and into the meadow. She started counting each step she took. She was shocked when she realized she had measured ten steps! The spring was delighted. She bounced back to the tree and hugged him. "Thank you for helping me measure!" she said. The tree hugged her back and smiled. "You're welcome!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very shy and didn't talk to many people. One day, her mom asked her what she wanted for dinner. Lily said, "I want pizza!" Her mom smiled and said, "Okay, we can have pizza for dinner tonight." Later that evening, the pizza arrived and Lily was very happy. She loved pizza! But when the delivery person came to the door, Lily was too shy to say anything. Her mom had to accept the pizza for her. After they ate their pizza, Lily felt brave. She asked her mom if they could invite some friends over to have pizza with them next time. Her mom said yes and Lily was so excited. She couldn't wait to share her favorite food with her friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She liked to play with her toys and go on adventures with her teddy bear, Brownie. One day, Lily's mommy said, "Lily, it's time for Brownie to take a nap. You can play quietly while he sleeps." Lily looked at Brownie and said, "Okay mommy, I'll be quiet so Brownie can nap." She then went to her room to play with her dolls. After a while, Lily's daddy came home from work. He was very tired and wanted to take a nap too. Lily went to her daddy and said, "Daddy, you can nap in my room. It's quiet in there." Her daddy smiled and said, "Thank you, Lily. You're such a good helper." And with that, her daddy took a nap in Lily's room while she played quietly with her toys.

Once upon a time on a cold winter night, there was a colorful reindeer. His name was Rudolph. He was very happy because it was almost Christmas. He was excited to show off his colorful antlers. Rudolph went outside to play with his friends in the snow. He wanted to see who could kick the snow the highest. They all took turns running and kicking it as high as they could. Suddenly Rudolph got the biggest kick of all. It was so high that it almost reached the sky! All of his friends were so impressed with Rudolph's kick. They even made him their leader. From then on, Rudolph was the leader of the pack. He was known as the leader of the colorful reindeers. Every year Rudolph's kick is remembered. On cold winter nights you can still hear the reindeer singing about how high he kicked that night. This is one of their favorite stories about Rudolph!

Tim and Sam were friends. They liked to play with toys. One day, they found a big box. Inside the box, there was an elephant. The elephant was small and gray. It had a long nose and big ears. "Wow, look at this!" Tim said. He picked up the elephant and hugged it. "It is so soft and cute. I want to keep it." "No, I want it!" Sam said. He grabbed the elephant from Tim and pulled it. "It is mine. I saw it first." Tim and Sam started to fight. They both wanted the elephant. They did not want to share. The elephant did not like that. It felt scared and sad. It used its long nose to make a loud noise. "Prrrrr!" Tim and Sam stopped fighting. They looked at the elephant. The elephant looked at them. It frowned. It did not want to be in the box. It wanted to be free and happy. "Sorry, elephant," Tim said. He felt bad. He let go of the elephant. "Sorry, elephant," Sam said. He felt bad too. He also let go of the elephant. The elephant smiled. It was glad. It used its long nose to touch Tim and Sam. It thanked them. Then it walked out of the box. It wanted to find its family. Tim and Sam watched the elephant go. They felt sorry for the elephant. They also felt sorry for each other. "Can we still be friends?" Tim asked. "Of course we can," Sam said. He hugged Tim. "Friends share and care." They smiled. They learned a lesson. They decided to play with other toys. They did not fight anymore. They were happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who wanted to help her mommy. Every day she watched her mommy do chores and loved to try and help. One day, her mommy asked her to go outside and bring her a twig. The little girl was so excited. She ran out of the house and started looking for the perfect twig. She looked around the yard, but couldn't find the right one. She kept looking and looking, but no twigs seemed right. The little girl was getting very tired, but she was so persistent. She kept looking until finally, she found the perfect twig. She picked it up and ran back inside. Mommy was so impressed! She thanked the little girl for being so persistent and for finding the perfect twig. The little girl was so proud of herself for being such a big help. From that day on, the little girl always tried her best to bring Mommy whatever she asked for.

Once upon a time there was a lucky kitten living on a farm. He loved to play in the warm sunlight and chase butterflies. One day, the kitten decided to explore the big white house by the barn. He slowly crept up the stairs and peeked into the first room. There in the corner was the biggest fireplace he had ever seen. He had never seen anything like it before. The kitten was excited, so he ran inside to explore. Suddenly, the kitten heard a loud noise. He quickly spun around and went back down the stairs. He was frightened, but he was also very curious. He decided to go back up with more caution. When he reached the top of the steps, the kitten noticed a dark object next to the fireplace. He slowly stepped closer and felt its cold metal surface. It was a shiny handle, and it was connected to something strange. The kitten gave it a tug and the handle started to move. The kitten had just reversed the fireplace! The room filled with warm air and a soft orange glow. The kitten was so happy and excited that he started jumping around. He had been so lucky to find the fireplace and reverse it! He ran downstairs and told all his animal friends the amazing story.

Once upon a time, there was a big, strong dog named Max. Max was mighty and loved to play with his ball. One day, Max went outside to play with his ball, but he accidentally left it in the mud.  Max's owner, a little girl named Lily, saw that Max's ball was dirty and said, "Max, your ball is dirty. Let's wash it!"  Max barked happily and Lily grabbed the ball. She washed it with soap and water until it was clean. Max was so happy that he wagged his tail and licked Lily's face.  From that day on, Max made sure to never leave his ball in the mud again. And Lily always made sure to wash it when it got dirty. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a yellow bird. The bird lived in a small cage. It wanted to fly and play with its friends. One sunny day, a kind girl saw the yellow bird. She felt sad for the bird. She wanted to help the bird. So, she opened the cage to release it. The bird was very happy. It flew in the mild air. It played with its friends. The girl was happy too. They all played together in the sun.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy who loved to watch helicopters fly. Every day, he dreamed of flying in one himself. One day, his dream came true. The helicopters took him up high into the sky. He was so proud to be able to fly in one! When he returned down to the ground, everyone wanted to hear all about it. The little boy proudly told them all about the journey. He told them how the helicopters had taken him up high into the sky and how he had seen clouds and birds from above. Everyone was so proud of him for completing the flight. The little boy smiled from ear to ear. He knew that he had achieved something very special.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat grapes because they were sweet and yummy. One day, her mom gave her some grapes to eat, but Lily refused to eat them because they had seeds in them. Later that day, Lily went to the park to play. She saw a graceful swan swimming in the pond. The swan was so pretty and Lily wanted to touch it, but her mom told her not to because the swan might get scared and fly away. As they were leaving the park, Lily's mom offered her some more grapes to eat. This time, Lily happily ate them because her mom had taken out all the seeds. She felt so full and happy, and she even said "thank you" to her mom for being so kind.

John and his family had a very fun event. It was a creative event and they used lots of fun things. They used balloons, paint and paper. Everyone had so much fun.  John used the paint to make a big picture. He was very creative and excited. He painted a big sun in the sky and little flowers. He used the paper to make a funny hat. He put it on and it made everyone laugh.  They used the balloons to make a game. They played tag with the balloons. Everyone ran around the house trying to catch them. It was the funniest thing!  John had so much fun. He loved his special event and thought it was very creative. It was definitely an event to remember!

Once upon a time, there was a beautiful princess. She loved to go exploring and one day she went deep into the forest. Suddenly, a big, scary bear appeared! She was so scared that she ran away as fast as she could. The bear chased her, but she was much too fast! Each time the bear came closer, she kicked the ground with her feet and ran even faster! Finally, the princess outran the bear and made it safely home. She was so relieved and happy that she had been brave and kicked the ground. The princess would never forget her adventure, deep in the forest.

Once upon a time there was a troubled tiger. The tiger didn't like the jungle. He wanted to find a better place to live. So one day the tiger zipped away to find a new home. First he zipped to a mountain. But the mountain wasn't nice.  So the tiger zipped again and this time he found a valley. It looked really nice. He thought it might be a good place to live.  But then the tiger saw a little girl, playing in the valley. The tiger was scared. He didn't want to hurt the girl, so he zipped away. Finally, the tiger found a perfect place to live, all by himself. He was happy and no longer troubled. And he lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had a small box with a lock on it. Inside the box, she kept her favorite toy, a pretty string. Lucy loved to play with the string and make fun shapes with it. One day, Lucy lost the key to the box. She felt nervous because she could not unlock the box and play with her string. Lucy looked everywhere for the key but could not find it. She was very sad and did not know what to do. Lucy's mom saw her crying and asked what was wrong. Lucy told her mom about the lost key. Her mom helped her look for the key, and they found it under her bed. Lucy was so happy! She learned that when you are nervous, it is good to ask for help. With help, she could unlock the box and play with her string again.

Once upon a time there was an elderly man who was sitting on the park bench. He was eating some butter on his toast and humming to himself.  Just then a little 3 year old boy came running up to him. He looked up at the elderly man with his big brown eyes and said, "What are you doing, Mister?"  The elderly man smiled and said, "I'm just enjoying my toast with some butter. Would you like some?"  The little boy shook his head and said, "No, thank you. But can you show me something?"  The elderly man looked around and said, "What would you like to see?" The little boy pointed to the trees and said, "Can you show me how to listen to the trees?" The elderly man's eyes twinkled and he said, "Yes, of course! Just close your eyes and listen. Can you hear the birds singing in the distance? The wind rustling through the leaves?" The little boy's face lit up with excitement and he began to listen. Soon he heard the birds singing and the leaves rustling, and he smiled.  The elderly man smiled too, glad that he was able to show the little boy something new and interesting. He watched on as the little boy listened to the sounds of nature, and thought of all the things he could show him in the future.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to walk in the park with her mom. One day, they saw a pale duck in the pond. "Look, Mommy! The duck is so pale!" said Lily. "Yes, it is," replied her mom. Later that day, they went home and turned on the TV. They watched a show about animals. "I love animals," said Lily. "Me too," said her mom. They talked about all the animals they had seen that day. Before bedtime, Lily asked her mom, "Can we walk in the park again tomorrow?" "Of course, we can," said her mom. Lily went to bed happy, dreaming about all the animals she would see on her walk tomorrow.

Once upon a time, there was a cow who lived on the farm. The cow loved to use the farm and graze in the fields. One day the farmer gave the cow a special treat. He gave her some apples. The cow was so grateful and ate the apples with delight. The cow thanked the farmer for her treat. The farmer was happy to see the cow so grateful and gave her another treat, some carrots for lunch. The cow munched on the carrots and enjoyed them so much. As the cow went back to the fields to graze, she was so very grateful for the farmer's kindness. She was thankful for the delicious treats he had given her. The cow returned to the farm every day and the farmer always had something special for her. The cow and the farmer became very good friends. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big, strong horse named Max. He used to carry heavy things for his owner, but one day he got sick and lost a lot of weight. His owner was sad because Max wasn't reliable anymore. The owner took Max to the vet who gave him medicine and food to restore his health. Max started eating and playing again and soon he was back to his normal weight. His owner was happy because Max was reliable once more. Max and his owner went on many adventures together, carrying heavy things and having fun. Max was happy to be strong and healthy again, and his owner was happy to have his reliable horse back. The end.

Ben is a farmer. He has a big farm with many animals. He likes to feed the cows, the pigs, the sheep and the chickens. He also likes to grow corn, carrots, apples and pumpkins. One day, Ben has to go to the town. He has to sell some of his food and buy some things for his farm. He takes his truck and drives on the road. He is happy to go to the town. But on the way, he sees a big problem. There is a lot of water on the road. It rained a lot last night and the road is flooded. Ben cannot drive his truck through the water. He has to stop and wait. He is sad and worried. He does not want to delay his trip to the town. Then he sees a big boat. It is a famous boat. It is the boat of the mayor. The mayor is the boss of the town. He is very nice and helps people. He sees Ben and his truck. He waves to him and says hello. "Hello, Ben! I see you have a problem. Do you need some help?" the mayor says. "Yes, please. I have to go to the town, but the road is flooded. Can you take me and my food on your boat?" Ben says. "Of course, I can. Come on board, Ben. I have some space for you and your food. I am also going to the town. We can go together." the mayor says. Ben is very happy. He thanks the mayor and puts his food on the boat. He gets on the boat and sits next to the mayor. The boat starts to move on the water. Ben sees the animals and the plants on his farm. He waves to them and says goodbye. He is not sad and worried anymore. He is excited and grateful. He does not mind the delay. He is happy to go to the town with the mayor on his famous boat.

Once upon a time there was a naughty fox. He was always looking for trouble. One day, he got into a lot of trouble when he tried to steal the farmer's chickens. The farmer was angry and he caught the fox. He took the fox to jail. The fox was very scared. He did not know what was going to happen. The fox said to the farmer, "Please let me go. I am very sorry. I will never be naughty again." But the farmer did not listen. He said, "No, you have done a bad thing. You must stay in jail."  The fox was so scared and he did not know what to do. He thought he would never get out of jail.  But then, one day, the farmer decided to forgive the fox and let him out. The fox was so happy and he said to the farmer, "Thank you for letting me go. I will never be naughty again."  And from that day forward, the fox was always very good and never got into trouble again.

Once upon a time, a mama and her baby were walking through the park when they stopped in a quiet corner to pray. Mama closed her eyes tight, put her hands together and whispered. Baby watched her and copied what she did by putting his little hands together and closing his eyes too. Mama pointed to the top of a very tall tree and told Baby they were going to pray for a bird’s nest. Baby looked up and saw a dirty old nest at the top. Mama and Baby prayed to the bird for a safe place to sleep and for happy days.  Mama and Baby kept walking until they saw another nest in a different tree, this one much cleaner. Mama was very happy and Baby cheered. Mama smiled and said that their prayer had been answered and that the birds would have a much nicer place to sleep now. Mama and Baby walked away from the park with big smiles on their faces. From now on, they would never forget to pray for the birds.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a big crane. The crane was very sleepy. It had a long neck and could reach very high. One day, the people in the town wanted to decorate a tall tree. They put pretty things on the tree, like shiny balls and bright lights. But they could not reach the top of the tree. They asked the sleepy crane for help. The crane was happy to help. It stretched its long neck up, up, up to the top of the tree. The people put the pretty things on the crane, and the crane put them on the tree. The tree looked very pretty when it was all done. The people were so happy, and they said "thank you" to the sleepy crane. The crane felt good for helping and could now go to sleep. Everyone in the town had a great time, and they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved his cozy sweater. It was warm and soft, and he wore it every day. One day, Timmy's mom said, "Timmy, it's time to go outside and play. But it's cold outside, so don't forget to put on your sweater."  Timmy replied, "Okay, Mommy. I will put on my sweater." He went to his room and found his sweater on the floor. He picked it up and put it on. "I love my sweater," he said. "It's so useful."  As Timmy was playing outside, he saw his friend Billy. Billy said, "Timmy, why do you always wear that sweater? It's not even that cold outside."  Timmy said, "I wear my sweater because it keeps me warm and it's my favorite. But now it's time to go inside. Mommy said it's getting close to dinner time."  Timmy and Billy went inside and had dinner with their families. Timmy's sweater kept him warm and cozy all night long. The end.

Anna and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to pretend they were astronauts and explore the stars. They had some equipment that they made from boxes and bottles. They had a rocket, a helmet, a radio and a telescope. "Are you ready, Anna?" Ben asked. He put on his helmet and held his radio. "We are going to blast off to the moon!" "Yes, Ben!" Anna said. She put on her helmet and knelt next to the rocket. "Let's go!" They counted down from ten and then made a loud noise. They lifted the rocket and ran around the park. They pretended they saw planets and aliens and meteors. They had a lot of fun. But then they saw something else. It was a small, furry animal. It had long ears, a fluffy tail and a pink nose. It was hopping around the grass and nibbling on some carrots. "Look, Ben!" Anna said. "What is that?" Ben looked through his telescope. He smiled. "It's a bunny, Anna! A cute bunny!" "Can we pet it, Ben?" Anna asked. She loved animals. Ben nodded. He put down his telescope and radio. He walked slowly towards the bunny. He reached out his hand. But the bunny was scared. It saw Ben and ran away. It hopped over a fence and disappeared. "Aw, no!" Ben said. He was sad. He wanted to pet the bunny. "Me too!" Anna said. She was sad too. They went back to their equipment. They looked at each other. "Maybe we can find another bunny, Ben," Anna said. "Maybe, Anna," Ben said. "Or maybe we can find something else. Something even more cute and fun." They smiled. They put on their helmets again. They knelt next to the rocket. "Are you ready, Anna?" Ben asked. "Yes, Ben!" Anna said. They counted down from ten and then made a loud noise. They lifted the rocket and ran around the park. They pretended they were astronauts and explore the stars. They had a lot of fun.

Sara and Tom are twins. They like to play with their toys and their dog, Spot. But they have to take a pill every day to be healthy. Mom gives them the pill in the morning and tells them to swallow it with water. One day, Sara and Tom are very excited. They are going to the park with Mom and Spot. They put on their hats and shoes and get ready to go. Mom says, "Did you take your pill today?" Sara and Tom look at each other. They forget to take their pill. They say, "No, Mom, we forget." Mom is not happy. She says, "You have to take your pill every day. It is very important. Go back to the kitchen and take your pill now." Sara and Tom are sad. They do not want to go back. They want to go to the park. They say, "Please, Mom, can we take our pill later?" Mom shakes her head. She says, "No, you have to take your pill now. If you don't, you will feel sick later. And you won't have fun at the park. Trust me, I know." Sara and Tom do not understand. They think Mom is being mean. They say, "But we feel fine now. We want to go to the park now." Mom sighs. She says, "I know you feel fine now. But you won't feel fine later. You see, your pill helps your body fight germs. Germs are bad things that make you sick. Sometimes, you can't see them or feel them. But they are there. And they can hurt you. That's why you have to take your pill every day. It makes you strong and ready to play." Sara and Tom listen to Mom. They think about germs. They do not like germs. They do not want to be sick. They say, "OK, Mom, we will take our pill now. We are sorry we forget." Mom smiles. She says, "That's good. I'm proud of you. Now, hurry up and take your pill. Then we can go to the park and have fun." Sara and Tom nod. They go back to the kitchen and take their pill. Then they run to the door and say, "We are ready, Mom. Let's go to the park!" Mom takes their hands and says, "Let's go." They go to the park with Spot and have a great time. They do not feel sick. They are happy. They remember to take their pill every day.

One day, Lily was playing in her bedroom. She looked around and saw lots of toys, but the one thing she wanted wasn't there.  "I want a medal!" she said loudly. Lily went to her parent's room and found her dad's printer. She pushed a button and a piece of paper came out that said 'medal'. She smiled, she had printed a medal!  But when she went to pick it up, it felt weird. It wasn't made out of gold or silver! Instead it had been printed on a piece of paper.  Lily was disappointed. She wanted a real medal, not a printed one. She went downstairs, and asked if she could get a real medal.  Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, let's go to the store and get one for you." So Lily and her mom went to the store and found a shiny medal, in the shape of a star.  Lily was very happy and put it around her neck with a big smile. She had earned her medal!

Lila and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to run and jump and swing on the swings. They saw a big tree with many branches. Some branches were low and some were high. "Look, Ben, I can pull this branch!" Lila said. She grabbed a low branch and pulled hard. The branch was old and dry. It broke with a loud snap. Lila fell on the grass. "Ow, ow, ow!" Lila cried. She hurt her hand and her knee. Ben ran to her and helped her up. "Are you okay, Lila?" Ben asked. He saw blood on her hand and her knee. He felt sorry for her. "I'm not okay, Ben. It hurts a lot." Lila said. She was sad and scared. She wanted her mom. "Let's go find your mom, Lila. She can make you feel better." Ben said. He held her hand and walked with her. He saw a bench where Lila's mom was sitting. He called her name. "Mom, mom, Lila needs you!" Ben shouted. Lila's mom heard him and saw them. She saw Lila's hand and knee. She got up and ran to them. "What happened, Lila? What happened, Ben?" Lila's mom asked. She hugged Lila and looked at her wounds. "Lila pulled a branch and it broke and she fell." Ben said. He told her what happened. "Oh, Lila, I'm sorry. That was a bad branch. Let me clean your hand and your knee. It will sting a little, but it will help." Lila's mom said. She took out a tissue and some water and some band-aids from her bag. She cleaned Lila's hand and knee and put band-aids on them. "Thank you, mom. Thank you, Ben." Lila said. She felt a little better. She smiled at her mom and her friend. "You're welcome, Lila. You're a brave girl. And thank you, Ben, for being a good friend." Lila's mom said. She smiled at them both. "Can we still play, mom?" Lila asked. "Sure, Lila, but be careful. Don't pull any more branches, okay?" Lila's mom said. "Okay, mom. I won't pull any more branches." Lila said. Lila and Ben went back to play. They had fun in the park. They did not pull any more branches. They played until it was time to go home.

Tom and Anna were playing in the garden. They had a big jug of water and some cups. They pretended to have a tea party with their toys. "Would you like some tea, Mr. Bear?" Anna asked, pouring water into a cup. "Yes, please, Anna. You are very kind," Tom said, making his bear talk. They smiled and drank their water. They liked to play together. But then, a big, ugly dog came into the garden. It had black fur and sharp teeth. It barked loudly and ran towards them. Tom and Anna were scared. They dropped their cups and jug.
