The water spilled on the ground. "Go away, dog! Leave us alone!" Tom shouted, holding his bear. The dog did not listen. It jumped on their toys and tore them apart. It bit the bear's ear and the doll's dress. Tom and Anna cried. They ran to the house and called for their mom. Mom came out and saw the dog. She was angry. She picked up a stick and waved it at the dog. "Shoo, shoo, bad dog! Get out of here!" she yelled. The dog was afraid of mom. It whimpered and ran away. Mom hugged Tom and Anna. She checked their toys. Some were broken, some were not. "I'm sorry, my loves. That was a mean dog. It should not have come here," she said. "It's okay, mom. We still have some toys. And we have you," Anna said. Tom nodded. He smiled and gave his bear a kiss. Mom smiled too. She took them inside and gave them some cookies. They forgot about the ugly dog. They were happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a kind and compassionate girl. She was always thinking of ways to help people and make them smile. One day, she was out in the park when she saw a little bird with a broken wing. She gave it a gentle pat on its head and felt a special connection. The bird fluttered its wings and blinked its eyes at the girl. She understood it was trying to tell her something. With a kind smile the girl said the bird was going to be ok, then it flew away. She thought the bird had sent her a message. The girl was moved by the bird's courage and loving gesture. It had showed such compassion for her. She felt special, like there was a connection between them. She smiled to herself and blinked back at the bird, grateful for the message it had sent her.

Once upon a time there was a little boy. He had a penny which was very special because it was green. He was very excited to show it to his dad. He ran towards his dad, pointing at the penny and shouting "look, look!" His dad smiled and said "where did you find this?" The little boy was so excited to show the penny that he pointed to an old woman and said that she had given it to him. The old woman heard and got very angry. She waved her arms and shouted. The little boy was scared and started to cry. His dad tried to explain that the little boy had not stolen the penny, but the old woman didn't want to listen. She wanted her penny back and so the dad gave it to her. Then the old woman left, looking sad and angry. The little boy and his dad were very sad too. They never saw the old woman again and the little boy never saw his penny again.

Sara and Ben are twins. They like to play and have fun. One day, they visit their grandma and grandpa. Grandma and grandpa live in a big house with a lot of things. They have a luxury sofa, a luxury bed, and a luxury car. Sara and Ben think the luxury things are very nice, but they also like to be silly. They jump on the luxury sofa and make funny noises. They pretend the luxury bed is a boat and they sail to an island. They sneak into the luxury car and honk the horn. Grandma and grandpa laugh and shake their heads. They love Sara and Ben very much, even when they are silly. But then, Sara and Ben see something else. It is a luxury cake. It is big and round and has cream and cherries on top. It looks very yummy. Sara and Ben want to taste it. They climb on a chair and reach for the cake. But they are too silly. They slip and fall and the cake falls too. It lands on their heads and makes a big mess. Grandma and grandpa hear the noise and come to see. They see Sara and Ben and the cake. They are shocked and angry. They scold Sara and Ben for being naughty and wasting the luxury cake. Sara and Ben feel sorry and sad. They say they are sorry and they hug grandma and grandpa. Grandma and grandpa are still mad, but they also love Sara and Ben very much. They forgive them and give them a kiss. They say they can have some cookies instead of the luxury cake. Sara and Ben say thank you and smile. They are happy again. They learn to be careful and not too silly with the luxury things. They still have fun and enjoy their visit.

Lily and her daddy were playing in the park. They liked to swing, slide and run. Lily saw a big hill with many rocks. She wanted to climb it. "Can we go there, daddy?" she asked. "Sure, sweetie. But be careful. The rocks are sharp and hard," daddy said. They walked to the hill and started to climb. Lily found a small rock that was shiny and smooth. She picked it up and showed it to daddy. "Look, daddy! A pretty rock!" she said. "That's very nice, Lily. You can keep it if you want," daddy said. Lily smiled and put the rock in her pocket. She saw a bigger rock that was round and brown. She tried to lift it, but it was too heavy. "Daddy, help me! I want this rock too!" she said. Daddy came over and looked at the rock. He saw that it was stuck in the ground. "That's not a rock, Lily. That's a root. It belongs to the tree. We can't remove it," he said. "Why not, daddy?" Lily asked. "Because the tree needs it. The root helps the tree get water and food from the ground. If we remove it, the tree will be sad and sick," daddy said. "Oh, I don't want that. I like the tree. It gives us shade and leaves," Lily said. "Me too, Lily. The tree is mighty and beautiful. We should respect it and leave it alone," daddy said. They hugged the tree and said thank you. Then they climbed down the hill and continued to play. Lily was happy with her small rock and her daddy. She learned something new and had fun.

Once upon a time there was a fat, green bell. Every day it would ring loudly in the garden. Everyone in the village heard it and smiled. One day, a red bird flew by and hopped onto the bell. He wanted to show the village a new color. He started to chirp loudly and flapped his wings. The bird's singing made the bell start ringing even louder than before. Everyone in the village loved it and cheered. The green bell was so happy that it kept ringing for days. Everyone heard it and it made them so happy. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy who loved to eat potatoes. One day, Timmy's mom brought home a big bag of potatoes from the store. Timmy was so happy and started to play with the potatoes. Timmy's friend, Billy, came over to play. Billy saw the potatoes and said, "Wow, those potatoes are big! Can I have one?" Timmy said, "Sure, but be polite and ask my mom first." Billy went to ask Timmy's mom for a potato. She said, "Of course, you can have one, but be careful not to drop it, they weigh a lot!" Billy took a potato and went back to play with Timmy. Later that day, Timmy and Billy were playing catch with the potato when suddenly, Billy dropped it. The potato fell on Billy's foot and hurt him badly. Billy had to go to the hospital and couldn't play with Timmy for a long time. From that day on, Timmy never played with potatoes again. He learned that they can be heavy and dangerous if not handled politely.

Once upon a time there was a little girl who was very persistent. Every day, she would take off her vest right after school and hang it up in the sun. She was determined to make her vest dry! One day, the little girl went outside and placed her vest in the sun. She watched it carefully, but it stayed wet. She was not giving up. She tried again the next day. This time, she stayed outside and watched her vest until it was dry. She was so happy. Suddenly, she felt the wind blowing on her face and she looked up. There was a rainbow in the sky!  The little girl felt so proud of herself. She had worked hard and her vest was now completely dry. She smiled and said, "I am so persistent!"

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max was very lively and loved to play fetch with his owner, Lily. Lily was the owner of a big garden, where Max loved to run around and play. One day, Lily noticed that Max kept digging in one corner of the garden. She wondered what he was looking for. She decided to keep an eye on him and see what he was up to. The next day, Lily found a little treasure buried in the spot where Max had been digging. It was a shiny bone! She realized that Max had been digging to hide his treasure. From that day on, Max would keep his treasures hidden in the garden, and Lily would always be on the lookout for his secret spots.

Once there was a small mouse named Daisy. Daisy was looking for a special kind of cheese called rare cheese. She looked everywhere, but she could not find any. Then Daisy saw a small clearing in the woods. She hurried to the clearing and saw beautiful, colourful flowers blooming everywhere. Daisy had never seen anything so beautiful! At last, Daisy noticed something shiny on one of the flowers. She rushed to the flower and found a piece of rare cheese! Daisy was so excited that she almost forgot to thank the flower. The flower spoke to Daisy and said, “You must never take cheese from these flowers without my permission. I don’t usually let visitors take my rare cheese.” Daisy apologised to the flower and offered to do something in exchange for the cheese. The flower said, “I am happy to help you, but what can you do to help me?” Daisy felt a little embarrassed. She did not know how to help the flower. Finally, Daisy said, “I will help you bloom by providing you with water and sunshine.” The flower was impressed and said, “Yes, I accept your offer.” Daisy thanked the flower and excitedly made her way home with the rare cheese.

Once upon a time there were two babies. One was called Tommy and the other was called Lilly. Tommy was outside playing in the garden with some toys when suddenly he noticed a crib in the middle of the garden. It was a white crib and it was shining in the sun. Tommy was so excited and wanted to play in the crib. He asked Lilly to come and play with him but she just laughed and said no. So Tommy decided to play alone in the crib. But after a few minutes he started to feel a little lonely and he wanted to have someone to share the fun with him. He then noticed Lilly watching him from the nearby window. She must have been wanting to play with him but she was too shy to come out. Tommy realized that it was much more fun to share your toys and play together with another person, even if he or she is shy. He called out to Lilly to come and join him and quickly they were both laughing and playing in the crib, having a very nice time together. The moral of the story is that it's much more fun to share and play together than alone!

Once upon a time, there was a small girl who was very lonely. She didn't have anyone to play with, so she had to play with imaginary friends. Every night she would sit and talk to them. One night, when the girl was feeling very lonely, she saw a strange glowing light. She stepped closer and noticed it was coming from a small box. Inside the box was a single memory. It was a memory of the little girl with a special friend from long ago. The girl thanked the memory and said goodbye. As she said goodbye, the light faded away. But, the girl still felt happy. She knew that the memory had given her comfort and company, even if only for a moment. The girl was no longer lonely because she had something to smile about. She would always remember her special friend and the wonderful moment she had shared. From then on, she would never feel lonely again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She was out for a walk with her mom. As they walked, Sue noticed something funny in the field: a cow. Sue thought it was very funny. She asked her mom, "Mom, why is that cow so funny?" Her mom smiled and said, "Let's go find out!" And so they went to the field. When they got there, Sue noticed that the cow was wearing a hat! She couldn't believe it, and she laughed and laughed. The cow noticed Sue and said, "Hello there Sue! I think you look funny too. Would you like to help me find my way home?" Sue nodded her head yes and they began to walk down the path. They laughed and talked the whole time. When they reached the cow's barn, the cow thanked Sue for helping it find its way home. Before the cow left, it noticed something funny about Sue: she was wearing the same hat as it! the cow laughed and said, "Well isn't that funny!" Sue smiled and said, "Yes, it is funny!" Her mom smiled too and said, "Sue, I think you can have this hat!" From that day forward, Sue and the cow were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a bear and a fox. They lived near each other in the woods. Every day, they would play together and have lots of fun. But one day, they started to quarrel. They could not agree on something and started to yell.  The bear said he wanted the gold. The fox said he wanted it too. Neither of them would back down.  Then, a light appeared in the sky. It was small and bright and twinkling. It floated closer and closer until they could see that it was a beautiful butterfly. She had bright, gold wings that shone in the light.  The bear and fox stopped arguing. They stared at the butterfly, amazed. Then they quickly made up and agreed to share the gold.  From that day on, the bear and fox were the best of friends! They played together every day in the light of the beautiful butterfly.  THE

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Lila. She loved to play in the park near her house.  One day, Lila saw something in the grass. She ran over to it, wondering what it was. It was a pretty glove. She picked it up and looked at it. "It's so pretty!" she said to herself, and then she ran to find her mom.  "Mommy! Mommy, I found a pretty glove!" she said with excitement.  "That's great, Lila! Let's see if someone has lost it," said her mom.  They came up to a family picnicking in the park. Mom asked them if they had lost a glove.  The family said no, but the little boy said, "I want it! Can I have it?" Mommy looked at Lila and said, "It's up to you, Lila. Do you want to yield the glove to the little boy?" Lila smiled and said, "Yes, I'll yield it to him. I want him to have it and be happy."  The little boy was so happy to get such a pretty glove and gave her a big hug. Lila was very proud and happy to have made someone so happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys, especially his favorite truck. One day, he went to the park to play with his truck. He drove it all around and had so much fun. Suddenly, a big dog came running towards Timmy. Timmy got scared because he thought the dog was dangerous. The dog barked and Timmy started to cry. A lady came over and asked Timmy what was wrong. Timmy told her about the dog and how he was scared. The lady told Timmy not to worry and that the dog belonged to her. She put the dog on a leash and walked away. Timmy felt much better and went back to playing with his truck. He even shared some of his salted pretzels with the lady and the dog.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy and his mommy wanted to go to the zoo. They got a ticket and went inside. The animals were so lively and made Timmy very happy. He saw monkeys, lions, and even a big elephant.  Timmy's mommy told him to stay close to her so he wouldn't get lost. Timmy listened and held his mommy's hand tight. They walked around the zoo and saw many different animals. Timmy loved the zoo and wanted to stay there forever. But when it was time to go home, he was very tired and fell asleep in the car.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and run around with her friends. One day, Lily fell down and hurt her knee. She started to cry and her mommy came running over to comfort her. "Mommy, it hurts so much," Lily said. "I know, sweetie. Let's go inside and I'll give you a treat to make it feel better," her mommy replied. Lily's mommy brought her inside and gave her a cookie. Lily felt happy and her knee started to feel better. The next day, Lily was playing outside again and saw her friend, Tommy, fall down and hurt himself. Lily remembered how her mommy comforted her and gave her a treat, so she went over to Tommy and said, "It's okay, Tommy. Let's go get a treat and it will be easy to feel better." Tommy smiled and they went inside together to get a cookie. From that day on, Lily always knew how to comfort her friends when they got hurt.

Once upon a time, there was a man who had a wife. They lived in a big house with a garden. One day, the man went to work and forgot his lunch. His wife ran after him and gave him his lunch. The man said, "Thank you, I almost forgot. You are the best wife ever!" The wife smiled and said, "I remember when we got married, you promised to always remember me. It makes me uncomfortable when you forget things." The man felt bad and promised to always remember his wife. He learned that it's important to keep promises and show love to those we care about.

Once there was a girl called Mandy. She sat on the grass in the garden and waited impatiently. She was waiting for her Mum and Dad to come back, but they were late. Suddenly a Big Bird flew over and landed right in front of Mandy. It stomped around and said "Why are you sitting here all alone?" Mandy was a bit scared. She replied: "I'm waiting for my Mum and my Dad to come back".  The Big Bird laughed and said "Don't worry, I'll stay with you until they come". Mandy nodded and sat quietly waiting for her parents. When they finally arrived she was so excited. She ran to them and hugged them tightly. Mandy and her parents spent the rest of the afternoon in the garden, playing games and having fun. Thanks to the Big Bird, Mandy was never impatient again.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He loved to go to the beach with his mommy and daddy. One day, they saw a huge dolphin swimming in the ocean. Timmy was so happy to see the dolphin. He felt excited and amazed. The dolphin swam closer to the shore and Timmy could see it better. It had a shiny grey skin and a big smile on its face. Timmy wanted to touch the dolphin, but his mommy told him it was not safe. They watched the dolphin swim away and Timmy felt a little sad. But then, the dolphin jumped out of the water and did a flip in the air! Timmy laughed and clapped his hands. He felt happy again. From that day on, Timmy always looked for the huge dolphin whenever he went to the beach.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved animals. One day, she went to the zoo with her mommy and daddy. They saw many animals like lions, tigers, and monkeys. But Lily wanted to see a kangaroo, which she had never seen before. Finally, they found a kangaroo! Lily was so happy. She had never seen such a rare animal before. The kangaroo had a baby in her pouch. Lily was so excited to see the little baby kangaroo. Lily and her family had a great time at the zoo. They were happy to have seen a kangaroo and it was a day they would never forget.

One day, a boy named Tom went to the store with his mom. They needed to buy some food for dinner. Tom saw a can of cheap soup on the shelf. He asked his mom, "Can I take this soup home?" His mom said, "No, we have to make our own soup today." Tom was sad because he really wanted the cheap soup. He didn't want to make soup at home. Tom's mom saw that he was sad and said, "Don't worry, our soup will be much better than the cheap soup." When they got home, Tom helped his mom make the soup. He cut the vegetables and stirred the pot. The soup smelled very good. Tom was happy that he helped make the soup. They sat down to eat, and Tom said, "This is the best soup ever!" His mom smiled and said, "I told you our soup would be better than the cheap soup."

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Harry and Joey. One day, they decided to go to the park to play. Joey carried a bucket with him, and Harry had a powerful toy truck.  They played for a long time, racing the truck and making sandcastles with the bucket. But soon, they had an argument about who was going to play with the truck and the bucket. Joey wanted the truck and Harry wanted the bucket. They both wanted to be the one with the powerful toy, and neither would back down.  Then, Harry had an idea. He said that both of them could play with the truck and the bucket, by taking turns each time. Joey was a bit hesitant, but he finally decided to give it a try. They both smiled, and had a lot of fun taking turns with the truck and the bucket.

Once there was a little elephant named Ella. Every day Ella went for a walk and she liked to explore new places. One day when Ella was out exploring she came across an old trunk. She thought that it looked like fun so she decided to open the trunk. When she opened the trunk, she was surprised by what she saw inside. Inside the trunk was something unknown. Ella didn't know what it was and she was curious. She looked closer and realized it was a big yellow flower. Ella was so excited! She used her trunk to pick up the flower and held it gently. She thought it was so beautiful and wondered where it had come from. Ella put the flower carefully back in the trunk, and decided she would take it home with her. Until she figured out what it was, she would keep it safe and secret in the trunk. The flower was unknown, but Ella was sure that it was something special.

Once upon a time, there was a furry lion. The lion loved to spoil himself with treats. He would eat yummy snacks and take lots of naps. One day, the lion was feeling extra spoiled. He gave himself a bubble bath, put on his favorite green shirt, and ate lots of candy. He felt so happy. But just then, he heard a loud noise. The lion was frightened, and he ran away as quickly as he could.  Soon, the lion found a cozy cave where he could hide. He curled up and hid until the noise stopped. When it was quiet again, the lion came out of his hiding place. He was relieved that he was safe and still feeling spoiled.  The lion decided to go back home. He walked around looking for his treats and snacks, until he found them. He enjoyed his treats, and then curled up for a nap in his most comfy spot. The lion fell asleep, all sprawled out and totally spoiled! He slept peacefully until the next morning.

Once upon a time, there was a happy family. Mommy and Daddy loved their little boy very much. One day, Daddy had to leave the family to go on a long, far away trip. This made the little boy very sad. He felt so heavy inside.  Mommy saw how sad the little boy was and knew she had to do something to restore his joy.  "Come with me, sweetheart," said Mommy. They took a special trip to the grocery store. At the grocery store, there was a very large and colorful display of toys and candy.  Mommy said, "Let's pick out something to make you happy. This is a special treat just for you." The little boy smiled and was so happy. He left the store with a lollipop in hand and was full of joy. On their way home, the little boy said, "When Daddy comes back home, can we welcome him with this special treat too?"  Mommy beamed and hugged her little one. The moral of the story is that kindness is always worth the effort. Kindness can restore joy and a happy welcome is always the best way to show appreciation and love.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. Her name was Sarah. She was very busy. Everyday she went to the market. She loved to go to the market to shop. At the market, Sarah loved to mark fruits and vegetables. She would scan them and mark them for the store. She was very good at it and it made her happy. Every day at the market was busy. People were always asking her to do more work. But she kept on marking the fruits and vegetables. She was very good at it! But sometimes the market was too busy. At the end of the day she had to rush, because she had to get back before her mom did. She had to mark all the fruits and vegetables in just a few minutes.  But Sarah was a fast worker. She marked everything quickly and made it back in time. She was very proud of herself!

One day, a little girl went sailing all by herself. She was very excited as this was her first time. There was a slight worry in her because it was a little scary. But she managed to go out in the boat all alone. Suddenly, she saw a noisy seagull flying across the sky above her. She pointed to it and yelled out, "Look at that noisy bird!" Her mom was nearby, so she felt much better. The little girl sailed on and the ocean was peaceful. There were no more worries. She kept sailing for some time and looked at the blue sky that was so beautiful. Then, she stopped sailing and got back to her mom's side. The little girl had enjoyed her sailing very much. She felt proud that she had gone out all alone. There was no more worry and she felt happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little dove. The dove lived in a dry tree. The dry tree had no leaves. The dove was sad because the tree was not pretty. One day, the dove wanted to sleep. It was very tired. So the dove tried to sleep on the dry tree. But the dry tree was not comfortable. The dove could not sleep well. The dove was very sad. It wanted to find a new tree to sleep on. But the dove was too tired to fly. The dove fell down from the dry tree. The dove did not feel good. The end.

Lila and Tom are happy. They like to play with their toys and books. They have a big port in their room. It is a big box with a hole. They can go inside and pretend it is a ship or a house. One day, Lila has an idea. She finds a big cloth in the closet. She says to Tom, "Let's wrap the port with this cloth. It will be a secret port. No one can see us inside." Tom likes the idea. He helps Lila wrap the port with the cloth. They tuck the ends under the box. They make sure there is a gap for the hole. They crawl inside the port. It is dark and cozy. They giggle and whisper. They tell each other stories and jokes. They play with their toys and books. They have fun in their secret port. Mom comes to check on them. She sees the wrapped port in their room. She smiles. She knows they are inside. She says, "Lila, Tom, are you in there?" Lila and Tom hear Mom. They say, "Yes, Mom, we are in the port. It is our secret port. Do you want to come in?" Mom says, "Sure, I would love to come in. Can I fit in the hole?" Lila and Tom say, "Yes, Mom, you can fit in the hole. Come in, come in." Mom crawls in the hole. She joins Lila and Tom in the port. They hug and kiss. They are happy. They have a secret port.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Tom. He was very energetic and curious. One day while walking around in the woods he saw a rough club lying on the ground. He decided to take a closer look and examine it. Suddenly a giant man appeared in the distance. He was the owner of the club and he was very angry. He shouted: "That club is mine!" Tom was scared and started to cry. He didn't know what to do. But then he heard a gentle voice from behind. It was a wise old lady. She said: "Tom, don't be scared. You shouldn't take what doesn't belong to you. You should respect other people's belongings and treat them with care."  Tom learned something valuable that day. He understood that even though he was curious and wanted to find out more about the club, it was not his to take. Even if something looks interesting, it is not polite to touch it without the permission of the owner.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with her favorite ink pen. One day, she went to the park to draw some beautiful flowers and butterflies.  While she was drawing, she saw a wild bird flying around. She thought it was beautiful and wanted to draw it too. But when she looked for her pen, it was gone! Someone had stolen it!  Lily felt sad and didn't know what to do. But then she heard a noise and turned around to see the wild bird again. It had her pen in its beak! The bird dropped the pen at Lily's feet and flew away. Lily was so happy to have her pen back and she knew she had made a new wild friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a friendly dog named Max. They loved to play together in the park. One day, they saw lightning in the sky. Timmy was scared, but Max settled him down by licking his face. They went back home and cuddled up under a blanket. Timmy fell asleep, feeling safe and warm.

Joe liked to keep busy. He loved finding things and he searched all over the place. One day, he found a trap. Joe thought it was brilliant and he wanted it for himself. He pulled on the handle to open it but it wouldn't move. He kept pulling but still, it wouldn't open. He decided to ask for help. He went over to his dad and said, "Please can you help me open the trap?" His dad looked at the trap and said, "No, it's too dangerous, Joe. Put it back." Joe said, "But I want to keep it; it's brilliant!" His dad replied, "No, Joe. You have to put it back. It's not safe." Joe felt angry and pulled the trap harder but it still wouldn't open. He kept pulling until, suddenly, the trap snapped open, but there was something inside! Joe was so shocked that he screamed. His dad rushed over and saw a wild animal inside the trap. He pulled Joe away and said, "See what happens when you don't listen?" Joe sadly nodded his head and they put the animal back in its home in the woods.

Jimmy was a three-year-old boy who was playing with his toys. His mum was in the kitchen making dinner. Jimmy pointed his finger at his truck and said, "Go!" He then saw something moving out of the corner of his eye. He turned and saw a bird flying in the open sky. He was so excited and shouted out, "Look mummy, motion!"  Jimmy's mum smiled and said, "That's right, Jimmy. It's a bird". "Point! Point," shouted Jimmy as the bird flew closer. His mum smiled again and said, "It's ok, Jimmy. The bird won't hurt you". She then opened the window and waved her hand in the air to show Jimmy the motion.  Jimmy was amazed. He couldn't contain his enthusiasm, so he ran over to the window and shouted, "Hello bird!" The bird chirped and flew away. Jimmy turned to his mum and said, "Bye bye bird!". His mum smiled and said, "Goodbye bird." Jimmy was happy and said, "I love motion!"

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to play outside when it was sunny. One day, it was raining outside, and Timmy's mom said he couldn't go out to play. Timmy was sad. Timmy's mom took him to a big building where people go to sign papers. Timmy thought it was boring. He wanted to go home and play with his toys. But his mom said they had to stay. While they were waiting, Timmy saw a big puddle outside. He wanted to go jump in it and get his feet wet. Timmy's mom said no, but Timmy didn't listen. He ran outside and jumped in the puddle. His mom was angry. When they got home, Timmy's mom made him take a bath. Timmy was sad again. He didn't want to take a bath. But he had to. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a large onion. The onion was so big that it felt like it would never stop growing. One day, something special started to happen. The onion started to get smaller and smaller. The more it shrank, the more the onion smiled and laughed. Soon the onion was so small, it could fit into a tiny teacup. Everyone who saw it was amazed. The onion was so happy that it finally had a chance to join in with their tea parties. And so, the onion made many new friends and it was always the life of the party.

Tim and Jen like to play outside. They have a big yard with a slide and a swing. They also have a smooth ball that they can kick and throw. One day, they want to play with the ball, but it starts to rain. The rain is cold and wet. It makes the grass and the slide slippery. Tim and Jen do not like the rain. They want it to stop. They run inside the house and look for something else to do. They see a big box in the living room. It has a picture of a train on it. Tim and Jen love trains. They open the box and find many pieces of track and cars and a shiny engine. They want to build the train on the floor. But they have a problem. Tim wants to make the train go in a circle. Jen wants to make the train go in a zigzag. They do not agree. They start to argue and pull the pieces. The train falls apart. Tim and Jen are sad and angry. Mom hears the noise and comes to see what is wrong. She sees the broken train and the wet ball. She asks Tim and Jen why they are fighting. They tell her about the rain and the train. Mom hugs them and says she is sorry. She says they can both have fun with the train if they share and take turns. She also says the rain will stop soon and they can play with the ball again. Tim and Jen say they are sorry too. They hug Mom and each other. They decide to work together and build the train again. They make it go in a circle and a zigzag. They have fun and laugh. They look outside and see the sun. The rain is gone. They smile and run outside with the ball. They are happy.

Mick was walking to school one day when he spotted something on the ground. He stopped and picked it up - it was a diary! Mick wondered where it had come from, but he didn't have time to think about it as he had to get to school.  Mick decided to take the diary with him, as it had looked like it was important. When he arrived at school, he showed the diary to his teacher. "Where did you get this?" asked his teacher. Mick explained that he found the diary near the school.  "What a lucky pass!" said his teacher. "This diary looks very important. I want you to make sure you keep it very tight so no-one else can take a look at it." Mick smiled and nodded. He was excited as he had never owned a diary before. He couldn't wait to get home and start writing in it.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and run in the grass. One day, Lily saw her mom carrying a big, heavy basket of clothes.  Lily asked, "Mommy, what are you doing?" "I'm doing the laundry, sweetie," her mom replied. Lily wanted to help her mommy, so she asked, "Can I give you a hand?" Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, you can help me fold the clothes. But be careful, some of them are heavy." Lily was happy to help and started folding the clothes. She picked up a big, heavy towel and said, "This cloth is heavy, Mommy!" Her mom laughed and said, "Yes, it is. But you're doing a great job helping me."  Lily felt proud of herself for helping her mommy and they finished the laundry together.

Bob loved to play in the garden. He liked to explore and look for wild animals. One day, he saw a thread. It was bright and colorful. He wanted to pick it up and take it home with him. He reached out to take it, but it slipped away! Bob was very disappointed and searched for the thread everywhere. He couldn't find it! He was sad and looked for comfort in his mommy's arms.  Suddenly, a wild animal appeared! Bob was so excited and forgot about his lost thread. He smiled and tried to get a closer look at the animal. It was as if the wild creature was saying "follow me". Bob got up and followed it. The wild animal led Bob to a special place. When he looked down at the ground, he saw the same thread! He was so happy and couldn't believe it. He picked up the thread and put it in his pocket. He was so lucky to find it! From that day on, Bob would always look for the thread when he went out to play, just in case.

Tim and his dad love to fix things. They have a big van with many tools and parts. They help people who have broken cars or bikes or machines. One day, they get a call from Mrs. Lee. She says her oven is not working. She needs to bake a cake for her son's birthday. Tim and his dad say they will come right away. They drive to Mrs. Lee's house in their van. They see her oven in the kitchen. It is cold and dark. Tim's dad opens the oven and looks inside. He says there is a problem with the wire. He takes out his tools and starts to fix it. Tim wants to help too. He asks his dad what he can do. His dad says he can hold the flashlight and hand him the tools. Tim feels great. He likes to work with his dad. He holds the flashlight and gives his dad the tools he needs. Soon, the oven is fixed. It is warm and bright. Mrs. Lee is very happy. She thanks Tim and his dad. She says they are great. She gives them a piece of cake. It is yummy. Tim and his dad smile. They say goodbye and get back in their van. They drive away, looking for the next thing to fix.

One day, a little girl named Sally was playing in her garden. She looked around and saw a pan. Sally thought it was very interesting so she picked it up. When Sally held the pan, she felt it was very lively. She wanted to know what it could do so she ran to the kitchen.  Sally's mom saw her. She smiled and asked what she was going to do with the pan. Sally said she wanted to eat something in it. Her mom told her she could use the pan to make pancakes. So Sally followed her mom's instructions, helping her mix the ingredients. Then they put the pan on the stove. Soon, Sally and her mom were eating the delicious pancakes together. They were having a lot of fun. Sally was so happy to be able to use the lively pan to eat something special.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toy cars and trucks. One day, Timmy's dad took him to the park to ride his bike. Timmy's bike had gears that made it go faster. Timmy's dad asked him if he wanted to ride on the bike path. Timmy said yes and they rode on the clear path. Timmy loved the feeling of the wind in his hair as they rode faster and faster.  After a while, Timmy's legs got tired and they stopped to take a break. Timmy's dad asked him if he wanted a snack and Timmy said yes. They sat on a bench and ate some crackers together. Timmy was happy to spend time with his dad and ride his bike with gears on the clear path.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Mia. She liked to play outside in her big yard. One day, Mia found a small bush near her house. She was very glad to see it. Mia thought the bush was pretty. Mia wanted to show her mom the bush. But, she forgot where it was. She looked and looked, but could not find it. Mia was sad. She called out, "Mom, I can't find the bush!" Her mom came outside and said, "Don't worry, Mia. Let's look for it together." They looked all around the yard. At last, they found the bush. Mia was glad again. She said, "Thank you, Mom!" From that day on, Mia and her mom took care of the bush. They watered it and watched it grow. And Mia never forgot where the bush was again. They were both very happy.

Tom and Lily are twins. They like to play outside. One day, they go to the lake with Mom and Dad. The lake is big and blue. There are ducks and fish in the lake. Tom and Lily see a boat. The boat is orange. It has a sail and a flag. Tom and Lily want to go on the boat. They ask Mom and Dad. "Can we go on the boat, please?" they say. Mom and Dad say, "No, you can't. The boat is not ours. It belongs to someone else. You have to ask before you touch things that are not yours. That is polite and kind." Tom and Lily are sad. They want to have fun on the boat. They think Mom and Dad are not fair. They wait until Mom and Dad are not looking. Then they run to the boat. They climb on the boat. They pretend to be pirates. "Arrr, we are the captains of the boat!" they say. "We can go wherever we want!" They pull the sail and the flag. They make loud noises. They do not see the man who owns the boat. The man is angry. He comes to the boat. He shouts at Tom and Lily. "Hey, what are you doing on my boat?" he says. "You have no right to be here. You are breaking my sail and my flag. You are making a mess. Get off my boat right now!" Tom and Lily are scared. They jump off the boat. They run to Mom and Dad. They are sorry for what they did. They say sorry to the man. They say sorry to Mom and Dad. Mom and Dad are not happy. They hug Tom and Lily. They say, "We love you, but you did a bad thing. You have to respect other people's things. You have to listen to us. We are here to keep you safe and teach you good manners. Next time, do not go on the boat without asking. Do you understand?" Tom and Lily nod. They understand. They learn their lesson. They say, "We understand. We will not do it again. We are sorry. We love you." The end.

Once upon a time there was a nosy figure. He enjoyed looking around and being nosy. He often left his home to explore what was beyond. One day he decided to leave on a new adventure. He packed his bag and left home with a big smile on his face. He walked for a long time until he came across a strange house. He was curious and nosy so he peeked through the window. Inside he saw a big table and he was excited to explore! He opened the door slowly and went inside. He was welcomed by a friendly voice from the kitchen. It was the voice of a woman who was baking something delicious. The nosy figure asked the woman what she was baking. She said she was making a special cake for her daughter’s birthday. The figure was so happy that he thanked the woman for the invitation to join the celebration. He stayed for a while, played with the other children and laughed. When it was time to go home, he thanked the woman again and left with a big smile on his face. He had had a wonderful time!

One day, a little girl was playing in a gloomy pine forest. She saw a bird facing lots of pine needles scattered across the ground. She wanted to help the bird, so she started to organize the needles. She hummed a song and picked up one needle at a time. The bird watched as the girl worked hard to sort the pine needles into piles. Soon, she had organized the whole forest. The bird chirped with joy and fluttered around the girl. She laughed and smiled at the bird's enthusiasm. The cheerful scene attracted other animals in the forest. Soon, rabbits and foxes were playing in the orderly piles the the girl had made with the pine needles. Everyone was happy and content in the pine forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a toy car that he loved to play with every day. One day, Timmy's friend, Johnny, came over to play. Johnny wanted to play with Timmy's toy car, but Timmy didn't want to share.  Timmy and Johnny started to argue about the toy car. Timmy didn't want to give it to Johnny, but Johnny really wanted to play with it. Suddenly, Timmy started to yawn because he was tired.  Timmy had an idea. He said, "Let's take turns playing with the car. You can play with it for one year, and then I can play with it for one year." Johnny thought this was a good idea, and they both agreed.  Their plan was successful, and they both had fun playing with the toy car. They learned that sharing is important and it's better to work together instead of fighting. From that day on, Timmy and Johnny were the best of friends. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Abbie. She was three years old. Abbie was very curious. Everywhere she went, she wanted to learn more and try new things. But there was one thing Abbie hated — weight. All the other kids were playing and having fun, while Abbie had to stand still and hold the weight in her hands. But one day, Abbie's mom told her a secret. She said that when Abbie started to do her exercises, the weight would feel lighter. Abbie started to do what her mom said and soon enough, she found that the weight was much easier to carry. Abbie was so happy! She carried the weight around the house and even did her exercises with a smile on her face. From then on, Abbie didn't hate the weight anymore — she was in control of it.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim had a task to clean his smelly room. He did not want to clean it. Instead, he wanted to nap. His mom said, "Tim, you need to clean your room before you nap." Tim did not listen. He lay down and took a nap. When he woke up, his room was still smelly. His mom came in and said, "Tim, if you clean your room, it will not be smelly anymore." Tim listened to his mom. He cleaned his room and it was not smelly anymore. Tim learned that if he does his tasks, things will be better. And then, he took a nice nap in his clean room.

Once upon a time there was an olive who wanted to explore the world. He wanted to see what was out there. So one day, he decided to part from his family's olive tree. "Olive, where are you going?" asked Mama Olive. "I'm going to explore the world!" he replied excitedly. Mama Olive was a bit worried. "Be sure to stay safe," she said. "Don't worry, Mama, I'll be ok!" Olive said. So Olive ventured out and was amazed at all he saw. He explored mountains, valleys, and fields. He met many new, friendly creatures along the way. But after all this adventuring, he eventually figured it was time to go back home. When Olive returned, Mama Olive hugged him tight. "Oh, Olive, I'm so glad you are safe." She smiled and hugged him again.  The two were happy to be reunited and Olive learned so much on his journey. He knew that being safe was the best way to explore and that Mama Olive would always be there for him.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Mike and Dan. They went outside to play in a wet field. The grass was wet and the sky was gray. The two friends started to run and shout. Then, further away, they saw something. It was a row of boats in the pond. They wanted to take a ride, but there was a delay. The sky had started to pour and the boats were getting wet. Mike and Dan saw that they had to wait. They watched the rain and talked while they waited.  After a while, the rain stopped and the sky was clear again. They quickly grabbed a couple of boats and rowed away. They went so fast that the water splashed on their faces. They spent the rest of the day in the boat, going up and down the long row. They waved to the other boats, sang songs and laughed along the way. At the end of the day, they thanked each other before walking back home. They had had a great time and were sure to come back and play again!

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to smile and play with her friends. One day, Lily saw a pretty dress in a shop. The dress was cheap, so her mom bought it for her. Lily was so happy with her new dress. She wore it to the park to show her friends. They all smiled when they saw her pretty dress. They played and laughed together all day. But then, it started to rain. Lily's cheap dress got wet and the colors ran. The dress was ruined. Lily was sad and didn't smile anymore. Her friends tried to cheer her up, but the dress was gone. The day had a bad ending.

One day, a little girl named Lily was playing with her toys. She had a big, red ball and a brilliant, shiny car. She loved to play with them both. But then, she saw something strange. A little cat was staring at her from her window. The cat looked sad and scared. Lily wanted to help the cat. She opened the window and let the cat come in. The cat was very happy and started to purr. But then, Lily's mom came into the room. She saw the cat and said, "Oh no, this is an emergency! The cat should not be in the house." Lily's mom took the cat outside and talked to Lily. She told her that some cats can make people sick, and it was not safe for the cat to be inside. Lily was sad, but she understood. She went outside to play with the cat and her toys. They had a lot of fun, and Lily learned how to be careful with animals.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Lila. She had big brown eyes and a thin face. One day, Lila went to the park with her mom. While they were there, they saw a puppy playing with its friends. Lila was so excited to pet the fluffy puppy. But then, Lila noticed that the puppy had a thin face. She could tell it was feeling sad.  So, Lila decided to tell the puppy that it was very beautiful. She smiled and said, “You are so lovely!” The puppy's face suddenly lit up. It started jumping around and wagging its tail. Lila and her mom watched as the puppy and its friends had lots of fun. They were so happy that Lila was able to make the puppy smile.  And from that day onwards, Lila learned that it's always important to be kind and tell others how special they are.

A boy stood by the window and gazed across the field. There was one special thing out there that he had never seen before. He saw an elephant. The boy had never seen anything so big before. He rubbed his eyes and looked again, but it was still there! The boy was so excited he couldn't stand still. He ran out of the house, into the field and stopped in front of the elephant. The elephant had a very flexible trunk. He could move it from side to side. The boy stretched out his arm and touched the trunk. The elephant was gentle and friendly. The boy spent the whole day with the elephant. They played hide and seek, and the elephant taught the boy how to be flexible. The boy had a lot of fun with his new friend. When nightfall came, the boy said goodbye to the elephant. He waved and watched it until it was out of sight.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and read her books, but her room was very boring. She wanted to make it more fun, but she didn't know how.  One day, Lily's friend came over to play. Her friend had a beautiful rug that Lily loved. She asked her friend if she could borrow the rug for a little while to put in her room. Her friend said yes, and Lily was so happy!  Lily put the rug in her room and it made it look so much better. She played on the rug and read her books on it. When her friend came back to get the rug, Lily was sad to see it go. But she was grateful that she got to borrow it and make her room more fun. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a green frog. He hopped around a big pond and liked to dance for fun. One day, the sun was very hot and the frog was so hot that he needed to cool off. So, he danced in the pond to cool down. He kept hopping from side to side and up and down and he felt the cool water against his body. The heat from the sun went away and soon he was feeling cold. He was so happy that he hopped out of the water and kept on dancing. He had so much fun dancing in the sun and he smiled with joy. He kept on dancing until his body was tired and he hopped back into the pond to go to sleep. The end.

One day, Billy and Sally went to the park to play. They brought a cooler with snacks and drinks. Billy was thirsty and asked Sally for a drink. Sally said no and Billy got upset.  Billy wanted to play a game but Sally didn't want to. She said, "I want to draw pictures and be creative." Billy didn't like that idea and said, "No, I want to play!"  Sally had an idea. She said, "Let's play a game where we mark the trees with our drawings!" Billy thought that was a good idea and they started to draw on the trees. They had so much fun and forgot about their argument. In the end, they shared the snacks and drinks from the cooler and went home happy.

Bob wanted to race. He invited his friends to take part in an impressive race. Everyone agreed and ran to the starting line. Bob pressed the button and the race began. All the racers were so fast but Bob was the fastest. He passed the others and reached the finish line first. The crowd was very excited. They shouted and clapped for Bob. The organizers printed out a certificate for Bob. He was very proud to receive it. Bob was the winner of the race. He was so happy that he wanted to race again and again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play outside. One day, she saw a yellow raven perched on a tree branch. "Wow, a yellow bird!" she said to herself. Lily tried to get closer to the raven, but it flew away. "Come back, birdie!" she shouted. Suddenly, she saw a big stick on the ground. She picked it up and waved it around. "Maybe I can remove the bird from the tree with this stick," she said. Just then, her mom came outside and asked, "What are you doing, Lily?" Lily explained about the yellow raven and her plan to remove it from the tree. Her mom laughed and said, "Oh, Lily, ravens don't like to be bothered. Let's just watch it from a distance and enjoy its beauty." So they sat together and watched the yellow raven fly away into the sky.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a little bunny named Ben. Ben loved to eat fruits, and his favorite fruit was the red apple. He thought apples had the best taste in the whole world. One day, Ben saw an impressive tree with big, red apples. Ben wanted to remove the apples from the tree, but he was too small. He jumped and jumped, but he could not reach them. He was very sad. Then, a tall giraffe named Gina saw Ben and asked, "Why are you sad?" Ben told Gina about the apples and how he could not remove them. Gina wanted to help. She used her long neck to reach the apples. She removed them and gave them to Ben. Ben was so happy! He shared the apples with Gina, and they became the best of friends. From that day on, they always helped each other and shared their favorite fruits.

Once upon a time there was a cow. Her name was Daisy. Daisy always wanted to be the cleanest cow on the farm, and she was the most persistent cow in trying to achieve her wish. One day, Daisy asked Farmer John if she could clean her horns. Farmer John said, “Of course, Daisy. You can clean your horns anytime.” So Daisy got to work. She licked and rubbed and polished until her horns were shiny and clean. Then she hopped and twirled around the grass, showing off her pretty horns. Meanwhile, Daisy’s friend, the big brown bull, was watching her work. When Daisy had finished, the bull said, “Daisy, you are so strong and determined. Your horns look so nice!” Daisy thanked the bull for his kind words and said, “Yes, I am very proud of my clean horns.” From then on, Daisy always kept her horns clean with her persistent effort.

Tom and Mia like to play pretend. They have a big box that they use as a van. They take turns to be the driver and the passenger. They make noises like a van and go to different places. One day, they pretend to go to the zoo. Tom is the driver and Mia is the passenger. Tom says, "Look, there is a lion. It is big and yellow. It roars like this: Rrrrr!" Mia says, "Wow, the lion is scary. I want to see the monkeys. They are funny and brown. They jump like this: Eee-ee-ee!" Tom says, "OK, we will go to the monkeys next. But first, we have to pay for the ticket. The ticket man is here. He is green and has a hat. He says, 'Hello, welcome to the zoo. How many tickets do you want?'" Mia says, "We want two tickets, please. How much are they?" Tom says, "They are five coins each. Here, I have ten coins. I will give them to you." He pretends to give the ticket man some coins. The ticket man says, "Thank you. Here are your tickets. Have a nice day. Bye-bye." Tom says, "Bye-bye. Thank you. Come on, Mia. Let's go to the monkeys." But Mia does not want to go. She says, "No, I want to be the driver now. You were the driver for too long. It is my turn." Tom says, "No, I am still the driver. You can be the driver later. We have to go to the monkeys now." Mia gets angry. She says, "No, no, no. I want to be the driver now. Give me the wheel. Give it to me." She tries to grab the wheel from Tom. Tom gets angry too. He says, "No, no, no. I am the driver. You are the passenger. Let go of the wheel. Let go of it." He tries to push Mia away. They start to fight. They pull and push and shout. The box van shakes and falls over. They both fall out of the box. They both cry. They both have boo-boos. Mom hears the noise. She comes to see what is wrong. She sees Tom and Mia on the floor. She sees the box van broken. She says, "Oh, no. What happened? Why are you fighting? Why are you crying?" Tom and Mia tell Mom what happened. They both say, "It is not fair. I want to be the driver. He/she does not let me." Mom says, "I see. You both want to be the driver. But you cannot be the driver at the same time. You have to share and take turns. That is how you play nicely. Do you understand?" Tom and Mia nod. They say, "Yes, Mom. We understand. We are sorry. We will share and take turns." Mom says, "That is good. I am glad you are sorry. Now, give each other a hug and say sorry." Tom and Mia hug and say sorry. They feel better. Mom says, "Now, do you want to fix the box van and play pretend again?" Tom and Mia say, "Yes, Mom. We want to play pretend again. We want to go to the zoo. We want to see the animals." Mom says, "OK, then. Let me help you fix the box van. Then you can go to the zoo. But remember, share and take turns. And have fun." Tom and Mia say, "OK, Mom. Thank you. We love you." Mom says, "I love you too. Now, let's go to the zoo."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the forest. One day, she saw a deer. The deer was very clear and beautiful. Lily wanted to poke it, but her mom said no.  Lily was sad, but she listened to her mom. She went to play with her toys instead. But then, she heard a loud noise. It was a hunter! The hunter wanted to poke the deer too, but he had a gun.  Lily was scared and ran to her mom. She told her what she saw. Her mom called the police, but it was too late. The hunter shot the deer. Lily was very sad. She wished she could have poked the deer before it was too late.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and run around. One day, she tripped and hurt her knee. It hurt a lot and she cried. Her mom came to help and said, "Don't worry, it's just a little scrape. It's harmless." Lily tried to stand up, but it hurt too much. Her mom said, "Let's try to clean it up and put a band-aid on it." Lily learned that sometimes we might fall and get hurt, but it's important to try and get back up. And sometimes, things might seem scary or dangerous, but they're actually harmless. Her knee felt better soon enough and she was able to go back to playing outside.

Once upon a time, there was an old man. He had an old chess set. One day, the old man saw something shiny in the corner of the room. When he went over to take a closer look, he realized that it was a little sparrow. The old man said, "Hello, little one. What are you doing here?" The sparrow said, "I was playing with your old chess pieces. I tore one of the pieces in two!" The old man was surprised. He told the sparrow not to worry, and carefully picked up the two pieces of the chess piece. He looked at the pieces, and smiled. The old man said, "At least you were having fun! We can put it back together. Here, watch me carefully." The old man carefully put the two pieces together, and then the piece shone just like new. The old man said to the sparrow, "See, we fixed it! Now, let's play a game of chess together." The old man and the sparrow played a game of chess, and the old man won every time. When it was time to go, the old man said goodbye to the sparrow and thanked him for the game. The sparrow said, "Thanks for fixing my mistake!" and flew away.

Max had a regular vacation. He wanted to make it special so he came up with a plan. He wanted to complete a big puzzle. Max's mom and dad thought it was a great idea and bought him the puzzle. Max got to work. He was so excited because he had never completed a big puzzle before. He worked hard and with lots of patience. Max's mom and dad helped him too. At the end of the vacation, Max had completed the big puzzle. He was so proud of himself! His mom and dad were so proud of him too. It was a great way to end the regular vacation.

Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Benny. Benny lived in a big forest with his friends. One day, Benny went for a walk and found a big log. He wanted to play with it, so he shook it and it made a loud noise.  Benny was so happy that he found the log. He decided to take it to his friends and show them. When he got to his friends, they were all amazed by the big log. Benny felt very proud but he was still modest.  Benny and his friends played with the log all day long. They jumped over it, rolled it around and even used it as a table for their snacks. Benny was very happy that he found the log and that he could share it with his friends.

Ben and Lily were playing in the park with their friends. They liked to run, jump and slide on the grass and the swings. They were having a lot of fun. But then, a big dog came into the park. It was black and brown and had a loud bark. It ran towards the children and chased them. The children were scared and ran away. They tried to find a safe place to hide. "Help! Help!" they shouted. "Go away, dog!" Ben saw a group of grown-ups sitting on a bench. He thought they could help them. He ran to them and called, "Please, help us! There is a big dog and it is scary!" But the grown-ups did not help. They laughed at Ben and said, "That is not a big dog. That is a puppy. It just wants to play. You are silly and scared of nothing." Ben felt embarrassed. He did not like that the grown-ups laughed at him. He felt sad and angry. He wished they were nice and kind. Lily saw that Ben was upset. She ran to him and gave him a hug. She said, "Don't worry, Ben. You are not silly. You are brave and smart. The grown-ups are mean and rude. We don't need them. We have each other and our friends." Ben smiled and hugged Lily back. He said, "Thank you, Lily. You are right. You are my best friend. And the puppy is not so scary. Maybe we can play with it later." They went back to their friends and continued to play. They forgot about the grown-ups and the puppy. They were happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a farmer who lived on a farm. He had many animals like cows, pigs, and chickens. One day, the farmer saw a wild fox trying to eat his chickens. He wanted to send the fox away, so he took a stick and chased after it.  The fox was very fast and ran far away from the farm. The farmer was happy that he had sent the fox away. But the fox was very clever and came back in the night when the farmer was sleeping. The fox ate all of the chickens and ran away again.  The farmer woke up in the morning and saw that all of his chickens were gone. He was very sad and angry. He realized that sending the fox away was not enough. He needed to find a better way to protect his animals. The farmer learned a lesson that day and never forgot it.

One sunny day, a little girl named Lily felt excited. She wanted to taste something new. She asked her mom, "Can we make a yummy treat?" Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, let's make a fruit salad!" They went to the porch and found a big bowl. They put in red apples, yellow bananas, and green grapes. Lily and her mom mixed it all up. Lily took a big bite of the fruit salad. "Mmm, it tastes so good!" she said. Her mom was happy to see Lily enjoying the fruit salad. They sat on the porch, ate their yummy treat, and laughed together.

Once upon a time, there was a rabbit. The rabbit was very popular because he was very cute. Everyone loved the rabbit and wanted to be his friend. One day, the rabbit's friend wanted to send him a letter. The friend wrote a letter and put it in an envelope. Then, the friend sent the letter to the rabbit's house. The rabbit was very happy when he got the letter. He hopped around and showed it to all his friends. From that day on, the rabbit's friend sent him letters all the time. The rabbit was very happy and felt even more popular. The end.

Once there was a girl named Ellie who loved kicking. Whenever she went outside, she would kick everything in sight, from balls to trees. One day though, she saw something orange on the ground that she hadn't noticed before. She bent down to look closer and saw it was a little package of chocolate! She became excited, so she decided to kick the package. As she did, the wrapper split open and out came the chocolate bar! She couldn't believe it. She was so happy and began eating it right away. Ellie enjoyed the chocolate so much that she kept kicking the ground around her. When she was done, she had even more orange packages of chocolate surrounding her. As she kicked some of them open, she began to share the chocolate with her friends. They all had a great time.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the garden with her friends. One day, while playing, they saw a hedge that was torn.  Lily's friend asked, "Who tore the hedge?"  Lily saw a deaf squirrel nearby and said, "Maybe the deaf squirrel did it by accident."  Her friend replied, "But it's still not good to tear things."  Lily realized her mistake and said, "You're right. We should always be careful and not tear things."  From that day on, Lily and her friends always made sure to be careful and not tear anything. They learned that it's important to take care of the things around us.

Once there was a rat who was very playful. His favorite game was to run and hide in the garden. One day, as he was playing, a dog came by. The rat was so scared that he quickly ran away and hid deep inside a bush. The dog ran after him, but he was too quick for the dog, so it stopped. When the rat came out from the bush he saw another animal. It was a cat! The rat was so scared he quickly ran away. The cat chased him, but the rat was so fast that he managed to get away again. The cat eventually stopped running. The rat was very happy to have gotten away, but he couldn't believe that he had been chased away twice in one day. He decided to go back to his hole and take a little nap. When he awoke he felt much better, and soon he was running and playing again in the garden.

Lily and Max were playing with clay in the garden. They liked to make different shapes and feel the texture of the clay. It was soft and squishy in their hands. "Look, I made a cat!" Lily said, showing Max her clay animal. "That's not a cat, that's a blob!" Max said, laughing. He made a snake and wrapped it around Lily's cat. "Hey, stop that! You ruined my cat!" Lily said, angry. She grabbed Max's snake and threw it on the ground. They started to fight over the clay, pulling and pushing each other. They did not see that their dog, Spot, was watching them. Spot was a nosy dog. He liked to sniff and lick everything. Spot saw the clay and thought it was food. He ran over to the clay and started to eat it. He ate Lily's cat, Max's snake, and some more clay. He did not like the taste, but he was hungry. Lily and Max stopped fighting when they heard Spot's loud barks. They turned around and saw him with clay all over his mouth. "Spot, no!" they shouted. They ran to him and tried to get the clay out of his mouth. But it was too late. Spot had swallowed too much clay. He felt sick and started to vomit. Lily and Max felt sorry for Spot. They hugged him and said they were sorry. They decided to stop playing with clay and find something else to do. They took Spot inside and gave him some water. They hoped he would feel better soon. They learned their lesson. Clay was not food, and fighting was not fun.

Tom and Sue are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a big fire in a house. They are scared. "Look, fire!" Tom says. "We have to run!" "No, wait!" Sue says. "My doll is in there! I forget her!" Sue runs to the house. Tom follows her. He does not want her to get hurt. They see a door. It is not on fire. They go inside. "Where is your doll?" Tom asks. Sue looks around. She sees a lot of things. But she does not see her doll. She is sad. "I don't know," she says. "Maybe she is in the bedroom." They go to the bedroom. They see a bed. They see a closet. They see a window. But they do not see the doll. "Maybe she is under the bed," Tom says. He bends down. He looks under the bed. He sees something. It is not the doll. It is a cat. "Meow!" the cat says. Tom is surprised. He likes cats. He picks up the cat. He shows it to Sue. "Look, a cat!" he says. "Maybe he knows where your doll is." Sue looks at the cat. She likes cats too. She smiles. "Maybe he does," she says. "Hello, cat. Do you know where my doll is?" The cat looks at Sue. He looks at Tom. He looks at the fire. He is scared too. He shakes his head. "No, I don't," he says. "But I know where the exit is. Follow me!" The cat jumps out of the window. Tom and Sue follow him. They see a ladder. They see a fireman. He helps them down. "Are you okay?" he asks. "Yes, we are," Tom says. "But we forget Sue's doll." "I'm sorry," the fireman says. "Maybe we can find her later. But you are very brave. And very modest. You saved the cat." Tom and Sue look at the cat. The cat looks at them. He purrs. "Thank you," he says. "You are my friends. And you can have my toy mouse. It is in the garden." Tom and Sue are happy. They hug the cat. They hug the fireman. They go to the garden. They find the toy mouse. They play with it. They forget the fire. They forget the doll. They have fun.

Lily wanted to play with her new doll. It had a pink dress with a zip on the back. She liked to zip and unzip the dress. It was her original doll, not like the others. But her brother Max wanted to play with it too. He said it was his turn. He tried to grab the doll from Lily's hands. Lily said no. She did not want to share. "Mom, Lily won't allow me to play with the doll!" Max shouted. He was angry and sad. Mom came to see what was wrong. She saw Lily and Max fighting over the doll. She said, "Stop, both of you. Why are you fighting?" "Because Lily won't allow me to play with the doll!" Max repeated. "But it's Lily's original doll. She got it for her birthday. She can decide who plays with it." Mom said. "But I want to play with it too! It has a zip!" Max said. Mom thought for a moment. She said, "How about this? Lily, you can play with the doll for ten minutes. Then you have to allow Max to play with it for ten minutes. And then you can take turns. Is that fair?" Lily nodded. She said, "Okay. But only if Max is careful with the zip. It might break." Max nodded too. He said, "Okay. I will be careful. Thank you, Lily." Mom smiled. She said, "Good. Now you can play nicely together. And remember to say please and thank you." Lily and Max agreed. They stopped fighting and started playing. They both liked the doll with the zip. It was original and fun.

Timmy was walking in the park one day. He saw a shiny gold piece next to the bench. He smiled and picked it up. It looked so easy to carry! He was happy to have found it.  Timmy walked around the park showing off his shiny gold piece to everyone he saw. But as he walked and showed it off, the shiny gold piece started to disappear. He became very sad, and he frowned.  Suddenly, a nice old man standing next to him saw his frown and asked him why he was sad. Timmy told him about the shiny gold piece and how it had started to disappear.  The man smiled and said, "That is an easy thing to fix." He then showed Timmy a special trick he had. He took out his handkerchief and rubbed the gold piece back and forth until it glittered again.  Timmy was so happy, he was grinning from one ear to the other! He thanked the man for being so kind, and ran off to show off his shiny gold piece to all of his friends.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Lily went to the park. She wore a pretty dress and a pink belt around her waist. She saw a boy playing with a ball and went to talk to him.  "Hi, my name is Lily. What's your name?" she asked the boy. "My name is Max. Do you want to play with me?" Max replied. Lily nodded and they started playing together. They had so much fun that they both laughed and ran around lively. After a while, Lily's mom called her to go home.  "I had so much fun playing with you, Max. Let's play again tomorrow!" Lily said. "Sure, I'll see you tomorrow!" Max replied. Lily went home happy and told her mom all about her new friend Max.

Once upon a time, there was a jeep. The jeep lived in the woods and was rarely seen by the people who lived near by. One day, the jeep went off and the people who lived near by heard a loud sound from far away. The people asked each other, "what was that loud sound?" and nobody could answer. As days passed, the loud sound kept growing louder.  The sound grew louder and louder, until one day, a little boy said, "It sounds like something is roaring!" Each time the jeep ventured out, the roar grew louder and harsher. Everyone was scared and confused and did not know what the loud roaring was coming from.  One day, the jeep ventured out, but this time there was something different. This time, the roar was even more harsh and powerful - it sounded like it was coming from a huge animal! The little boy said, "It's a lion!" and everyone was so scared. Suddenly, the jeep came back and everyone saw it had a huge lion in it.  Everyone was so amazed, but they understood that the roaring they had heard before was the lion. They were so glad the jeep had brought the lion back peacefully.  The end.

Anna was lonely. She lived in a big house with no friends. She only had her doll, Lily, to play with. She wished she had a real friend to hug and talk to. One day, she saw a sign in the shop window. It said: "Buy a puppy today! They are cute and friendly and need a home." Anna ran inside and asked the shop lady, "Can I buy a puppy, please?" The shop lady smiled and said, "Of course, dear. They are in the back. You can choose one you like." She led Anna to a room full of puppies. They were all different colors and sizes. They barked and wagged their tails. Anna looked at them and felt her heart melt. She wanted to take them all home. But she knew she could only buy one. She saw a small brown puppy in the corner. It looked sad and scared. It did not bark or wag its tail. Anna felt sorry for it. She walked over and picked it up. It licked her face and snuggled in her arms. "I want this one," Anna said. "He needs a friend, like me." The shop lady nodded and said, "He is a good choice. He is very sweet and gentle. He just needs some love and care. What will you name him?" Anna thought for a moment and said, "I will name him Lucky. Because he is lucky to have me, and I am lucky to have him." The shop lady helped Anna pay for Lucky and gave her a leash and a collar. Anna thanked her and left the shop with her new friend. She felt happy and excited. She could not wait to show Lucky her home and her doll. She ran all the way to her house and opened the door. She called out, "Mom, Dad, I have a surprise for you!" She heard her parents' voices from the living room. They were sitting by the fireplace, reading and drinking tea. They looked up and saw Anna and Lucky. "Anna, what is that?" her mom asked, surprised. "It's a puppy, Mom. His name is Lucky. I bought him with my allowance. He is my friend. Can I keep him, please?" Anna said, pleading. Her parents looked at each other and smiled. They saw how happy Anna was and how cute Lucky was. They knew Anna was lonely and needed a companion. "Of course, you can keep him, Anna," her dad said. "He is adorable. And he is lucky to have you, too." Anna hugged her parents and thanked them. She introduced Lucky to Lily and put them on the couch. She joined her parents by the fireplace and cuddled with Lucky. She felt warm and cozy. She was not lonely anymore. She had a family and a friend. She was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy lived on a farm with his family. They had many animals, but Timmy loved the chickens the most. He liked to watch them peck at the ground and flap their wings. One day, Timmy's family went to a different farm to meet some new friends. Timmy was excited to see what animals they had. When they arrived, Timmy saw a chicken that looked different from the ones at his farm. It had feathers that were all different colors! Later that day, Timmy's family went back to their own farm. Timmy couldn't stop thinking about the different chicken he had met. Suddenly, he remembered something. His family had talked about getting some new chickens to add to their farm! Timmy was so happy because he knew he would get to see the different chicken again soon.

Lily liked to paint. She had many colors and brushes. She painted flowers and animals and houses. She made a big mess on the table and the floor. But she did not care. She was happy. One day, she painted a picture for her grandma. She painted a big heart and wrote "I love you" with red paint. She was very proud of her picture. She wanted to send it to her grandma. She asked her mom for help. "Mom, can you help me send this picture to grandma?" she said. "Sure, Lily. That is a very nice picture. Grandma will love it. But first, we need to clean up your mess. Look at all the paint on the table and the floor. We need to be organized and tidy," her mom said. "Okay, mom. I will help you. But can we send the picture today?" Lily said. "Yes, we can. After we clean up, we will put the picture in an envelope and write grandma's address. Then we will go to the post office and mail it. Grandma will get it in a few days," her mom said. Lily nodded. She was excited. She hoped grandma would like her picture. She helped her mom clean up the paint. She was organized and tidy. She put her colors and brushes in a box. She wiped the table and the floor with a cloth. She thanked her mom for helping her. Then they went to the post office and mailed the picture. Lily smiled. She loved her grandma. She could not wait to hear from her.

Once upon a time there was a sand castle by the sea. It was tall and strong. Inside the castle lived a brave prince, who loved to play in the sand. One day, a giant wave came and knocked down the castle. The prince was very sad. He looked around. Everything was gone. Then suddenly, he heard a voice. “Hello!”  He looked up. A seagull was flying above him.  The prince asked, “What can I do?” The seagull answered, “Use your shovel! Sharp it in the sand and build your castle again!”  The prince felt better. He got out his shovel and began to dig. He worked and worked until he had rebuilt the sand castle. The prince was so happy, his troubles were gone. He thanked the seagull and they played together all day in the sand.

Once upon a time, there was a jolly dog. He was so happy that he was always smiling. One day he found a bottle and it said "spray me!". He sprayed it around, and it made a rainbow in the sky. The rainbow spelled out the word "reward" in the sky. The dog was so excited and barked with joy. He waited and waited and then a big box of treats fell from the sky!The dog was so happy he did a happy dance around the treats. He ate the treats and ran around being jolly again. He learned that when he sprayed the bottle, he got a big reward.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a small village near a big tower. The tower was very tall and had a lot of windows. Lily loved to watch the lively birds fly around the tower. One day, Lily went to the tower to explore. She climbed up the stairs and looked out the window. She saw the beautiful view of the village. Suddenly, she heard a loud noise and felt the tower shake. She regretted going up the tower because she was scared. Just then, a kind man came to help her down the stairs. He told her that the tower was being repaired and it was not safe to be inside. Lily was relieved and thanked the man for helping her. She learned her lesson and promised to always listen to the grown-ups.

Once upon a time, there were two brothers. Both brothers were quite ordinary, but one seemed to like pastries more than the other.  One day, the brother who liked pastries the most asked his mom for a special pastry. His mom said yes and went out to the store. Before she came back, the other brother noticed that something special seemed to be happening.  When their mom got back, she was holding a big, sweet pastry.
