She gave it to the brother who liked pastries the most and he was so happy!  The other brother was so excited, too. He asked if he could have some of the pastry and his mom said yes!  They both ate the pastry and it was so delicious. They enjoyed it so much and it seemed like this ordinary pastry was the best one ever.  The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Leah. She was only three years old. One day, Leah asked her mom if she could go outside and play. Her mom said yes but told her to stay near the gate.  Leah agreed and went outside to the big gate. She found a patch of tall grass and began to pick some. But then, a sour smell made Leah stop. She looked around and saw a big beehive in the grass. Leah knew that she couldn't touch the beehive. She wanted to get a closer look, though. Leah asked her mom if she could go nearer to the beehive. Her mom thought for a moment and then allowed Leah to go a little closer. But Leah stayed near the gate. She watched the bees fly in and out of the beehive. Then, she went back home with a smile. Leah was glad that her mom allowed her to get a closer look at the beehive.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She wanted to learn how to ride her bike without training wheels. Her dad said he would teach her. Dad said, "We need to get you a new helmet. Let's go to the store and pick out a package with a helmet and knee pads." Lily was excited to get her new helmet, and she picked out a package that had a pretty pink helmet with flowers on it. Dad helped her put it on and they went outside to practice. Lily tried and tried, but she kept falling off. Dad encouraged her and said, "Don't worry, we'll keep practicing until you're successful." But then, Lily fell off her bike and hurt her arm. She cried and said she didn't want to ride her bike anymore. Dad hugged her and said, "It's okay, we can try again another day."

Bunny was having lots of fun in the park. She hopped around in the grass, feeling the warm sunshine on her fur. Suddenly, Bunny noticed something pink in the sky. It was a hot air balloon! Bunny was excited to see it, so she hopped closer to take a better look. The hot air balloon was moving quickly, displaying its amazing speed. Bunny couldn't believe how quickly it flew above, its bright pink bottom glistening in the sun. Bunny wanted to feel the speed of the balloon too, so she started to run around in circles. She twirled and leaped, her tiny legs moving as fast as she could. Bunny felt a rush of joy inside, just like she did when the hot air balloon sped past. She was so happy, she started running in circles again! Bunny was displaying her own speed, just like the hot air balloon!

Once upon a time, there was a kind dragon who lived in a nearby cave. Every day, the dragon would fly around and find all the special things to offer his lunch. One day, the dragon had an unusual offer to make. He offered to share his lunch with all the animals! The animals were so excited, they all came to the cave to get their lunch. But just when the dragon was about to share his lunch, something strange happened! All the animals suddenly started to dance, and it was the most amazing sight ever! The dragon was so happy, he had never seen anything like this before. He laughed and cheered, and all the animals cheered with him.  And that was the unusual day the dragon offered his lunch to the animals and they all danced together.

Once upon a time, there were two friends - a boy and a girl. They loved to play together and have fun. But one day, they started to quarrel over a toy. The boy wanted to play with it, but the girl didn't want to share. As they were arguing, they heard a loud crack. They looked around and saw that the toy had broken into two pieces. They both felt sad and didn't know what to do. But then the boy had an idea. He suggested that they could take turns playing with the toy. The girl thought that was a polite thing to do, so they agreed. From that day on, they played together happily and never quarreled again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to paint pictures of flowers and trees. One day, she was painting a picture outside when her mom came up to her. Mom: "Lily, we have to go to the store now." Lily: "But I'm not done painting yet." Mom: "Don't worry, you can finish painting when we come back." Lily was worried that her painting would get ruined while they were gone. But her mom promised to keep it safe. They went to the store and bought some snacks for later. When they came back, Lily ran to her painting. She saw that it was still there and hadn't moved at all. She was so happy that she started to rock back and forth with excitement. Mom: "I'm glad you're happy, Lily. Your painting looks beautiful." Lily: "Thank you, Mommy. I love painting."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was going to a party with her mommy and daddy. Lily was very excited because she was going to see her friends and eat cake. In the car, Lily sat in her seat and looked out the window. She saw the trees and the birds. But then, she started to worry. "Mommy, where is my favorite toy?" she asked. "Don't worry, sweetie," said her mommy. "We'll find it when we get home." When they arrived at the party, Lily saw her friends and ran to play with them. She forgot all about her toy. She ate cake and danced with her friends. Lily was so happy that she didn't even remember to worry anymore.

Once upon a time there was a big, loud slide. The slide was so big and loud that a young girl who lived nearby heard it. She was so curious that she decided to go check it out.  When she arrived, she saw a giant, blue coat next to the slide. It was bright and sparkly, and she wanted to try it on. She quickly put the coat on and ran to the slide.  She climbed to the top of the slide and slid down. The coat was so sparkly and big that, as she slid down, it was like a rainbow! She was so excited that she slid down the slide again and again.  The more she slid, the more she laughed. Then, suddenly, she heard an even louder noise. It was her mom telling her it was time to go home! She took off the coat, waved goodbye to the slide, and ran to her mom.  She never forgot her fun day!

Once upon a time, there was a little fish named Nemo. Nemo liked to swim in the ocean with his friends. One day, they saw a jellyfish. The jellyfish was very pretty, but Nemo's friend said it was also very dangerous. Nemo didn't believe him and swam towards the jellyfish. Suddenly, the jellyfish stung Nemo! It hurt a lot, but luckily Nemo's friend knew what to do. He helped Nemo and they swam back to their home. When they got back, Nemo's friend told him a joke to make him feel better. Nemo laughed and forgot about the jellyfish. Later, they went to play in a pond, but it was very filthy. They didn't want to swim in it because it was too dirty. Instead, they played on the shore and had fun telling more jokes. Nemo was happy to have such a good friend who could make him laugh and keep him safe.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to swing and slide and run. They saw a big dog with brown fur and a long tail. The dog was barking and jumping. Lily and Ben wanted to pet the dog. "Hello, doggy!" Lily said. She walked to the dog and reached out her hand. The dog growled and showed his teeth. He did not like Lily. He was a wild dog. "Be careful, Lily!" Ben said. He ran to Lily and tried to pull her away. The dog was faster. He bit Lily's hand and made her cry. He was a terrible dog. "Ow, ow, ow!" Lily screamed. She was hurt and scared. Ben was angry and brave. He slapped the dog on the nose and made him yelp. He was a good brother. "Go away, doggy!" Ben shouted. He picked up a stick and waved it at the dog. The dog was not afraid. He snarled and jumped at Ben. He bit Ben's leg and made him fall. He was a mean dog. "Help, help, help!" Lily and Ben cried. They needed help. They hoped someone would hear them and save them. But no one came. The dog was hungry and strong. He ate Lily and Ben and licked his lips. He was a happy dog.

Once there was a little girl. She had a modest house to live in. In her house there was an attic. She really wanted to fill the attic with lots of things. One day, her parents supplied her with lots of things for her attic! She was so excited as she put the things into the attic. In the attic there was a bed, dolls, books and toys. It was the best day ever! The little girl was now able to play with her things in the attic and even have sleepovers with her dolls. It was the perfect place for fun!

Sara and Ben were playing with their dolls in the living room. They had a big box of clothes and accessories for their dolls. Sara liked to dress her doll in wool sweaters and hats, because they were soft and warm. Ben liked to dress his doll in spicy colors, like red and yellow, because they were bright and fun. "Look at my doll, Sara," Ben said. "She is wearing a spicy dress and a spicy scarf. She is ready to go to a party." "I don't like your doll, Ben," Sara said. "She is too spicy. She hurts my eyes. My doll is wearing a wool sweater and a wool hat. She is cozy and cute. She is ready to go to bed." Sara and Ben started to argue about whose doll was better. They raised their voices and pulled each other's dolls. Sara was so angry that she slapped Ben's doll in the face. Ben was so shocked that he slapped Sara's doll in the head. "Ow!" Sara and Ben cried at the same time. They dropped their dolls and rubbed their hands. They realized that slapping was not nice. It made them and their dolls feel bad. "I'm sorry, Sara," Ben said. "I shouldn't have slapped your doll. She is cozy and cute. I like her wool sweater and hat." "I'm sorry, Ben," Sara said. "I shouldn't have slapped your doll. She is bright and fun. I like her spicy dress and scarf." Sara and Ben hugged and made up. They decided to share their clothes and accessories. They dressed their dolls in wool and spicy outfits. They agreed that their dolls were both beautiful and happy. They played together nicely and had a lot of fun.

Tom and Mia are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they find a big oak tree. The oak tree has many leaves and acorns. Tom and Mia want to make a necklace with the acorns. They pick some acorns from the ground. They use a string to tie them together. They make a long necklace. They are happy. "Look, Mia, we made a great necklace!" Tom says. "Yes, Tom, it is very pretty. But it is not shiny. I want it to be shiny," Mia says. "How can we make it shiny?" Tom asks. "I know. We can polish it. My mom polishes her shoes with a cloth. Maybe we can find a cloth," Mia says. They look around the park. They see a bench. On the bench, there is a red cloth. Someone left it there. "Look, Tom, there is a cloth. We can use it to polish our necklace," Mia says. They run to the bench. They take the cloth. They rub the acorns with the cloth. The acorns become shiny. They are happy. "Wow, Mia, our necklace is shiny now. It looks great," Tom says. "Yes, Tom, it does. We are very good at polishing. Let's wear our necklace and show it to everyone," Mia says. They put the necklace around their necks. They smile. They are proud of their work. They walk around the park. They show their necklace to the birds, the squirrels, and the people. Everyone likes their necklace. Tom and Mia are happy. They are friends.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Daisy. She had a special rocking chair which her Daddy had made for her. Every day when Daisy was tired, she would sit down in the rocker and her Daddy would give her a big push and say, 'One, two, three, rock!' Sometimes Daisy's little sister, Annabelle, would join in. She would carefully climb on to Daisy's lap and hug her tight. Then Daisy and Annabelle would hold on as Daddy pushed them back and forth. When Daisy rocked, she felt so safe and happy. She would close her eyes and feel the rocking going faster and faster, until it felt like they were flying. "Wheee!" cried Daisy with a huge grin.  Annabelle would squeal with delight, and Daddy would laugh, too. Then the rocking slowed down until it came to a gentle stop. "That was the best ever!" said Daisy, hugging her Daddy and her little sister close. "Rock me again, please!"  And so dad Patiently pushed Daisy and Annabelle back and forth, again and again, in their special rocking chair, until Daisy was sleepy and ready for a nap.  And that's what happened every time Daisy and Annabelle went for a ride in their rocking chair.

Lily liked to play the flute. She had a small flute that made nice sounds when she blew into it. She played the flute every day in her room. She felt happy and peaceful when she played. One day, her brother Tom came into her room. He was bored and wanted to play with Lily. He saw her flute and grabbed it. He said, "Let me play with this. It looks fun." Lily was angry and scared. She did not want Tom to take her flute. She said, "No, Tom, that is mine. Give it back. You don't know how to play it. You will break it." Tom did not listen. He blew into the flute very hard. He made a loud and ugly noise. He laughed and said, "This is easy. I can play better than you." Lily started to cry. She wanted her flute back. She said, "Tom, please, stop. You are hurting my flute. You are hurting my ears. You are hurting my feelings." Tom saw that Lily was crying. He felt sorry and ashamed. He realized that he was being mean and selfish. He said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I was wrong. Here, take your flute. I won't touch it again." He gave the flute back to Lily. Lily stopped crying. She looked at her flute and saw that it was not broken. She was relieved and grateful. She said, "Thank you, Tom. I forgive you. Do you want to play something else with me?" Tom nodded and smiled. He said, "Yes, Lily. I want to play with you. You are my sister and I love you." They hugged each other and went to play with their toys. They felt happy and peaceful again. They learned to share and respect each other's things. They played the flute together and made nice sounds.

Sara likes pink. She has a pink dress, a pink hat, and a pink bike. She likes to ride her bike in the park with her parent. One day, she sees a big dog in the park. The dog is not pink. It is black and white and has a loud bark. Sara stops her bike and stares at the dog. She is not scared, but curious. She wants to pet the dog, but she does not know if the dog is friendly. She looks at her parent and asks, "Can I touch the dog?" Her parent smiles and says, "You can, but you have to ask the owner first. The owner is the person who has the leash. The leash is the rope that connects the dog and the owner. The owner can tell you if the dog likes to be touched or not." Sara nods and rides her bike closer to the owner. The owner is a lady with a blue shirt and a green hat. She sees Sara and smiles too. She says, "Hello, little girl. Do you like my dog? His name is Spot." Sara says, "Hello, lady. I like your dog. He is big and has a loud bark. Can I touch him?" The lady says, "Sure, you can. Spot is very friendly. He likes to be touched. But you have to be gentle and slow. Do not pull his fur or his ears. Just stroke his back and his head." Sara says, "Okay, I will be gentle and slow." She gets off her bike and walks to Spot. She reaches out her hand and touches his back. Spot wags his tail and licks her face. Sara giggles and says, "He is soft and warm. He likes me." The lady says, "He does like you. You are a good girl. Do you want to play with him for a while?" Sara looks at her parent and says, "Can I play with him, please?" Her parent says, "Yes, you can. But stay close and be careful. I will watch you from here." Sara says, "Thank you, parent. Thank you, lady. Thank you, Spot." She runs and plays with the dog in the park. She is happy. She likes pink, but she also likes black and white.

Once upon a time, there was a very hairy gorilla. The gorilla lived in the jungle and he loved to tell stories. Every day he would tell a different story about his life in the jungle. One day, a little 3 year old child was walking through the jungle. He heard the gorilla telling stories, and he wanted to listen. He crept closer and closer, until he was sitting right beside the gorilla. The little child listened carefully to the gorilla's stories. He was so excited to hear them, and he asked the gorilla to tell him another one. The gorilla chuckled and began to tell another story. The little child loved the stories, and he spent many happy hours listening to the gorilla tell them. He was so glad that he found the hairy gorilla in the jungle.

Lila and Max were playing with their toys in the living room. They liked to pretend they were space explorers, and they had a yellow laser that made funny noises. Lila held the laser and pointed it at Max. "Zap! Zap! I got you, Max! You are a bad alien!" she said. Max laughed and fell to the floor. He pretended to be hurt, but he was not. He had a plan. He waited for Lila to come closer, and then he grabbed the laser from her hand. "Ha! Now I have the laser, Lila! You are a good alien, and I am a bad one!" he said. Lila gasped and tried to get the laser back. She chased Max around the couch and the table. They ran and ran, but Max was faster. He ran to the kitchen, where their mom was making a cake. "Mom, mom, look what I have!" he said, holding the laser. Mom turned around and saw the laser. She smiled and said, "Wow, that's a nice toy, Max. Where did you get it?" Max was about to answer, when he saw something behind mom. It was a big, round, shiny thing. It looked like a giant ball of metal. It had a hole in the middle, and a red light inside. "Mom, what is that?" he asked, pointing at the thing. Mom looked behind her and said, "Oh, that's the new oven, Max. Dad bought it yesterday. It can bake cakes very fast. Do you want to see?" Max nodded. He was curious. He wanted to see the oven. He followed mom to the oven, and Lila followed him. Mom opened the oven door and showed them the cake. It was almost done. It smelled good. "See, this is the cake I'm making for your dad's birthday. It's his favorite. Chocolate with cream and cherries. Do you like it?" mom asked. Lila and Max nodded. They liked it. They wanted to taste it. Mom closed the oven door and said, "It will be ready in a few minutes. Then we can decorate it and surprise dad. He will be home soon. Can you guess what he will say?" Lila and Max thought for a moment. They tried to guess what dad would say. They said different things, like "Wow, thank you!" or "Yummy, yummy!" or "Best cake ever!" Mom laughed and said, "You are both very good at guessing. I think dad will say all of those things. And he will also say, 'I love you, Lila and Max. You are the best kids in the world.'" Lila and Max smiled and hugged mom. They said, "We love you, mom. You are the best mom in the world." Mom hugged them back and said, "I love you, too, Lila and Max. You are the best kids in the world." They were happy. They waited for the cake to be done. They waited for dad to come home. They did not notice the yellow laser that Max had left on the counter. They did not notice the red light that came out of the oven hole. They did not notice the laser and the light that met in the air. They did not notice the big boom that followed. They did not notice the cake that flew out of the oven and landed on the floor. They did not notice the smoke and the fire that filled the kitchen. They did not notice anything, until it was too late.

Once there was a small, cute girl. She was only 3 years old, but she was curious about many things. One day, the girl was looking through her mom's old books. She found one that had some funny words in it. She asked her mom what it said, and her mom said it was a spell. The girl wanted to attach the spell to something, but she didn't know what. Finally, she found a small teddy bear in her room. She thought the teddy bear was cute and decided to attach the spell to it. She smiled and set the bear down, and hoped that the spell would bring some magic to her life. Sometimes, when the girl thought she needed some magic, she looked at the teddy bear and thought about the spell. She smiled, feeling comforted.

Once upon a time there was a little girl. She was three years old and loved to explore the world around her. One day she went outside to play and felt the heat of the sun on her skin. She liked how it felt and wanted to know more. She looked around and saw lots of rough rocks and stones. She wanted to touch them to find out if they were as rough as they looked. She slowly touched one of the stones and it was very rough. She was surprised! The little girl enjoyed learning about the rough rocks and decided to take some home with her. When she arrived home, she showed her mommy the rocks and told her all about the heat she felt in the sun. Her mommy smiled and said, "That's wonderful sweetheart. You know so much!" The little girl smiled and ran off to play. She was proud of herself for learning new things outside.

Once there was a young girl who was very polite. One day, she noticed something strange was happening- she was shrinking. Every minute she got smaller and smaller! She was worried, so she shouted for help. Soon, a kind old man spotted her. He picked her up and carried her home.  Inside the house, he showed the young girl a special potion. He said it would stop her from shrinking. She drank it in one big gulp and, within seconds, she stopped shrinking. She was so happy, she thanked the old man for his help. He smiled and said, “You’re very polite. That’s why I helped you.”  The young girl was glad to stay the same size with the old man’s help. She thanked him again and went back home.

Once upon a time, there was a Pixie who wanted to surprise all of his friends. So one day he decided to plan a meeting. He told his friends to wear their best clothes, but then he told them that the meeting was very cheap.  The Pixie's friends were delighted! They showed up to the meeting wearing their best clothes, but they were surprised to find they didn't need to spend any money at all. Instead, the Pixie had planned a fun game and some tasty treats. Everyone had a great time.  The moral of the story is that it's important to share with others. Even if you don't have a lot of money, you can still surprise your friends in special and unforgettable ways. Even a simple game or treat can make someone's day!

Once upon a time, there were two friends, Jack and Jill. They liked to talk about fun things. One day, they started to discuss an island - it seemed far away, and it was very long.  Jack and Jill were excited. They talked about what it might look like, who might live there and what fun things they could do. They made up silly stories about the people who lived on the island and what kinds of animals they might find.  After a while, Jack and Jill got tired of discussing the island - but they knew they would come back to it. Maybe they would visit the island someday, they thought. That would be so much fun, they smiled.  The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to church with her family every Sunday. The church was big and organized with rows of seats and a big cross on the wall. One Sunday, Lily and her family were sitting in their usual spot when Lily noticed a man sitting in the back of the church. He was whispering to himself and looking around nervously. Lily's mommy told her not to worry and that everything was okay. After the service, Lily's family went outside to say hello to their friends. Suddenly, they heard a loud noise coming from inside the church. Everyone started to panic and run away. But Lily remembered the man from earlier and knew he needed help. She bravely ran back into the church and found the man stuck under a pew. She whispered to him that everything was going to be okay and helped him get free. From that day on, Lily was known as the hero of the church.

Mummy was in the living room, looking at the television. She was not smiling.  "What is wrong Mummy?" asked three year old Jack. "This television is bad. We have to clean it," said Mummy. Jack was excited and said, "I can help clean it!" Mummy laughed and said, "Okay, let's clean the television together." So they both grabbed a cloth and rubbed the television, until it was all clean.  Mummy smiled and said, "Thank you so much, Jack. You are a very good cleaner."  Jack smiled proudly and said, "Let's do it again!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to drink milk every day. One day, her mom gave her a cup of milk that tasted funny. Lily was troubled and didn't know what to do. She wanted to ask her mom about it, but she was afraid.  Lily decided to ask her dad for help. Her dad listened to her and asked her to show him the milk. He smelled it and realized that it was spoiled. He explained to Lily that it's important to ask questions when we are unsure about something, especially when it comes to our health.  From that day on, Lily learned to ask questions when she was troubled or unsure about something. She knew that it was better to ask and get an answer than to stay quiet and worry. And she never drank spoiled milk again!

Once upon a time, there was a big jeep. It was red and shiny. One day, the jeep started to move. It drove on a bumpy road and went up a hill. The jeep was so fast and it was so much fun! After a while, the jeep stopped near a big tree. There were some yummy apples on the tree. The jeep's driver picked some apples and they were very delicious. The driver shared the apples with the jeep and they both enjoyed them very much.

Once upon a time there was a cheerful magic wand. It belonged to the nicest witch in the world. With a wave of the wand the witch could make all kinds of beautiful things appear. One day the witch was doing her magic and playing her music when something disturbed her. It was a naughty little fairy who was trying to snatch away her wand!  The witch quickly said a magic spell to stop the fairy in its tracks. The fairy decided it was no fun and flew away.  The witch smiled and went back to her magic. She waved her wand and mysterious things began to appear. The whole room was filled with cheerful noises and laughter. Everyone was happy.  The witch kept on doing her magic until the sun began to go down. Then she said goodbye, put her wand away and went home. All the magic had been a lot of fun!

Once upon a time there was a chick called Henry. He lived in a nice cozy nest with his mummy and daddy. Every day Henry loved to fly high in the sky and soar very high above the clouds. One day, Henry decided to fly even higher and it got colder the higher he flew. He was so cold and the air was so bitter! He looked down and in the snow he saw a mitten. Henry flew lower to look at the mitten and realised it was lost on the ground. He thought about the small girl who had lost it in the snow, and he suddenly felt so sad. He decided he wanted to make the girl happy and flew back to the nest to tell mummy and daddy what he had seen. Mummy and daddy were so proud of Henry. They promised they would help him make the girl happy again by making a new mitten. Henry and his parents made a beautiful mitten and Henry flew it back up to the sky, so the little girl would find it. The little girl was very happy when she found the mitten, and hugged Henry. Henry had taught everyone an important lesson that day – that being kind and helping others makes everyone happier. He knew that even the littlest things can make someone's day.

Sara and Ben were twins. They liked to play games and have fun. But they did not like to clean their room. They were lazy. One day, their mom said, "Sara and Ben, you have to clean your room. It is very messy. If you do not clean it, you will not get any cookies." She gave them a key. "This is the key to the cookie jar. I will put it on the table. When you are done, you can get the cookies. But do not lose the key." Sara and Ben nodded. They did not want to lose the cookies. But they did not want to clean their room either. They had a plan. They decided to order their toys. They put all their toys in a big pile. Then they said, "Toys, clean the room. We are the bosses. You have to do what we say." But the toys did not move. They did not listen. They were just toys. Sara and Ben waited and waited. But nothing happened. They got bored and sleepy. They forgot about the key and the cookies. They fell asleep on the floor. Their mom came back. She saw the big pile of toys and the dirty room. She saw Sara and Ben sleeping. She saw the key on the table. She shook her head. She said, "Sara and Ben, you are very silly. You cannot order your toys. You have to do the work yourself. You are too lazy. Now you have no cookies. Maybe next time you will listen to me." She took the key and the cookie jar. She left the room. Sara and Ben did not hear her. They did not get any cookies. They were sad.

Once upon a time, there was a big mountain called a volcano. It was very hot and made fire come out of its top. One day, something happened and the volcano started to shake. The ground shook too and the people who lived nearby were scared. A bossy bird named Sammy saw what happened and flew to warn everyone. "The volcano is going to erupt!" he squawked loudly. The people listened and quickly ran away to a safe place.  Suddenly, the volcano exploded and hot lava flowed down its sides. The people were sad to see their homes destroyed, but they were happy they listened to Sammy and were safe. They thanked him for being a bossy bird and saving their lives.

John looked up in the sky. He saw a white dove. He wanted to touch it, but it was too high. Then he had an idea. He wanted to release the dove. So he ran to get help. John found his mom. He asked her to help him release the dove. His mom smiled. She took John to the park. At the park, John saw a tree with a big nest. Inside the nest, there were two hungry doves! John was so happy. He and his mom worked together to release the doves. First, they opened the cage door. Then, the doves flew out of the cage. They flew high in the sky. John waved his arms as the doves flew away. He was so excited! It was the best day ever.

One day, there was a thief. He wanted to steal something very special. He knew he needed a plan. He wanted something that was very heavy, so he came up with an idea. He decided to weigh things at the market. Every day he went to the market, he would look around and weigh different items. One day, he came upon an open box. It was very heavy, so the thief was very excited. He thought it would be the perfect item to steal. He quickly took the box and ran away. The thief did not know that the box was filled with coins and jewels. He was only focused on the fact that it was heavy. Little did he know, that he had just stolen the most valuable item in the market!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a brother named Max who loved to eat. One day, Lily's mom made some cookies that smelled really tasty. Max saw them and asked if he could have one.  Lily's mom said he could, but only if he acted nicely and shared with Lily. Max promised he would. But when he got the cookie, he didn't share with Lily.  Later that day, Lily found a toy that Max really liked. She wanted to play with it, but Max wouldn't let her. Then Lily remembered what happened with the cookie. She told Max that she would let him play with her toy if he shared the cookie with her. Max felt bad and realized he should have kept his promise. He shared the cookie with Lily and they played with the toy together.

Sara and Ben are playing in the garden. They like to pretend they are chefs and make food with leaves, flowers and dirt. Sara is very creative. She makes a pizza with a big leaf as the base and puts some olives on top. Olives are small and round and black or green. Sara likes olives. Ben does not. "Look, Ben, I made a pizza. Do you want some?" Sara says. Ben kneels down to see the pizza. He does not like olives. He thinks they are yucky. He makes a face. "No, thank you, Sara. I do not like olives. They are yucky. Can I have something else?" Ben says. Sara is sad. She worked hard on her pizza. She thinks it is yummy. She does not want to waste it. "Please, Ben, try a bite. Maybe you will like it. Olives are good for you. They are healthy." Sara says. Ben does not want to hurt Sara's feelings. He is a good friend. He decides to try a bite. He picks up a small piece of the pizza and puts it in his mouth. He chews slowly. He is surprised. The pizza is not yucky. It is yummy. He likes olives. "Mmm, Sara, this is yummy. You are a good chef. I like olives. Can I have some more?" Ben says. Sara is happy. She smiles. She is glad Ben likes her pizza. She shares it with him. They eat the pizza together. They are good friends. They have fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Buddy. Buddy was very happy because he had a big bowl of food that his owner filled every day. One day, Buddy saw a flea on his fur. He didn't like the flea, but he didn't know what to do. Buddy went to his owner and said, "I have a flea on me. Can you help me?" His owner said, "Sure, I'll give you a bath and wash the flea away." Buddy was happy and wagged his tail. But when Buddy got in the bath, he saw the water fill up higher and higher. He was scared and tried to jump out, but he slipped and fell. Buddy was ashamed because he knew he should have been more careful. The water filled up so much that Buddy couldn't breathe and he drowned. Poor Buddy!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim loved the beach. He liked to play in the sand and swim in the water. One day, Tim went to the beach with his mom and dad. When they got there, they saw that the beach was filthy. There was trash everywhere. Tim was sad. He wanted to play, but he didn't like the dirty beach. His mom and dad told him to believe that they could make it clean. So, they all started to pick up the trash. They put the trash in bags and threw it away. After they cleaned up the beach, it was not filthy anymore. Tim was happy. He played in the sand and swam in the water all day. He believed that he could make the beach clean, and he did. Tim, his mom, and his dad had a great day at the beach.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Bella who wanted to ask a question. She asked her mom: "What is an olive?". Mom looked at her and said "It is a fruit"!. Bella said, "I would like to have an olive". So mom took her to the store and found an olive for Bella. Bella held the olive and asked "What do I do with it?". Mom answered: "You can eat it". So Bella did and said it tasted nice. Bella wanted to ask more questions, so she asked her mom if she could get more olives. Her mom said "Yes, but they aren't very reliable fruits". Bella asked "What do you mean?". Mom answered "Olives don't always taste the same, so you should be careful when you eat them. However, they are delicious and are a great snack".  Bella was so happy to find out about olives and she liked them a lot. She decided to always be reliable when eating olives, so that she could enjoy their taste.

It was a bright and sunny day. Mommy and Johnnie were in the yard. "Johnnie," said Mommy, "let's go for a drive in the vehicle."  Johnnie was so excited! He loved the vehicle.  Mommy started the vehicle and began to drive. They drove past lots of houses and trees. Then, they approached a tall bridge. Johnnie was curious how the vehicle would make it across the bridge. "That's hard," said Johnnie. "Don't worry, Johnnie," said Mommy. "Our vehicle is very smart." And sure enough, the vehicle drove across the bridge with ease. Johnnie was so proud of the vehicle. He couldn't believe it was so smart!

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a messy cave. A small bear lived in the cave. One day, a tiny bird entered the cave. The bird was lost and scared. The small bear saw the bird and said, "Why are you in my messy cave?" The tiny bird said, "I'm lost. I can't find my mom." The small bear wanted to help the tiny bird find its mom. But the bird was scared of the bear. The bird said, "You are big. I am scared." The small bear felt sad. He wanted to show the bird that he was nice. So he said, "Don't be scared. I will help you find your mom." The tiny bird felt better. They both left the cave to find the bird's mom. Soon, they found her. The bird and her mom were happy. The small bear felt happy too, because he made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a very little boy. He was out playing in the park, when he saw a bird in the mud. The bird was so sad, it was miserable. The boy wanted to help the bird, so he thought of a way to rescue it. He went over to the bird and very carefully picked it up. But he saw that the bird had a small white pill stuck in its feathers. He didn't know what to do, so he asked a grown-up. The grown-up said that if he gave the bird the pill, it would be better soon. So, the boy gave the bird the pill, and it flew away happier than ever. The boy was so pleased to have been able to rescue the bird!

Once upon a time there was a naughty boy. One day, he saw a weapon and thought it looked fun. He decided to throw it.  The naughty boy threw the weapon in the air. Then, his mom came running over. "No!" she shouted. "It's not nice to throw things!" He looked down at the ground. "But why?" he asked.  His mom gave him a big hug. "Because it's not safe," she said. "And it's not very nice either."  The naughty boy gave her a nod. He knew he shouldn't throw weapons. Then, his mom gave him a hug and said, "You can always come and ask me for help if you aren't sure about something."  And the naughty boy never threw a weapon again.

Jack was a very sleepy little boy. He was three years old and loved playing games. One day he was walking near a big oak tree. It was tall and strong. Jack wanted to play a game to repair the tree. He gathered some mud, twigs, and leaves. He mixed the mud with water and used it to make a glue. He stuck the twigs and leaves onto the oak tree. When he was done, the tree was fixed. Jack smiled and was happy. The oak tree was his proud repair job. He saw it standing tall again and was happy he helped it. He hugged the oak tree and said "There, now you're good as new!"  The oak tree thanked Jack and the little boy went back home. He was very tired from his repair job and quickly fell into a deep and sleepy slumber.

Once upon a time there was a organized cake. It was in a box and it was so special that it needed a wind to remove it from the box. So the little girl grabbed the wind and put it on the cake. The wind gently moved away the top of the box and the cake emerged. The little girl was so excited when she saw the cake that she jumped with joy and laughed out loud. The little girl thanked the wind for helping to remove the cake from the box. She then enjoyed every bite of the organized cake. The end.

Once upon a time there was a big dragon. It had a huge head and fire would come out of its mouth. The dragon lived high up in a mountain and it always looked very angry. One day, a brave knight rode up to the mountain and stood in front of the dragon. He was ready to fight the dragon, but he did not have to. The dragon said "it is time for me to release the fire inside me". The knight was surprised. He wanted to know how the dragon was going to do that. The dragon said "Just wait a little bit." So the brave knight waited. And then, a huge burst of light surrounded the dragon. It was like its head opened up, and all the fire inside was released out into the world. The dragon smiled and it looked very happy. The brave knight was amazed. He said "you look so different". The dragon said "Yes, now I am free". Then the knight and the dragon became good friends.

Once upon a time, there was a flexible statue. Every day, it would slide around the park, bouncing off the trees and dancing around the flowers.  One day, a little girl saw the flexible statue. She was so excited and decided to follow it. She slowly walked behind it, watching it slide around.  The girl saw the statue go around the trees, then through a ball pit, and then around a slide. It was having so much fun! The girl felt like she was playing with it.  The little girl kept following the statue, and eventually they both got tired. So they stopped near a bench and plopped down next to each other.  The flexible statue had been such a great friend to the little girl, so she promised to come back and play with the statue every day. And that's exactly what she did.  Every day, the girl would come to the park and slide around with her flexible statue friend.  The End.

Once upon a time, there was a young boy named Tim. Tim liked to play and move all day. One day, while playing in his room, he saw a switch on the wall. He had never seen this switch before. Tim was curious. Tim asked his mom, "What does this switch do?" His mom said, "It makes the room bright when it is dark. You can try it when the sun goes down." That night, when the sun went down, Tim went to his room. He remembered the switch on the wall. He moved his hand up and touched the switch. The room became bright! Tim was happy and showed his mom. They both smiled and played in the bright room.

Once there was a little girl named Sarah. She was three years old and loved to play with her bracelet. She wore it every day and never wanted to take it off.  One day, Sarah decided to make a game from folding her bracelet. She would fold it over and over until it looked like a fan. Then she leaned on the wall, watching it flutter in the wind. Suddenly, she heard a voice behind her. "That's a great bracelet, Sarah. Where did you get it?" Sarah turned around to see an old man with a long beard. She smiled at him and told him honestly, "My mom gave it to me." The old man nodded and smiled. Then he said, "Keep it, Sarah. It will remind you to always be honest."  Sarah thanked the old man and hugged her bracelet tight. She was excited and happy to have such a special bracelet. From then on, she always remembered the old man's words and was honest.

Lily and Max were playing in the park. They liked to search for shiny things in the sand. Sometimes they found coins, buttons, or beads. They put them in their pockets and showed them to their mom. One day, they saw something very shiny in the sand. It was a gem. It was orange and sparkled in the sun. Lily and Max ran to pick it up. "Wow, look at this!" Lily said. "It is so pretty!" "Can I see?" Max asked. He reached for the gem, but Lily held it tight. "No, it is mine!" Lily said. "I saw it first!" "But I want to see it too!" Max said. He tried to grab the gem, but Lily pulled it away. They started to fight over the gem. They pulled and pushed and shouted. They did not see the big dog that came near them. The dog saw the gem and thought it was a ball. He barked and jumped and snatched the gem from Lily's hand. He ran away with it in his mouth. Lily and Max stopped fighting. They looked at the dog and the gem. They felt sad and sorry. "Come back!" Lily cried. "That is our gem!" "Bad dog!" Max yelled. "Give it back!" But the dog did not listen. He ran to his owner and wagged his tail. He dropped the gem at his feet and licked his face. Lily and Max ran after the dog. They tried to get their gem back, but the owner picked it up and put it in his pocket. "Sorry, kids," he said. "This is my dog's toy. He likes shiny things too." He walked away with the dog and the gem. Lily and Max looked at each other. They felt sad and angry. They hugged each other and said sorry. They decided to share their other shiny things. They went back to the sand and searched for more. They hoped to find another gem someday.

Once upon a time, there was a boy called Sam. Sam had a very special goal. He wanted to be the best at playing hide-and-seek!  One day, Sam was playing hide-and-seek with his friends. He ran and ran until he found a nice, comfortable spot to hide. Sam waited and waited, but then he began to feel a little bit sleepy.  Suddenly, Sam slipped and fell asleep. He slept and slept until it was time to go home.  When he woke up, Sam was excited. He knew he was very close to achieving his goal. He had played the best hide-and-seek game ever!  From then on, Sam felt very comfortable whenever he played hide-and-seek. He knew he could always rely on himself to win!

Once upon a time there was a mole who wanted to travel. He was so excited, but he was also slow. So he took small steps and scurried down the path. As he traveled, he came across a pond. The mole stopped and looked around. He found a nice rock to rest on. He looked into the water and saw fishes swimming around. Suddenly, he heard a voice. It was a crow. The crow said "Hello, little mole. What are you doing here?" The mole was so surprised and he answered "I am traveling." The crow said "Have a nice trip!" and flew away. The mole smiled and continued on his journey. He traveled for a long time, stopping every once in a while to look around and admire the beauty of the world. Finally, the mole reached his destination. He was so happy to be there! He had enjoyed his trip and was glad he was able to travel slow and take in all the sights.

Once upon a time there was a strong flower that bloomed in the garden. It was the most special flower of all because its petals were a beautiful gem. Every day the flower grew and bloomed more and more. One day, a strong wind came and blew the petals away. The flower was sad and felt like it had lost its special gem. But then one of the petals came back. It had flown to the other side of the garden, to a new and different flower. The new flower was so happy to get the petal, and it was so strong that it even grew a beautiful gem of its own. The original flower was so pleased for the new flower, and felt very proud that its petal had gone and made someone else so happy. The story tells us that it is always good to help and share with others, who might also be able to bloom and be strong with our help.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. She was three years old. One day, Sarah saw a big stair. It was very tall. She wanted to go up the stair, but it was so high. She looked scared. Suddenly, a voice came from behind her. "Sarah, what's wrong?" it asked. Sarah turned around. It was her mom. "Mom," Sarah said, "The stair is so high. I am scared." Her mom smiled and said, "It's OK, Sarah. You can do it. Just take it one step at a time and be safe." Sarah smiled and nodded. She took a deep breath and started walking up the stair. Every step, she said to herself "safe, safe, safe." Finally, she made it to the top. She looked around and asked, "Mom, did I do it?" Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, Sarah. You did it! You were very brave." Sarah was very happy and proud of herself. She knew that she could do it if she was safe!

Billy was playing with his blocks. He had built a very tall tower. It was almost as big as him! He was very clever. Suddenly, he heard someone yell. It was his mom, saying it was time for dinner. Billy was excited. He loved dinner, but he didn't want to stop playing. So he yelled, "I don't wanna stop playing!" His mom laughed. She said, "I understand, but it's already time for dinner. You can play with the blocks again after you eat." Billy reluctantly put down the blocks, but he was still excited for dinner. He couldn't wait to eat and then get back to the blocks!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to draw and design things. One day, he drew a picture of a big, high wall. His mom saw the picture and said, "Wow, Timmy, you're such a good artist! Did you design that wall all by yourself?" Timmy smiled and said, "Yes, I did! I want to build a big, high wall like that someday." His mom replied, "That sounds like a great idea, Timmy. Maybe we can build a wall together in our backyard." Timmy was so happy and excited to hear that. He couldn't wait to start building his big, high wall with his mom.

Once upon a time, there was a violin. It was delicate and shiny and it made a sound like no other. Every day, the violin rolled around the house, and wherever it went, it sang a happy song.  One day, a little girl came to the house. She was three years old and she loved the sound of the violin. She followed it around the house, dancing and singing along. The little girl begged the violin to come and play with her.  The violin could roll around the room and the girl could keep up with it. They rolled together, back and forth, and they had so much fun! The little girl laughed and the violin made music.  When it was time to say goodbye, the violin rolled away, but the little girl still remembered the happy music it made. The delicate, shiny violin had made her day so special.

Once upon a time there was a panda who was very intelligent. He wanted to tell the world about his intelligence, so he asked his friends for help. His lion friend said he could shout about it, but his rabbit friend knew a better way. The rabbit told him to go to the park and show everyone by using his intelligence. So the panda went to the park and started doing lots of amazing things. He climbed a tree, jumped over a pond and even taught a group of birds some special tricks. Everyone was so impressed with the panda's skills and began to tell all of their friends. Soon enough, the whole park was full of people watching and cheering the intelligent panda. He was so proud of himself and decided to keep showing off his intelligence. The panda had become famous and everyone in the park was sure to tell everyone they knew about the intelligent panda. He was a big hit and the whole town was proud of him!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. He loved to play with his red ball. One sunny day, Tom went outside to play with his ball in the land near his home. Tom kicked the ball high in the sky. The ball went far, far away. Tom was sad because he could not find his ball. He walked and walked, looking for it. The land was big and sometimes dangerous. Tom knew he had to be careful. At last, Tom found his ball near a big tree. He was very happy. Tom knew he should not kick the ball too hard next time. He went back home, holding his ball tightly. Tom played safely in his yard, away from the dangerous land.

Once upon a time, there was a tall boy named Tim. Tim had a big bag with a zipper. One day, he wanted to weigh his bag to see how heavy it was. Tim asked his mom, "Mom, can you help me weigh my bag?" His mom said, "Sure, Tim!" She put the bag on a big scale. The scale showed that the bag was very heavy. Tim opened the zipper of his bag. Inside, there were lots of toys! Tim took out some toys to make the bag lighter. Then, he closed the zipper and weighed the bag again. This time, the bag was not as heavy as before. Tim was happy and decided to share his toys with his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a girl called Tara. She was three years old and loved to balance on her toes. One day, her mom gave her a bar of soap in the shape of a star. It was pale pink, Tara's favorite color. Tara couldn't wait to play with it. She looked down at her feet and saw that she was standing on her toes. "I'm balancing!", she said out loud. Her mom smiled and said, "You're doing a great job, Tara! Keep balancing and have fun with the soap". Tara looked back up at her mom and replied, "Okay, Mommy. I will!" She hopped around the room, balancing on one foot for a few seconds at a time, and painting the walls pink with the pale pink soap. At the end of the day, Tara was so proud that she had balanced and made the whole room pink. She quickly ran over to her mom and said, "Look, Mommy! I balanced and made everything pink!" Her mom looked around the room with a big smile on her face. "Wonderful job, Tara! You are so talented!"

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his football. His football was the most special thing he had. One day, Timmy went to play with his friends in the park. But when he got there, he realized he forgot to unlock his door.  Timmy was very sad because he couldn't play with his football. He tried to open the door, but it was locked. Suddenly, he remembered that his dad had given him a special key to unlock the door. Timmy found the key and unlocked the door.  He was so happy that he could finally play with his ordinary football. Timmy and his friends played for hours until it was time to go home. Timmy went to bed that night feeling very proud of himself for unlocking the door and getting to play with his football.

Tom and Lily were playing on the lawn with their ball. They liked to kick the ball to each other and run after it. They were having fun and laughing. But then, a big dog came out of nowhere and ran towards them. The dog was unknown to them. It had black fur and sharp teeth. It barked loudly and chased the ball. Tom and Lily were scared. They dropped the ball and ran to the house. They shouted for their mom. "Mom, mom, there is a big dog on the lawn! It is unknown and scary!" Mom heard them and came out. She saw the dog and recognized it. It was their neighbor's dog, Rex. He had escaped from his yard. Mom called the neighbor and told him to come and get Rex. She also told Rex to behave and leave the ball alone. Rex heard mom and stopped barking. He looked at mom and wagged his tail. He was not mean, just playful. The neighbor came and apologized. He took Rex back to his yard and fixed the fence. Mom hugged Tom and Lily and told them they were brave. She gave them cookies and milk and a new ball. They thanked mom and smiled. They were happy and safe. They decided to play inside for a while. They hoped Rex would behave next time.

Once upon a time, there was a brilliant king. He was the best king in the world. The king loved to use his imagination. He imagined many wonderful things. One day he decided to go for a walk in his garden. Suddenly, he heard a small voice. He looked around and noticed a little bird. The king smiled and said: "Hello, my friend! What is your name?" The little bird answered: "My name is Tweetie! And I can help you imagine something really special!" The king was delighted. He said: "I would love to imagine something special! What should I do?" Tweetie told him that he had to close his eyes, imagine a beautiful garden and then he would be able to see the most brilliant things. The king did as he was told and before he knew it, he was surrounded by the most magical things he had ever seen! The king was so happy with what he had imagined. He thanked Tweetie for helping him and then continued his walk in his now brilliant garden.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play in the water and take baths. Every time she finished, her mommy would give her a towel to dry off. One day, Lily decided to hide the towel instead of putting it away in the store.  When her mommy asked for the towel, Lily couldn't find it. Her mommy got impatient and asked why Lily didn't put it away in the store. Lily felt bad and realized that hiding things wasn't a good idea.  Her mommy hugged her and said, "It's okay, Lily. We all make mistakes. But it's important to be responsible and put things away where they belong so we can find them when we need them." Lily promised to always put things away in the store from then on.  The moral of the story is that it's important to be responsible and put things away where they belong, so we don't lose them and make others upset.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the grass. One day, she met a gray cat.  "Hello, little cat," said Lily.  "Meow," replied the cat.  Lily petted the cat and they became friends. They played in the grass together and had so much fun.  After a while, Lily's mom called her inside for dinner.  "I have to go now, cat. But we can meet again tomorrow," said Lily.  "Meow," replied the cat.  Lily went inside with a smile on her face, happy to have made a new friend.

Tim and Sam liked to play in the garden. They liked to dig and plant and water. They liked to see the flowers and the bugs and the birds. But they did not like the big fence that was around the garden. The fence was old and brown and had holes in it. They wanted to see what was on the other side of the fence. One day, they found a big hole in the fence. They looked at each other and smiled. They crawled through the hole and saw a new garden. But this garden was not like their garden. This garden was dark and dirty and had no flowers or bugs or birds. It had only weeds and trash and a bad smell. They saw a big pile of fruit that looked like it was rotting. The fruit was black and green and had worms in it. Tim and Sam felt scared and sad. They wanted to go back to their garden. But then they saw something shiny in the pile of fruit. It was a can of soda. They liked soda. They thought it was sweet and fizzy. They ran to the can and opened it. They took a sip and made a face. The soda was not sweet and fizzy. It was sour and flat. It tasted like the rotting fruit. Tim and Sam spit out the soda and threw the can away. They felt sick and sorry. They realized they had made a mistake. They crawled back through the hole and ran to their garden. They hugged their flowers and their bugs and their birds. They never went to the other side of the fence again. They learned that some things are not what they seem. And that their garden was the best garden in the world.

Once upon a time there was a hero who was brave and strong. She was always ready to help those who were in need. One day the hero was walking through the town when she heard a loud yelling. She looked around and saw a little boy, pushing against a wall but he couldn’t move it.  The hero rushed to help him, but she was surprised when the boy thanked her before she had even done anything. The hero then leaned against the wall and it quickly moved away. The boy was so happy! The hero smiled and said, “You’re a brave and strong little boy! You didn’t need me after all!”  The boy thanked the hero again and said, “You are a real hero!”  The hero smiled and said, “We all can be heroes when we try our best!”

Once there was a little boy who was playing in his bathtub. He had lots of fun, splashing the water with his hands. He started to get all wet so his mommy gave him a big bar of soap.  He started to play with the soap and it made big bubbles. The little boy loved the bubbles, they felt so nice on his skin. He wanted to keep playing with them but soon they were all gone. The little boy wanted more bubbles so he grabbed his toy alligator. He put some fake soap in the alligators mouth and splashed it in the water. Suddenly, lots of bubbles started to appear.  The little boy was so excited to have more bubbles that he forgot he was playing in the bathtub. He had such a great time making bubbles with his alligator that he forgot to get all clean.

Anna and Ben are friends. They like to play outside. But today the weather is bad. It is cold and wet. They cannot go to the park or ride their bikes. "Let's play inside," Anna says. "We can make signs for our rooms." "OK," Ben says. "That sounds fun. What kind of signs do you want to make?" Anna thinks for a moment. She likes modern things. She likes bright colors and shapes. She says, "I want to make a sign with a star and a heart. And I want to write my name in big letters. What about you?" Ben likes modern things too. But he likes different colors and shapes. He says, "I want to make a sign with a circle and a square. And I want to write my name in small letters. Let's go get some paper and crayons." They go to Anna's room. They find some paper and crayons. They start to make their signs. They draw and color. They write their names. They are happy. They show each other their signs. "Wow, your sign is very modern," Anna says. "I like your circle and square. They look cool." "Thank you," Ben says. "Your sign is very modern too. I like your star and heart. They look pretty." They smile at each other. They are proud of their signs. They hang them on their doors. They say, "These are our rooms. These are our signs. We are modern friends."

Once there was a girl called Lucy. The sun was shining brightly and Lucy wanted to go outside and play. She grabbed her favourite flute and happily skipped outside. But when Lucy went outside, she started to feel bored. She looked around, but there was nothing to do! Then she started to panic. Where had her flute gone? Suddenly, she remembered that she had lost it when she was skipping. Lucy looked everywhere for her flute but it was nowhere to be found! Suddenly, from behind a bush, she heard a familiar sound. It was her lost flute! Lucy ran over and grabbed her flute. She hugged it tightly and felt very happy her flute hadn't been lost forever. Lucy happily skipped back inside and knew that she wouldn't ever lose her flute again. She knew that being bored was much more fun than losing her favourite flute!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a big, modern house with her mommy and daddy. One day, while playing outside, Lily found a shiny, red balloon. She was so happy and played with it all day long. But when it was time for bed, Lily realized the balloon was gone. She looked everywhere but couldn't find it. She started to cry and suffer because she loved that balloon so much. Her mommy and daddy tried to comfort her, but it didn't work. The next day, Lily's mommy took her to the store to buy a new balloon. They picked out a beautiful blue one with a number 5 on it. Lily was happy again and played with it all day. But when it was time for bed, she remembered what happened to the red balloon and was afraid she would lose this one too. However, this time she made sure to hold it tight and not let it go. From that day on, Lily learned to take care of her things and not suffer when she lost them.

Once upon a time there was a kind little girl named Lily. She wanted to help animals in the sea, so she swam out to find them. She saw a big shark swimming and she said, "Hi! Can I help you?". The shark was scared and quickly turned around. She said to Lily, "No, I'm scared you will hurt me." Lily said, "I won't hurt you. I only want to help you".  The shark said, "Thank you for offering to help, but I'm too scared. I can only trust my own kind. You should go find someone else that needs your help". Lily swam back but she was sad. She had hoped the shark would want her help. She realized that sometimes it's hard to trust someone that is not like us, even if they are kind. So she decided to use her kindness to help others find friendship and trust too.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play with her hoop. She would roll it around and try to make it go up and down. One day, Lily's friend Timmy came to play with her. "Can I play with your hoop?" Timmy asked. "Sure!" Lily said. "But it's a little big for you. Maybe we can improve it to make it fit better." They went to Lily's dad and asked him to help. He cut the hoop down to size and made it fit just right for Timmy. They played together for hours, rolling the hoop back and forth and having lots of fun.  "Thanks for improving the hoop, Lily's dad!" Timmy said. "You're welcome," Lily's dad replied. "I'm glad you two had a good time."

Once upon a time, there was a large family of bears. They were usually very happy and shared lots of hugs and food together.  One day, the youngest bear was feeling worried. He didn't want to share his toast with anyone else.  The mother bear smiled at him and said, "Little one, why don't you want to share your toast?"  The little bear shrugged sadly and said, "I'm worried that I won't have enough for everyone." But the mother bear told him that there were enough pieces of toast to share with everyone in the family. Everyone was able to eat a delicious snack.  The little bear was so happy! They all shared the toast and it was the most delicious snack ever.  The end.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jane. She loved to explore new things, so one day she decided to go on a nature walk. As she walked, she spotted something shiny in the grass; it was a pipe! She was so excited and quickly grabbed it. As Jane examined the pipe, she realized that it was a toy! She was about to play with it when she heard someone call out to her.  “That’s my pipe!” called an old man from across the field. Jane was very sorry to have taken someone else's toy and quickly put it back. The old man smiled at her and said “It’s ok. You can keep it, but please don’t forget to take good care of it.” Jane was so happy and nodded her head in agreement. She decided to take the pipe home and promised to keep it safe.  She thanked the old man and quickly ran home with the pipe. She was so excited to show it to her family and her friends. Jane decided to play with the pipe everyday and she never forgot how sorry she was for taking it without permission.

Once upon a time, there was a round ball called Joe. Joe was sad because he wanted to play with his friends, but he was all alone. So Joe went in search of his friends, but he couldn’t find them anywhere. He looked high and low, but there was no one around. Joe started to feel even more sad. Then Joe heard some music in the distance. He guessed it must be his friends. Joe was so happy and he ran to see who it was. And there they were, all Joe’s friends playing with music and dancing! They saw Joe and said, with happy faces, “We’ve been looking for you Joe, join us!” So Joe went and joined his friends and they all played and danced together. Joe was so happy that his sadness was gone! The End.

Tommy was happy to be in the backyard. He saw his friends gathered there with their jump ropes. He was a bit envious that they had jump ropes but he was still very excited. He looked around the backyard and saw so many things to play with and explore. He ran around the backyard searching for something interesting. After a few minutes of searching, he found some string that was lying on the grass. He quickly grabbed it and gathered his friends together. They all set to work making circle shapes with the string.  Happy with their creation, Tommy's friends started playing together. Tommy was so happy to be part of the fun in the backyard. He watched as his friends jumped their ropes and ran around him. He wished he his own jump rope but he still felt content to be with his friends.  His friends finally stopped playing and all gathered around Tommy as they talked and laughed. They never seemed to get bored in the backyard. Tommy was glad he could be part of such wonderful memories.

Sara liked to question everything. She always asked why, how, and what. She wanted to learn new things and understand the world. Her mom and dad liked her curiosity, but sometimes they got tired of answering so many questions. One day, Sara saw a cake on the table. It was round and brown and had white cream on top. It looked yummy, but it was different from the cakes she had before. She wondered what it was made of and how it tasted. She asked her mom, "What is this cake?" Her mom smiled and said, "This is a chocolate cake. It is made of flour, sugar, eggs, butter, and cocoa. Cocoa is a powder that comes from a plant and gives the cake a brown color and a sweet flavor. Do you want to try a piece?" Sara nodded eagerly. She loved sweets and wanted to try new things. Her mom cut a small slice and gave it to her on a plate. Sara took a bite and felt the soft cake and the smooth cream in her mouth. She liked the taste very much. It was sweet and rich and different from the other cakes she had before. She said, "Mmm, this is good. Thank you, mom." Her mom hugged her and said, "You're welcome, Sara. I'm glad you like it. You can have another piece later, but first you have to eat your lunch. Do you have any more questions?" Sara thought for a moment. She still had many questions, but she decided to save them for later. She said, "No, mom. I'm ready to eat my lunch. But can I ask you something later?" Her mom nodded and said, "Of course, Sara. You can always ask me anything. I love your questions. They show me how smart and curious you are."

Once upon a time, there was a silly dog named Will. Will liked to collect sticks. Every day, he would go outside and find more sticks to add to his big pile. One day, Will went to the park to collect more sticks. He found a big stick, a small stick, and a long stick. He was very happy with his new sticks. Will carried them all the way back to his home. When he got home, Will's friend, a cat named Sam, saw his big pile of sticks. Sam thought it was very silly. But Will didn't care. He loved his sticks and was proud of his collection. They played with the sticks all day and had lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her hoop in the park. One day, she went to the park with her friends, but the park was very messy. There were toys everywhere and the children were running around and screaming.  Lily decided to help her friends organize the toys. She asked her friends to gather all the toys and put them in one place. They worked together and soon all the toys were organized.  After they finished, Lily and her friends played with the hoop. They were very calm and happy because they had organized the toys. They had a great time playing together and promised to always keep the park clean and organized.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat pastries and would always ask her mom to buy her some. One day, she saw a pastry on the ground and picked it up. It was filthy and covered in dirt, but Lily didn't care. She ate it anyway. Her mom told her, "Lily, don't eat things off the ground. It's not safe." But Lily didn't listen. She kept eating dirty pastries she found on the ground. One day, Lily got really sick. She had to go to the hospital and stay there for a long time. Her mom told her, "Lily, you should have listened to me. Eating dirty things is not good for you. Now you're very sick and it's all because you didn't listen." The moral of the story is to always listen to your parents and not eat things off the ground. Lily learned her lesson the hard way.

Once upon a time there was a wild figure. He lived in the forest and liked to explore. One day he heard a strange noise. He stopped and wondered, "What is that?" He followed the noise and found a little girl playing in the field. She had bright eyes and a big smile. The figure said hello and the girl looked up and smiled. The girl pointed to the sky and asked "What is that?" The figure looked up and saw a bird flying above. He told the girl it was a bird and watched as she twirled and laughed in delight. The figure was curious and asked the girl lots of questions. He wanted to know all about her. The girl talked about her day and the wild animals she had seen. They laughed together and became friends. At the end of the day the girl waved goodbye to the figure with a happy smile. The figure watched her walk away and was glad he was able to answer her questions. He continued on his way, content that he had met a new friend. The end.

Once upon a time there was a girl named Bella. Bella was 3 years old, and loved to explore new things. One day, Bella was in her house when her mom asked her a question. "Bella, sweetheart, do you know where the bathroom is?" Bella smiled and answered, "Yes! I know!" Then she ran off to find the bathroom.  Bella opened the door to the bathroom and inside she saw a tub full of water. She thought it looked fun and wanted to get in. So she stepped in, but it was too slippery and she fell. Bella was hurt and started to cry. Her mom heard her crying and quickly came to comfort her.  Bella's mom hugged her and wiped away her tears. She said, "It's ok, sweetheart. You're not hurt anymore. Everything's ok."  Bella was happy again and smiled. She climbed out of the tub and her mom helped her get dressed. Then they did something fun together.  The End.

One day, a little girl named Lucy went to the park. She saw a boy named Tom with a wet napkin. Tom looked sad. Lucy asked, "Why is your napkin wet?" Tom said, "I spilled water on it. Now, I can't use it to clean my hands." Lucy thought for a moment. She said, "I recommend using the sun to dry your napkin. The sun is warm and can make it dry." Tom smiled and put the wet napkin in the sun. They played while they waited for the napkin to dry. After a while, the napkin was dry. Tom was very happy and thanked Lucy for her help. They both learned that helping each other is a good thing to do. And they became best friends, always ready to help one another.

Tom and Lily like to play in the park. They run and jump and swing and slide. They have fun and get good exercise. One day, they see a big dog in the park. The dog is black and furry and has a loud bark. Tom and Lily are scared of the dog. They think the dog will chase them and bite them. They run away from the dog and hide behind a tree. They hug each other and hope the dog will go away. They hear the dog barking and running around the park. But then, they hear another voice. It is a man. He says, "Rex, come here, boy. Good dog, Rex. Where are you, Rex?" Tom and Lily peek from behind the tree. They see the man with a leash and a ball. He is looking for the dog. He is the dog's owner. The dog sees the man and runs to him. He wags his tail and licks his face. He is happy to see the man. He is not a bad dog. He is a friendly dog. The man sees Tom and Lily behind the tree. He smiles and waves at them. He says, "Hi, kids. Do you want to play with Rex? He is a good dog. He likes to play fetch and give kisses. He won't hurt you. He just wants to have fun." Tom and Lily look at each other. They are not scared anymore. They are curious. They come out from behind the tree and walk to the man and the dog. They pet the dog and throw the ball for him. They laugh and play with him. They make a new friend. They learn that the dog is not scary. He is good. They have more fun and get more exercise. They are happy.

Once upon a time, there was a 3 year old boy named Jack. He liked to play with his toys, but today he was looking for something different. Then, all of a sudden, he heard a voice. The voice said, "Come in and get some yarn!" Jack was very excited and ran to the door. He opened it and entered. Inside was a shop full of colorful yarn! It was all very exciting. He then saw a woman sitting behind the counter. She was kind, yet bossy. She showed him all kinds of wonderful yarn. He chose a bright green one and ran over to a corner to play with it. He made a big ball with the green yarn. He played with it all afternoon and had lots of fun. When the day was done, Jack thanked the bossy woman for the yarn and ran outside, back to his home, with a smile on his face. And that is the story of how Jack found his special yarn.

Once upon a time there was a thin sack. One day, the sack was walking in the woods when it saw a pie on the ground. The sack was so hungry, it wanted to eat the pie. The sack asked, "Can I eat this pie?" Suddenly, a voice came from the sky.  "Do not eat, sack," the voice said. The sack was confused. Why not eat it? The voice said, "It's not yours and if you eat it, the other animals won't have anything to eat. You should share so everyone can enjoy it." The sack thought carefully and realized the voice was right. It did not eat the pie, but took it to a nearby stream and placed it down. The sack looked around to make sure no one was there. Then it broke up the pie into small pieces and spread it all around the stream. Soon, lots of animals came to the stream and ate the pie. Everyone was happy, including the thin sack. The moral of the story is that sharing is caring. Nobody should take something that doesn't belong to them, but instead should think of others and share with them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily wanted to know more about magnets. She asked her mom, “What are magnets?” Her mom told her, “Magnets are very impressive. They pull things to them.” Lily was excited. She wanted to see a magnet for herself. She went to the store and found the most incredible magnet. It was a rainbow and it glittered in the light. Lily was so excited and she wanted to show her friends what she knew about magnets. She took out the magnet and showed them how it would attract things. It was so impressive! Her friends were so amazed. They all learned more about magnets. Lily was proud. She now knew a lot about magnets and had an impressive rainbow magnet to show her friends. She was so happy that she had learned something new.

John was a bald man who was looking for his phone. He searched around his room and asked his 3 year old daughter for help. John: "Have you seen my phone sweetheart?" Daughter: "No, I haven't seen it." John looked all around the house but still could not find his phone. He became frustrated and started shouting. John: "Where is my phone?!" His daughter started crying and ran out of the room. John was feeling guilty and followed after her. He found his daughter in the kitchen looking at the counter. Daughter: "It's there!" John saw his phone on the counter and smiled. He picked up the phone and hugged his daughter. John: "Thank you for finding my phone, sweetheart!" His daughter smiled and hugged him back. From then on, John was more careful to keep his phone in the same place.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the sunshine and watch the big, fluffy clouds go by. One day, she saw an ancient tree in the park and decided to go see it up close. When she got there, she saw a man kneeling next to the tree. He was looking up at the branches and smiling. Lily asked him what he was doing and he said he was talking to the tree. Lily thought that was very funny, but the man explained that he believed the tree was very old and wise and had many stories to tell. Lily thought about that for a while and then looked up at the clouds again. She wondered if they had stories to tell too. Maybe if she knelt down and listened closely, she could hear them whispering their secrets. So she knelt down and closed her eyes, and listened very carefully. But all she could hear was the sound of the wind blowing through the leaves of the ancient tree.

Today was a big day for Mommy, Daddy, and their little girl. They were going on an adventure!  Mommy packed a big bag with all the things they would need. Daddy had a flag to fly when they arrived.  The girl was so excited. She was so playful, and while Mommy and Daddy packed the car, she ran all around the house, dreaming about their trip.  Finally, Mommy and Daddy were finished packing and the car was ready to go. Mommy called, "It's time to go!" The little girl cheered, grabbed the flag, and off they drove.  The adventure was about to begin!

Once there was a little girl named Sadie. She was three years old and loved to sing. Everywhere she went she brought a microphone and sang loudly.  One day Sadie's mother said to her, "Sadie why don't you go outside and have some fun in the sunshine?".  Sadie excitedly said, "Yes! I will go jump in the puddles".
