Her mom said, "No, don't jump in the puddles, because it will make you wet. Instead, why don't you soak your feet in the fountain".  Sadie replied, "That sounds like fun mommy!" So, she skipped over to the fountain and gently stepped in. The water felt cool and healthy on her feet.  Suddenly Sadie spotted something sparkling in the water. It was a microphone! Sadie bent down and carefully plucked it from the fountain. She gave it a good squeeze and it still worked.  Sadie joyfully shouted, "Mommy, look what I found in the fountain! It's a microphone for me to sing with".  Her mother smiled and said, "That's wonderful! Now you can sing as loud as you want".  So, Sadie began to belt out her favorite tune. She sang and splashed in the fountain with her microphone, feeling happy and healthy.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird who loved to fly in the sky. One day, the bird saw a big, mean cat who wanted to eat him. The bird was scared and cried for help, but no one heard him. The bird tried to fly away, but the cat was too fast. The cat caught the little bird and ate him up. The sky turned dark and sad, and all the other birds cried too. It was a very sad day, but the other birds remembered the helpful little bird and how he loved to fly in the sky. They decided to always remember him and be kind to each other.

One day, a dolphin named Bob was swimming in the sea. He saw a boat with a man. The man was eating something that looked good. Bob swam closer and saw that it was spicy food. The man saw Bob and gave him a big smile. Bob nodded his head and smiled back. The man had an idea. He thought that if he gave Bob some of the spicy food, they could be friends. He held out the food for Bob to eat. Bob was happy to try the food, but he did not know that it was spicy. He took a bite and his mouth started to feel hot. Bob did not like the spicy food. It was too hot for him. He tried to swim away, but the man did not want Bob to leave. He tried to give Bob more spicy food, but Bob did not want it. He wanted to go back to his family. The man did not let Bob go, and Bob was sad.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his ball. One day, he went to the park to play with his ball. He kicked the ball so hard that it went over the fence. Timmy was sad because he couldn't get his ball back. Then, he saw a switch on the fence. He wondered what it did. He flicked the switch and the fence opened. Timmy was happy that he could get his ball back. Suddenly, a man came and asked Timmy if he had opened the fence. Timmy said yes and the man thanked him. The man said that the fence was smooth and needed a switch to open it. Timmy was happy that he could help the man. They both went home with a smile on their faces. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play hide-and-seek. One day, she found a great hiding spot behind a big tree. She was so hidden that no one could find her! As she sat there, she blinked her eyes and thought about her opinion on the game. She decided that it was the best game ever because it was so much fun. Suddenly, she heard her friend calling out her name. "Where are you, Lily?" her friend asked. Lily giggled and replied, "I'm hidden behind the big tree!" Her friend found her and they both laughed and played together. From that day on, they played hide-and-seek every day and Lily's opinion never changed. It was still the best game ever!

Once upon a time, there were two friends. Their names were Sarah and Bill. Sarah had an idea. She wanted to borrow a towel from Bill. Bill said, "No,Sarah. That is a dangerous thing to do." He was scared that it would be too difficult for her. Sarah disagreed. She really wanted to borrow the towel. "Please, Bill," she begged. "I just need it for a little while." Bill sighed. He knew that Sarah really wanted the towel. Finally, he said, "OK, but you have to be careful. Towels can be dangerous." So Sarah borrowed the towel from Bill. She was very careful, and she had a lot of fun with it. Finally, she returned the towel safely to Bill. The end.

Sam loved to rock. His dad had a big old rocking chair with smooth wood that slid back and forth. Every day after school Sam would head over to the rocking chair, jump inside and start to rock softly. He imagined he was on an adventure - sailing across the sea, flying high in the sky or even exploring a far away land. “The motion of the rocking chair helps me think up new stories,” Sam said to himself one day. Just then Mom peered into the room. “Are you sure you’re not swaying too much, Sammy?” she asked. Sam stopped rocking, embarrassed. “Sorry, mom,” he said. Mom smiled. “It’s ok, sweetheart. I’m just making sure you’re being careful.” Sam resumed his rocking, this time moving slower and more gently. He let his thoughts take him away on a new journey and he soon forgot all about his mom. Soon he was back in his favorite place - the rocking chair. He felt safe and secure as he moved back and forth. Sam smiled - he knew that no matter where his imagination took him, he could always come back to the rocking chair.

Once upon a time there was a creative clown. He liked to have fun and make people laugh. One day he decided he wanted to take a bath. He filled the tub with warm water and bubbles and hopped right in. He laughed and splashed around, so happy to be enjoying a fun bath. After a while, he hopped out and put on his colorful clown costume. He went out to the park to entertain the kids with all his clowning around. They loved to watch him be creative and excitedly laughed and cheered. The creative clown was so happy and ready to have fun!

Lily and Ben were friends. They liked to play in the park. One day, they saw a new boy sitting on a bench. He looked sad and lonely. He had a blue hat and a blue bike. "Hi, what is your name?" Lily asked the boy. "I am Max. I just moved here. I don't know anyone," the boy said. "Do you want to play with us?" Ben asked. "We have a ball and a kite. We can have fun." Max smiled. He liked the ball and the kite. He wanted to have fun. He said yes. Lily and Ben welcomed Max. They played together. They kicked the ball, flew the kite, and ran around. They laughed and talked. They became friends. They saw a big bin in the park. It was full of waste. People had thrown away cans, bottles, and papers. It was dirty and smelly. "That is not good," Lily said. "We should not waste things. We should keep the park clean." "You are right," Ben said. "We can help. We can pick up the waste and put it in the bin." Max agreed. He said he had a bag in his bike. He got the bag and gave it to Lily and Ben. They used the bag to collect the waste. They put the waste in the bin. They made the park clean. They were happy. They had done a good thing. They had made a new friend. They hugged each other. They said goodbye. They went home. They looked forward to playing again.

Sara and Ben were playing in the snow. They made a big snowman with a hat and a scarf. They also made snowballs and threw them at each other. They laughed and had fun. "Look, a jet!" Ben said, pointing at the sky. He saw a white line behind a fast plane. "It makes a sound like this: vroom!" Sara looked up and saw the jet too. She liked how it flew high and fast. She wondered where it was going. "Maybe it is going to a warm place, where there is no snow," she said. "Maybe," Ben said. "But I like the snow. It is icy and soft and fun. Do you want to make a snow angel?" Sara nodded. She lay down on the snow and moved her arms and legs. She made a shape like an angel. Ben did the same. They looked at their snow angels and smiled. But then they heard a loud horn. It was a big truck coming down the road. It was carrying a lot of logs. The truck driver saw the children and the snowman. He did not want to hit them. He pressed the brake and the horn. He yelled, "Yield, yield, yield!" Sara and Ben heard the horn and the yell. They were scared. They jumped up and ran to the sidewalk. They held each other and watched the truck. The truck stopped just before the snowman. The snowman was safe. The truck driver got out of the truck. He was angry and worried. He walked to the children and said, "Are you okay? You should not play on the road. It is dangerous. You have to yield to the trucks. Do you know what yield means?" Sara and Ben nodded. They felt sorry and ashamed. They said, "Yes, we know. Yield means to let the trucks go first. We are sorry. We did not see the truck. We were looking at the jet." The truck driver sighed. He was glad that the children were not hurt. He said, "It's okay. I'm glad you are okay. But please be careful next time. And don't play on the road. Play in the park or in your yard. And enjoy the snow. It is icy and soft and fun." Sara and Ben said, "Thank you. We will. And we are sorry again." The truck driver smiled. He said, "You're welcome. And don't be sorry. Just be safe. And have fun." He got back in his truck and drove away. Sara and Ben waved at him. They looked at their snowman and their snow angels. They were happy. They decided to play in the park. They took their snowballs and ran to the park. They laughed and had fun.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved to collect shiny rocks, but her favorite was a sparkly gem. She would show it to everyone who visited her house, and they all thought it was very pretty. One day, Lily's friend came over and saw the gem. She said, "Wow, you're so lucky to own such a beautiful gem!" Lily smiled and felt proud. She loved owning the gem and showing it off to her friends. Lily was an intelligent girl and knew how to take care of her gem. She kept it safe in a special box and would clean it every day. She wanted to make sure her gem stayed shiny and beautiful forever. And every time she looked at it, she felt happy and grateful to own such a special treasure.

Jill was playing in the living room with her favourite toy bunny. She loved to rub the bunny's soft, white fur. Suddenly, she heard a voice say, "Do you want to go on an adventure?". Jill looked around, but she couldn't see who had said it. She searched and searched but still, she couldn't find the source of the voice.  Finally, she saw a tiny door, and when she opened it, a magical world appeared. Jill gasped with amazement as she realised she was at an oasis! There were so many things to explore, and Jill felt very excited. She ran over to the sandy bank, and started to rub the warm sand between her fingers.  The sand felt amazing and Jill could hardly believe how lucky she was. Then, a friendly creature stepped out of the bushes and said, "It's glad to have you here. You can rub the sand all you want." Jill smiled because she knew she had made a new friend, and she couldn't wait to explore the oasis more.

Once upon a time, there was a big, big hole in the ground. It was so huge that it could fit a house inside. One day, a little boy named Timmy was walking near the hole with his mom.  "Mommy, can we go down the hole?" asked Timmy. "No, Timmy. It's too dangerous. We need to remain safe," said his mom. Timmy was sad that he couldn't explore the hole. But then, he saw a group of workers nearby. They were setting up a ladder and ropes. "What are you doing?" asked Timmy. "We're going down the hole to see what's inside," said one of the workers. Timmy was excited. He wanted to go down too. But his mom reminded him to remain safe and not go near the hole.  Later that day, the workers came back up from the hole. They had found something amazing - a huge treasure chest! Timmy was happy for them, but he knew that he had to remain patient and wait until he was older to explore the hole himself.

One day, Bob and his sister Sally decided to go for a ride. As they headed outside, they saw their mom discussing something with their dad. The conversation seemed serious.  "What are they discussing?", asked Sally. Bob looked alert as he answered, "I think they're talking about the motor in the car." So Bob and Sally decided to have a look. When they reached the car, they saw a big motor inside! It was shiny and brightly coloured. Bob and Sally were very curious and asked their parents a lot of questions about the motor.  Mom and dad were very happy to explain everything to the children and told them all about how the motor worked. Bob and Sally were very pleased to learn all about the motor and thanked their parents before heading back inside to play.

Sara and Tom were playing with their toys in the living room. Sara had a tea set and Tom had a truck. Sara wanted to have a tea party with Tom, but Tom did not want to. "Tom, come and have tea with me," Sara said. "I have cups and plates and cookies." "No, I want to play with my truck," Tom said. "It is fast and loud and fun." Sara was stubborn. She did not like it when Tom said no. She picked up the teapot and walked over to Tom. She poured some water from the teapot onto Tom's truck. "Hey, stop that!" Tom shouted. "You are making my truck wet and dirty!" Sara laughed. She thought it was funny to pour water on Tom's truck. She poured some more water on Tom's head. "Stop it, stop it, stop it!" Tom cried. He was wet and cold and angry. Sara did not stop. She poured all the water from the teapot on Tom and his truck. She was having fun. Tom had enough. He grabbed the teapot from Sara and threw it on the floor. It broke into pieces. The water spilled everywhere. The pieces were white and sharp. Sara and Tom both gasped. They knew they were in trouble. They heard their mom coming. "What is going on here?" their mom asked. She saw the water, the broken teapot, and the wet and dirty children. She was not happy. Sara and Tom looked at each other. They did not know what to say. They wished they had played nicely.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved pastries, especially the ones with sweet jam inside. One day, she went to the bakery with her mom to buy some pastries.  Lily saw a spicy pastry and asked her mom, "Can I have that one, please?"  Her mom replied, "That one is too spicy for you, Lily. You won't like it."  But Lily was determined to try it, so her mom bought it for her. She took a bite and her mouth felt hot, but she liked the taste.  Lily said to her mom, "I gained a new favorite pastry today! Thank you for letting me try it."

Lily and Tom are twins. They like to study many things. They study books, toys, animals and plants. They are very intelligent. One day, they go to the store with Mom. Mom wants to buy some food and clothes. Lily and Tom want to buy some books and puzzles. They see a big shelf with many books and puzzles. They run to the shelf and look at them. "Look, Tom, this book has many pictures of dinosaurs. I want to study dinosaurs. They are big and strong and have sharp teeth. Do you want to study dinosaurs too?" Lily asks. "Yes, Lily, I want to study dinosaurs too. But I also want to study this puzzle. It has many pieces and colors. It looks fun and hard. Do you want to study this puzzle too?" Tom replies. "OK, Tom, we can study both. Let's ask Mom if we can buy them. Maybe she will say yes. She likes when we study and learn new things. She says we are very intelligent." Lily says. They take the book and the puzzle and go to Mom. They show her what they want to buy. Mom smiles and nods. She is proud of Lily and Tom. She says they are very intelligent and curious. She buys the book and the puzzle for them. They thank her and hug her. They go home and study the book and the puzzle. They learn many things about dinosaurs and colors and shapes. They have fun and are happy. They are very intelligent.

Once upon a time, there was a child. She was very happy because today was the day she was going to learn how to swim! The child's family brought her to the pool. The water was so shiny and there were red swimmers everywhere. The child felt so excited and couldn't wait to start. The child's mom and dad said, "The most important rule is to always listen to your swimming teacher." The child nodded her head. The swimming teacher said, "Let's get into the water. Come on everyone, it's time to swim!" The child jumped into the pool with the other swimmers. Everyone was having so much fun swimming around. The child was picking up lots of skills, like kicking with her feet and moving her arms. At the end of the day, the child said goodbye to her swimming teacher and smiled. She was so proud of herself for learning how to swim!

Once upon a time, there was a bunny. He wanted to dance, so he hopped out of his burrow. He felt so happy and excited.  But then, he saw an empty operation room. He was very scared and wanted to go back home. He didn't want to dance anymore. But then, he saw a magical bunny that was wearing a pretty dress and dancing in the middle of the room. The magical bunny smiled at him and said, "Come join me!" So the bunny hopped closer and soon he was dancing too. They danced together for hours and hours. The bunny's fear was gone and he smiled from ear to ear.  When it was time to go, the magical bunny waved goodbye. The bunny smiled and waved back. From that day on, the bunny danced happily. He never felt afraid or empty.

Lily and Tom were friends who liked to play with boats. They made boats from paper, wood, and plastic. They took their boats to the pond and watched them sail on the water. They pretended they were sailors and pirates and explorers. One day, Lily and Tom found a big boat in the park. It was red and white and had a sail and a flag. They climbed on the boat and looked around. They saw a cake, a dress, and a ring. They wondered who left them there. Then they heard a voice. It was a man who said he was the owner of the boat. He said he was going to get married on the boat, but his bride did not come. He was sad and angry. He saw Lily and Tom and asked them what they were doing on his boat. Lily and Tom were scared. They said they were sorry and they just wanted to play. They said they liked his boat and his cake and his dress and his ring. They said they were polite and did not touch anything. The man looked at them and smiled. He said they were cute and brave. He said he did not need his cake and his dress and his ring anymore. He said he would give them to Lily and Tom if they wanted. He said they could play on his boat as long as they liked. Lily and Tom were happy. They thanked the man and said they were sorry for his marriage. They said they hoped he would find a new bride soon. They said they would share his cake and his dress and his ring. They said they would sail on his boat and have fun. They said they were friends.

Once upon a time, a little animal was walking in the forest. Suddenly, it started to panic because it could not find its mommy. It looked everywhere, but it was not available. It felt so scared and lonely.  The animal kept walking until it heard a familiar noise. It was its mommy’s voice! The animal ran as fast as it could towards the sound. When it got close enough, it realized that its mommy had been searching for it too.  As soon as the animal saw its mommy, it felt much better. It smiled and hugged her tightly. From that day, the animal made sure not to wander off too far; it drew a line on the ground, so it would always be available when mommy was looking for it!

One day, Mike wanted to fly his kite. He went outside and ran on the grass. His kite flew up above him, faster and faster, zooming in the sky. He felt so happy. The wind felt nice and the kite flew so light.  But then, the wind died down and Mike's kite faded away. It was too light and couldn't stay in the air. Mike tried to chase after it but it was too late. His kite was gone.  Mike was so sad. He watched the sky, hoping that his kite would come back, but it never did. He never got to fly his kite again.

Once upon a time, there was a deer named Bambi. Bambi wanted to play with his friends in the forest, but he couldn't find any comfortable clothes to wear. He tried on many clothes, but none of them fit him well.  Bambi felt sad and worried that he wouldn't be able to play with his friends. Suddenly, he saw a rabbit hopping towards him. The rabbit asked Bambi what was wrong, and Bambi told him about his problem.  The rabbit had an idea and took Bambi to a nearby store. There, they found a perfect outfit for Bambi that fit him just right. Bambi was so happy and grateful to the rabbit. He put on his new clothes and ran to play with his friends.  From that day on, Bambi learned that it's important to ask for help when you have a problem and that there's always a solution to every problem.

Once upon a time, there was a little ant who lived in a big garden. One day, the ant saw a big computer on the ground. The ant felt worried because it didn't know what the computer was for. Suddenly, the ant saw a crumb of bread on the keyboard. The ant crawled up to the bread and ate it.  The ant felt happy because it found food, but it was still worried about the computer. The ant crawled around the computer, trying to figure out what it was. Then, the ant saw a big spider crawling towards the computer too. The ant felt scared and crawled away quickly.  The spider crawled onto the computer and started typing on the keyboard with its eight legs. The ant watched in amazement as the spider used the computer to find a picture of a fly to eat. The ant realized that the computer was a useful tool and didn't need to be worried anymore.

Tim and Lily were playing in the park. They saw a big tower made of blocks. They wanted to climb it and see how high they could go. "Let's go to the tower!" Tim said. "OK, but be careful!" Lily said. They ran to the tower and started to climb. They were having fun, but they did not see the dark clouds in the sky. Soon, it started to rain. The rain was heavy and cold. It soaked their clothes and hair. The blocks became wet and slippery. "Oh no, the rain is bad!" Lily said. "We have to go down!" Tim said. But as they tried to go down, the tower started to fall. The blocks were cheap and weak. They could not hold the weight of the rain and the children. The tower crashed to the ground with a loud noise. Tim and Lily fell with it. They were not hurt, but they were very wet and dirty. They got up and looked at the mess. The tower was gone. The blocks were broken and scattered. They felt sad and angry. "Who made this tower? It was cheap and bad!" Tim said. "I don't know, but they should make a better one!" Lily said. They ran to their mom, who was waiting for them with an umbrella. She saw them and smiled. "Did you have fun, my darlings?" she asked. They shook their heads and told her what happened. She hugged them and said. "I'm sorry, that was not a good tower. But don't worry, we can make a new one at home. We have good blocks and glue. And we can dry your clothes and hair. Come on, let's go home!" They nodded and followed her. They still felt sad, but they also felt hopeful. They wanted to make a new tower, a better one. A tower that would not fall or soak. A tower that they could be proud of.

Once upon a time there was a princess who lived in a castle. One day she was walking close to the beach when she heard a sound coming from the ocean. She looked out and saw a little dog in the water. He was very nervous and he was swimming close to the shore but he just couldn't get out. The princess knew she had to rescue him so she wasted no time. She quickly called out to the little dog and he looked over at her with wide eyes. She then picked him up with both hands and carried him back to the beach. The princess and the dog both smiled in relief, but the princess still had to figure out where the dog came from. She sat down on the sand near a tall palm tree and the dog sat by her side. Suddenly, a boy appeared and he ran up to her and hugged the dog. He was so happy to see his puppy again!  The princess said goodbye to the happy boy and the dog, then walked back to her castle, feeling very satisfied. She was glad she was able to rescue the little dog and return him to his owner.

One day, an elephant was very eager to learn. He wanted to make something special. He saw a piece of paper, and decided to fold it. He carefully folded it over and over again. With each fold, he made something new.  The elephant was so excited. He had made something! He proudly showed his friends. They all oohed and ahhed. They thought it was so beautiful! The elephant kept practicing. He folded paper into shapes, animals, and all sorts of things. Then one day, he made something even better. He made an elephant out of paper.  He was so proud of himself. He shared his paper elephant with his friends. They all loved it and praised him for his hard work. Everyone had learned something new that day!

One sunny day, Mandy was walking around the playground with her friend Emily. Suddenly she noticed the stove and stared at it with admiration.  “Let’s go and look at it,” said Mandy.  Emily nodded her head in agreement and the two girls ran to the stove.   Mandy was fascinated by the graceful shape of the stove. She reached for the big handle and began to turn it.  “What are you doing?” asked Emily. Mandy replied, “I’m locking the stove so no one can use it.”  Emily laughed and said, “That’s silly, Mandy. Who would want to use a stove in the playground?” Mandy smiled and shrugged her shoulders.  “It was worth a try!” she said. The two girls laughed and skipped away, off to find something else to explore.

One warm summer day, a small girl named Charlotte ran out to the backyard with glee. She was so excited for a new adventure that day! She noticed a beautiful palm tree in the center of the backyard and ran towards it. When she made it to the base of the palms, she saw an ant on the ground inching its way up the trunk at a slow, steady pace. Charlotte watched it for a few moments, and then said, “hello ant! Why are you running so slow?” The ant looked up at her and said, “I'm running slow because I'm trying to reach the top of this palm tree, and that's a long way to go!” Charlotte smiled, and she said, “then let's both run together, so you can get there faster!”  The ant smiled back and said, “that sounds like a great idea!” So, the two of them started running together up the palm tree, faster and faster. Eventually, they made it to the top! Charlotte and the ant stopped at the top of the palm and looked down. They both smiled and Charlotte said, “thank you for running with me, my little ant friend. That was lots of fun!” The ant nodded and said, “me too, Charlotte. Until next time!” And with that, they went

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Emma. Emma loved to play with her ball. It was big and round, and it was the color orange. Emma would roll the ball around her yard and have so much fun. One day, Emma's ball rolled into the street. Emma knew it was not safe to go into the street, so she asked her mommy to help her get it. Emma's mommy went into the street and got the ball for her. Emma was happy and thanked her mommy. From then on, Emma was careful to not let her ball roll into the street again.

Mommy was worried. She had to find something special to decorate the house. Then she had an idea. She went outside and found a very cute caterpillar in the garden. The caterpillar was very colourful. Red and yellow! Mommy thought it would look good in the house. She carefully picked it up and brought it inside. Mommy put the caterpillar in the middle of the room and gave it lots of decorations to play with. She gave it a paintbrush, some paper and some colourful glitter. The caterpillar had so much fun decorating the house. When it was finished, the caterpillar looked very happy. Mommy was no longer worried. She was so happy that she gave the caterpillar a big hug.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They saw a big dog with sharp teeth. The dog was barking and running towards them. Lily and Ben were scared. They trembled and cried. "Help! Help!" they shouted. "The dog is dangerous!" But no one heard them. The dog was too fast. It jumped on Lily and bit her arm. She screamed in pain. Ben tried to help her, but the dog bit him too. They fell to the ground, bleeding and hurt. The dog ran away, looking for more food. Lily and Ben were alone. They wished their mom and dad were here. But they were not here yet. They did not know what to do. They were in trouble. They closed their eyes and hoped for help. But help did not come.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to bake cookies with her grandma. One day, Lily and her grandma made some dough for cookies. The dough was soft and squishy. Lily's grandma said, "We need to change the dough. Let's add some chocolate chips!"  Lily was excited and said, "Yay! Chocolate chips!" They put the chocolate chips in the dough and mixed it all up. Then they put the dough in the oven to bake.  After a few minutes, the cookies were done. They were so yummy and soft. Lily and her grandma ate the cookies together and had a happy day.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she was playing in the rain and she saw a big drain. She wanted to see what was inside the drain so she tried to look inside. But she was clumsy and she fell in! Lily's mom heard her cries and rushed to help her. "What happened, Lily?" her mom asked. "I fell in the drain," Lily said. "Oh no! Are you hurt?" her mom asked. "No, I'm okay. But I don't want to be clumsy anymore," Lily said. "Don't worry, Lily. You're not clumsy. You just need to be more careful," her mom said. Lily smiled and hugged her mom. "Thanks, Mom. You always know how to make me feel better," Lily said. From that day on, Lily was more careful and never fell in the drain again.

Once upon a time there was a funny little girl called Isla. She was so excited for a new day: she was about to arrive at a zero! Isla was so excited that she immediately jumped out of bed and ran around. She put on her most creative pink dress and set off. She didn't know what a zero was but she knew it was something different and special. When she arrived at the zero, Isla saw lots of colours and shapes. She explored the zero with her imagination and soon she was making up stories and creating her own little world. Isla stayed there the whole day and had lots of fun.  At the end of the day, Isla was tired but very happy. She had been creative and made new friends. She said goodbye with a big smile and she knew she would come back to the zero soon.

Lila and Sam liked to play with their toy cars. They had many cars of different colors and sizes. They made zoom sounds as they moved the cars on the floor. Sometimes they had races to see which car was faster. One day, they found a big box in the garage. It was heavy and had a picture of a train on it. They asked their mom if they could open it. She said yes, but they had to be careful. Inside the box, there was a train set with tracks, a locomotive, and some cars. Lila and Sam were very happy. They wanted to try the train set right away. They cleared some space on the floor and started to put the tracks together. They followed the instructions and made a circle with a bridge and a tunnel. Then they attached the locomotive and the cars to the tracks. They plugged in the power cord and turned on the switch. The train started to move. It made a chug-chug sound and a whistle. Lila and Sam watched the train go around the circle. They saw it cross the bridge and disappear into the tunnel. They clapped and cheered. They played with the train set for a long time. They took turns to control the speed and direction of the train. They pretended to be the conductor and the passengers. They had fun making stories about the train and its adventures. They forgot about their toy cars. When it was time for dinner, their mom called them. They turned off the switch and unplugged the power cord. They picked up the tracks and the train and put them back in the box. They lifted the box and carried it to the corner. It was still heavy. They settled the box on the floor and closed the lid. They said goodbye to the train and thanked their mom for the gift. They ran to the kitchen to wash their hands and eat. They decided to play with the train set again tomorrow.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Emma. She was only three years old, but she was very brave. One day Emma's mommy wanted to teach her something new. She wanted to teach Emma how to swim. Emma was a bit scared at first. But eventually, with lots of patience and gentle teaching, Emma learned how to swim. At the end of summer, Emma and her mommy went to the big pool. Emma was so proud to show her mommy what she had learned. She swam laps back and forth, and all the other people at the pool were very impressed. When Emma was done swimming, Mommy gave her a special medal for being so brave and for learning how to swim. It was a beautiful gold medal with a star on it. Emma was so excited. She got the best medal ever! But then Mommy warned Emma about something terrible. She said, "Now you must remember never to swim alone." Emma promised to never, ever swim alone. She knew it was very important. So Emma and Mommy both smiled and were very happy. Emma kept the medal safe, and she never forgot her promise to never swim alone.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat ice cream with a spoon. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. She brought her favorite little spoon with her. While playing, Lily's friend, Timmy, wanted to eat his ice cream too. But he didn't have a spoon. Lily saw that Timmy was sad, so she said, "I can lend you my little spoon, Timmy." Timmy was happy and said, "Thank you, Lily! You are a good friend." Lily smiled and said, "Sharing is caring. It's important to help others when we can." From that day on, Lily and Timmy always shared their spoons and helped each other. They learned that kindness and sharing make the world a better place.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Jane. Jane liked to go for walks. One morning, she decided to go for a walk with her mom. They went to the park and saw lots of nice things. Jane wanted to find a special bean. She looked around and soon found a pale bean. It was so pretty! Jane was so excited. She showed it to her mom and they both smiled. They carried on with their walk and soon they were back home. Jane put the pale bean in a special box so she could look at it whenever she wanted. She was so happy and thanked her mom for the nice walk.

Lily and Tom were twins who liked to play in the garden. One day, they saw a big jar of jelly on the table. They wanted to taste it, but they were too small to reach it. "Let's crawl to the table and get the jelly," Tom said. "OK, but be quiet. Mommy is sleeping in the sofa," Lily said. They crawled slowly and quietly across the grass. They saw a lot of bugs and flowers on the way. They said hello to them, but the bugs and flowers did not answer. They reached the table and climbed on a chair. They saw the jar of jelly shining in the sun. It looked yummy and colorful. "Wow, look at the jelly. It is red and green and yellow," Tom said. "Can I have some?" Lily asked. "Sure, let me open the jar," Tom said. He tried to open the jar, but it was too tight. He twisted and pulled, but the jar did not move. "Help me, Lily," he said. Lily helped him, but the jar was still too tight. They pushed and pulled, but the jar did not move. They were so busy trying to open the jar that they did not hear Mommy waking up. She saw them on the table and smiled. "What are you doing, my little ones?" she asked. They looked at her and smiled back. "We want some jelly, Mommy," they said. Mommy laughed and hugged them. "OK, let me help you with the jar. But first, let's wash your hands. They are dirty from crawling," she said. She took them to the sink and washed their hands. Then she opened the jar and gave them each a spoon of jelly. They tasted the jelly and made happy noises. "Mmm, this is good jelly, Mommy," Tom said. "Thank you, Mommy. We love you," Lily said. Mommy kissed them and said, "I love you too, my sweeties. Now, let's go back to the sofa and have a peaceful nap. You must be tired from crawling." They nodded and followed her to the sofa. They cuddled with her and fell asleep. They dreamed of jelly and bugs and flowers.

John wanted to go to the park. So his mum sent him a ticket. On the ticket, it said to go on the bus. So John and his mum went outside. It was very cold. The bus came. John and his mum got on the bus. There were lots of people there. John and his mum found a seat to sit on. The bus ride was long and bumpy. After a while, the bus stopped near the park. John and his mum got up and got off the bus. They could finally see the park! John was so happy. He ran around the park and had a lot of fun. It was a great day.

Once upon a time there were two friends, Jay and Sue, who lived in a big house. They liked to play and explore, but sometimes things got messy. One day, Jay and Sue decided it was time to get organized. They picked up their toys and put them away. They wiped the counters and vacuumed the floor. After that, Jay and Sue decided to play. But just as they were about to, they heard a noise from below. It was coming from the basement! They quickly opened the door and looked inside. The basement was full of boxes and stacks of papers. Everything was so mixed up! Jay and Sue's eyes lit up and they said, "Let's organize it!" They worked hard for hours, until at last the basement was neat and organized! Jay and Sue smiled at each other. They had worked very hard and now the basement was ready for lots of fun!

Once upon a time there was a man called Tim. He was very weak and always felt sad. One day, he was out trying to find some food when he suddenly saw something shiny. It was a knife! He was so excited, he picked it up and took it home. At home, Tim examined the knife and found that it was very sharp and shiny. He knew that he could use it to cut food. He felt even more excited.  He took the knife outside and tried to cut some vegetables. The vegetables were very hard and he had to push the knife very hard to cut them. He was so weak that he was having trouble. Suddenly, the knife slipped and Tim caught his finger! He was very scared and started to cry. He ran home and his mom put a bandaid on it. She hugged him and told him that he had to be very careful next time.  Tim was sad but he was still excited about his new knife. He made sure to be very careful from now on and it made him feel a lot better.

Once upon a time, there lived a big pig. The pig was very proud and always thought he was the best. One day, the pig went to a market and saw a little pig. The big pig laughed and said: "Look at that small pig, how silly he is". The little pig heard it and said: "I may be small, but I also have something to offer".  The big pig was so surprised, he asked: "What can you offer?". The little pig replied: "I may be small but I can offer friendship and kindness". The big pig realised he had been mean and said sorry. From that day on, the two pigs became friends. They worked together and split the work down each side. The moral of the story is that no matter how big or small you are, you can always offer friendship and kindness.

One day, a little girl named Sarah was playing with her crayons. She loved to draw and color with them. She had all sorts of different kinds. Suddenly, a popular boy came up to her. He had never talked to her before. He asked Sarah if he could borrow one of her crayons. Sarah was very surprised and said yes. The boy said he would give it back soon, but he never did. Sarah waited, but the boy never returned the crayon. In the end, Sarah realised that the boy had stolen her crayon! She was so upset. She learned that sometimes it is not wise to trust strangers.

Tim and Sam were twins who liked to play outside. One day, they saw a big cane in the snow. It was shiny and red and had a hook at the end. They wanted to touch it and see what it was. They ran to the cane and grabbed it. It was very cold and icy. They felt a sharp pain in their hands. They looked and saw little teeth marks. The cane was not a cane, but a snake! It was hiding in the snow and bit them when they touched it. They screamed and dropped the snake. They ran back to their house and told their mom what happened. She was very scared and angry. She wrapped their hands in a cloth and took them to the doctor. The doctor gave them some medicine and said they would be okay. Tim and Sam learned a lesson. They should not touch things they do not know. They should be careful when they play outside. They should listen to their mom and stay away from snakes.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Molly. She loved to explore, and she found a twig on the ground. She picked it up and started playing with it. Suddenly, a bird flew down and perched on the twig. Molly was very excited, and she and the bird talked to each other.  "Hello!" said Molly. "What's your name?"  "I'm Tweet," said the bird. "I saw you picking this twig, and I thought it would make a great place for me to rest."  Molly was happy to help Tweet gain a comfortable place to sit. She put the twig up in a nearby tree for the bird. Then she said goodbye and went on her way.  From then on, Molly and Tweet were good friends. Every time Molly went to explore, Tweet was always there to greet her. And Molly was glad to help Tweet gain a comfortable place to rest.

John was playing with his toys outside on the lawn. His mom watched from the kitchen window with a smile. Suddenly, something disturbed John. He heard a loud noise coming from behind the fence. John walked closer to the fence and said, “Who’s there?” He looked over the fence and saw a rough line that was drawn in the dirt. “What’s this?” asked John. A voice from behind the fence replied, “That’s my line. I’m not allowed to cross it.” John said, “That’s not nice. You need to play with me. Come over and play!” The voice said, “Okay. I can come over, but I have to stay on this side of the line. We can have lots of fun, okay?” John smiled and said, “Okay!”  The two kids played together, having lots of fun, while staying on their own side of the rough line.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved summer because he could play outside all day long. One day, Timmy went to the park and saw a little girl sitting alone on a bench. Timmy went to talk to her and asked if she wanted to play with him. The little girl was shy at first, but Timmy was patient and waited for her to feel comfortable. They played together all day and had so much fun. From that day on, they became best friends and played together every summer.

Lila was a fairy who liked to shine. She had a wand that made bright sparks when she waved it. She loved to fly around the garden and make the flowers and the bugs glow. She was happy and free. One day, she saw a big glass jar on the grass. It had a shiny lid and a label that said "Jam". Lila was curious. She flew closer to the jar and saw a red and sticky stuff inside. It looked yummy. She wanted to taste it. She pushed the lid with her wand, but it was too heavy. She tried to pull it with her hands, but it was too tight. She thought of a clever idea. She used her wand to make a hole in the lid. Then she squeezed through the hole and flew into the jar. She dipped her finger in the jam and licked it. It was sweet and sour. She liked it a lot. She ate more and more, until her tummy was full. She felt sleepy. She decided to take a nap in the jar. She closed her eyes and snored. She did not hear the footsteps of a big boy who came to the garden. He saw the jar and picked it up. He saw Lila inside and smiled. He liked fairies. He wanted to keep her as a pet. He carried the jar to his room and put it on his shelf. He screwed the lid back on, with the hole still there. He did not know that Lila needed air to breathe. He did not know that she would suffocate in the jar. He did not know that he had killed her. He went to play with his toys and forgot about the jar. Lila never woke up. She never shone again. She was not happy and free. She was not safe.

Once upon a time there was a melon. It was very big and colourful. The melon liked to play with the other fruit in the garden. One day, the melon wanted to climb a big tree. But he was worried. He was afraid he might slip and fall. Suddenly, a big bird came and offered to help the melon. The bird said, “Climb onto my back. I will help you reach the top of the tree.” The melon was still a bit scared but he decided to take the bird’s help. The bird carried the melon carefully to the top of the tree. The melon was so happy. He said a big thank you to the bird and the bird flew away. From the top of the tree, the melon could see a lot of colourful flowers. He jumped from flower to flower, enjoying the view. His worries were gone.

Once there was a boy who liked to throw things. He liked to throw stones and rocks at the ground and feel them bounce back up at him. One day, he decided to throw something else - a question. He thought to himself, "I wonder if this will fit?" But it didn't fit. The question was too big and it didn't bounce back. He was left feeling scared and sad. Then it started to rain and the question sank into the ground. The boy kept thinking about it, but he knew he had gone too far. He tried to pull the question back up, but it felt like it was stuck and he was too small to pull it out without help. The boy was sad and ashamed of what he did. He never tried to throw a question again. He didn't even want to talk about it. Things weren't the same after that, and he wasn't sure what to do. The bad ending was that the question stayed in the ground forever.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sarah. She and her mommy were walking through the park and she saw a big, tall mailbox. Sarah pointed at it and said, "Mommy, what's that?"  Her mommy smiled and said, "That's a mailbox. That's where people put their mail so it can be delivered to them. See, there's even a flag on one side so the mailman knows when there is mail to collect."  The little girl was excited. She asked if she could put something in the mailbox. Mommy said yes, so Sarah took a calm, steady pace and marched up to the mailbox. She reached inside and carefully placed her drawing inside.  She stepped back and smiled proudly at her accomplishment. Sarah was very happy now that she had been able to do something helpful. She thanked her mommy and the two of them went on their way.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved robots. He had a toy robot that he played with every day. One day, Timmy went to a store with his mom and saw a big robot. It was very tall and shiny. Timmy wanted to touch it, but it was too high for him. Timmy's mom asked the store owner if Timmy could touch the robot. The store owner said yes, and he helped Timmy touch the robot's arm. Timmy was so happy and proud that he got to touch a real robot. He smiled and told his mom that he loved robots even more now. From that day on, Timmy wanted to be a robot when he grew up.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Anna. She was three years old. One day, Anna went to a restaurant with her family. She was so excited! At the restaurant, there was a big blue menu behind the counter. Anna peeked at the menu, but it was too difficult for her to read. Instead, she asked her mommy to help her.  Mommy helped Anna to order one delicious ice cream. It was a big scoop of vanilla in a bright blue bowl. Anna was so happy! She wanted to try the yummy ice cream. She smiled and said "Delicious!"  The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big brown alligator in the pond. He wanted to know how much he weighed. So he asked the other animals in the pond to help him. He asked the fish, the frogs, and the turtles. However, none of them knew what to do. Then, a little bird offered to help. She said she knew how to weigh him. The alligator was very excited. He stayed very still as the little bird used a long stick to measure how much he weighed. Finally, the bird told the alligator he weighed a ton. Everyone in the pond was so happy and cheered for the big brown alligator! From then on, the alligator always wanted to know how much he weighed.

Once upon a time, there was a big, green crocodile who lived in a swamp. He was very scary and had lots of sharp teeth. One day, a little girl was walking by the swamp and saw the crocodile. She was so scared that she ran away as fast as she could. But then, a kind man came along and saw the little girl crying. He asked her what was wrong and she told him about the crazy crocodile. The man knew just what to do - he went to the store and bought some special polish. When he got back to the swamp, he used the polish to make the crocodile's teeth shiny and clean. The crocodile was so happy that he stopped being scary and became friends with the little girl. From then on, they would play together every day and have lots of fun.

Lily and Ben are twins. They like to play in their room. They have many toys and books. But they do not have much furniture. They only have a bed, a table and a chair. One day, their mom says, "I have a surprise for you. Come with me." She takes them to the living room. There, they see a big box. It has a picture of a sofa on it. "What is this, mom?" Lily asks. "It is a sofa, my dear. It is a new piece of furniture for your room. You can sit on it, read on it, or nap on it. Do you like it?" mom says. "Yes, we like it! Thank you, mom!" Ben says. Mom helps them open the box and take out the sofa. It is soft and colorful. It has pillows and a blanket. Mom says, "This sofa is easy to assemble. You just have to snap the legs on. Do you want to help me?" "Yes, we want to help!" Lily and Ben say. They take the legs and snap them on the sofa. They hear a click sound. They are happy. They have gained a new sofa. They hug mom and say, "Thank you, mom! You are the best!" Mom smiles and says, "You are welcome, my loves. Now, you can enjoy your new furniture. But remember to share and be careful. And don't forget to clean up your toys and books when you are done playing." Lily and Ben nod and say, "OK, mom. We will." They run to their room with their new sofa. They put it next to their bed. They sit on it, read on it, and nap on it. They are very happy. They have gained a new sofa and a new place to play.

Jake was very frightened. He was only three years old and had just moved into a strange house. Everywhere he looked in his new home, he felt scared. But then he spotted something he recognized. It was his old crib from his house before! Jake knew that if he lay down in it, he would feel safe. So he climbed inside the crib and lay down. Jake was snuggled up with his favourite teddy and he wasn't so scared anymore. He knew he could always go back to his crib if he ever felt frightened again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She was three years old and she loved playing outside with her friends. One day, Lucy decided to go for a walk. She skipped along until she came to a big tree. She was surprised to see a needles in the trunk. It was a harsh, long needle and she couldn't understand why it was there. Lucy had seen needles used for sewing and painting, but she didn't know why it was in the tree. She knew it was something she needed, so she carefully picked it up. She was very surprised to find that the needle was like a powerful key. Whenever Lucy held it in her hands, the wind moved around her and the trees blew gently. Lucy soon learned that the needle was a magical item that could open special doors. She could enter into different worlds and explore them. Lucy was delighted with her new discovery. Everywhere she went, she brought along her needle. With the help of her magic needle, Lucy was able to make new friends and go on exciting adventures. She also opened some tough doors which she thought were too harsh. But with the help of her special item, she managed to make it through. Through her adventures, Lucy learned that nothing is ever too harsh if you have the courage to try. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lucy. She had an attractive toy car that she loved to play with. It was shiny and red. Lucy liked to drive it around her room and make it go very fast. One day, Lucy's friend, Tim, came over to play. He saw the attractive toy car and wanted to play with it too. Lucy thought about it and decided to share her toy car with Tim. They took turns driving the car around the room, making it go fast and having lots of fun together. While they were playing, the toy car had a little wreck. It hit the wall and lost a wheel. Lucy and Tim were sad, but they worked together to fix the car. They found a new wheel and put it on the car. It was as good as new! Lucy said, "I'm glad we shared my car, even though it had a wreck. We fixed it together and had fun!" Tim agreed and said, "Sharing is fun, and it's good to help each other when things go wrong." The moral of the story is that sharing is a good thing to do, and it's important to help each other when things go wrong.

One day, a little girl named Lucy wanted to play a game. She thought of a fun quiz for her friends. She made a fake key and a real key. Lucy put the keys in a box and locked it. Lucy called her friend Tom to play the quiz. She said, "Tom, I have a fun game. Guess which key is fake and which one is real. If you guess right, I will give you a prize!" Tom was excited to play the game. Tom thought hard and picked the fake key. Lucy opened the box with the real key and gave Tom a prize. They both laughed and had a great time playing the quiz. They played many more games and had a fun day together.

Once upon a time, there was a fragile barrel. It was all alone in the middle of a field, and it was very quiet. One day, the sky turned grey and it started to rain. The rain filled the barrel until it was full.  The barrel was no longer dry. It was full of water, and it was too heavy to carry. A little girl saw the barrel and knew it couldn't stay there. She got her dad to help her carry the barrel and they took it home. At home, the little girl and her dad put the barrel in the sun. They hoped the sun would dry the water out of the barrel. Day after day, the sun shined brightly and the water dried up.  Soon, the barrel was dry. The little girl was so happy that the water was gone. Now the barrel was light and she could play with it. She had made something fragile strong again!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat spicy food and she would always ask her mom to make her food extra spicy. One day, Lily's mom made her a big plate of spicy noodles for lunch.  As Lily was eating her noodles, she suddenly felt a sharp pain in her mouth. She realized that she had accidentally swallowed a spicy chili pepper whole! Lily started to panic and cry. Her mom knew it was an emergency and quickly called the doctor.  When the doctor arrived, he knew just what to do. He gave Lily a special medicine that would make the spicy feeling go away. Before leaving, the doctor gave Lily a big kiss on the forehead and told her to be more careful when eating spicy food. From that day on, Lily always made sure to chew her food carefully before swallowing.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. Sue loved to eat cherries. She thought they were very delicious. One day, her mom gave her a big bowl of cherries to eat. Sue was so happy. She sat down and started to eat the cherries one by one. She liked how they were red and sweet. She ate and ate until there was just one cherry left. Sue wanted to finish all the cherries in the bowl. She picked up the last cherry and ate it. It was the most delicious cherry of all. Sue was very full and happy. She thanked her mom for the yummy cherries and went to play outside.

Once upon a time, there was a family who lived near the mountains. One day, the mom said to her little girl, "Let's go outside, it's a good day." When they stepped out, the little girl saw a lot of snow in the sky. She asked, "Mommy, what is that? It's so pretty!" Her mom smiled and said, "That's snow! It's bringing us a white blanket." The little girl got excited and said, "Can I go play in it?" Her mom said, "Of course! But, put on your warm clothes first." The little girl was so happy. She put on her warm clothes and ran outside. She then started making snow angels and having a wonderful time. She giggled and shouted, "It's so much fun! Snow is so good!"  The little girl played in the snow until dark. When she came back home, her mom asked her, "Did you have a good time?" The little girl smiled, "Yes! Snow is so good!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a cute teddy bear that she loved to keep with her all the time. One day, Lily's mom asked her, "Do you want to help me make some popcorn?"  Lily was excited and said, "Yes, I want to help!" They went to the kitchen and her mom showed her how to put the corn in a pot and keep stirring it until it popped.  When the popcorn was ready, Lily's dad came in and said, "Wow, this popcorn looks delicious!" Lily offered him some and he said, "Thank you, Lily. You are so helpful."  Lily smiled and hugged her teddy bear, feeling happy that she could help her family.

Alice was walking through a big field when she suddenly heard loud clapping. As she got closer, she saw an orange bird with beautiful feathers. The bird was flapping its wings and singing a song. Alice watched it for a few minutes until the bird was done singing. Afterwards, the orange bird bowed and the field became filled with applause. Alice clapped and applauded too. The bird flew away, but Alice could still feel the love in the air.  Alice smiled and thought to herself “that was so much fun!” She couldn’t help but be filled with admiration and appreciation for the wonderful orange bird.

One day, there was a modern child. She liked to explore and learn new things. She was walking in the park when she saw something shiny. She carefully walked over and saw that it was a special pointy rock. She picked it up and pointed it towards the sky. She watched as the sun shone on it and sparkled. She then pointed it towards the ground and saw how it created funny shadows on the grass. She spent a long time picking different things up and pointing them. She also pointed at the birds flying in the sky, the wind blowing in the trees and the different animals she saw! She had so much fun playing with the pointy rock and learning about her environment.

Tom and Anna like to play in the park. They have a big bucket of seeds. They want to feed the birds. They scatter the seeds on the grass and wait for the birds to come. But then the sky turns dark and it starts to rain. The rain is very heavy and fast. The park becomes a flood. The water covers the grass and the seeds. The birds fly away. "Oh no!" Tom says. "The seeds are gone! The birds are hungry!" "Don't be sad," Anna says. "We can share our cookies with the birds. They are sweet and yummy." Tom and Anna take out their cookies from their backpacks. They break them into small pieces. They throw the pieces on the water. The birds see the cookies and come back. They eat the cookies and sing. "Look!" Tom says. "The birds are happy! They like our cookies!" "Yes!" Anna says. "We are good friends to the birds!" Tom and Anna smile and hug. They watch the birds and listen to their songs. They don't mind the rain. They are happy too.

Once upon a time there was a big hole in the ground. A sleepy fox was inside the hole and he couldn't get out. He tried over and over, but his tired legs were too tired. Then one day the fox looked up and saw a friendly cat. The cat said, "I know how to help you get out." The fox jumped up with joy! The cat put her paw over the hole and she said, "Close your eyes and count to three." The fox did what she said and when he opened his eyes, the hole was closed. The fox and the cat were so happy that they couldn't stop smiling. They were friends forever!

Once there was a little boy named Tim. He was only three years old and loved exploring his garden. One day, he thought it would be fun to fish in the pond. He got out his net and went to the pond. He looked around and spotted a big, hairy fish! Tim said to the fish, 'Hi there! What's your name?' The fish replied, 'I guess my name is Fred.' Tim was so excited, he started to jump up and down. He used his net to scoop up the fish. 'Come and live with me!' He exclaimed. Fred the fish wasn't so sure, but he decided he should go along. From that day forward, they became the best of friends. They played together in the pond and even went for walks in the garden. Tim and Fred loved each other very much and they lived happily ever after.

Once there was a yellow bird. It was looking for a place to belong. It flew all around searching for the perfect nest. Finally it spied a cozy yellow nest in the tree. It hopped inside and knew that this was the place for it. It felt like it belonged. The bird stayed in the nest and kept it clean. Every morning it would look out from the nest and sing a song. All the other birds heard the yellow bird's beautiful song and they knew it had found its home. The yellow bird was very happy with its nest. It was safe and warm and it was the perfect place to belong. The bird knew it was lucky to have such a great home.

Once upon a time there was a boy who wanted to explore the world. He put on his shoes, grabbed his backpack and headed out. As he walked, the fog started to roll in. It was incredible! He couldn't see anything in front of him. Suddenly, he heard a strange sound behind him. He spun around, but he couldn't see anything in the fog. He started to run, but the fog was so thick that he got lost. He stumbled around for hours until he finally dropped down to the ground, exhausted. He was never able to find his way out of the fog, and he never got to explore the world.

Once there was a cheerful little girl named Lucy. She was always looking for ways to have fun and explore. Every day she would ask her Mom what she could do. One day Lucy asked her Mom, "What can I do today?". Her Mom said, "Why don't you see what you can do with this pan?" She handed her a pan and Lucy cheerfully grabbed it. "What am I supposed to do with this?" asked Lucy. Her Mom smiled, "Maybe you can solve the problem of what to do with the pan," she said. Lucy thought for a moment, and then she had an idea. She filled the pan with water and set it on the ground. Then she grabbed the garden hose and started to fill the pan with water. Soon she had created a small pond in the garden and she was so pleased with herself! She was so cheerful about her work she even made little boats for the pond out of leaves and sticks.  Lucy kept going outside to her pond everyday. She would always find a new way to solve the problem of what to do with the pan.

Mark had a spicy food. He wanted it but he couldn't eat it. He kept looking at it and wanted it more and more. He asked his mom if he could have it, but she said no. Mark started to cry. He really wanted the spicy food.  Then his mom had an idea. She drew a mark on the spicy food. She told Mark that if he wanted to have the spicy food he would have to find another mark just like it. Mark was so excited. He started running around the house, looking for a mark like the one his mom had made. He searched everywhere but he couldn't find another one.  Finally, Mark gave up. He asked his mom if she could help him find the mark. His mom said yes and took him outside. She showed him another spicy food with the same mark. Mark was so happy. He was able to eat the spicy food he wanted!

Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to climb the big slide and go down fast. Lily was brave and went first. Ben followed her, but he was a bit scared. "Look, Lily, there is a dog!" Ben said, pointing to a big, black dog that was running towards them. Lily saw the dog and felt afraid. She did not like dogs. They were loud and had sharp teeth. She grabbed Ben's hand and ran to the slide. "Let's go up the slide and hide!" she said. "The dog can't climb the slide. He can't get us there." They ran up the steps of the slide and sat at the top. The dog barked and jumped, but he could not reach them. Lily and Ben hugged each other and waited for the dog to go away. "Are you okay, Ben?" Lily asked. "I'm okay, Lily. You are very brave. You protected me from the dog," Ben said. "Thank you, Ben. You are very charming. You made me feel better," Lily said. They smiled and looked at the park. They saw a man coming with a leash. He called the dog and put the leash on him. He said sorry to Lily and Ben and walked away with the dog. Lily and Ben felt safe again. They decided to go down the slide and play some more. They had fun in the park. They were good friends.

Lily and Ben were twins. They liked to play with their toys and books. But they did not like to share. They always wanted the same thing. One day, they found a big seat in the yard. It was red and soft and had wheels. Lily and Ben both wanted to sit on it and ride it. They ran to the seat and pushed each other. "I saw it first!" Lily said. "No, I did!" Ben said. They both tried to climb on the seat, but it was too big for them. They fell off and bumped their heads. They cried and rubbed their heads. Mom heard them and came to the yard. She saw the seat and the twins. She knew what happened. "Come here, Lily and Ben," Mom said. "I have something to tell you." Lily and Ben stopped crying and went to Mom. They were curious and hopeful. Mom smiled and said, "This seat is not a toy. It is a stroller. It is for your baby brother, who will come soon. You can help me push him in the seat, but you cannot sit on it or ride it. It is not safe for you. Do you understand?" Lily and Ben nodded. They were surprised and excited. They had a baby brother! Mom hugged them and said, "You are going to be great big siblings. But you have to learn to share and be kind. Can you do that?" Lily and Ben looked at each other. They thought about the seat and the baby. They wanted to be good and happy. They nodded again and said, "Yes, Mom. We can do that." Mom smiled and said, "Good. Now, let's go inside and have some cookies. And maybe later, we can lean on the seat and watch the birds." Lily and Ben agreed. They followed Mom inside, holding hands. They forgot about the seat and the fight. They were looking forward to the baby.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She went to the park to play. When she arrived, she noticed a goose in the pond. The pond was peaceful and the girl was curious. She walked up to the goose and said "Hello". The goose did not answer so the girl sat at the edge of the pond. She waited and waited. Then, suddenly, the goose opened its beak and said "Hello". The girl was so excited and they talked and talked. The girl asked the goose if it wanted to play with her and the goose said "Yes". They had so much fun together, jumping and running around the pond. The girl felt so peaceful, she never wanted it to end. But the sun was setting and it was getting late. The little girl said goodbye to her friend the goose and returned home. She felt happy, knowing she would soon come back and play with her goose again.

Once upon a time, there was an old man who loved to write. He had a leather notebook that he used to write stories and poems in. One day he was walking in the woods and he saw a fearful fox. The fox was scared and the old man wanted to help. The old man took out his leather notebook and wrote some words in it. He showed it to the fox and the fox was very happy. The old man smiled and the fox soon wasn't scared anymore. The fox waved goodbye and ran back into the woods. All because the old man took out his leather notebook and wrote down some special words!

Lily likes to dress up in her mom's clothes. She finds a big hat, a long scarf, and some shiny shoes in the closet. She puts them on and looks in the mirror. She feels very pretty and fancy. She sees an ashtray on the dresser. It is round and has some gray stuff inside. She thinks it is a bowl for snacks. She picks it up and tries to eat the gray stuff. It tastes bad and makes her cough. She spits it out and drops the ashtray. It breaks and makes a loud noise. Mom hears the noise and comes to the room. She sees Lily in her clothes and the broken ashtray on the floor. She is not happy. She tells Lily to take off her clothes and go to the bathroom. She says the ashtray is not for eating and it is dangerous. She says she will clean up the mess. Lily feels sorry and sad. She does what mom says and goes to the bathroom. She washes her mouth and face. She wishes she had a real snack. She wonders if mom has any cookies available. She hopes mom will forgive her and hug her. She loves mom and wants to make her happy.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. He had a big, tall armchair that he loved to sit in and read his books. One day, his friend Sammy came over to play. Sammy wanted to sit in the armchair too, but it was too tall for him to climb up. Timmy decided to share his armchair with Sammy. He helped Sammy climb up and they both sat in the armchair together. They read books and told stories, and had a lot of fun sharing the cozy armchair. From then on, whenever Sammy came over to play, they always shared the armchair and had a great time together. The end.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sarah. She wanted to build a tower but she was scared. She kept looking up at the sky and felt a little overwhelmed. Her mom came up to her and said, “Sarah, I know you are scared, but I will help you. I will encourage you.” Sarah took a deep breath and nodded her head. She wanted to do it. Her mom showed her how to stack one block on top of the other. She was careful and steady. After they had built the tower, Sarah's mom encouraged her to take one more block and put it on top of the tower. Sarah reached up and put the block on top of the tower. But the tower started to wobble and before they knew it, the tower was crashing down. The blocks were scattered everywhere. Sarah looked up at her mom, her face clear with fear. Her mom smiled sadly and said, “That's okay Sarah, we can try again next time.”

Once upon a time, there was a dependable dog named Spot. Spot was a good dog who always helped his family. He liked to provide help to his mom and dad. Spot loved to play outside in the evening when the sun was going down. One day, Spot was playing with his ball when he saw a cat named Whiskers. Whiskers wanted to take Spot's ball away. Spot said, "No, Whiskers, this is my ball. We can play together, but you can't take it away." Whiskers didn't listen and tried to take the ball again. Spot was sad, but he had an idea. He told Whiskers, "If we share the ball, we can both have fun." Whiskers thought about it and agreed. They played together in the evening and became good friends. From that day on, Spot and Whiskers always shared their toys and played together.

Anna and Ben were playing in the park with their ball. They liked to pass the ball to each other and catch it. Sometimes they threw the ball very high and watched it fly in the sky. One day, they saw a giant walking in the park. He was very big and tall, and he had a long beard and a big hat. He looked scary, but he was not mean. He was harmless. He just liked to walk and see the flowers and the trees. "Hello, little ones," the giant said to Anna and Ben. "Do you want to play with me?" Anna and Ben were afraid of the giant. They did not know what to do. They held their ball tight and hid behind a bench. "Don't be scared," the giant said. "I won't hurt you. I just want to have some fun. Can I pass the ball with you?" Anna and Ben looked at each other. They saw that the giant had a kind smile and a gentle voice. They decided to give him a chance. "Okay," Anna said. "But you have to be careful. Don't throw the ball too hard or too far." "Of course," the giant said. "I will be gentle. Thank you for playing with me." Anna and Ben came out from behind the bench and passed the ball to the giant. The giant passed the ball back to them. They had a lot of fun. They laughed and talked and made a new friend. The giant was not scary at all. He was harmless.

Once upon a time there was a filthy operation. The operation was a mess, with items scattered all around. The operation's workers had to do something, so they decided to clean it.  They grabbed all of their cleaning tools and got to work. First they swept the floors, then they washed the walls. They tidied up all the desks, chairs and other items. Everyone worked hard to make sure the operation was sparkling.  The workers were so proud when they finished cleaning. The operation had gone from being filthy to spotless. Now they could feel good about their work and enjoy the operation in all its clean glory!

Once upon a time, there was a big parade in town. Everyone was excited to see it. The parade was very popular, and lots of people came to watch.  A little girl named Lily was there with her family. She was so happy to see all the colorful floats and balloons. Suddenly, she saw a clown walking by. He looked very funny with his big red nose and silly hat.  Lily wanted to say hello to the clown, but she was too shy to speak. So, she just smiled and waved. The clown noticed her and came over to say hello. He gave her a balloon animal and they became friends.  After the parade, Lily was sad to say goodbye to her new friend. But the clown promised to come back next year for the parade. Lily was so excited to see him again and couldn't wait to speak to him. And just like the clown promised, he came back the next year and they had even more fun together.

Once there was a man and a woman. The man and woman were rushing to the beach. They wanted to catch shrimp! When they got there, they took out their net. It was very flexible! They dipped it into the ocean and waited. Suddenly they felt a tug on the net. The woman pulled it up and sure enough, there were lots of shrimp in it! They were so excited! The man and woman kept on rushing around the beach. They caught so many shrimp! Then, they had a big feast. Everyone was so happy and full. The End!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a toy bunny that she loved very much. One day, Lily went to the park to play. She left her bunny on a bench and went to play on the swings.  A little boy named Max saw the bunny and thought it was lost. He picked it up and went to look for the owner. When he saw Lily, he said, "Excuse me, is this bunny yours?"  Lily was so excited to see her bunny. She said, "Yes, that's mine! It belongs to me." Max gave the bunny back to Lily and they became friends. They played together and had fun on the playground.  From that day on, Lily and Max played together every day. They shared their toys and had lots of fun. Lily was happy to have her bunny back and she was grateful to have a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her backyard. One day, she was playing with her dolls when she accidentally dropped one in the pond. She tried to reach for it, but she couldn't swim.  Lily's mom saw what happened and quickly ran to rescue her. She jumped in the pond and grabbed Lily. "Are you okay?" her mom asked.  Lily nodded her head and pointed to her doll. "My dolly," she said.  Her mom saw the green cloth sticking out of the water and reached for it. She rescued the doll and gave it back to Lily. "Here you go," she said.  Lily hugged her mom and said, "Thank you for rescuing me and my dolly." Her mom smiled and said, "Of course, I'll always be here to rescue you."

Once upon a time, there lived two cats. One was named Fluffy and the other one was called Furry. They both loved to go for walks around the garden. One day, when the cats were strolling along the rail, something unexpected happened. They heard a loud noise and Fluffy got so frightened that he ran away. Furry tried to follow him, but he couldn't find him. He felt worried, so he started to rub the rail. Suddenly, he heard Fluffy's meowing coming from the bushes. When Furry rushed over there, he saw Fluffy rubbing himself against the rail. He was so relieved to find him! They hugged each other and went back home, happy to be safe.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She had some very special hands. Every day she used her hands to dress up in her favorite clothes. She always chose ordinary clothes - nothing too fancy. Sometimes, she put on a bright dress with sparkles. Or maybe a dress with sparkly jewels. But her favorite thing to wear was her ordinary dress with the white dots. Every day, she practiced dressing herself with her hands until she was an expert at it! On special days, she showed off her dress-up skills. Whenever anyone asked, she was proud to show that she could dress herself all by herself. It didn’t take her long to become an expert at dressing herself with her special hands. And from then on, she could dress with ease and put on any dress she wanted.

Julie was a 3 year old who loved to make things. She had a special pattern which she wanted to make into a dress. So she asked her mom if she could mail the pattern to a special tailor. Her mom said she could. So Julie was happy and sent the pattern off. The tailor sent Julie a beautiful dress back. Unfortunately, when Julie tried it on, it didn't fit. She was so sad. She wanted to wear it so badly. Her mom saw how upset she was and said they would try to fix the problem. They called the tailor and asked if they could exchange the dress for one that fit better. The tailor said yes. Julie was so excited when the new dress came in the mail. When she tried it on, it fit perfectly. She couldn't have been happier. Julie loved wearing the dress and it became her new favorite.

Bella was three years old and excited to go to the park. She had been watching more birds and squirrels outside her window lately and wanted to see them in person. As she put on her shoes, her mom said to her, "Be sure to be calm at the park. Can you manage that?" Bella nodded and smiled. At the park, Bella was amazed. The trees were tall and the sky a bright blue. She saw several ducks and birds around the pond. But what she was most excited about was all the oranges that were on the trees! She had never seen oranges on trees before.  Bella plucked one off the tree, put it in her pocket, and ran to find her mom. Smiling, Bella gave her mom the orange. "Mommy, I managed to find an orange!" Her mom smiled and laughed. She gave Bella a hug and said, "Yes you did! You did a great job - let's all calm down and enjoy these oranges."  Bella, her mom, and their friends all sat down and ate the oranges, laughing and enjoying the sunny day. Bella spent the rest of the day running around and watching the birds, but she never forgot how she managed to find the orange.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Daisy. One day Daisy was out in the park, when she saw a big puddle! It looked so fun to jump in, so she stepped up to it.  'Oh no, it looks so deep!' said Daisy. Suddenly, a voice came from behind her. 'Don't worry Daisy, the puddle is soft' said her Mum. Mum had just arrived to pick Daisy up.
