Daisy smiled and jumped into the puddle. She splashed around and laughed as bubbles came up all around her. Mum laughed at Daisy's silliness. 'Come on Daisy, let's get you dried off'.  Every so often Daisy still goes to the park to jump in the soft puddle. It's a special memory that Daisy cherishes!

Philip was very excited. He was ready to go out and see the weather. Philip jumped up and down and smiled. He grabbed his boots and put them on. Then he grabbed his coat and put it on too. He was ready to go.  Philip opened the door and stepped outside into the cold. The wind was chilly, but Philip was determined. He began running down the street. As he ran, he saw a tree with a lot of fruit on it. He wanted to pick the fruit, but he knew he had to yield.  Philip felt a little sad, but he kept going. He ran to the end of the street and then turned around. All of a sudden, the wind started to blow and the sky grew dark. Philip knew a storm was coming. He started to run again, this time towards home.  When he got back, he saw his mom and dad waiting for him. He was just in time! He was ready for the storm. He and his parents ran inside and together they prepared the house.  Philip had yielded to the weather, but he was happy he made it home just in time!

Once there was a gifted girl named Daisy. She loved spending time at the pond. Every day she would watch as the small fishes swam around. One day she noticed a very big tree near the pond. Every time the wind blew, the leaves of the tree would whisper. Daisy stopped to listen. She sighed and closed her eyes. Suddenly she heard singing. It was the most beautiful music she had ever heard. Daisy opened her eyes and saw the fishes had changed colour and were now singing together. She smiled, it was the most magical thing she had ever seen! The fishes whispered to Daisy that they were thankful to have their own secret song and they were glad she was gifted enough to have heard it. Daisy thanked them and waved goodbye. She knew she would never forget her special time at the pond.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to hop around in the springtime when the flowers were blooming and the sun was shining. One day, Benny was hopping along when he saw a big, scary bear. Benny was frightened and didn't know what to do. The bear looked at Benny and asked him why he looked so scared. Benny didn't know what to say, so he just shrugged his shoulders. The bear saw how little and cute Benny was and decided not to hurt him. Instead, the bear asked Benny if he wanted to play a game of tag. Benny was so happy that the bear wasn't going to hurt him that he agreed to play. They played tag all afternoon and had so much fun. From that day on, Benny wasn't afraid of bears anymore and he loved to hop around in the springtime with all his animal friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had two feet that she liked to wiggle and move around. One day, Lily and her mom went for a walk in the park. Lily was very alert and looked at all the birds and flowers. Suddenly, Lily saw a butterfly and wanted to catch it. She told her mom, "I want to go and catch the butterfly!" Her mom said, "Okay, but be careful not to step on any bugs with your feet." Lily nodded and ran after the butterfly. She was very fast and her mom had to run to keep up with her. Finally, Lily caught the butterfly and was very happy. She showed it to her mom and they both looked at it together. Then, they went back home and Lily fell asleep with a big smile on her face, dreaming of all the fun things she would do with her feet tomorrow.

Once there was a brave girl named Lucy. One day Lucy decided she wanted to have an adventure, so she built a tent in her backyard. It was an unusual tent, all different colors and shapes. Lucy brought some of her friends over to play in the tent with her. They all had fun playing hide-and-seek and singing songs in the tent. At one point they all started to get a bit bored. Lucy had an idea and said, "Who dares to do something really fun?" Everyone cheered and agreed to do something daring. They all ran out of the tent, laughing and shouting. They ran around the yard for a long time, playing silly games and daring each other to do all sorts of unusual things. Finally, when it was time to go home, everyone agreed that they had a wonderful time in Lucy's tent. They all said they would never forget their daring adventure together.

Once upon a time, there was a very delicate jacket. It was a soft, fluffy jacket made of the finest fabric. The jacket was very important, so the child had to protect it.  Every day, the child put on the jacket and made sure to be extra careful. The child did not want to rip or tear the jacket in any way.  The jacket kept the child so warm and cozy, that it was the child's best friend.    So everyday, the child made sure to take all precautions to protect the delicate jacket. The child made sure to put it away when the weather was too hot, and to wear it when it was cold outside.   The child also made sure to keep the jacket clean and always let adult help put it on and take it off. The delicate jacket was very careful looked after, and it kept the child both happy and warm. The end.

Once upon a time, a three year old child named Sarah was playing in the park. She was having lots of fun running around and playing tag with her friends. But then she noticed the park was too tidy! Everywhere she looked the grass was cut short, the playground was all the same, and the flowers were in straight, neat rows. Sarah was really disappointed. Suddenly, the whole park started to get really cold and everything began to freeze. Winter had come early to the park! Sarah was so sad that she couldn't play in her favorite park any more. But then her friends had an idea. They got together and worked hard to make the park cozy and fun. They cleared the ice, planted flowers of all different shapes and sizes, and laid down warm blankets and cushions for everyone to play on. When Sarah saw the park again, it was more fun and colorful than ever! Now the park was perfectly tidy, but in a much more cozy, fun way. Plus, Sarah and her friends could play in it all year round!

Once upon a time, in a town by the sea, lived a furry navy dog called Patch. He was always full of energy and ready for adventures. Even when Patch was just a tiny puppy, he always sprung around the town after anything that moved. One day, Patch's family went on a walk to the beach. When Patch saw the waves, he simply couldn't contain himself. He sprung up, barked, and ran at full speed into the sea. Patch's family shouted for him to come back, but he just kept running.  Just as Patch was about to reach the last wave, he jumped, and to everyone's surprise, he sprang over the top of it. Patch's family clapped and cheered and Patch was so happy to show everyone his springing skills.  From that day forward, Patch sprang out of bed each morning, ready to explore his town - with his navy blue fur shining in the sun.

Tom and Lily were playing in the park. They saw a big tunnel under a hill. They wanted to go inside and see what was there. "Let's go, Tom. Maybe we can find something fun in the tunnel," Lily said. "OK, Lily. But we have to be careful. It might be dark and scary in there," Tom said. They held hands and walked into the tunnel. It was dark and cold. They could not see anything. They hoped to find a way out soon. But they did not find a way out. They found a big bear. The bear was hungry and angry. It saw Tom and Lily and roared. "Help, help! It's a bear! Run, run!" Tom and Lily screamed. They tried to run back to the park. But the bear was faster and stronger. It caught them and ate them. They were sweet and tasty. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a funny little dog named Spot. Spot loved to play and run all day. One day, Spot saw a big hill and wanted to climb it. Spot took a step and started to climb the hill. As he went up, he met a big bird. The bird said, "Hi Spot, do you want to play with me?" Spot said, "Yes, let's play!" They played together and had a lot of fun. After a while, Spot felt tired. He sighed and said, "I need to go home now." The big bird was sad and didn't want Spot to leave. So, the bird hid Spot's toy so he couldn't find it. Spot looked and looked, but he couldn't find his toy anywhere. Spot was very sad and cried. The big bird felt bad and gave Spot's toy back. Spot was still sad because he didn't like the big bird's mean trick. He walked back down the hill and went home without saying goodbye to the big bird.

One day, a little boy had an important decision to make. He stood in his bedroom and looked around until his gaze fell on a drawer. He kneeled and opened the drawer. Inside, it was light and he could see a bright, shiny toy. He wanted it so badly! But the little boy decided to leave the toy in the drawer and close it.  The little boy had learned a moral value: to be content with what you have. Taking only what you need is important and it can make you feel fulfilled and light. The little boy smiled and felt relieved, knowing that he had done the right thing. Learning to be content is a valuable lesson for everyone, big and small. So, remember to take only what you need and be happy with it!

Jenny and her parents were in the living room of their modern house. Jenny was looking around and saw a very large carpet. She asked her parents what it was for. Her father said it was a puzzle carpet. Jenny was surprised and asked, "A puzzle carpet? What is that?" Her father explained that it was a carpet with all sorts of pieces of puzzles on it. The challenge was to solve all the puzzles that were hidden in the carpet. Jenny was excited and asked if she could try to solve the puzzles. Her parents said yes and gave her some help. Jenny spent the next few hours trying to solve the puzzles. Every time she solved one, she felt very happy. Eventually, she solved all the puzzles on the modern carpet. She was very excited and proud of herself.

Once upon a time, there was a little frog named Freddy. Freddy lived in a big pond with lots of other frogs. One day, Freddy forgot where his favorite lily pad was. He asked his frog friends if they could help him remember, but they were all ignorant and didn't know. Freddy hopped around the pond, searching for his lily pad. He looked under rocks and around plants, but it was nowhere to be found. As the sun began to set, Freddy started to feel sad. He thought he would never find his lily pad again. Just as Freddy was about to give up, he saw a glimmer of green in the distance. It was his lily pad! He hopped over to it and felt so happy to be home. From then on, he made sure to remember where his lily pad was so he would never lose it again.

Once upon a time, there was a big van. It was red and had four wheels. One day, it rained a lot and the van got very wet. It was so wet that the driver had to soak up all the water with a towel.  After the rain stopped, the driver noticed something unusual. A little bird was sitting on top of the van! The bird was very small and had bright blue feathers. The driver had never seen a bird like this before.  The driver decided to wait until the bird flew away before driving the van. But the bird didn't fly away. It just sat there, looking at the driver. The driver thought it was very strange. Finally, the bird flew away and the driver drove the van home.

Once upon a time, there was a big purple dragon named Puff. Puff loved to fly high in the sky and blow smoke out of his nose. One day, Puff met a little girl named Lily who wanted to learn how to fly like him. Puff decided to teach her how to fly. Puff showed Lily how to flap her wings and soar through the clouds. Lily was so happy that she could fly just like Puff. They flew together for hours until it was time for Lily to go home. As she was leaving, Puff blew a big cloud of smoke to say goodbye. Lily went home and told her mom all about her adventure with Puff the dragon. She was so excited that she drew a picture of Puff with his purple scales and big wings. Her mom hung the picture on the fridge so they could remember their fun day with Puff forever.

Once upon a time, there was a man. He was very nice and always tried to do the right thing. One day, he went to the store to buy some food for his dinner. He saw a big cake and thought it would be perfect for dessert.  But when he got home and opened the cake, he saw that it was spoiled. That means it was not good to eat anymore. The man was sad because he really wanted to eat cake for dessert.  He decided to go back to the store and ask for a new cake. The store was very nice and gave him a perfect cake. The man was happy and enjoyed his dessert very much. From then on, he always checked his food before he bought it so it wouldn't spoil again. The end.

Once upon a time, there lived two old friends: a bear and a rabbit. They were very good friends, and they welcomed each other every day with a big hug. One day, the bear was feeling a little bit sad. He thought about how he wished he had something special to give to his friend to show how much he cared. He remembered something his grandmother had taught him! She said that a rare rub from a bear was the best thing to give a friend who was feeling a little bit down. So the bear happily gave the rabbit a big rub, and the rabbit felt much better! He thanked the bear for the rare, special rub, and the two friends smiled and hugged, welcoming each other once again.

Once upon a time there was a baby called Andy. He loved playing with his favourite blanket. It was fancy, with little stars and moons on it. One day his mommy said with a smile, "Andy, we are going to raise your blanket up in the air!" Andy was so excited to see what would happen. He could feel the blanket becoming lighter and lighter. Then, all of a sudden, Andy was lifted off the ground. He squealed with delight as he flew through the air, the blanket swishing around him. Mommy had raised Andy high in the air on the blanket! It was like a fancy special magic ride! Andy laughed and laughed as he spun around. All of his family and friends clapped with joy to see him so happy. Andy flew higher and higher and just when he thought he was reaching the sky, he fell gently down to the ground. The magic was over, and Andy was sad - until his mommy said, "Who wants to go round again?" Andy shouted with joy, "Me, me!"

Lily and Tom were happy. They wanted to have a picnic in the park. They packed some bread, cheese, fruit and juice in a large basket. They took a blanket and a ball too. They walked to the park with their mom. They found a nice spot under a big tree. They spread the blanket on the grass and put the basket on it. They were ready to start their picnic. "Can I have some juice, please?" Lily asked. "Sure, here you go," mom said and gave her a cup. "Can I have some cheese, please?" Tom asked. "Sure, here you go," mom said and gave him a slice. They ate and drank and talked. They were having fun. Then they heard a loud roar. They looked up and saw a large bear. The bear was hungry. It smelled the food. It ran towards them. "Run, run, run!" mom shouted. They grabbed the blanket and the ball and ran. But the basket was too heavy. They had to leave it behind. The bear reached the basket. It opened it and ate everything. It was happy. Lily, Tom and mom were sad. They had no picnic. They had no food. They had to go home. They were scared of the bear. They did not have fun.

Lily and Tom were best friends. They liked to play with their toys every Sunday. Lily had a big dollhouse and Tom had a fast car. They shared their toys and had fun. One Sunday, Lily and Tom saw a cat on a tree. The cat was scared and meowed. Lily and Tom wanted to help the cat. They asked their mom and dad if they could rescue the cat. Their mom and dad said yes, but they had to be careful. Lily and Tom got a ladder and a blanket. They put the ladder near the tree and climbed up. Lily held the blanket and Tom reached for the cat. The cat was happy and jumped into the blanket. Lily and Tom hugged the cat and brought it down. "Good job, Lily and Tom! You rescued the cat!" their mom and dad said. They were proud of their children. Lily and Tom named the cat Fluffy and decided to keep it. They played with Fluffy and their toys. They were very happy. Sam was their neighbor. He saw Lily and Tom with Fluffy. He had no cat and no toys. He was envious of Lily and Tom. He wanted to have a cat and toys too. "Can I play with you and Fluffy?" Sam asked. "Sure, Sam. You can play with us and our toys. We are friends," Lily and Tom said. Sam smiled and joined them. He played with Fluffy and the toys. He was not envious anymore. He was happy too.

Tim and Lily were friends. They liked to play with toys. One night, Tim saw a black car in Lily's room. He wanted the car. He said to Lily, "Can I have your car?" Lily said, "No, this is my car. I got it for my birthday. You have your own car." Tim was angry. He waited until Lily was asleep. He took the car and ran to his room. He thought he was clever. But Lily woke up and saw that her car was gone. She cried and called her mom. Her mom came and asked, "What's wrong, Lily?" Lily said, "Tim stole my car. He took it in the night. He is a bad friend." Her mom hugged her and said, "Don't worry, Lily. We will get your car back. Stealing is wrong. Tim will be sorry." Her mom went to Tim's room and knocked on the door. She said, "Tim, open the door. I need to talk to you." Tim was scared. He knew he did a bad thing. He hid the car under his bed. He said, "What do you want?" Her mom said, "I want you to give back Lily's car. You stole it from her. That is not nice. How would you feel if someone stole your car?" Tim felt ashamed. He said, "I'm sorry. I wanted the car. It was black and shiny. I didn't think Lily would miss it." Her mom said, "Lily loves her car. She was very sad when she saw it was gone. You hurt her feelings. You need to say sorry to her and give her back the car." Tim took the car and followed her mom to Lily's room. He said to Lily, "I'm sorry, Lily. I stole your car. It was wrong. Here is your car. Can you forgive me?" Lily looked at Tim and saw that he was sorry. She said, "Thank you, Tim. I forgive you. But don't steal again. It is not nice. We can share our cars if we ask nicely." Tim nodded and said, "You're right, Lily. I'm sorry. Can we still be friends?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, we can still be friends. But next time, ask me first." They hugged and played with their cars. They learned a lesson. Stealing is bad. Sharing is good. Friends are better.

Once there was a happy boy named Jimmy. He was three years old. Every day his mom allowed him to play with his toys. One day he saw a box of tape. He asked his mom if he could use it. She said yes and allowed him to use it.  Jimmy was so excited. He used the tape to build things with his toys. He built a boat and a castle. He loved making new things with the tape.  Jimmy's Mom was so proud of him. She always videotaped him while he played. She always said he was a very normal boy and madeher very happy.  Jimmy and his mom had so much fun together. And it was all because she allowed him to use the tape.

Once there was a little girl who lived in a town with lots of people. One day, the town had a big celebration and they let off a special kind of bright thing called a firework. Everyone in the town was excited and the little girl was very happy. On the day of the celebration, the little girl was out in the garden when she saw something strange - a lit firework was on the ground! The little girl knew she had to be careful, so she stayed away. But then the firework started to move and it seemed like it wanted to follow her. The little girl wanted to get away, so she ran and ran until she felt safe. The firework followed her all the way until it reached the river. Suddenly, the firework exploded with a big noise and lots of bright sparks! The little girl was lucky, she was unharmed and she was very relieved. The little girl was glad that the firework was destroyed and she learned a very important lesson - to always be careful with fireworks!

Once upon a time, there was a bald man. Everyday he would walk to the beach near his house and admire the beautiful ocean. On his way, he would always pass by a small shop. He looked inside and saw a very special vase. The vase was so beautiful, the bald man just had to have it.  He went inside and asked to the shopkeeper, "Can I make the vase mine?"  The shopkeeper replied with a smile. "Of course! That will be five dollars."  The bald man was so excited - he now had the vase! He quickly paid the shopkeeper and ran home.  The bald man was so proud of his vase. He showed it to all his friends, who all admired it.  The bald man said softly to himself, "I am so happy I was able to make this vase mine."

The sun was shining brightly on the farm. The chickens were clucking and the cows were mooing. "Let's go and gather some squash," said Mama to her two little children. The children followed Mama outside and soon they were picking big oranges squash that were growing in the garden. While the children were picking the squash, Mama saw that one of her chickens was in the garden, too. It had the biggest orange squash in its beak. Mama yelled, "Come back here!" But the chicken wouldn't listen and ran away. Mama chased the chicken and it ran into a bramble bush. Mama quickly ran after the chicken, but when she reached the bush, she was hurt and started to cry. The children quickly ran to her side and said, "Mama, are you okay?" Mama took a deep breath and said, "Yes, but the chicken is too fast and we didn't get the squash." "Don't worry, Mama," said the children with big smiles. "We still have lots of squash, let's just go and gather more!"

Tom and Mia were going to camp with their mom and dad. They were very happy. They packed their bags with clothes, toys and snacks. They got in the car and drove for a long time. When they got to the camp, they saw many tents, trees and flowers. They also saw other kids and grown-ups. They said hello to them. They found a spot to set up their tent. They helped their mom and dad with the poles and the ropes. After they finished, they went to explore the camp. They saw a big lake with ducks and fish. They saw a playground with swings and slides. They saw a fire pit with logs and marshmallows. They wanted to try everything. "Can we go to the lake, mom?" Tom asked. "Can we go to the playground, dad?" Mia asked. "Sure, but be careful and stay together," mom and dad said. Tom and Mia ran to the lake. They threw stones and watched them splash. They fed the ducks and saw them quack. They felt happy and excited. Then they ran to the playground. They climbed the swings and pushed each other. They slid down the slides and laughed. They felt fun and free. They ran back to the fire pit. They saw their mom and dad waiting for them. They had sticks and marshmallows ready. They roasted the marshmallows and ate them. They felt warm and sweet. They hugged their mom and dad and said thank you. They said good night to the other kids and grown-ups. They went to their tent and snuggled in their sleeping bags. They felt tired and cozy. They closed their eyes and dreamed of the camp. They felt happy and loved. They had an ordinary day, but it was also a special day.

Once there was a boy named Tim. Tim was sad and miserable. He did not have any friends. He liked to keep his toys on a bookshelf in his room. The bookshelf was big and had many toys. One day, Tim saw a cat outside his window. The cat was lost and looked sad too. Tim wanted to be friends with the cat. He took the cat inside his house and gave it some food. The cat was happy and Tim was happy too. But the cat liked to play with Tim's toys on the bookshelf. The cat knocked over the toys and broke them. Tim was very sad and angry. He took the cat back outside and said, "You cannot be my friend." Tim was alone again, and the cat was sad too.

Sara and Ben were twins who liked to play with their toys. But sometimes they did not share well. One day, Sara found a fragile doll that belonged to their mom when she was little. She wanted to dress it up and comb its hair. "Look, Ben, this is my doll now. She is so pretty and old. You can't touch her or she will break," Sara said. Ben felt angry. He wanted to play with the doll too. He did not like that Sara ignored him. He tried to grab the doll from Sara, but she held it tight. "Stop it, Ben! You are mean and rude. Go away and leave me alone," Sara shouted. Ben did not listen. He pulled harder and harder. Sara screamed and cried. The doll's arm snapped off and fell to the floor. Sara and Ben both gasped. They knew they were in trouble. Mom heard the noise and came to see what was wrong. She saw the broken doll and the sad twins. She was very upset. "What have you done? This was my special doll. How could you be so careless and selfish? You need to learn to share and be gentle. Now you both have to take a nap and think about what you did," Mom said. Sara and Ben felt sorry. They hugged each other and said they were sorry. They picked up the doll's arm and gave it to Mom. They hoped she could fix it. They went to their beds and took a nap. They dreamed of playing nicely with each other and the doll.

Mia and Leo were twins who liked to play in their room. They had many toys and books and puzzles, but their favorite thing was the lamp. The lamp had a bulb that changed colors when they touched it. Sometimes it was red, sometimes blue, sometimes green, sometimes yellow. They liked to make up stories about the colors and what they meant. One day, they were playing with the lamp and the bulb turned purple. They had never seen purple before and they wondered what it meant. "Maybe it means magic," Mia said. "Maybe we can do magic with the lamp." "Maybe it means trouble," Leo said. "Maybe the lamp is broken and we have to fix it." They argued for a while, each wanting to try their idea. They pulled and pushed the lamp, but the bulb stayed purple. "Stop it!" Mia shouted. "You are hurting the lamp!" "No, you stop it!" Leo shouted back. "You are making it worse!" They were so loud that their mom heard them from downstairs. She came up to their room and saw them fighting over the lamp. "What is going on here?" she asked. "Why are you yelling at each other?" They both stopped and looked at their mom. They pointed at the lamp and the purple bulb. "It's purple!" Mia said. "It's purple!" Leo said. Their mom smiled and hugged them. She explained that the bulb was not ordinary, but special. It had a sensor that detected their mood and changed colors accordingly. Purple meant that they were both curious and excited, but also frustrated and angry. "It's okay to have different feelings," she said. "But you have to learn to share and listen to each other. The lamp is not a toy, but a tool. It can help you understand your emotions and communicate better." She showed them how to touch the lamp gently and watch the colors change. She asked them to tell her how they felt and why. They took turns talking and listening, and the bulb changed to different colors. They saw pink, orange, green, and blue. They felt happy, calm, and loved. They thanked their mom and hugged her. They decided to play with the lamp together, and make up stories that matched the colors. They settled on the floor, holding hands, and watched the bulb glow. They felt like they had a magic lamp, but also a friend.

Tommy was feeling lazy. He sat in his mum's lap in front of the fireplace. His mum had a big basket of things that she was dropping into the fireplace. Sparks flew out of the fireplace as the things dropped in. Tommy wanted to help, so he reached out his hands to grab things. He dropped the things into the fireplace one by one. Some of them made a loud crackle sound when they dropped. Some made lots of beautiful sparks. Tommy's mum was very proud of him. She smiled each time he dropped a new thing. The fireplace became very warm and the room was full of light. It was such a cozy place to be. Tommy and his mum stayed in front of the fireplace for a long time. It was so nice there with the warm fire. They both felt happy and lazy.

Bobby was a 3 year old boy who loved to play outside. He would spend hours exploring and discovering new things. One day he went outside and saw a broken play set in his neighbor's yard. He was sad to see it was broken, and wanted to help. He ran to his Mommy and Daddy and asked them if he could fix it. They said he should try. So Bobby set to work serving the play set. He spent all day tightening screws and putting things back together. Finally his work was done and the play set was as good as new. Bobby was so proud of himself. His Mommy and Daddy were so happy that Bobby helped fix the play set. Everyone was very happy.

Lily and Tom were playing hide and seek in the garden. Lily was the seeker and Tom was the hider. Lily counted to ten and then looked for Tom. She saw a big bush with green leaves and smelled something nice. She thought Tom might be hiding behind the bush. She walked to the bush and peeked behind it. She saw Tom sitting on the ground with a bunch of herbs in his hands. He was chewing on some of them and making funny faces. "Tom, I found you!" Lily said. "What are you doing with those herbs?" Tom looked at Lily and smiled. "I'm eating them. They taste good and make me feel funny. Do you want some?" He offered Lily some herbs. Lily was curious and took a bite. The herbs were bitter and spicy. She did not like them at all. She spit them out and made a yucky sound. "Tom, these herbs are gross! Why do you eat them?" Lily asked. Tom shrugged. "I don't know. I just like them. They make me dizzy and happy. Come on, let's eat more and play some more." Lily shook her head. "No, thank you. I don't want to eat more. I don't want to be dizzy and happy. I want to be normal and safe. These herbs are not good for you, Tom. They might make you sick or hurt you. We should stop eating them and tell Mommy." Tom frowned. "No, I don't want to stop. I don't want to tell Mommy. I want to eat more and more. You are no fun, Lily. Go away and leave me alone." Lily felt sad and scared. She did not like how Tom was acting. She did not want to leave him alone, but he did not listen to her. She ran away from the bush and looked for Mommy. She wanted to tell her what Tom was doing and ask for help. But it was too late. Tom ate too many herbs and got very sick. He fell asleep and did not wake up. Mommy found him and cried. She called the doctor, but he could not help. Tom was gone. Lily lost her brother and her friend. She wished she had never peeked behind the bush. She wished Tom had never eaten the herbs. She wished they had played a different game. She wished they had a happy ending.

Once upon a time, there was a little fishy named Nemo. Nemo loved to swim in the big ocean with his fishy friends. One day, Nemo got tired and wanted to rest. He found a cozy spot near some seaweed where he felt comfortable.  Suddenly, Nemo smelled something yummy coming from the other side of the ocean. He wanted to see what it was, so he swam over to investigate. When he got there, he saw his friend Dory stirring a big pot of fish soup!  Nemo was so excited to try the soup, but he didn't want to leave his comfortable spot. Dory understood and brought a bowl of soup over to him. Nemo slurped up the soup and felt so happy and comfortable. He thanked Dory for being such a good friend and for making the delicious soup.

Once there was a shark who lived in the sea. He was a very selfish shark and he liked to disturb the other creatures of the sea. He would often scare them and cause them trouble.  One day, a little fish saw the shark and was scared. She swam away as fast as she could, but the shark spotted her. He chased her and was about to grab her with his sharp teeth.  Just then, a bigger fish appeared. He scared the shark away and protected the little fish. The little fish was so happy and thanked the big fish. The big fish said, “No need to thank me. It’s not good to be selfish and disturb others.”  The little fish nodded and promised to always think of others before herself. The big fish was happy to hear this and swam away. The little fish learned a valuable lesson that day and never forgot it.

Tom is a boy who likes to draw. He has many colors of mark pens. He draws on paper, on books, on walls. He draws cars, animals, flowers. He is happy when he draws. But his mom is not happy. She says, "Tom, stop drawing on the walls! You make a mess. You have to clean it up. It is hard to take off the marks. You have to draw on paper only." Tom says, "Sorry, mom. I like to draw. I will clean it up." He tries to clean the walls with a cloth. But the marks are hard to take off. He rubs and rubs. He is tired and hungry. Mom says, "Tom, it is time for dinner. Come and eat. You can draw later." She makes dinner for Tom. She makes soup, bread, cheese, apple. Tom likes these foods. He says, "Thank you, mom. This is a good dinner." Mom says, "You are welcome, Tom. I am glad you like it. After dinner, you can draw on paper. I have a new book for you. It has many blank pages. You can draw anything you want." Tom says, "Wow, mom. That is a great book. I will draw a picture for you. I will draw you and me and a big heart. I love you, mom." Mom says, "I love you too, Tom. You are a good boy. You make me happy." She hugs Tom and kisses him. They smile and eat their dinner.

Once upon a time there was a cold tiger. He was really thirsty, so he went to the lake to drink some water. He jumped in and started to drink, but after a few minutes he saw something moving in the water. It was a big fish! The tiger got scared and jumped out of the lake.  He ran away and hid behind a big tree. He was so scared that he couldn't move. But after a few minutes he saw something else. It was a big jug of milk! The tiger was so happy that he ran over and started to drink it. He drank and drank until the jug was empty. The tiger was happy and content. He thanked the milk for giving him a drink. Now he was no longer thirsty, and he wasn't cold anymore. The tiger thanked the milk and went home, happy and content.  The tiger never forgot the lesson he learned - if you are thirsty, there is always something to drink.

Once upon a time, there were two best friends - Tom and Jack. Tom loved the navy and wanted to join it. But Jack did not think it was a good idea and tried to advise Tom against it. Tom: "I want to enter the navy and sail around the world!" Jack: "It won't be easy. Are you sure?" Tom: "Yes, I'm sure. I have always wanted to join the navy!" Jack smiled, and then said: "If you enter the navy, always remember - be brave and stay true to your friends." Tom took Jack's advice and decided to give it a try. He was accepted and began sailing around the world. He was so happy to be on the navy ship and he loved exploring. Everywhere he went, the food tasted so tasty! After a year on the navy, Tom realised the importance of Jack's advice - it is important to stay brave and be loyal to your friends!

Once upon a time there was a girl called Daisy. One day, Daisy wanted to make something. She had seen a picture of a veil and wanted to make one just like it. First, she found some material and some ribbon. Then, Daisy used the ribbon to make two loops. She put each loop through the material and then tied them together. When Daisy finished making her veil, she put it on her head. But, the loops were weak and so the veil didn't stay on. Daisy was sad. But then she had an idea. She took some tape and used it to stick the loops together. It worked! The veil stayed on her head and Daisy was very happy. She danced around with her veil on her head and everyone in the room couldn't help but smile.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was only 3 years old. Every day she spent time with her mommy and daddy, who taught her all sorts of things. They reminded her to always be kind and to always behave. One day she was out playing with her dolls when she saw a mouse. She was so scared! But then she remembered what her mom and dad had taught her about wisdom. She was brave and didn't run away like she wanted to. The mouse started talking to her and said, "You are very wise for such a little girl. You must have some magical powers!" She was so happy that she had done the right thing. The mouse had an idea. He told her about a place on the other side of the forest. He said that it was full of crazy, wild creatures that were always getting up to all sorts of mischief. He said it would be fun to go and see them! The little girl thought it sounded like a great idea and went off to the other side of the forest with the mouse. When she arrived, she was shocked! The creatures were very crazy! But she remembered to behave and stay calm. All in all, it was a very fun adventure. When she got home, she told her mom and dad all about it. They were so proud that she remembered to behave. They gave her a hug and said that the wisdom she had shown was truly

Once upon a time, there was a big boat with a door. The door was called a port. The boat could go on the water and take people to different places.  One day, the wind was very strong and the boat was moving a lot. The captain told everyone to shut the port so the water would not come inside.  The port was made of a flexible material that could move easily. When the wind stopped, the captain opened the port again and they continued their journey.  Everyone was happy and they arrived at their destination safely. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a helpless girl. She was walking in a meadow and she saw a big envelope. She was surprised, and went close to have a look. Suddenly, a big wind came and scattered the envelope all around. The helpless girl was very sad and felt like she had lost something very important. But then, a big bird came flying from the sky and started picking up the pieces from the envelope. He put them back together, carefully, and dropped it off in the same place. The helpless girl was very happy and could not believe it. She hugged the envelope tightly and thanked the bird for his help. Soon enough, the girl opened the envelope and found a great surprise. Inside, there was a toy for her to play with. Her eyes lit up and she was happier than ever! From that day onwards, the little helpless girl and the big bird were best friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, she saw her friend Timmy with a rabbit. It was so cute! Lily loved the rabbit and wanted to play with it. She asked Timmy if she could borrow the rabbit, but Timmy was nervous to let her take it.  Lily promised to take good care of the rabbit and not to hurt it. She said she would bring it back as soon as she was done playing with it. Timmy finally agreed and let her borrow the rabbit.  Lily had so much fun playing with the rabbit! She gave it carrots to eat and cuddled with it. When it was time to return the rabbit, Lily thanked Timmy for letting her borrow it. She promised to ask for permission next time before taking anything that wasn't hers.

One day, John was very eager to receive something special. He was wondering what it could be. Suddenly, he heard a knock on the door. He ran to answer it and saw a box! He was so excited he began jumping up and down. When he opened the box, to his surprise, he found a big bowl of pasta! He couldn't believe his eyes. He was so eager to eat the pasta. He grabbed a spoon and started eating. It was the best pasta he had ever tasted! He smiled and laughed with joy. He was so happy and thankful to receive such a special gift.

Once upon a time, there lived a loyal dog. Each day the dog obediently waited outside the house of its master, while only being given scraps of food as a reward. One day, the master was angry and decided to punish the dog. He shouted and hit it. The poor dog was so scared that it ran and never returned. All the neighbours felt sorry for the dog, but it was too late. The next day, the master was sad and felt guilty for his treatment of the dog. But the dog was gone and he could not find it. He longed for its loyalty and promised to treat the dog better, if only it returned. He waited and waited, but the loyal dog never came back. The dog was out in the wilderness and it suffered a lot. It was hungry and cold, but it stayed loyal to its master and never gave up hope that his master would eventually come and save it. Sadly, it was the dog's loyalty that made it suffer and it died all alone in the wilderness, never receiving the reward for its loyalty.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Betsy. Betsy loved to play in the fields and eat carrots. One day, while Betsy was nibbling on a carrot, she saw a big, scary wolf. The wolf wanted to eat Betsy for dinner! Betsy knew she had to protect herself. She ran as fast as she could and hid in a bush. The wolf couldn't find her there. Betsy was safe. After the wolf left, Betsy went back to her burrow. She realized that she needed to always be careful and protect herself from danger. She also learned that a mild-mannered bunny like herself can still be brave and strong. From then on, Betsy made sure to brush up on her safety skills and never let her guard down. She knew that being cautious was the best way to stay safe and happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat grapes, especially the purple ones. One day, she saw a grape on the ground and picked it up. She wondered if it was still good to eat. Lily tried the grape and it was delicious! She was so happy that she found a yummy grape. But then, she dropped the grape and it rolled away. Lily searched and searched for the grape, but it was persistent in hiding from her. Finally, Lily found the grape under a chair. She was so happy to find it again and ate it right away. From then on, Lily always made sure to hold onto her grapes tightly so they wouldn't roll away again.

Once upon a time, there was a duck who sailed the river. One day, he saw a tasty slice of bread floating down the river. He swam over to it and gulped it down in one bite. The duck was always so happy and content with the tasty slice of bread he found every day. One day, he wanted more and so he put his beak in the water and tried to find more slices of bread. But instead, he found a delicious fish! The duck realised that although it was tempting to be happy with just the one slice of bread, it was so much better to make an effort to search for something even tastier than just a piece of bread. The moral of the story is: never settle for good when you can find something even better.

Once upon a time there was a silly rabbit, her name was Roxy. Roxy was always looking for adventures. One day, Roxy saw a map. She thought it looked so exciting. "Let's go explore!" she said to her friends, Flip and Bob. They all grabbed their backpacks, put on warm clothes and got ready to adventure. They took the map with them and followed the directions. Roxy looked up and pointed. "Look everyone! There's a castle up there!" So, they all ran up to the castle and when they got there, there was a big sign that said, "TIE A RIBBON HERE TO CLAIM THIS CASTLE!" Roxy smiled and rummaged through her backpack. She pulled out a long, green ribbon and began to tie it to the castle wall. When she was done, her friends cheered. "Congratulations Roxy! You found the castle!" said Flip. Roxy smiled with pride and said happily, "We have a castle now!"

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to have fun and play all day. One day, Timmy's mom gave him a dictionary. Timmy didn't know what it was, but his mom said it was a book with lots of words. Timmy loved his new dictionary and would carry it everywhere he went. He would show it to all his friends and they would look at the pictures inside. But one day, Timmy accidentally spilled juice on his dictionary. The pages got all sticky and the pictures were ruined. His dictionary was now spoiled. Timmy was very sad and didn't know what to do. He tried to clean it, but it was too late. He didn't have another dictionary and he couldn't read his favorite stories anymore. Timmy learned a lesson that day, to take care of his things and not have accidents.

Once upon a time, there was a beautiful cat. She had a soft, shiny fur. She lived in a big house with a kind girl named Amy. Amy loved her cat very much. One day, Amy and her cat went outside to play. They ran and jumped in the green grass. The sun was shining, and the birds were singing. While they were playing, Amy fell down and hurt her knee. Amy sat down and began to cry. The beautiful cat saw Amy's knee and knew she was sad. So, the cat sat down next to Amy and stared at her knee. The cat wanted to make Amy feel better. Amy saw the cat staring at her knee and smiled. She knew her cat cared about her. The cat's love made Amy's knee feel better. They played together all day, and Amy's knee was not hurt anymore. They were very happy and loved each other very much.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who was wondering why the sky was so dark. She asked her mother why, and her mother looked up into the sky and explained, “It is because of lightning. Lightning is a big, scary thing that comes from the sky.” The little girl felt scared and helpless, but her mother reassured her that she was safe.  Inside the house, the little girl asked her mother why the lightning made so much noise. Her mother explained, “The lightning is so strong and so fast that it makes a loud noise when it moves across the sky. It looks like bright lights.”  The little girl was fascinated by the lightning and watched it streak across the sky. But she was still a bit scared because it was so bright and loud. Her mother explained, “It’s OK to be scared of lightning and loud noises, but you’re also safe inside with me.” The little girl felt less helpless now, and she watched the lightning in wonder.

Once upon a time there was a bridge. The bridge was very long and it crossed over a deep, wide river. The bridge was very reliable, so people knew that it was safe to use. One day, a boy wanted to cross the bridge. He was only three years old, so he was scared to try. He took a deep breath and slowly stepped onto the bridge. He held tight to the ropes as he walked, but he still felt scared. At the end of the bridge, the boy saw his mom waiting. She cheered and clapped for him. He was so relieved that he had made it across the bridge all by himself. He had been brave, and he had tried really hard.  The bridge was reliable, and it had helped the boy cross the river. That made him feel really happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little mouse named Mickey. Mickey loved to eat cheese, but one day he accidentally broke his favorite cheese plate. He was sad and didn't know what to do. Mickey's friend, a kind rabbit named Rosie, saw him looking sad and asked him what was wrong. Mickey told her what happened and Rosie said, "Don't worry, I can help you repair it!" Rosie took the broken cheese plate and used some glue to fix it. Mickey was so happy and grateful. He said, "Thank you so much, Rosie! You're the best friend ever!"  Suddenly, a big, mean cat appeared and wanted to harm Mickey. But Rosie quickly stepped in and blocked the cat. The cat tried to attack, but Rosie was too strong and harmless. The cat finally gave up and ran away. Mickey was safe and sound, and he knew he had the best friend in the world.

One day, a clever dog named Spot wanted to play. He saw a small box and thought, "I want to fit in that box!" So, Spot tried to fit in the box, but he was too big. The next day, Spot found a bigger box. He tried to fit in it, and this time, he fit! Spot was so happy that he could play in the bigger box. He jumped in and out of the box all day. On the third day, Spot's friend, a little cat named Fluffy, came to play. Fluffy saw the box and wanted to fit in it too. Spot and Fluffy tried to fit in the box together. They both fit, and they had lots of fun playing in the box that day.

There was an old house with a park outside. One day, a little boy wanted to go and explore the park. He ran out of the house and walked to the park. When he arrived, he saw lots of animals and a big swing. He played for hours, swinging and running around. After he played a while, he felt tired and decided to rest. He lay down on the floor and felt the sun warming his body. He closed his eyes and slowly fell asleep. He woke up a few hours later feeling refreshed. He said goodbye to the park and walked back to the old house. He felt happy and he knew he would visit the park again soon.

Once there was a monkey who lived in a dry forest. The monkey loved to listen to the sounds of the forest. He hopped from tree to tree and heard the chirping of the birds. He listened to the sound of leaves rustling in the breeze. One day, the monkey heard something special. It was a rustling sound that he had never heard before. He stopped hopping around and listened more closely. The Monkey heard a whisper coming from the old dry tree. He lifted his nose up high and saw a tiny mouse peeking out from the bark. The monkey was so surprised! The mouse was talking to him telling him a story. The monkey was mesmerised and listened the whole time. When the mouse was done, the monkey thanked her with a hug and a bow. He said goodbye and hopped away. This monkey was happy. He learnt something new by listening!

Once, there was a small boy who was feeling very lonely. He wanted someone to play with but no one was around. He decided to go on an adventure and see if he could find someone to help him. Just as he was about to begin his journey, he spotted a judge. The judge was looking sad and seemed lonely too. The boy asked the judge if he wanted to come along on his adventure. The judge said he would love to! The two of them went on a wonderful journey and the judge taught the little boy lots of interesting things. The boy was having so much fun and was so appreciative of all the things the judge had taught him that he wanted to show his gratitude. So, the boy asked the judge if he could lend him some money. The judge said yes and gave the boy enough money to buy a few nice things for his journey. The boy thanked the judge for his generosity, and the two of them parted ways. The boy was incredibly grateful for the judge’s kindness and felt less lonely now that he had a new friend.

Sara and Tom were playing in the park. They had a toy gun that could shoot water. They liked to shoot each other and laugh. "Tom, I will shoot you!" Sara said. She ran after him with the gun. "No, Sara, don't shoot me!" Tom said. He ran away from her. He hid behind a tree. Sara looked for Tom. She saw his feet under the tree. She smiled. She aimed the gun at his feet and shot. "Ah, Sara, you got me!" Tom said. He came out from the tree. He was wet. They heard a loud noise. They looked up. They saw an enormous plane in the sky. It was flying very low. It had a big star on it. "Wow, look at that plane!" Sara said. She pointed at it. "It's so big!" Tom said. He stared at it. The plane flew over them. It made a loud sound. It dropped something from its belly. It looked like a big ball. "What is that?" Sara asked. She was curious. "I don't know," Tom said. He was scared. The ball fell to the ground. It made a big boom. It was a bomb. It exploded. It made fire and smoke. It hurt many people and things. Sara and Tom were very lucky. They were far from the bomb. They did not get hurt. But they were very sad. They saw the fire and smoke. They saw the people and things that were hurt. They dropped the toy gun. They did not want to shoot anymore. They hugged each other. They cried.

Once upon a time, there was a young girl named Lily. She had a gentle cat named Mittens. Lily loved to play with Mittens and cuddle with her. One day, Lily's mom asked her to go to the store to buy some milk. Lily was scared to go alone, but her mom told her to trust herself and be brave. So, Lily took Mittens with her and they walked to the store together. On their way, they saw a little bird that had fallen from its nest. Lily picked up the bird and held it gently in her hands. Mittens watched over the bird too, making sure it was safe. When they got to the store, Lily bought the milk and they walked back home. Lily felt proud of herself for being brave and helping the little bird. She knew she could trust herself and be gentle with animals.

Paul had a cane that was very fine. He really liked his cane and was proud to share it with his friends.  One day Paul asked his friend, Jimmy, if he would like to play with the cane. Jimmy smiled and said, "Yes! That would be fun!" Paul was delighted and showed Jimmy how to hold the cane just right. He then proceeded to teach Jimmy the fun game to play with it.  Jimmy was amazed at how masterful Paul was. He practiced and practiced until he was just as good as Paul. When the game was over, Paul and Jimmy both agreed that they had had a really fun time. They shared a high five and smiled. It had been a really fine day!

One day, Jimmy went out to play in the park. He was so excited but he started to worry. What if he didn't find a friend to play with? Then, he heard a happy tune coming from a nearby bush. It was a little bird, whistling away! Jimmy was not worried anymore, he wanted to learn the song and whistle it himself. He got closer and wanted to make friends. The little bird was scared and flew away. Jimmy kept listening and tried to learn the tune by ear. He kept trying and soon he was whistling the same tune as the little bird. The bird came back and was amazed at Jimmy's whistling. They got to talking and the bird told Jimmy his name was Tweety. They were soon playing hide and seek. Jimmy felt happy, he wasn't worried anymore. They played until it started to get dark. Jimmy didn't want Tweety to fly away so he gave him a cheap whistle as a goodbye gift. Tweety said goodbye and flew away. Jimmy was happy, Tweety was his new friend. From that day on, he never worried again.

Tom and Lily liked to play with their toy cars and trucks. They had many different colors and sizes. They made roads and bridges with blocks and books. They zoomed and honked and crashed their toys. One day, they decided to play a new game. They called it "guard the treasure". They found a shiny box and filled it with their prettiest toys. They put the box in the middle of the room and made a circle of cars and trucks around it. They said, "This is our treasure and we are the guards. No one can take it from us." But their dog, Spot, was curious. He saw the shiny box and wanted to see what was inside. He walked towards the circle of cars and trucks. Tom and Lily saw him and shouted, "Stop, Spot! You can't have our treasure!" But Spot did not listen. He pushed his nose through the circle and knocked over some cars and trucks. He opened the box and saw the toys. He liked them and wanted to play with them. He grabbed a toy bear and ran away. Tom and Lily chased him and tried to get the bear back. But Spot was faster and ran around the room. He scattered the toys everywhere. He made a big mess. Tom and Lily were angry and sad. They said, "Bad dog, Spot! You ruined our game!" Spot did not understand. He thought they were playing with him. He wagged his tail and barked. He dropped the bear and picked up a toy ball. He threw it in the air and caught it. He was having fun. Tom and Lily stopped chasing him. They saw how happy he was. They felt sorry for him. They said, "Maybe Spot is lonely. Maybe he wants to play with us." They picked up some toys and joined him. They threw the ball and the bear and the other toys. They laughed and hugged him. They said, "We love you, Spot. You can be our friend." They played until they were tired. They cleaned up the mess and put the toys back in the box. They made a new circle of cars and trucks around it. They said, "This is still our treasure and we are still the guards. But Spot can share it with us. He is our guard dog." They cuddled with him and fell asleep. They had a good day.

Once upon a time, there were two friends named Jack and Jane. They wanted to go out and play but their bikes were broken and wouldn't work. Jane suggested they go find a mechanic to help fix their bikes.  So, the two friends set out in search of a mechanic. Eventually, they found a white garage with a mechanic inside. The mechanic greeted them and asked what the problem was. Jack and Jane explained that their bikes wouldn't work. The mechanic thought for a moment and then suggested they should try changing the tires on their bikes. Jack and Jane were very excited. They thanked the mechanic and went off to buy new tires. When they had finished, they fixed their tires to their bikes. Jack and Jane thanked the mechanic yet again and then went off to have fun!

Once upon a time, there was a little duck named Ducky. Ducky loved to play in the pond with his friends. One day, Ducky was walking by the pond when he saw a big frog. The frog was green and slimy and had big eyes. Ducky was a little scared of the frog, but he wanted to say hello. "Hi there, Mr. Frog," said Ducky in a gentle voice. The frog didn't say anything. He just looked at Ducky with his big eyes. Suddenly, the frog jumped out of the pond and onto the shore. Ducky was so shocked that he stepped back and fell into the pond. Ducky's friends came over to help him out of the water. "Don't worry, Ducky," said his friend Quackers. "We'll help you get out of the pond." Ducky was grateful for his friends' help. He learned that sometimes things can be scary, but with the help of friends, everything will be okay.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who was very eager to play. She asked her mom if she could invite a friend over to play. Her mom said yes, so the little girl ran off to invite her friend. When her friend arrived, they decided to play a game. They each picked a bulb and had fun pretending to plant flowers in a pretend garden. The little girl had a great time with her friend. They played together until it was time for her friend to go. When her friend left, the little girl was sad but still very eager for their next play date.

Bob and his mum were walking down the street when they saw a magazine in the shop window. Bob was very excited and asked if he could go inside and buy it. His mum said, "Yes, but don't forget to follow me when we are finished." When they got inside, Bob ran to the shelves and looked at all the magazines. He saw one with a picture of a superhero on the front and he knew this was the one he wanted. He jumped up and down with excitement and his mum smiled.  They went to the counter and Bob's mum paid for the magazine. Then she said, "Let's go now. Don't forget to follow me." Bob was so happy he started running down the street. But after a few steps, he stopped because he had forgotten to take his magazine. He was very upset and started to cry. His mum came over and said, "It's ok. I see the magazine. Come on, let's go now and don't forget to follow me." Bob followed his mum, clutching the magazine tightly the whole way home.

Once upon a time, there was a girl. She loved her bracelet. It was made of thin threads and tiny rocks. It was very pretty, and the girl wore it all the time. One day, the girl was playing in the garden. Suddenly, she saw a small butterfly and tried to follow it! The butterfly flew so quickly and she ran fast, but the bracelet on her arm kept getting in the way. The girl looked down at her beautiful bracelet, and decided to make it smaller so she could chase the butterfly more easily. She took out a pair of scissors and carefully cut the threads until the bracelet fit perfectly.  The girl was very happy with her new bracelet, and she raced around the garden, chasing after the butterfly. She was thrilled that her bracelet was so small and she could play without it getting in her way.

Once there was a little girl called Sarah. She was three years old and loved to play outside. One day, Sarah decided to go for a walk and see what she could find.  She came to a pond and saw some ducks there. They were swimming around and looked so happy. Sarah wanted to join them so she started to take off her clothes and jump in the water. Suddenly, she heard a voice calling her. It was her mother, telling her to get out of the pond. Sarah said she wanted to join the ducks, but her mom told her that if she got her clothes and shoes wet, they would become soggy.  So Sarah stayed on the shore. She found some corn nearby and started to soak it in the pond. She wanted to feed the ducks. She liked them very much. The corn became mild and the ducks ate it all. They quacked happily and Sarah smiled. She was glad she didn't get her clothes wet.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a very pretty dress that she loved to wear. One day, she saw her friend Sarah wearing an even prettier dress. Lily felt envious of Sarah's dress and wanted one just like it. Lily went to her mom and said, "Mommy, I want a pretty dress like Sarah's." Her mom said, "Let's go to the store and find one for you." At the store, they found a beautiful dress that Lily loved. Her mom said, "Let's buy it and take it home." When they got home, Lily wanted to try on her new dress. But she accidentally cut a small hole in it while taking off the tag. She felt very sad and scared that her mom would be mad. But her mom said, "Don't worry, it's just a small threat. We can fix it and your dress will be good as new." Lily was relieved and happy that her mom wasn't mad at her.

Tom is a boy who likes animals. He lives in a big city with his mom and dad. He has never seen a cow or a horse before. One day, his mom and dad take him to a ranch for a vacation. Tom is very happy and excited. At the ranch, Tom meets a friendly man named Jack. Jack is the rancher. He takes care of the animals. He shows Tom around the ranch and lets him pet the cows and the horses. Tom likes the soft fur and the big eyes of the animals. He also likes the sounds they make. He says "moo" and "neigh" with them. Tom also meets a friendly girl named Lucy. Lucy is Jack's daughter. She is the same age as Tom. She likes to play with the animals too. She teaches Tom how to feed the chickens and the pigs. She also teaches him how to ride a pony. Tom thinks Lucy is very nice and fun. He wants to be her friend. Tom has a lot of fun at the ranch. He learns many new things and makes new friends. He thanks Jack and Lucy for showing him the ranch and the animals. He tells his mom and dad that he loves the ranch and wants to come back again. His mom and dad smile and hug him. They are glad that Tom had a good time. They also like the ranch and the friendly people. They say goodbye to Jack and Lucy and promise to visit again soon.

Anna liked to play in the park with her friends. They liked to climb the big tree and sit on the branches. They felt like birds in the sky. Sometimes they sang songs and told stories. One day, a new boy came to the park. His name was Ben. He wanted to play with Anna and her friends, but he was shy. He did not know how to climb the tree. He watched them from the ground and wished he could join them. Anna saw Ben and felt sorry for him. She was a compassionate girl. She wanted to help him. She asked her friends to permit Ben to play with them. They agreed. They climbed down from the tree and greeted Ben. They taught him how to climb the tree and sit on the branches. They shared their songs and stories with him. Ben was happy. He thanked Anna and her friends for being kind to him. He said he liked the tree and the branches. He said he liked them too. They became friends and played together every day. They felt like birds in the sky.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to design pretty dresses for her dolls. One day, she decided to design a special dress for her mommy's tea party. Lily's mommy was very excited to see the dress Lily had designed. She poured some tea for herself and her friends and they all sat down to enjoy the party. But after a while, Lily started feeling dizzy and had to lie down. Her mommy realized that Lily had forgotten to eat something before the party and gave her some cookies. Lily felt better and was able to join the party again. Everyone complimented her on her beautiful dress and she felt very proud of herself. From that day on, Lily always made sure to eat something before attending a party. She also continued to design beautiful dresses for her dolls and her mommy's tea parties.

Once upon a time, there was a family who loved to celebrate. One day, the family was having a celebration for milkshakes. Everyone made their own milkshake - some liked them sweet, and others liked them sour. The family's little 3 year old was especially excited. He wanted to make his own milkshake. The family put all the ingredients in a jar and let the little one mix everything together. He added some ice cream, and then he added some fruits - he wanted it to be sour! When he was finished, he poured his milkshake into a cup and the family toasted and celebrated with him. The little one was very happy - it was the best milkshake he had ever tasted! He kept the jar with the leftovers so he could enjoy more of his sour milkshake later.  The family celebrated together, laughing and telling stories. It was a day to remember!

Sara and Tom are twins. They like to play together in the garden. One day, they see a big melon on the table. It is green and round and smells sweet. "Can we have some melon?" Sara asks Mom. "Not now, dear. The melon is for dinner. You can have a banana or an apple instead." Mom says. Sara and Tom nod, but they still want the melon. They wait until Mom goes to the kitchen. Then they sneak to the table and grab the melon. They run to the garden and hide behind a bush. They use a knife to cut the melon and eat it. It is juicy and yummy. "Wow, this is the best melon ever!" Tom says. "I know, right?" Sara says. They finish the melon and throw the rind away. They wipe their mouths and go back to the house. They pretend nothing happened. But Mom knows. She sees the empty spot on the table and the knife. She sees the rind in the garden and the juice on their faces. She is angry and sad. "Who ate the melon?" Mom asks. Sara and Tom look at each other. They feel guilty. They know they did a bad thing. They lower their heads and say sorry. Mom sighs. She hugs them and says she loves them. But she also says they have to learn to share and to listen. She says they have to help her make a new salad for dinner. And no dessert for them tonight. Sara and Tom nod. They hug Mom and say they love her too. They say they will be good and not eat the melon again. They go to the kitchen and help Mom. They hope she will forgive them. They hope the salad will be good too.

One day, a little girl named Lily went to the park with her mommy. They sat on a bench and watched the birds fly. Suddenly, Lily saw a whistle on the ground. She picked it up and showed it to her mommy. "Look mommy, I found a whistle!" Lily exclaimed. "That's great, Lily. Can you pull the string and make it whistle?" her mommy asked. Lily tried to pull the string, but it was too hard. "It's not working, mommy. The string is not flexible," she said. Her mommy smiled and helped her pull the string. The whistle made a loud sound that scared the birds away. Lily giggled and said, "I love my new whistle!"

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Anna. She was so adorable, with bright blue eyes and curly dark hair. One night, Anna needed to find her way in the dark, so she grabbed her flashlight and headed out of her bedroom. She walked carefully, and remembered what her mom told her to do. "Always use your flashlight to light your way," her Mom would remind her. Anna shone her flashlight all around her, and then she noticed something unusual - a big, white bunny had followed her out of her room! The bunny was so cute and gentle, but Anna knew she should head back to her bedroom. So, holding her flashlight in one hand, she gently picked up the bunny in her other one. She took one last look at the bunny, then went back to her room. Anna placed the bunny back in its place, then hugged it goodbye. She stood back, smiled, and remembered the gentle bunny with its big, floppy ears - so adorable!  Anna made sure to remind herself to use her flashlight in the dark, so she can avoid any unexpected surprises.

Jeff wanted to play a game. He got out his cool watch. But it was broken! Jeff was a little sad because he couldn't play the game. Then his mom had an idea. She said, “We can take your watch to the shop to get it fixed. Then you can play your game.” Jeff and his mom drove to the shop. While they were there, Jeff saw some cool new watches and he just had to have one. After the man in the shop fixed his watch, Jeff was so happy. His mom gave him the new watch as a surprise. He learned a lesson about being careful of his things so that he wouldn't need to get them fixed.  Jeff thanked his mom for helping him fix his watch. Now he can have fun playing his game with his cool new watch.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Jack. He had a very tidy cap on his head. Every day, Jack liked to go out and kick a ball.  One day, Jack went out for a walk and saw a ball rolling down the street. He ran after it and gave it a big kick. The ball flew up high in the sky!  Jack's cap also flew off his head. It flew away and landed far away. Jack was sad and ran towards the cap. When he got there, he saw a dog playing with the cap. So Jack decided to kick the ball towards the dog. The dog was scared and ran away. But it left the cap behind! Jack was very happy. He picked up his cap, brushed it off and put it back on his head. It was nice and tidy again!  He gave a big smile and continued walking with his ball and tidy cap.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to explore the world around her. One day, while playing in the park, she discovered a shiny battery on the ground. It was so nice and new-looking that she decided to pick it up and take it home with her. When she got home, Lily showed her mommy the battery she found. Her mommy was happy and proud of her for discovering something so interesting. They talked about how batteries make things work, like toys and flashlights. Lily was so excited about her discovery that she decided to put the battery in her toy car. She wanted to see how fast it would go with the new battery. And sure enough, her car went faster than ever before! Lily was so happy and proud of herself for finding such a nice battery.

A girl was feeling very shy. Every day she would watch other kids playing and wished she could join them. She knew she was too scared to do it. One day the girl had a plan. She was going to be brave and try to make some new friends. She took a deep breath, gave a little wave, and said "hello" to the other kids. They all said "hello" back and smiled. The girl was so happy to have new friends. She played with them until it was time to go home. The girl told her parents all about her plan and how it worked out. Her parents were so proud of her. From that day forward she was never shy again.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Toni. She was three years old and loved to explore in the garden. One day, when Toni was in the garden, she found something small and round. She picked it up and saw it was a new stamp. It had a bright yellow circle on it with a big "S" in the middle. Toni said, "What could this be?" She went to find her mommy and asked her. Her mommy said, "That's a stamp, sweetie. It's like a special sign that I put on a letter when I mail it." Toni was so excited to have her own special stamp. She put it carefully in her pocket and decided to take it to bed with her. That night, Toni put the stamp on her pillow and went to sleep. She had the best sleep ever and dreamed of places she could use her new stamp.

Once upon a time, in a big forest, there was a fat bear named Bobo. Bobo was always hungry. One day, he saw smoke coming from a small house. He walked closer to see what was there. Inside the house, a nice lady was cooking. She saw Bobo and said, "Hello, fat bear! Are you hungry?" Bobo nodded his head. The nice lady gave him some food to eat. It was very yummy. After eating, Bobo said, "Thank you!" He was not hungry anymore. The nice lady was happy to help. Bobo went back to the forest, and they both lived happily ever after.

Once there were two friends called Sam and Mia. Sam wanted to talk to Mia about something but was feeling a bit shy. He finally mentioned it to her. Mia had a different opinion to Sam, but that was ok. The opinion Mia had was very smelly! Sam was surprised by Mia's smelly opinion. But he still liked Mia, even if her opinion was smelly. They both laughed together and made up their own smelly opinion. They still talk about it now.

One day, there was a boy named Max. He was three years old and he very much liked to play. He had a red bicycle with two pedals, and he always liked to make it go as fast as he could. One day, while Max was going on an adventure, his pedal broke loose and his bike stopped working. Max was so sad. He looked at the broken pedal and he said, "That was a bad thing to happen. I need to find a new pedal so I can keep going." Max looked around and he saw a lady. He approached her and said, "Do you have a pedal I can use?" She smiled and said, "Yes, of course I do! You can have this one." Max thanked the lady and put the pedal on his bike. He hopped onto the bike and started to go on his adventure again. He was happy, and he never forgot about the kind lady who helped him find the pedal.

Once upon a time, there was a beautiful bear. He had soft, fluffy fur and he loved playing in the sunshine. One day, he wanted to make something special. He found some sticks and brought them over to his cozy den. He grabbed some glue and snap, snap, snap he put the sticks together. He was so happy when he finished; It was a beautiful basket! He put it by the window so he could look at it whenever he wanted. He wanted to make something else so he found some pretty leaves. He took the glue and started to work again. Snap, snap, snap with the leaves, he made a beautiful crown. He put it on his head and smiled. His afternoon of crafts was lots of fun. He had made two beautiful things using the glue. He was so proud of himself! He was a very clever bear.

Lisa and Tom were twins who liked to help their mom with the housework. They liked to put the dirty plates and cups in the dishwasher and press the button to make it start. They thought it was fun to watch the water and soap clean the dishes. One day, the dishwasher made a loud noise and stopped working. Mom looked worried and said, "Oh no, the dishwasher is broken. We have to call someone to fix it. It might cost a lot of money." Lisa and Tom felt sad and scared. They did not want their mom to be worried or spend a lot of money. They wanted the dishwasher to work again. They decided to do something to help. They went to their room and knelt on their bed. They folded their hands and closed their eyes. They prayed to God and asked him to help their mom and the dishwasher. They said, "Dear God, please help our mom and the dishwasher. Please make the dishwasher work again and make our mom happy. Thank you for everything you give us. Amen." They felt more comfortable and hopeful after they prayed. They hugged each other and went back to the kitchen. They saw their mom smiling and the dishwasher running. She said, "Guess what, kids? The dishwasher is working again. It was just a loose wire. I fixed it myself. Isn't that great?" Lisa and Tom were amazed and happy. They thanked God and their mom. They helped their mom put away the clean dishes. They felt proud and grateful. They learned that praying can make a difference.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play outside and sail her toy boat in the pond. One day, Lily's mom gave her a cup of juice to drink. Lily was so excited to drink the juice, but she accidentally spilled it all over her dress. Lily's mom said, "Don't worry, Lily. We'll go inside and change your dress." But Lily was persistent. She said, "No, Mommy. I want to sail my boat first." So, Lily sailed her boat in the pond with her wet dress. After a while, Lily's boat got stuck in some weeds. She tried to pull it out, but it wouldn't budge. Then, a kind old man came by and asked, "Do you need help?" Lily said, "Yes, please." The old man helped her get the boat unstuck and said, "Remember, Lily, it's okay to ask for help when you need it. And next time, be careful with your juice." Lily smiled and said, "Thank you!" From then on, Lily always asked for help when she needed it and never spilled her juice again.

There was once a little girl called Sue. She loved exploring in the woods near her house. One day she found an old tree and thought it would be fun to climb it. She started climbing and once she was in the top she noticed a furry squirrel running through the branches. When Sue tried to touch it, the squirrel ran away.  Sue was very sad but she suddenly noticed something in the bark of the tree - a small, round hole. She put her finger in the hole and pulled out a furry texture! She was really excited and showed it to her dad.  Sue's dad looked at the texture and smiled. He said, "I think this texture used to belong to the squirrel. We should restore it to its rightful owner!"  So Sue went back to the tree, ready to put the texture back. But, when she got there the tree was gone! She was so sad and started to cry. She could not see the squirrel anywhere.  She wondered what she should do when suddenly she heard the noise of claws against the bark. She looked up and there was the squirrel jumping down the branches with its tail twitching. Sue put out her hand with the texture in it, and the squirrel took it and ran off. Sue smiled and was happy to have been able to restore the furry texture to its rightful owner.

Once upon a time, there lived an underground monster who liked to roar. Each day, he would roar as loud as he could. Everyone in the underground was scared of his loud roars.  One day, a little rabbit who lived nearby had a good idea. She decided to visit the monster and talk to him.  She was very brave. She jumped down into the underground and said "Hello! I hear you like to roar, but you're scaring everyone".  The monster was surprised. He said, "I didn't know that my roars were scaring anyone. I like to roar because it makes me feel good".  The little rabbit said, "That's ok, you don't have to stop roaring, but maybe you can roar a bit quieter so everyone is happy."  So the monster tried it! He took a deep breath and let out a soft, gentle roar. Everyone was so pleased!  From then on, he roars every day, but now it's not too loud and everyone is happy.  The end!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to take pictures with her camera. One day, she saw a bird with weak wings that couldn't fly. Lily asked the bird, "Why are your wings weak?" "I don't know," said the bird. "Maybe I need to study how to fly better." Lily had an idea.
