She took out her camera and said, "I will take a picture of you, and then we can study it together to see how you can fly better." So, Lily took a picture of the bird and they studied it together. They noticed that the bird was not flapping its wings enough. So, they practiced flapping until the bird could fly high in the sky. From then on, the bird was no longer weak and could fly wherever it wanted to go.

Anna likes to play with her doll. She has a pink comb for her doll's hair. She combs her doll's hair every day. She makes her doll look pretty. One day, Anna's brother Tom comes into her room. He is naughty. He sees the comb on the floor. He picks it up and runs away. He laughs and says, "This is my comb now!" Anna is angry. She runs after Tom. She says, "Give me back my comb! It is not yours! It is for my doll!" Tom does not listen. He shakes the comb in the air. He says, "No, it is mine! I like to shake it! It makes a funny noise!" Anna tries to catch Tom. She jumps and reaches for the comb. But Tom is too fast. He runs around the room. He shakes the comb harder and harder. He says, "Ha ha ha! You can't get it!" Anna is sad. She cries. She says, "Please, Tom, give me back my comb! You are hurting it! It is not a toy! It is for my doll's hair!" Tom stops. He sees Anna's tears. He feels sorry. He says, "I'm sorry, Anna. I was just playing. Here is your comb. I won't shake it anymore." He gives the comb back to Anna. Anna smiles. She says, "Thank you, Tom. You are a good brother. I love you." She hugs Tom. She takes the comb and goes back to her doll. She combs her doll's hair gently. She says, "Don't worry, doll. Your hair is still pretty. I will take care of you."

Once upon a time there was a bald boy called Thomas. He was three years old. One day, he was playing in his bedroom when he discovered a bookshelf. He got very excited and decided to explore it. Inside the bookshelf, he found a box. He opened it up, but it was empty. He got very scared and ran out of the bookshelf. Thomas looked around the room, but he couldn't find anyone. Suddenly, a voice from the bookshelf called out to him. “Come closer, Thomas,” the voice said. Thomas was scared, but he was also curious. He slowly walked towards the bookshelf and discovered an old man. The man was bald. “What do you want?” Thomas asked. The old man smiled and said, “I want to take you away.” Without thinking, Thomas took the man’s hand. The old man took him away to a scary, dark place and disappeared. Thomas was never seen again.

Once upon a time there was a girl. She was three years old. She had a big red ball. She leaned over to pick it up. Then she saw a big tub of ice cream. She loved ice cream and she wanted to eat it. She leaned over and opened the tub. She saw the cream inside and it looked so yummy! She was a little bit scared, because she had never tried ice cream before. But it was so easy! She smiled and leaned forward to take a taste. It was the most delicious thing she had ever tasted. She leaned back, happily licking her spoon. Ice cream was so yummy! Now she knew why so many people liked it.

One morning, the sun rose in the sky. It was a peaceful sunrise, with birds singing and animals playing. Mama and Daddy were in the kitchen, talking in low voices. Mama had caught Sammy, the little boy, breaking something in the house. She was telling Daddy that Sammy needed to learn he couldn't break things.  Daddy agreed with Mama, and said that Sammy needed to be punished. So they made a plan. The next day, they took Sammy outside when the sun rose. Sammy was confused, but they said they were going to have a special lesson. On the grass, they had Sammy write with a stick, 'I must not break things.' All morning Sammy wrote this, so he would remember. By the time the sun was high in the sky, Sammy was done writing.  Mama and Daddy looked at the words. They said Sammy had been punished, and now he must always remember to be careful. Sammy nodded, and said he would.  Mama and Daddy hugged Sammy. Then they all went inside, happy and together.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a tutor named Miss Sue who helped him learn new things. Timmy loved Miss Sue because she was very kind and patient with him. Sometimes Timmy would be slow to understand things, but Miss Sue would always help him solve the problem. One day, Timmy was trying to build a tower with his blocks, but it kept falling down. He was getting frustrated and didn't know what to do. Miss Sue saw that Timmy was struggling and came over to help him. She showed Timmy how to build the tower slowly and carefully, and soon they had a tall tower that didn't fall down. Timmy was so happy that he gave Miss Sue a big hug. He realized that even when things are hard, there is always someone who can help you solve the problem.

Once upon a time, there was a baby. The baby liked to play with toys. One day, the baby was in the park with mom and dad. The baby saw a big red ball and wanted to play with it. The baby went to the ball and started to play. Suddenly, a big dog came and took the ball away. The baby was sad and began to scream. The mom and dad heard the baby and became alert. Mom and dad ran to the baby and hugged him. They took the ball back from the dog. The baby was happy again. They all played together with the ball and had a fun day at the park.

On a bright, sunny day, there was a chubby little goose who wanted to go on an adventure. She snapped her wings and off she flew! She flew over rivers, hills and trees, and had a wonderful time exploring the world. Pretty soon, the little goose was getting tired. She snapped her wings and started flying back to her home. But when she got there, she was surprised to find a chubby little fox waiting for her. The fox sat still and smiled at her, and she was too tired to fly away.  The fox asked if the goose wanted to be his friend. The goose nodded and the fox motioned for her to follow. He led her to the edge of a forest, and with a snap of his tail he opened a secret door that led under the ground. The little goose was amazed and curious. She stepped inside and what she saw made her heart smile. Everywhere she looked it was filled with chubby little animals who welcomed her with open wings. They showed her around and told her stories, and before she knew it, the sun was setting and it was time to go home. The little goose said goodbye to all her new animal friends, and with a snap of her wings she flew back home. Every day after that she would come back and visit her animal friends, and they would always have wonderful adventures together.

Ann was a young girl. She was only three years old. Every day she looked forward to going outside with her dad. They liked to take long walks together. Today Ann and her dad strolled along the beach. Ann loved to gaze at the sea. She could feel its gentle waves. Ann felt peaceful and happy. Suddenly, she spotted a fish out in the ocean. It was a large fish and its scales shone brightly in the sun. Ann was instantly drawn to the fish. She felt its wisdom as it looked back at her. Then Ann noticed something else. High above the sea she saw a fragile little bird. It was barely bigger than a bug. Ann wanted to learn from the bird. She wanted to use its wisdom. Ann watched the bird for ages and soon she felt joy and freedom in her heart. She thought about how amazing life was. Ann and her dad smiled at each other, both feeling the same joy.

Once upon a time, there was a big elephant named Ellie. Ellie had a wife named Ella who was very large too. One day, Ellie went to the store to buy some bananas for Ella. But when he got home, he saw that Ella was very angry. "What happened?" asked Ellie. "You spoil me too much!" said Ella. "I don't want bananas anymore. I want something else." Ellie didn't know what to do. He loved Ella so much and didn't want her to be upset. So, he went back to the store and bought some flowers for her. When he gave them to her, Ella's face lit up with a big smile. She hugged Ellie and said, "Thank you, my dear husband. You always know how to make me happy." From that day on, Ellie learned that spoiling his wife didn't always mean buying her things, but sometimes just showing her love and affection.

Anna and Ben are playing with their toy animals. Anna has a lion and Ben has a giraffe. They make the animals talk to each other. "Hello, lion. I am giraffe. Do you want to be friends?" Ben says. "Yes, giraffe. I want to be friends. You are very tall and I am very strong. We can help each other," Anna says. They play for a long time, making the animals run, jump, and eat. They have fun and laugh a lot. Soon, it is evening. The sky is dark and the stars are bright. Anna and Ben's mom calls them. "Anna, Ben, it is time to go to bed. Come and brush your teeth and put on your pajamas," mom says. Anna and Ben do not want to stop playing. They want to play more with their animals. "Mom, can we play a little more? Please, please, please?" Anna says. "Mom, we are having so much fun. Just a little more?" Ben says. Mom smiles and shakes her head. She is patient with them. "No, my loves. You have played enough for today. You need to sleep and rest. You can play more tomorrow. Come on, let's go," mom says. Anna and Ben sigh. They know mom is right. They pick up their animals and hug them. "Good night, lion. Good night, giraffe. Thank you for being my friend," Anna says. "Good night, giraffe. Good night, lion. You are my best friend," Ben says. They put their animals on their beds and follow mom. Before they go to their rooms, they bow to each other. "Good night, Anna. Good night, Ben. You are my best sister/brother," they say. They kiss mom and go to sleep. They dream of their animals and their friendship.

Once upon a time, there was a beautiful plane. It had shiny red and blue wings. The plane was going to measure something special. So the plane flew up high, up into the sky. It flew all the way to the clouds. The plane flew around and around, measuring the sky. When the plane was finished, it flew back down to the ground. The plane did a happy dance when it finished measuring. It was so proud of itself that it made a big smile.  The plane was so happy that it flew around and around. It wiggled and twirled in the sky. The plane was so beautiful, everyone stopped to watch it. It was so special that everybody waved and smiled. The plane was so happy it had measured something so important. It was so proud of itself that it flew up into the sky. It flew up to the clouds and kept flying and flying. The plane flew around and around, and waves goodbye to everyone it had seen.  The End.

Once there was a girl called Lisa. She was 3 years old and liked to play. Today, Lisa's mum said, "Let's go to the park." Lisa said, "Yay!" She was so excited. They got to the park and saw a big, red grill. Lisa said, "What's that?" Her mum said, "That's a grill. It's used to cook food." Lisa said, "Can we eat here?" Her mum said, "No, this is too boring. Let's go play on the swings!"  So that's what they did. They played for a long time and had lots of fun!

Once upon a time, there was a big garden. In the garden, there was a tall plant with a yellow flower. It was called a sunflower. The sunflower was very happy because it loved to feel the sun on its face. But one day, a little girl came to the garden. She was frustrated because she wanted to pick the sunflower. The sunflower said, "Please don't pick me. I want to stay here and grow big and strong." The little girl understood and allowed the sunflower to stay in the garden. From that day on, the sunflower grew bigger and bigger. It was so tall that it could see over the garden fence. The little girl was happy to see the sunflower every time she came to the garden. And the sunflower was happy to be allowed to stay and grow.

Lily loves to sign. She signs with her hands and her face. She signs to her mom and dad, and to her friends at school. She signs when she is happy, sad, angry, or curious. She signs because she cannot hear. Today is Lily's birthday. She is four years old. She is very excited. She wears a pink dress and a crown. She goes to school with a big smile. She signs to her teacher and her classmates, "Today is my birthday!" Her teacher signs back, "Happy birthday, Lily! We have a surprise for you!" She takes Lily and the other children to the playground. There, Lily sees a big table with balloons and streamers. And on the table, there is a big cake with candles. The cake has Lily's name on it, in letters and signs. Lily is so happy. She claps her hands and jumps up and down. She signs, "Thank you, thank you, thank you!" She hugs her teacher and her friends. They all sing and sign, "Happy birthday to you!" But there is one more surprise. Under the table, there is a hidden box. Lily's teacher gives her the box and signs, "Open it, Lily. It is a gift from us." Lily opens the box and gasps. Inside, there is a book. A book with pictures and words and signs. A book about a girl who loves to sign, just like Lily. Lily is so happy. She signs, "I love it, I love it, I love it!" She hugs the book and shows it to everyone. She signs, "This is the best birthday ever!"

Once upon a time, there was a girl who loved to explore and have wonder. She was always full of wonder, looking at the world in awe. One day, she was walking through a rough field, and she saw a man. He was sneaky and mean, trying to steal something. The girl was very scared, and she quickly ran back home. The girl told her mom what she saw and felt very scared. Her mom hugged her, and said they would work together to figure out what to do. They figured out that the man was trying to steal from the farm nearby. Her mom decided it was best to tell the farmer what happened. So the girl and her mom went to the farm and told the farmer about the man trying to steal. The farmer was very angry and scared because he knew it could happen again. He asked his friends for help and together, they set a big fence around the farm. The girl was happy to see the farm safe and full of wonder again. She was also glad to know that she and her family could be brave and help keep the farm safe. The rough field was now a place of safety, thanks to her and her mom.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside with his toys. One day, Timmy's mom said, "Timmy, it's time to wash your hands for dinner." Timmy went inside to wash his hands. While Timmy was washing his hands, he felt the ground shake. "Mommy, what's happening?" Timmy asked. "It's just an earthquake, Timmy. Don't worry," his mom said reassuringly. Timmy was impressed by how powerful the earthquake was. After the earthquake stopped, Timmy went back outside to play with his toys. He saw his neighbor, Billy, and said, "Did you feel the earthquake, Billy? It was impressive!" Billy nodded his head and said, "Yeah, it was scary too." Timmy and Billy played together until it was time for dinner.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lucy. She had a big box. Inside the box, there was a blouse. Lucy wanted to unpack the box to see the blouse. When Lucy unpacked the box, she found a pretty blouse. It was red and had flowers on it. Lucy was so happy! She put on the blouse and danced around her room. Lucy's mom made dinner. They had spicy food. Lucy liked spicy food a lot. She ate all her food and said, "Yum! I like my new blouse and spicy food!" And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy who loved animals. He dreamed of going on a safari one day to see all the wild animals in their natural habitat. One day, his parents surprised him with a trip to a nearby zoo. Timmy was so excited he could hardly contain himself. As they walked around the zoo, Timmy saw all kinds of animals - lions, tigers, elephants, and giraffes. He even got to feed the monkeys! At the end of the day, they stopped by the gift shop to buy a souvenir. Timmy picked out a stuffed lion to remember his amazing day. On the way home, Timmy fell asleep in the car. When they arrived home, his parents carried him to bed. But when Timmy woke up the next morning, he didn't feel very well. He was hot and had a bad cough. His parents took him to the doctor, who said Timmy had caught a cold from being out in the rain at the zoo. Timmy was so tired and sad that he couldn't go on his dream safari. He just wanted to print out pictures of the animals he had seen and go back to bed.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy. He had a special shoe that he liked to bounce. He would bounce the shoe up and down and around. It was so impressive to watch him! He was so proud of himself and his bouncing shoe. Everytime he bounced it, he smiled and laughed. The little boy showed his special shoe to all of his friends. They were in awe at the fantastic bouncing the little boy could do. He was so talented! Everywhere he went, he took his special shoe and bounced it. One day, he even managed to bounce the shoe all the way over his house! His friends cheered and clapped for him. They had never seen anyone bounce a shoe so far! The little boy was so proud of himself and his bouncing shoe. He could now do an impressive thing with it and enjoyed to show it off to all of his friends.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat yummy food like apples and bananas. One day, her mommy made her a sandwich with peanut butter and jelly. It was so tasty! Later that day, Lily's daddy came home and said, "Let's go for a drive!" They hopped in the car and drove to the park. When they got there, Lily saw a big, dry playground. She ran over to the slide and climbed up to the top. Wheee! She slid down and giggled. After playing for a while, they got back in the car and drove home. Lily was tired from all the fun, but happy and full from the yummy food she had eaten earlier. She fell asleep in the car and dreamed about the next time she could go on a drive with her family. The end.

Timmy was playing in his sandbox when he noticed something falling from the sky. “What’s that?” he asked his dad. “That’s ash,” his dad replied. “It’s from the volcano near the city.” Timmy frowned. He felt sad that the volcano was hurting people. He noticed his dad talking to a rude man across the street. The man yelled, “Stop the volcano! Make it fall down!” His dad shook his head. “That’s not nice. We can’t make the volcano fall - only nature can do that.” Timmy smiled. He was glad his dad was so kind. He watched as the ash continued to fall from the sky.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Jane. Jane loved to buy things but she was always careful to stay alert. She knew that getting into trouble was a bad thing so she always watched out for it. One day Jane went shopping with her mom. She wanted to buy a new toy. Jane's mom said she could buy one thing if she stayed on her best behavior. Jane stayed alert while they walked around the store. They looked at lots of toys, but Jane didn't find one that she liked. Suddenly, she spotted a toy she had been wanting for weeks! She asked her mom if she could buy it. Her mom said yes, so Jane happily grabbed the toy and went to check out. Jane paid for the toy with the money her mom gave her. She said a quick thank you, put the toy in her bag and ran off. She was glad she bought the toy and stayed alert so she didn't get into any trouble.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to skip and play with her toys. One day, she decided to start a game of hide-and-seek with her friends. She was very excited to play! Lily was careful when she hid behind a big tree. She didn't want her friends to find her too quickly. But as she waited, she heard a loud noise. It sounded like a growling monster!  Lily was scared, but she remembered her mom telling her to be brave. She peeked around the tree and saw that it was just her friend's dog, Max. He had been chasing a squirrel. Lily laughed and ran to find her friends. They all had a good laugh about the silly scare.  From that day on, Lily was always careful when playing hide-and-seek. She didn't want to be scared by any more silly things! And she always made sure to skip and play with her friends, because it made her very happy. The end.

The family went for a walk in the park. The sun was shining and the sky was a bright blue. Daddy asked his two daughters if they wanted to play. The little girl, who was three, said she wanted to go to the swings. Daddy said it was a great idea so off they went. The little girl ran to the swings and started to swing. She squealed with delight as Daddy pushed her higher and higher. Soon, her sister wanted to join in. Daddy asked her if she wanted to swing on the big swing or the small one, and the little girl said the small one. So Daddy put his two daughters on the swing, one on each side and they swung together, laughing and singing. They had a great time. When they were done swinging, Daddy asked the little girl what she wanted to do next. She pointed to the slide and said, “Slide!” Daddy said that was a great idea, so he carried them both to the top of the slide. He showed them how to sit down and slide down the slide easily. The little girl had a great sight when she looked down the slide. She smiled and said, “Let's do that again!” So they did, again and again, until the girls were ready to go.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys in the park. One day, she saw a man with a big bag walking towards her. The man looked strange and Lily felt scared.  Suddenly, the man grabbed Lily's doll and tried to run away. But Lily remembered what her mom had told her. She pushed the man and he fell down. The man was a thief who wanted to steal Lily's toys.  Lily's mom was very proud of her. She told Lily that it's always important to be careful and protect our things. Lily learned that it's not always easy to trust strangers, but she knew that she could always count on her mom and herself to stay safe.

Once upon a time, in a big pink house, there lived a kind lady. She loved to give massages to her friends. Her hands were so soft and warm, and her friends always felt happy after her massages. One day, a little bird with a hurt wing came to the lady's window. The bird could not fly, and it was sad. The kind lady saw the bird and wanted to help. She prayed for the little bird to feel better soon. The lady took the bird inside her pink house and gave it a gentle massage. The bird felt better and better as the lady massaged its wing. After a while, the bird could move its wing again. The lady and the bird were so happy! The next day, the bird was ready to fly again. It thanked the kind lady for her help and her great massage. The lady prayed for the bird to have a safe journey, and the bird flew away into the sky. From that day on, the bird would visit the kind lady in her pink house every day. They became the best of friends, and the lady continued to give massages to all her friends, making them feel happy and loved.

Once there was a little girl named Daisy who loved to explore. One day, she went in the garden and decided to look everywhere. She saw a cobweb in the corner, it was green and beautiful. Daisy decided to look closer and so she gently moved closer to the web. What Daisy saw made her gasp: A little green spider appeared! He smiled at Daisy and said: "If you don't touch my web I will be your friend!" Daisy thought it was a nice idea and so she decided to be friends with the spider. They played together all day long and Daisy never touched his cobweb. They were the best of friends!

Billy liked ice cream. He wanted some cream to eat. So he went to the shop and bought some.  However, when he was walking back home, he slipped and the cream dropped to the ground. It made a big mess. Billy was very sad.  His mom saw what happened and said, "it's ok, Billy." She grabbed a cloth and cleaned up the mess. Then she walked back to the shop and bought some more cream.  When they got home, Billy was very happy. His mom said the old cream was bad and not good to eat. Billy thought that was silly and said the new cream would be yummy.  Billy and his mom laughed, sat down and shared the cream. It was delicious and Billy enjoyed it very much.

Once upon a time, there was a green frog named Bob. Bob lived in a big pond. He liked to jump and play with his friends. One day, Bob saw a big jar of cream. He did not know what it was. Bob and his friends went to look at the cream. They jumped into the jar to see what it was like. The cream was wet and sticky. They had fun playing in it. But then, the sun came out and the cream began to dry.  Bob and his friends started to feel stuck in the dry cream. They tried to jump out, but they could not. They were scared. Then, a big bird saw them and helped them get out of the jar. Bob and his friends were so happy to be free. They thanked the bird and went back to their pond to play.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing in her room with her toys. One day, she found a big cushion and she was so excited! She jumped on it and rolled around. Her mom came in and asked, "What are you doing, Lily?" "I'm playing on my cushion! Imagine if I could bounce on it like a trampoline!" Lily said with a big smile. Her mom laughed and said, "That would be so much fun! Maybe we can find a real trampoline for you to play on outside." Lily was even more excited at the thought of playing on a trampoline. She hugged her mom and said, "Thank you, mom! You always know how to make me happy."

One day, a little girl named Mia went for a walk in the woods. She saw a beautiful flower and wanted to pick it. But when she tried, a tiny spirit came out of the flower. The spirit said, "Please don't pick the flower, it's my home." Mia felt sad because she wanted the flower, but she didn't want to make the spirit sad too. So, Mia asked the spirit, "What can I do to have a beautiful flower like this without making you sad?" The spirit thought for a moment and said, "I can help you grow a beautiful flower just like this one." Mia was happy and said thank you to the spirit. They worked together to plant a new flower. Soon, Mia had her own beautiful flower, and the spirit still had its home.

Once upon a time there lived a great little mouse. He loved playing and exploring everywhere he could. One day he saw a trap. It was made of metal and had a lock on the front. He had never seen anything like it before.  He was curious and carefully he hopped closer to take a closer look. The mouse started to play with the lock and before he knew it, he felt himself falling. The trap had closed and he was stuck inside!  He was so scared and he started to cry. But then he heard a voice from somewhere nearby. It was a cat. She said: "Don't worry, little mouse. I know how to unlock the trap." The cat carefully unlocked the trap. Once it was open, the mouse was free again. He thanked her for helping and the cat said "you're welcome".  The mouse ran off, safe and sound. From then on, he always knew to stay away from traps and locks!

Once upon a time, there were two birds; a bald eagle and a sparrow. The bald eagle said to the sparrow, “Let’s fly together!”  The sparrow was scared, so he said, “But I’m not strong enough to fly so high. I can only fly a short distance.” The bald eagle smiled and said, “It’s okay, I can help you. Just stick close to me and I will help you fly higher.” So the sparrow followed the bald eagle as they soared in the sky. Suddenly, the sky became cold. The bald eagle was about to fall because he was getting tired, but the sparrow came to help him. The sparrow said, “Let's stick together, then we can make it through the cold air easier.”    So they did, and they both managed to fly past the cold air safely.  At the end of their journey, the bald eagle said, “We made it! But I wouldn’t have been able to make it without you.” The moral of the story is that it is better to help each other and stick together, instead of trying to do things on our own.

Tom and Sam were brothers who liked to play with their dad's tools. One day, they found a big metal thing that looked shiny and fun. They did not know it was a polish machine that made things smooth and bright. They wanted to try it on their toys and other things. They plugged the machine into the wall and turned it on. It made a loud noise and spun very fast. They took turns to hold their toys against the machine. They saw sparks and smoke come out. They thought it was cool and funny. They did not smell the bad smell or see the fire. Soon, the fire grew bigger and hotter. It reached the curtains and the carpet. It made more smoke and noise. Tom and Sam started to cough and cry. They were scared and wanted to run away. But the door was locked and they could not open it. They did not know where the key was. They did not know how to call for help. Their dad came home and saw the smoke and fire. He ran to the door and tried to break it. But it was too late. The fire was too strong and dangerous. He could not save his sons. He fell to the ground and screamed. He was very sad and angry. He wished he had never left the polish machine out. He wished he had taught his sons to be careful and safe. He wished he could hug them and say sorry. But he could not. They were gone.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to explore the forest near her house. One day, she saw a big cave. She wanted to go inside, but she was scared.  Lily went home and told her mom about the cave. Her mom said, "Maybe we can go together tomorrow." Lily was happy and went to sleep dreaming about the cave. The next day, Lily and her mom went to the cave. It was dark and scary, but they had a flashlight. Suddenly, they saw something shiny. It was a cheap necklace! Lily was so happy and said, "Welcome to our treasure!"  From that day on, Lily and her mom went to the cave every week. They found many treasures and had fun exploring. Lily learned that sometimes scary things can be fun too.

Bob was out walking on the beach. It was a hot day, and he was looking at the waves. Suddenly, it started to rain. Bob was surprised. Rain was rare in this part of the world, so he was happy it was raining. He wanted to go for a swim, so he started running towards the sea. When he got closer, he saw a big wave. Bob stopped and looked at it. It was so big! He couldn't believe his eyes. He looked around and saw that everyone else was running away from it. Bob called out: "Why are you running away from the wave?" One of the people replied: "It's too big! It will sweep us away!" Bob was brave. He ran towards the big wave and jumped into it. He was happily swimming in the water. Bob had a rare and exciting experience!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally was very excited as it was dinner time.  Sally's tummy was grumbling with hunger. She raced to the table, looking forward to dinner. "Momma, what's for dinner?" Sally asked with excitement. "Pasta!" Her Momma said with a big smile. "Yay!" Sally said and clapped her hands. Sally's Momma started to cook the pasta. While it was cooking, Sally was getting more and more excited. Once the pasta was ready, Momma put a plate of pasta in front of Sally. "It's time to eat," Momma said. Sally took a bite and said "Mmmm, this pasta is the best! I demand more pasta please, Momma." Momma was so happy that Sally liked her pasta so much, she put more on her plate. Sally smiled, thanked her Momma, and continued to eat her yummy dinner.

Once upon a time there was a friendly fireman. He went to work each day, returning in the evening to tell stories and laugh with his family. He was very competitive and worked hard.  One day on the way home, the fireman had a strange feeling. He hurried back to his house, and when he arrived, it was on fire! The fireman went to work, spraying the water from his hose on the fire. He fought hard to put out the blaze.  After several hours, the fireman had won the battle. He looked around at the damage the fire had caused, but he made sure everyone was safe.  The fireman was very proud of his work. He had returned home to find a fire, and despite the odds was able to conquer it. He was relieved that no one was hurt, and had saved his home. The fireman smiled as he went to bed, satisfied with his achievement.

Once there was a frog named Fred. He lived in a small town and he loved to swim. Every day he would jump into the pond near his house and swim around. One day, Fred decided to swim further out of town. He passed by some busy streets and he saw lots of people walking around. But he didn't stop. He kept swimming further and further away. Finally, Fred reached a large lake. It was crystal clear and he could see lots of little fish swimming around. He was so happy to be here! He swam around, exploring the lake and having fun. But while he was swimming, Fred suddenly heard a sound in the distance. It sounded like someone was calling his name. He swam closer, and he saw two little frogs waiting for him on the shore. It was his brother and sister! He had a feeling that this lake would bring him big adventures with his family, and he was right! He and his siblings spent lots of time swimming around the lake together, exploring and having even more fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy. He was so excited to go and play in the park. He had a new toy and he wanted to show his friends. As he walked, he saw a big lake. He wanted to row his toy across the lake.  He tried and tried but he was just too little. He kept dropping the oars. He got so frustrated he started to cry. His mum saw him struggling and said "Don't worry, I can help!" She helped him row to the other side of the lake.  He was so proud of himself, he had worked so hard! He showed all his friends his toy. They were so impressed and they all decided to go and row together. It was such a fun day.  The little boy learned that with a bit of hard work, he can do anything!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. He loved to play with his toys all day long. One day, Timmy went to the park to play with his friends. They played hide and seek, and Timmy was very good at hiding. His friends could not find him for a long time. When they finally found him, Timmy said, "I was hiding like a ninja!" His friends laughed and said, "You're such a jokester, Timmy!" Timmy smiled and felt happy that he made his friends laugh. After playing for a while, they decided to have a race. Timmy wanted to win, so he ran as fast as he could. He was very alert and made sure he didn't trip. Finally, Timmy crossed the finish line first and shouted, "I won! I won! I am the victory!" His friends clapped and cheered for him. They all had a great time together.

Once upon a time there was a crazy sailboat. It was made of cauliflower! All the other boats were made of wood and metal, but this one was made of cauliflower. The little sailboat floated on the big, blue ocean all day. It sailed over big waves, small waves and crazy storms. Nothing could stop the cauliflower sailboat! Suddenly, a strong wind blew the sailboat off course. It sailed faster and farther than ever before and went to a magical island. On this island, the cauliflower sailboat met many other boats of all shapes and sizes. They danced and played for days and days! At the end of their journey, the cauliflower sailboat and its new friends sailed back to the shore. The little sailboat was feeling sad to be leaving its new friends, but it was also happy to be back home. The cauliflower sailboat sailed and sailed, until finally it reached its destination: a place where it would feel safe and be happy forever.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Sally who had a very special silver spoon. Every morning, she liked to dip it in hot, spicy soup. She would take a big sip and then split the spoon apart to make two pieces.  One day Sally's mom said, "Sally, it's time for a surprise! Take your special silver spoon and split it into two pieces."  Sally couldn't believe it. She said, "Split my spoon in two? But I don't want to!" But her mom smiled and said, "Don't worry, you'll get something special in return."  So Sally followed her mom's instructions and split her spoon into two pieces. To her surprise, there were two spoons. One was silver and the other was made of spice-filled chocolate. Sally smiled and said, "Thanks, Mom! I love my new spicy spoon!"

Billy was walking in the park one day. He saw two cats fighting in the grass. Billy thought it was funny and he wanted to join in. He found a lime and tried to pick it up. It was green, round and heavy. Billy ran up to the cats and tried to join the fight. He waved the lime around. The cats backed away and stopped fighting. They were scared of the lime. Billy laughed and smiled. He had just made the cats stop fighting! He shook the lime at them one more time and they quickly ran away. From then on, whenever the cats started to fight, Billy would grab the lime and the cats would stop. Billy called the lime his magic lime!

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to go to the beach with his family. One day, he saw a seal on the shore. The seal was amazing! Timmy wanted to carry the seal back to the water, but he knew he couldn't do it alone. So, he asked his dad to help him. Together, they carried the seal to the water and watched it swim away. Timmy felt happy that he helped the seal. From that day on, Timmy always looked for seals on the beach and hoped he could help them too.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Amelia. She liked to try new and exciting things, like playing games and sports, travelling and learning. One day, Amelia decided to try yoga. Amelia put on some comfy clothes and went to the yoga studio. Everyone in the studio was so friendly and kind. Amelia took a deep breath and started to move her body. She giggled and smiled, feeling very happy. There were lots of different poses that Amelia tried out and she felt very relaxed. But when it came to balancing poses, Amelia struggled a bit. She started to feel a bit frustrated, so she paused for a moment and looked around the room. Amelia felt inspired by the other people in the room and their clear focus on the yoga. She tried one more time and finally, she managed to hold the pose. Amelia felt so proud and clear. She had really enjoyed her very first yoga class!

Once upon a time, there was a clever little girl named Lily. One day, she found a secret box in her room. She was so excited to see what was inside! Lily's mom asked her, "What are you doing, Lily?"  "I found a secret box! Can we examine it together?" Lily replied.  Her mom smiled and said, "Of course!"  They carefully opened the box and found a beautiful necklace inside. "Wow, it's so pretty!" Lily exclaimed.  Her mom said, "You're a clever girl, Lily. You found a special treasure."  Lily was so happy and wore the necklace every day. She loved her special secret box and the treasure inside.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to play with his toys in the park. One day, he saw a tall man walking by with a big bag. Timmy asked the man, "What's in your bag?" The man said, "It includes some food for the whales at the aquarium." Timmy was curious and asked, "What's a whale?" The man explained, "A whale is a big animal that lives in the ocean. They are very tall and can be as big as a house!" Timmy was amazed and said, "Wow, I want to see a whale!" The man smiled and said, "You can go to the aquarium and see them there. It's very fun!" Timmy thanked the man and ran home to tell his mom about the tall and amazing whale he learned about.

Sam was a 3 year old boy. He loved to explore and would often wander away from his mom. One day, he was in the backyard playing with his toys. He suddenly heard something. Sam looked up and he saw a colorful bird. Its feathers were yellow, green, and purple. He wanted to get closer to the bird. He stepped slowly and carefully towards the bird. The bird flew away. Sam was sad, but he was excited to see what else he could explore. He noticed a big tree with many colorful leaves. It was like a colorful rainbow. Sam stepped closer to the tree and noticed it had some tiny steps. He started to climb them. As he climbed higher, he could see farther away. He could see the clouds in the sky and the houses around him. It was so exciting! He was proud that he was able to see so much!  Sam noticed a beautiful garden nearby. He wanted to explore it. He stepped towards the garden and soon he was surrounded by colorful flowers. He admired the different colors and shapes of the flowers. He could see a small pond nearby. He wanted to see the fish swimming inside! He stepped closer and saw the fish swimming. It was so fun!  Sam smiled. He had had a colorful day of exploration!

Tiara was so excited to go to her birthday party. She loved birthdays - they were so fun! At the party, there were so many colorful decorations. Her favorite color was pink and she saw lots of pink balloons, streamers and cupcakes.  Tiara couldn't believe that there was a cake with her name on it! It was pink and covered in sprinkles. It had colorful candles on top, which she was so excited to blow out.  Then everyone sang "Happy Birthday" and Tiara blew out all the candles. She got to have a piece of the cake and it was so yummy and sweet. She ate it with a big smile on her face. When it was time to go, Tiara was sad to leave. She told her friends she wanted to stay and eat cake forever! But it was time to go home. She said goodbye, hugged all her friends, and left the colorful party.

One day, a boy named Tom wanted to eat yogurt. He was very hungry. He went to the kitchen and saw a big yogurt cup. Tom was very happy. He wanted to eat it all. Tom's sister, Lily, came into the kitchen. She saw the yogurt too. She said, "I want some yogurt too!" Tom did not want to share the yogurt. He wanted it all for himself. This made Lily sad. Tom thought about it for a moment. He wanted to be a generous brother. So, Tom said, "Okay, we can share the yogurt." But when he tried to open the yogurt cup, it was very hard. He pulled and pulled, and then the yogurt cup broke! Yogurt went everywhere! Tom and Lily looked at each other and started to laugh. They knew they had to clean up the mess. After cleaning, they both learned to share and be more careful with their food. And from that day, Tom and Lily always shared their snacks and became more generous with each other.

Once upon a time, there was an angry lion. He was very big and strong. The lion roared through the forest. He was so mad that he shook the ground. The lion had not eaten for days. He was very hungry. Everywhere he looked, he saw nothing to eat.  Then, the lion saw something very strange. It was a pink bunny. The bunny was hopping around, looking for something to eat. The lion got very excited. He took a big leap and chased after the bunny.  The bunny ran very fast, but the lion was faster. He got close very quickly and roared loudly. The bunny was so scared that it stopped moving.  The lion was very hungry. But he was also very kind. He let the bunny go. Instead, he found a big apple tree and ate all the apples. He was satisfied and happy. The end.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Anna went to the office with her mom. It was a white office, and Anna was very curious about what was inside. She wanted to explore it!  As soon as Anna and her mom walked into the office, Anna's mom took out a big flat piece of paper. She showed Anna how to attach it to the wall with tape. Anna was very excited to help with this special project!  Before long, the big white piece of paper was completely attached to the wall. Then Anna's mom took out some bright markers. She drew lots of colorful pictures on the paper and asked Anna to help. Anna was so happy to help decorate the office!  When they were finished, the office was even brighter than before. Anna and her mom smiled at each other with pride. They had done a wonderful job of attaching the paper and making the office look so nice!

Sara and Ben like to play in the park. They like to go on the swings, the slide and the seesaw. But their favorite thing is the roundabout. The roundabout is a big circle that can spin fast or slow. One day, they go to the park with their mom. It is a cold day, so they wear warm hats and coats. They run to the roundabout and take turns to push it. Sara pushes first, and Ben sits on the roundabout. He holds on tight and laughs as he spins. Then Ben pushes, and Sara sits on the roundabout. She holds on tight and smiles as she spins. But then they see a big boy coming. He is older and taller than them. He has a mean face and a loud voice. He walks to the roundabout and says, "This is mine. Go away." He pushes Sara and Ben off the roundabout and sits on it. He tries to spin, but he is too big. He does not fit on the roundabout. He gets stuck and can not move. Sara and Ben are scared and sad. They run to their mom and tell her what happened. Their mom hugs them and says, "That was not nice. He should share and be kind." She walks to the roundabout and talks to the big boy. She tells him to get off and say sorry. He does not want to, but he has no choice. He gets off and mumbles sorry. He walks away, looking angry. Sara and Ben are happy again. They go back to the roundabout and play. They spin and spin and spin. They have fun and forget about the big boy. They are glad they have each other and their mom. They are a good team.

One day, a cheerful boy named Tim went to the park to play. He saw a big truck with many things to load. Tim was excited to watch the truck. He knew something fun was going to happen. Tim saw a man with a big ball. The man said, "We are going to play a game. Can you help me load the balls into the truck?" Tim was happy to help. They loaded all the balls into the truck together. The man told Tim, "Thank you! Come to the park tomorrow and see what we do with the balls." The next day, Tim went to the park and saw many kids playing with the balls. They were trying to make a high score by throwing the balls into a big basket. Tim joined them and had lots of fun. He even made a new high score! The man from before smiled and said, "I knew you would have fun today. Thanks for your help!"

Once upon a time in a small town there lived a little boy named Tom. He was only three years old, but he was very clever and loved to make things. One day, he decided he wanted to create something special.  Tom searched around and found some thin sticks and a few stones. He thought for a while and then he knew what he wanted to do. He started to piece the sticks and stones together very carefully to make an escape.  When Tom was done, he looked around to see if anyone had noticed what he was doing. But no one was there. Tom was excited and wanted to test out his escape. He sat inside the escape and took a deep breath.  Just then, a voice called out from behind him, “Wow, Tom! That’s an amazing escape you’ve made!”  Tom jumped in surprise and spun around to see his mom smiling behind him. “Can I try it out?” she asked. Tom nodded eagerly and watched as his mom took a seat in his escape and closed the door behind her. Tom smiled. He was so proud of the escape he had made, and he knew his mom was too.

Beth was a young girl who had long brown hair. Every morning she would brush it carefully and then rub lotion in. This made her hair more silky and gave it a beautiful sheen. One day when she went to put lotion on her hair, her brother grabbed the bottle. "Give that back!" Beth said. Her brother ignored her and tried to run away with it, but Beth was determined not to let him take it. She resisted and managed to grab the lotion bottle away from her brother and run back to her room. She put the lotion back and smiled at herself in the mirror. She did it! She had resisted her brother and taken back her lotion. She was proud of herself!

Lila and Tom are friends. They like to play in the park. One day, they see a new thing in the park. It is green and has many sharp points. Lila and Tom are curious. "What is that?" Lila asks. "I don't know. Let's go and see," Tom says. They walk to the new thing. It is a cactus. A sign says "Do not touch. It can hurt you." Lila and Tom look at the cactus. They see some flowers on it. The flowers are pink and yellow. They are pretty. "Wow, the cactus has flowers!" Lila says. "Yes, it does. They are nice," Tom says. They smile at the cactus. They think it is a good thing. They are happy to see something new. "Can we say hello to the cactus?" Lila asks. "Sure, we can. But we have to be careful. We can't touch it," Tom says. They wave to the cactus. They say "Hello, cactus. You are pretty. We like you." The cactus does not say anything. But it seems to smile back at them. Lila and Tom are glad. They have made a new friend.

Once upon a time, there was a big brown bear. He loved to chew on honey and berries. One day, he went for a walk in the forest and found a cave. He went inside to explore and found an exit at the back.  As he was walking towards the exit, he saw a little rabbit stuck in a trap. The bear felt sad for the rabbit and decided to help him. He chewed the rope that was holding the trap and set the rabbit free. The rabbit was very grateful and thanked the bear. From that day on, the bear and the rabbit became friends. They would often meet at the cave and share honey and berries. The bear was happy to have made a new friend and the rabbit was happy to have been saved by the kind bear.

Ben and Lily are twins. They like to eat cereal for breakfast. They have a big box of cereal with many colors and shapes. They call it rainbow cereal. One morning, Ben and Lily wake up early. They are hungry and want to eat rainbow cereal. They go to the kitchen and find the box on the shelf. They try to reach it, but it is too high. They need a stool. "Ben, can you get the stool?" Lily asks. "OK, Lily, I will try," Ben says. Ben goes to the corner and pulls the stool. It is heavy and makes a loud noise. Ben does not notice the noise. He is happy to get the stool. But Mom and Dad notice the noise. They are sleeping in their room. They hear the loud noise and wake up. They wonder what is going on. They get out of bed and go to the kitchen. They see Ben and Lily with the stool and the box of cereal. They look surprised and a little angry. "Ben, Lily, what are you doing?" Mom asks. "We want to eat rainbow cereal, Mom," Lily says. "But it is too early, Ben," Dad says. "We are hungry, Dad," Ben says. Mom and Dad sigh. They are not happy, but they are not very mad. They love Ben and Lily. They decide to help them. "OK, Ben, Lily, you can eat rainbow cereal, but only a little bit. And next time, please wait for us to wake up. Do you understand?" Mom says. "Yes, Mom, we understand," Ben and Lily say. They smile and hug Mom and Dad. They pour some cereal in their bowls and add some milk. They eat their rainbow cereal and enjoy it. They are happy and full. They say thank you to Mom and Dad. Mom and Dad smile and hug them back. They are glad that Ben and Lily are good and polite. They make some coffee and toast for themselves. They sit with Ben and Lily and talk. They are a happy family.

Anna and Ben were playing in their room. They liked to pretend they were in different places. Sometimes they were pirates, sometimes they were astronauts, sometimes they were animals. Today they wanted to be spies. They found a big wardrobe in the corner. It was old and dusty. They opened the door and saw many clothes and shoes. They put on some hats and coats and pretended they were secret agents. "Shh, we have to be quiet," Anna whispered. "We are on a mission. We have to find the bad guy and stop him." "OK, let's go," Ben said. He held a flashlight and a toy gun. They crawled out of the wardrobe and looked around. They saw a door that said "Do not enter". "That must be where the bad guy is hiding," Anna said. "Let's go and catch him." They opened the door and saw a dark and scary room. There were many machines and wires and bottles. They smelled something sour and nasty. "Yuck, what is that?" Ben asked. "I don't know, but it doesn't look good," Anna said. "Maybe the bad guy is making a poison or a bomb. We have to stop him." They walked into the room and saw a man sitting at a desk. He had a big beard and a mean face. He was typing on a computer. "Who are you?" the man shouted. "What are you doing here?" "We are spies," Anna said. "We are here to stop you. You are the bad guy." The man laughed. "Spies? You are just kids. You don't know anything. You are in big trouble. You have to stay here with me. You can't escape." He got up and walked towards them. He looked angry and scary. Anna and Ben were scared. They didn't want to stay with the bad guy. They wanted to escape. They looked for a way out. They saw a window behind the desk. It was small and high, but maybe they could reach it. "Quick, follow me," Anna said. She grabbed Ben's hand and ran to the desk. She climbed on a chair and pushed the window open. She saw the garden outside. "Come on, Ben, we can do it," she said. She helped Ben climb on the chair and then on the window sill. They jumped out of the window and landed on the grass. They ran away from the house. They were free. They had escaped. They saw their mom waiting for them outside. She looked worried and angry. "Anna, Ben, where have you been?" she asked. "What have you done? You are dirty and messy. And what are you wearing?" Anna and Ben looked at each other. They smiled. They had a great adventure. They were spies. "Sorry, mom," they said. "We were just playing."

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a huge tree near a rail. The tree was so big that all the kids loved to play under it. One sunny day, a little girl named Mia and her friend Tom went to play near the rail. As they played, Mia saw a sign on the tree. She asked Tom, "What does the sign say?" Tom looked at the sign and said, "It says, 'Be careful near the rail!'" Mia and Tom knew they had to be safe, so they played far away from the rail. They had lots of fun under the huge tree. They laughed and played all day long. And every time they played near the rail, they remembered the sign and stayed safe.

Once upon a time, there was a young girl. She had a box full of pastel crayons. The girl went outside one day to play. She wanted to leave her box of crayons and explore. She went to the park and played in the sand. She made a beautiful sandcastle. After she finished, she decided to leave. Just as she was about to, she saw a young butterfly. She stopped and watched it flap its wings. She watched it fly away, leaving its colorful wings behind.  The young girl was inspired. She grabbed her box of pastel crayons and drew a picture of the butterfly. She left the picture in the park.  The girl ran back home and showed her family her drawing. They all smiled and applauded her work.  The young girl was so proud of her picture. It was a reminder of her beautiful day at the park.

Once there was a little girl named Daisy and she was three years old. Daisy loved giving her mom a kiss every day and her mom always said, "You know what? I'm saving up your kisses for a special holiday!"  When the holidays came, Daisy was so excited. She couldn't wait to give all the kisses to her mom. She ran to her bedroom and found a present waiting with a big bow on it. When she opened it, she saw a big card that said, "I'm so happy to have you in my life and your kisses are the most special thing of all!"  Daisy hugged her mom and they hugged each other so tight. Daisy said, "Mom, I want to give you a lot of kisses to show you how much I love you!" Her mom said, "That's so kind of you, but wait! I have one more surprise for you!"  In Daisy's bedroom, there was a basketball hoop! Daisy couldn't wait to get started. She said, "Oh, I can play ball every day!" Her mom said, "Yes, and I have a special court available too!" Daisy was so excited that she gave her mom even more kisses!  Daisy was so happy to have a basketball hoop and a special court for her to play on during the holidays. She knew she was really lucky and so she gave her mom lots of kisses to show her love and her

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing basketball. One day, Timmy's mom told him they were going to the park to play basketball. Timmy was so happy, he started jumping up and down.  When they got to the park, Timmy saw that it was very cold outside. The ground was icy and slippery. Timmy's mom told him to be careful and not to slip. Timmy tried to walk carefully, but he was too excited to play basketball.  Timmy's mom said they had to hurry and play quickly because it was getting even colder outside. Timmy and his mom played basketball for a little while, but then they had to go back home. Timmy was sad to leave, but he knew he would come back to play basketball again soon.

Once upon a time there was a hairy monkey. The monkey was especially fond of jazz music. He liked to listen to it every day. Everyone in the neighbourhood would gather around to hear the music and the monkey would dance along. One day the monkey wanted to see how much he weighed. He asked all his friends to help him. They took some pieces of fruit and placed them on either side of a weighing scale. The monkey hopped onto the scale and the others watched the fruits on either side. At first the monkey's side was lower than the fruit's side, but then it became even! The monkey was so excited, he started to dance a jazzy dance. Everyone clapped and laughed and they all agreed that the monkey weighed the same as the pieces of fruit. The monkey was so proud of himself. From then on, he practiced his jazzy dance every day and was always sure to weigh himself.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy had a big birthday party coming up and his mom had an important job for him. She asked him to cut the cake and put candles on it. Timmy was so excited to help his mom.  He got a big knife and started to cut the cake. It was a big cake, but Timmy was strong. He cut it into many pieces. After that, he put candles on the cake. There were ten candles, one for each year of his age.  When the party started, Timmy's mom brought out the cake. Everyone sang "Happy Birthday" and Timmy blew out the candles. He was so happy that he could help his mom. From that day on, Timmy knew that he was an important part of his family.

Once upon a time, there was a fun park for kids. In the middle of the park was a big square swing that was very smooth and slippery. Two friends, Cory and Mark, saw the swing and decided to give it a try. Cory shouted, “Let’s swing!” Mark said, “That looks fun! Let’s do it!” Cory and Mark grabbed onto the swing and started to swing back and forth. Cory and Mark kept swinging higher and higher until they felt like they were flying! The wind blew their hair as they screamed and laughed. They went higher and higher until their feet were touching the sky!  Cory and Mark had so much fun swinging on the smooth, slippery square swing that they stayed at the park all day. Every time they felt like they were getting tired, they just thought about their flying dream and started swinging higher and higher.

Once upon a time, there was a beautiful fragile cross. The cross lived in a magical forest, right by a river. Every morning birds filled the sky with joyous singing and the wind filled the trees with a peaceful melody.  One day, the cross decided to go on an adventure. She picked herself up and walked over to the river. There she filled her tiny hands with water and cast it into the sky. Just then, a small creature in a boat appeared. It asked, “Why did you fill the sky?” The cross smiled and replied, “To make it look pretty!” The little creature laughed and said, “That’s a wonderful idea. Let me take you with me.” And so, with a single tug, the little boat filled with the fragile cross, and they spent the rest of the day exploring the river together.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and explore the world around her. One day, while playing in the park, she fell down and hurt her knee. It was very sore and she couldn't walk properly.  Lily's mommy came to help her and gave her a big hug. She told Lily that she needed to rest her knee and let it heal. Lily's knee felt better after a while, but it was still a little stiff. So, her mommy helped her stretch her leg gently.  Lily thought that her mommy was very kind and gentle, not harsh like some people can be. She was happy to have her mommy there to help her and make her feel better. From that day on, Lily was more careful when playing outside, but she still loved to explore and have fun.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy was feeling grumpy because he wanted a toy that he saw in the store, but his mom said no.  Suddenly, there was an emergency! Timmy's mom got a phone call and had to leave right away. Timmy was scared, but he knew he had to be brave.  He wanted to help his mom, so he grabbed his favorite stuffed animal and followed her out the door. Timmy's mom was so proud of him for being such a good helper during the emergency. And when they got back home, she surprised him with the toy he wanted as a reward for being so brave.

Once upon a time there was a little lady called Lily. She lived in a meadow full of flowers. Every day she would make sure that the flowers were clean and happy. One day a flower in the meadow needed some extra care. Lily was eager to help, so she started taking care of it. She watered it with love and care, and before long the flower began to bloom. Lily knew that if she took care of the flower it would eventually bloom. This taught her a valuable lesson, that with enough love and care anything can blossom and grow. She continued to take care of the other flowers, and soon the entire meadow was filled with bright and beautiful blooms. All the other ladies in the meadow were very impressed and wanted to learn from Lily. They asked her to teach them how to make their flowers bloom. Lily smiled and said, “Nothing will bloom without love and care.”  The other ladies were very impressed with Lily. She showed them that love and care are essential to make something beautiful bloom. From that day on, they all looked after the meadow and the flowers, and everyone was happy.

Once upon a time there was a tall tree in the woods. The tree shivered and trembled in the wind. There was a mist in the air, making everything feel strange and cool. The tall tree was scared. It shook and quivered as the mist floated by. The tree wanted to run but it just couldn't. It wished for a friend to help it feel better. Then one day, a little bird flew down from the sky and landed on the tall tree. The bird was gentle and kind. The tree stopped trembling and felt safe. The bird sang a beautiful song and the mist slowly disappeared. The bird stayed with the tall tree for a long, long time and the tree was never scared again.

Once upon a time, there was a big rhinoceros. He was a little bit crazy. He liked to tell funny stories to his friends. His friends were a cat, a dog, and a bird. They all lived in a big green forest. One day, the crazy rhinoceros told a new story. He said, "I can jump very high and touch the sky!" His friends laughed and said, "No, you can't!" The rhinoceros said, "Yes, I can! Watch me!" He started to run very fast. The cat, the dog, and the bird watched the crazy rhinoceros run. He jumped high into the air. But he could not touch the sky. He fell down on the ground very hard. The rhinoceros was hurt and sad. His friends felt bad too. The crazy rhinoceros learned not to tell stories that were not true.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the park, but one day she fell down and hurt her knee. It was very uncomfortable and she started to cry. Her mom came to help her and gave her a bandaid to make it feel better. Lily was sad because she didn't want to fall again and get hurt. Her mom told her that it's okay to fall sometimes, but we need to learn from our mistakes and be careful next time. Lily didn't understand what her mom meant, but she listened carefully. Later that day, Lily was looking at some pictures with her mom. They were memories of when she was a baby. Lily was happy looking at the pictures and remembering all the fun times she had. Her mom told her that memories are like treasures that we keep in our hearts forever. Lily realized that even though falling down was uncomfortable, it was a memory that she could learn from. She promised herself to be more careful next time and to make more happy memories. From that day on, Lily was more careful when playing outside and always remembered to treasure her memories.

One day, a little girl named Sarah had an exciting day ahead of her. She was going to the park with her parents! She jumped around with glee.  When they arrived at the park, Sarah saw that it was big and beautiful. She could hardly contain her excitement. All around, the trees were tall and green and the sky was a pale blue. Sarah's father said, "It's time to go inside the park, Sarah. Are you ready?" Sarah happily nodded yes and followed her dad. She looked around. Everything was new and exciting - there were lots of other children playing, birds singing and lots of tall, green trees.  Suddenly, Sarah heard her father call out, "It's time for ice cream!" She was so excited that she ran to where her father had ordered the ice cream for her. Sarah smiled with delight; all of her anticipation had paid off with a delicious treat! The ice cream was creamy and sweet. She knew her day at the park would be a great one!

Once upon a time, there was a bunny named Bill. He was a very bouncy bunny, always hopping around the garden. One day, Bill was feeling a bit grumpy. He wanted to do something exciting, something new! He decided it was time to do an adventure. He followed his nose along a path, deep into the forest. It soon became very dark, so he hopped faster and faster. Suddenly, he stumbled over a big muscle! He was a little scared at first, but then he noticed the muscle was smiling. He asked the muscle what he was doing there. The muscle said he was looking for an adventure too! Bill was so excited and asked the muscle if he wanted to come with him. The muscle happily followed Bill along the path. Everywhere they went, they had an incredible adventure. Bill's grumpy mood soon vanished and they both had the best time ever!

Once upon a time, there was a neighbor. He was very messy. He never cleaned up after himself, and his house was often cluttered with things. One day, his friends saw how messy he was and started to laugh. They were teasing him for being so untidy. But, one of his friends stepped forward and said, "Wait! We don't need to laugh at our neighbor. We should support him instead!" The other friends agreed and they helped him clean up his house. They even offered to come by to help him clean. The moral of this story is that it is always better to support your friends instead of making fun of them. We all make mistakes, but it is important to help each other and be kind.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved flowers. She would pick them and hold them close to her nose to smell their sweet fragrance. One day, she saw a soft, pink flower and wondered what it would feel like to touch it. Lily's friend, Timmy, came over and saw the flower too. "That flower is so pretty!" he exclaimed. "Can I touch it?"  Lily nodded and Timmy reached out to touch the flower. But as soon as he did, a bee flew out and stung him on the hand. He cried out in pain and Lily ran to get help. Sadly, Timmy had an allergic reaction to the bee sting and had to go to the hospital. Lily felt terrible for showing him the flower and wondered if she should have been more careful. From that day on, she made sure to always check for bees before touching any flowers.

Joe was hungry. He wanted an apple, but there wasn't one in sight. He walked by the park and heard somebody say "Look, I have a pistol". Joe was a little scared so he stepped back. Suddenly he heard something moving quickly in the grass. It was a rabbit! Joe stepped closer and the rabbit started to bite his feet. Joe shouted in pain. Joe was angry now. He wanted the rabbit to stop. He asked the person with the pistol for help. The person was happy to help, and he shot the pistol into the sky. The rabbit ran away and Joe was relieved.  Joe thanked the person and looked at the pistol. He asked if he could borrow the pistol so he could get an apple. The person said no, that it wasn't safe. Joe was still hungry, but he knew he had to find another way to get food. He thanked the person again, and continued his search for food.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her garden. She liked to make mud pies and pick pretty flowers.  One day, Lily's garden was very slow. The flowers were not growing and the mud was not soft. Lily was sad because she loved her garden very much. She asked her mommy what was wrong.  Mommy said that the garden needed more water and sunshine. So, Lily got a big watering can and poured lots of water on her garden. She also asked the sun to come out and shine on her garden.  After a few days, Lily's garden was no longer slow. The flowers were bigger and prettier than ever before. Lily was happy again and she continued to make mud pies and pick pretty flowers in her beautiful garden. The end.

Once upon a time, there lived a beautiful turkey. She was proud of her feathers and enjoyed the warm sunshine each day. One day, the turkey went to the river to take a bath. She slipped on a rock and fell into the river. "Help! Help!" the turkey squawked. Then, a little boy heard her cries for help. He was only three years old, but he was brave and determined to help the turkey. He ran to the river and reached in to grab the turkey.  "There, there," said the little boy as he scooped up the turkey. He was very proud of what he had done, and he held the turkey close so she would know she was safe.  The turkey was so happy to be safe and dry. She thanked the little boy with a gentle nudge. The little boy and the turkey both beamed with pride. From then on, they were the best of friends and always looked out for each other.

Once upon a time, there was a car. The car was red and fast. The car had a driver. The driver liked to drive the car.  One day, the driver went to a big park. The park was busy. Lots of people were there. The driver saw a man selling fireworks. The driver wanted to see the fireworks.  The man lit the fireworks. The fireworks were pretty. They made loud noises. The driver was happy. The driver got back in the car and drove home. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a big yellow sun and a small shadow. The shadow lived under a tree. The tree had many leaves. The shadow liked to play with the leaves. One day, a little boy came to play near the tree. The shadow saw the boy and wanted to share his leaves. The boy thought it was important to share too. So, they both played with the leaves together. After playing, the boy and the shadow became good friends. They shared many things like toys and snacks. They always remembered that sharing was important. And they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a garden where she grew lots of yummy things to eat. One day, she found a big, red tomato hiding behind some leaves. She was so happy to see it! She picked the tomato and took it inside to show her mommy. When her mommy saw the tomato, she was amazed. "Wow, Lily! What a big tomato you found!" she said. Lily was so proud of herself. She felt like a bossy boss of her garden. Later that day, Lily's little brother came to play. Lily wanted to show him the tomato too, but she wanted to make it special. She had an idea! She took the tomato and carefully cut it open to reveal all the juicy seeds inside. Her brother was so excited to see it. They both ate some of the tomato and it was the best thing they had ever tasted.

Once upon a time, there was a young fox. The fox often explored the forest, looking for fun and adventure. One day, the fox met an old dragon. The dragon was wise and had seen many things in his long life, so he decided to teach the young fox a lesson.  The dragon said: "Today, I will teach you how to be brave. Follow me."  The fox and the dragon came to a deep cave. Inside the cave was a very hot flame. The dragon said, "This is where I will teach you how to be brave. Jump into the flame and I will help you to get out."  The fox was scared but he trusted the dragon and carefully jumped into the flame. The dragon laughed and said: "You have been brave! No matter how hard things get in life, you must be brave and never give up!" The dragon and the fox left the cave, and the fox never forgot the dragon's lesson. He kept his courage and kept exploring the forest. The fox learned that by being brave, you can find new friendships and experience great adventures.

Once there was a small girl who was so very lonely. She sat in the middle of the busy street, looking at all the traffic as it streamed by.  "Can anyone play with me?" she pled. Suddenly, right in front of her, she heard a voice reply, "Yes! We can play together!" The voice belonged to a bright yellow bird who had landed right beside the girl. The two of them were together and suddenly the street seemed much less lonely. The bird and the girl played together, running up and down the street, and repeating the same running game over and over.  Finally, tired from all the running, the little girl said to the bird, "I don't want to go home just yet."  The bird said, "We don't have to go yet. We can keep playing till it's dark, and then I will take you back. We can repeat the same game again and again, just like the traffic does in this street."  The little girl smiled and the two continued to play, no longer feeling lonely.

Once upon a time, there was a little dog named Max. Max loved to run and race in the park. One day, Max saw a big bone on the ground. He was so happy and ran to get it, but then he saw a big, scary dog. Max was fearful and didn't want to lose his bone, so he ran away as fast as he could. Max ran and ran until he saw his friend, Lily the cat. "What's wrong, Max?" asked Lily. "I saw a big, scary dog and I was so fearful," said Max. "I didn't want to lose my bone, so I ran away." "Don't be afraid, Max," said Lily. "I'll help you get your bone back. We can race to the bone and get it before the big dog does." Max was so happy to have Lily's help. They raced to the bone and got it before the big dog could get there. Max was so thankful to have such a good friend like Lily.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Ann. She loved to go on safaris. One day, her dad said they were heading off on a distant safari. Ann was so excited! They got on the car and began their drive. On the way, Ann started to feel like something was missing… “Dad, why do I feel like I'm forgetting something?” Ann asked. “I don't know,” said her dad. “Maybe it will come back to you when we get there.” Ann nodded and they continued driving. When they arrived at the safari camp, Ann remembered what it was she had forgotten - her favourite stuffed toy! She had left it on the kitchen counter. Ann started to feel sad. “It's alright,” said Dad. “Your toy will still be there when we get back.” But when they drove back home, Ann's toy had disappeared! She looked everywhere, but she couldn't find it. Suddenly, Ann had an idea. She grabbed her binoculars and climbed to the top of the hill nearby. When she looked through the binoculars, she saw that her toy was in a distant field. She smiled, picked it up and ran back home with it. The end!

Isaac and his Mum were playing in the living room. He was having so much fun! Suddenly, Isaac looked up and pointed to the ceiling. "What's that Mum?", he asked. Mum squinted up at the ceiling, "Oh, that's a fan. It keeps us cool on hot days". Isaac thought for a moment, "I want it!", he said. Mum laughed, "That's an interesting request, but no, you can't have it". Just then, a weird noise came from the ceiling. Isaac gasped, "What was that?" Mum looked up and smiled, "I think the fan needs some attention. Don't worry, it was just a bit weird!" She reached up and fixed the fan. Isaac smiled, glad that the noise had gone, and the fan was back to normal.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to watch movies. One day, Timmy went to the movie theater with his mommy and daddy. They watched a funny movie about a silly dog. After the movie, Timmy and his family went to get some ice cream. While they were eating their ice cream, they saw a bird trying to escape from a cage. Timmy felt sad for the bird because it looked like it was hurt. His mommy and daddy helped the bird escape from the cage and it flew away happily.  Timmy was happy that the bird was free and not hurt anymore. He went home and told his stuffed animals all about the funny movie and the bird that escaped. They all listened and agreed that it was a great day. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a big house with her mommy and daddy. One day, Lily's mommy had to go to the office to work.  Lily asked, "Mommy, what's an office?" "It's a place where people go to do their jobs," mommy replied. "Oh," said Lily. "Will you be gone long?" "Just for a little while," mommy said. Lily felt envious that her mommy had to go to work, but she knew that mommy had to do it to make money to buy things they needed. As the day went on, Lily watched the clock and waited for her mommy to come home. When she finally arrived, Lily's happiness increased and they hugged each other tightly.

Once upon a time, there was a big garden with many pretty flowers. A naughty rabbit lived in the garden and loved to eat the flowers. One day, the rabbit saw a shiny bulb and wanted it for himself. He stole it from the ground and ran away. The flowers in the garden were very sad because they loved the bulb too. They didn't understand why the rabbit would take it away. A wise old owl saw what happened and explained to the flowers that the rabbit was ignorant and didn't know that stealing was wrong. The flowers forgave the rabbit, but they also taught him a lesson. They told him that it's not nice to take things that don't belong to you. The rabbit felt sorry and promised to never steal again. From that day on, the rabbit and the flowers became good friends and played together in the garden.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Henry. He was three years old. Henry was very curious and had a lot of questions about the world around him. One day, his parents decided to take him on a special trip to the forest.  When they arrived, Henry was amazed by the trees and the animals. He asked his parents if he could explore the forest by himself. His parents agreed and set him off in one direction.  Henry had been walking for a few minutes when he came across something rare.
