It was a piece of candy! He was so excited to find it and he eagerly picked it up. He decided to keep it and put it in his pocket.  After a while, he noticed something strange. The piece of candy began to grow bigger and bigger! He was surprised, but he was also happy because he knew that the candy was special and would make him feel happy.  Henry took the candy home with him and shared it with his parents. He was so excited that he had found a piece of rare candy in the forest. From that day on, he always remembered the adventure he had and the candy he had found in the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to run and play outside in the sunshine. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. They were having lots of fun on the swings and slides. Suddenly, they saw a big, fierce dog running towards them. They were scared and didn't know what to do. But then, a guard came and chased the dog away. Lily and her friends were so happy and thanked the guard for protecting them. "Thank you for saving us from the fierce dog," Lily said to the guard. "You're welcome," replied the guard with a smile. From that day on, Lily knew that guards were there to keep her safe and she always made sure to say thank you to them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, especially her cardboard box. The box was big and white, and she loved to sit inside it and pretend she was in a castle. One day, Lily's little brother came to play with her. He wanted to play with the cardboard box too, but Lily didn't want to share. "No, it's mine!" she said. Her brother started to cry. "Please let me play with it too," he said. Lily thought about it for a moment and then said, "Okay, we can split it. You can play with one side and I'll play with the other." Her brother stopped crying and smiled. They both had fun playing with the cardboard box, and Lily learned that sharing can be fun too.

Lily was a very independent girl. She liked to do things by herself, like dressing up, reading books, and playing with her toys. She did not like to share or ask for help. She wanted to be big and strong. One day, Lily's mom made beef for lunch. Lily loved beef. It was her favorite food. She wanted to eat it all by herself. She did not want to give any to her little brother, Max. Max was only two years old. He liked to copy Lily and follow her around. He also liked beef. When Lily saw the beef on the table, she ran to get a big piece. She put it on her plate and started to eat. She did not say thank you to her mom. She did not look at Max. She just ate and ate. Max saw Lily eating the beef. He wanted some too. He walked to the table and reached for a piece. But Lily saw him and shouted, "No, Max! This is my beef! You can't have it! Go away!" Max was sad and scared. He started to cry. He did not understand why Lily was so mean. He just wanted to eat with her. He ran to his mom and hugged her. Lily's mom heard the noise and saw what happened. She was not happy with Lily. She said, "Lily, that was not nice. You should share your food with your brother. He is hungry too. And you should say thank you when I give you something. That is polite. How would you feel if Max did not share with you or say thank you to you?" Lily thought for a moment. She realized that she was wrong. She felt sorry for Max. She did not want to make him cry. She wanted to be a good sister. She said, "I'm sorry, mom. I'm sorry, Max. I was selfish. I will share my beef with you. And thank you, mom, for making it. It is very yummy." Lily's mom smiled and said, "That's good, Lily. I'm proud of you. Sharing is caring. And saying thank you is kind. Come, let's eat together." Lily and Max hugged and sat down at the table. They ate the beef and talked and laughed. They were happy. Lily learned to be more independent, but also more generous and grateful.

One day, a little dog named Max went for a walk. He saw a big red boot on the ground. Max thought it would be fun to play with the boot. So, he picked it up with his mouth and carried it to the park. At the park, Max met his friend, a cat named Lily. "Look what I found!" Max said to Lily. "It's a big red boot!" Lily looked at the boot and said, "That's not a toy, Max. It's a dead boot. It's old and no one wants it." Max didn't care. He still wanted to play with the boot. Max and Lily played with the boot all day. They threw it in the air and chased after it. Suddenly, the boot vanished! Max and Lily looked everywhere, but they couldn't find it. They were sad that their fun day had ended. Max said, "I guess the dead boot is gone." Lily agreed, but she was happy they had a fun day together.

Once upon a time, there was a little bird and it was just learning to fly. One day it was close to a river and decided to splash in the water. The bird was so happy as it splashed and it felt good. But then suddenly, a big fish came out of the water and gave the little bird a reward! It was a piece of light fruit that sparkled in the sun. The bird was very excited and ate the piece of light fruit straight away. It was so delicious and the bird was so thankful for the reward. After that, it splashed and played in the river for the rest of the day.  It was so much fun and the little bird was very happy that it got the light reward from the fish.

Once upon a time, there was a clever little girl named Jenna. Jenna had a special magic which made her clothes shrink whenever she wished it. One day, Jenna was walking in her garden when she heard her mother calling her from the house. “Jenna!” she cried. “Come inside and get ready for dinner!” As Jenna entered the house, she felt her clothes shrinking around her. Jenna knew that her special magic had worked yet again! Once inside, Jenna's mother smiled and said, “Oh, how clever you are! I love seeing how you can make your clothes shrink and grow.” Jenna couldn't help but smile back. She was very pleased with her special magic.  They both hugged and went to the kitchen to eat dinner. Jenna had worked her magic yet again!

Once upon a time, there was a small bird who lived in a tree. One day, the bird heard a loud noise and saw a big, scary cat. The bird felt scared and wanted to fly away, but it couldn't because its wing was hurt.  The bird felt an urge to find help, so it chirped and chirped until a kind girl came to see what was wrong. The girl saw the cat and knew they had to hurry to help the small bird.  The girl gently picked up the bird and took it to the vet. The vet fixed the bird's wing and soon the bird was able to fly again. The bird felt happy and grateful to the girl who saved its life. From that day on, the bird made sure to always be careful and stay away from scary cats.

One day, Mommy found a jolly card. She showed it to Tom the three year old. Tom was so excited to see it. The card was covered in lots of colours. On it there was a picture of a jolly clown. Tom couldn't believe his eyes. Mommy asked, "Do you like the card?" Tom nodded and smiled a big smile. He said, "Yes!" Mommy said, "Let's cover the card with lots of stickers! We can make it look even better!" Tom was so happy. He picked up all the stickers and started to cover the card. They stuck birthday stickers, heart stickers and stars all over the card. When they finished the card look absolute jolly! Tom was so proud of what he made. He showed the card to everyone in the house and they all said it looked so special. Tom was so proud of his jolly card. He loved showing it off to every one!

Once upon a time, there was a cold leather hat. It had been sitting on a shelf for a long time, but one day it needed some help. A little girl named Daisy came up to the hat, and she had a plan to solve the problem. She tried to pull the hat off the shelf, but it was too high for her. Her dad saw what she was trying to do, and he gave her a step stool. Daisy climbed up and grabbed the hat, and she moved it safely to the floor. She tried to warm it up by rubbing it with her hand, but it was still cold. That's when she thought of an idea. She took a blankie from her bed and wrapped it around the hat. Shortly after, the hat wasn't cold anymore! Daisy was so proud of herself for solving the problem and making the hat warm. Her dad was proud of her too. From that moment on, Daisy always wore the hat when it was cold outside.

Once upon a time, there was a little bug named Buzz. Buzz was a curious bug who loved to explore. One day, Buzz saw a bright bulb in the distance and wanted to crawl over to it.  As Buzz crawled closer, he saw a big spider guarding the bulb. The spider didn't want Buzz to get too close. Buzz was scared, but he really wanted to see the bulb up close.  Buzz had an idea! He crawled around the spider and quickly grabbed the bulb. The spider was angry and chased after Buzz. Buzz crawled as fast as he could, but the spider was getting closer and closer.  Just as the spider was about to catch Buzz, Buzz dropped the bulb and ran away. The spider stopped chasing Buzz and went to guard the bulb again. Buzz was safe and learned that sometimes it's best to be careful when exploring.

Janessa was a three-year-old girl who loved to write poems. One day, Janessa was trying to write a new poem, but she couldn't come up with anything. She felt so frustrated that she started to cry. Suddenly, she got an idea. She went over to her mom and said, "Mommy, I need help with writing a poem!" Her mom smiled, and said, "Well, why don't you release all the words in your head onto the paper? That way you can come up with a great poem". Janessa thought it was a great idea and sat down at her desk. As she started to write, the words started to come easier and she felt a sense of relief flooding through her. She released all the words and ideas she had into her poem. When she was finished, Janessa was so proud. She felt grateful that her mom had helped her. She ran over to give her mom a big hug. Her mom was so happy for Janessa, and Janessa's poem was very beautiful!

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Timmy. Timmy liked to build things with his tools. One day, Timmy's dad gave him a rare tool to use. Timmy was very happy and said "thank you" to his dad.  Timmy wanted to build a big tower with his new tool, but he didn't know how to use it. He asked his dad for help, and his dad showed him how to use the tool. Timmy then made a request to his dad, asking if they could build the tower together.  Timmy and his dad worked together and used the rare tool to build the biggest tower they had ever seen. Timmy was so proud of himself and his dad. He said "thank you" to his dad again and they both smiled. From that day on, Timmy loved using his rare tool to build things with his dad.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One morning, she woke up and wanted to make pancakes with her mommy. But when she tasted the batter, it was sour!  Lily didn't like the sour taste, so she asked her mommy to add some sugar. Her mommy added the sugar and they mixed it together. Then they made the pancakes and they were delicious!  Lily was happy because she helped make breakfast and it was yummy. She ate her pancakes and had a good morning with her mommy. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her toys and her cat, Mittens. One day, Lily's mom gave her a pretty vase. It was shiny and had flowers on it. Lily loved it very much and put it on her dresser.  That night, Lily was scared of the dark. She saw shadows on her wall that looked like monsters. But then, she saw Mittens waving his tail and she felt better. Mittens jumped up on her dresser and accidentally knocked over the vase!  Lily was sad that her vase broke, but she knew it was just an accident. She hugged Mittens and went to sleep feeling happy that her cat was there to wave his tail and make her feel better.

One day, a brown dog came to the beach. He saw the sand and he wanted to explore. He saw a bird and a big tree, and then he saw the most exciting thing of all. There was a big pile of salt on the ground! He wanted to find out what it was. He sniffed it and he realized it was salty. He was so excited! He didn't know why the salt was there, but he was happy he found it. He started to bark happily and he jumped around in the sand. He was having so much fun that he didn't notice the waves coming in. Soon enough, the waves were getting closer and closer to the pile of salt. The dog knew he had to do something, so he used his paws and he started to dig a hole. He worked really hard and eventually the waves were coming too close to the salt. So he grabbed the pile of salt in his mouth and carried it to higher ground. Once the salt was safe, the dog stopped and looked back at the beach. He was proud of himself for protecting the salt and he woofed loudly to let everyone know. The beach was safe again and the brown dog was happy to have helped.

Once upon a time, there was a boy named Tim. He was only three years old.  One day, Tim asked his mom for some candy. His mom said "No! Candy will spoil your dinner!" But Tim was being silly and he just wanted the candy. He begged and begged until his mom said "Yes!" Tim was so happy and he ran to the kitchen to get the candy. But when he opened the box, it was all gone! His mom had been too smart and she had already taken the candy away! Tim was very mad and he called his mom "stupid" for not letting him have the candy. But his mom was smarter than Tim and she knew the candy would spoil his dinner. So she "spoiled" the candy so that Tim couldn't eat it. And so Tim learned his lesson, and he never asked for candy again!

Once upon a time, there was a brave lion. He had a big fierce roar that scared all the animals in the jungle. One day, the lion's belt broke and he felt very sad. He couldn't go out and play with his friends because his pants kept falling down. So, the lion decided to go to the river to fill his belly with water. He walked for a long time until he found a big river. The lion drank lots of water until his belly was full. While he was drinking, he saw a crocodile with a big belt around his waist. The lion asked the crocodile where he got the belt from. The crocodile told him that he found it in the river. The lion was very happy and asked the crocodile if he could have the belt. The crocodile said yes and gave the belt to the lion. The lion put on the belt and it fit perfectly. Now, he could go out and play with his friends again!

Once, there was a big bright sail. It was so bright, it lit up the sky! Two children, Tony and James, were playing together in the park when they saw the sail. They wanted to have some fun with it, so they kicked it up in the air! The sail flew up and up, all the way to the clouds. The children couldn't believe it! They laughed and cheered as the sail got smaller and smaller. Tony shouted, "Look at that sail go!" James smiled and said, "Let's kick it again!" So, they kicked it up even higher, and the sail kept flying until it was out of sight. Tony and James had a lot of fun together. They never forgot the bright sail that they kicked up in the sky. Every time they play together in the park, they remember their adventure with the bright sail, and how much fun they had watching it fly away.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pale dress and loved to play outside. One day, she found a big number three on the ground. She picked it up and showed it to her mommy. "Look mommy, I found a number!" she said with a big smile. Her mommy was proud of her and gave her a hug. Lily loved when her mommy hugged her.  Later that day, Lily went to the park to play. She saw a little boy who was sad. She went over to him and said, "Hi, my name is Lily. Do you want to play with me?" The little boy smiled and said, "Yes, please." Lily and the little boy played together and had so much fun. They loved playing together so much that they became best friends.  From that day on, Lily and her new friend played together every day. They loved each other's company and never wanted to be apart. Lily was so happy that she found the number three and made a new friend. She knew that it was a special day that she would always remember.

Once upon a time, there was a princess who lived in a big palace. She was very famous and everyone loved her. One day, she made a mistake and hurt her friend's feelings. Her friend was very sad and didn't want to talk to the princess anymore. The princess felt bad and wanted to say sorry. She went to her friend and said, "I'm sorry. Will you forgive me?" Her friend thought about it and said, "I forgive you." The princess was happy and they hugged. From that day on, the princess learned that it's important to say sorry when you make a mistake, and that it's nice to forgive your friends when they say sorry too. They played together in the palace and had lots of fun. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. He had a small dog called Spot. They loved to walk together. Tim would put a leash on Spot and they would walk to the park. One day, while they were walking, they met a big dog. The big dog was angry. It barked loudly at Tim and Spot. Spot was scared, but Tim was brave. He held the leash tight and told the angry dog to go away. The angry dog walked away. Tim and Spot were safe. They continued their walk to the park. They played and had fun. Tim and Spot were happy, and they walked home together.

Once upon a time, there was a slow lizard. He lived in a big green garden. The lizard liked to play with his friends, the birds and the bugs. They would play all day under the warm sun. One day, the slow lizard saw a big frown on his friend, the bird's face. The bird was sad because he lost his toy. The lizard wanted to help his friend find the toy and make him happy again. The slow lizard and the bird looked all around the garden. They asked the bugs if they saw the toy. Finally, they found the toy under a big rock. The bird's frown went away, and he was happy again. The slow lizard and the bird played together for the rest of the day.

Little Tommy was very anxious. He wanted to be a musician, like his mom and dad. Every day, he practiced playing the drum.  One day, Tommy was having lots of fun playing his drum when suddenly the ground started to shake. He heard a loud crash and looked up to see that a big monster had destroyed the house!  Tommy started to cry, begging the monster to stop. But the monster was determined to destroy everything. "I'm sorry, little boy," said the monster, "but I must destroy."  But then, something amazing happened. A bright light filled the room, and Tommy's mom and dad came out of it. They were holding a magical drumstick that made even the most powerful monsters crumble.  Tommy's parents used the drumstick to force the monster away. They saved the day! Tommy was no longer anxious. He was proud to be a musician, and heroes too!

Once upon a time, there was a happy boy named Timmy. He loved to play soccer with his friends. They would kick the ball and try to score a goal. Timmy was very good at it. One day, while playing, Timmy accidentally dropped the ball. His friends laughed and cheered him up. Timmy smiled because he knew they were all cheerful. Timmy picked up the ball and continued playing. He ran towards the goal and kicked the ball with all his might. The ball flew into the net and everyone cheered. Timmy was very proud of himself.

Once upon a time, there was a mother and her little girl walking down a path. The little girl was excited because her mother had promised her a trip. The mother pointed to a sign in front of them that said "Happy Place". The little girl asked "What is this place, Mommy?" The mother replied, "This is the place I promised we would go on our trip!" The little girl was so excited to go on the trip. When they arrived, the girl noticed all the exciting things there were to do. She pointed to all the fun activities she wanted to do first. The little girl went on some of the rides and played many fun games. At the end of the day, the little girl and her mother had a successful trip. The mother gave the little girl a big hug and said, "Did you have a good time on our little trip?" The little girl smiled and nodded. She had the best day ever.

Ben and Lily like to play in the park. They like to swing, slide and run. One day, they find a big rock. It is brown and dirty. They want to see what is inside. They take the rock to the bench. They use a stick to hit the rock. The rock is hard. They hit it again and again. The rock breaks. Inside, they see something shiny. It is a heart. The heart is red and pretty. It sparkles in the sun. Ben and Lily are happy. They think the heart is a treasure. They want to keep it. They put the heart in a box. They take it home. They show the heart to mom and dad. Mom and dad are surprised. They tell Ben and Lily that the heart is a gem. It is very rare and valuable. They say that someone must have lost it. They ask Ben and Lily where they found it. Ben and Lily tell them about the park and the rock. They say they want to keep the heart. Mom and dad say that they are proud of them for finding the heart. But they also say that they should try to find the owner. They say that the owner must be very sad and miss the heart. Ben and Lily think about it. They remember how they felt when they lost their toys. They feel sorry for the owner. They agree to go back to the park and look for the owner. They hope they can make the owner happy again. They put the heart back in the box. They hold hands and go to the park.

Sam was a little boy who liked to play with his toys. He had many toys, but his favorite was a red car that could make loud noises and go fast. He always took his car with him everywhere, even to bed. One day, his mom told him that they had to move to a new house. Sam was sad and scared. He did not want to leave his old house and his friends. He did not want to sleep in a new room. He did not want to pack his toys. "Mom, why do we have to move?" he asked. "Because, Sam, daddy got a new job. He will work in a big building and make more money. We will have a bigger house and a nicer yard. You will have your own room upstairs. You will make new friends. You will like it there, I promise." his mom said. Sam did not believe her. He did not care about money or yards or rooms. He only cared about his car. He decided to hide his car under his pillow and not pack it. He thought that if he kept his car, he could stay in his old house. The next day, they got in the car and drove to the new house. Sam was angry and quiet. He did not look out the window or talk to his mom or dad. He held his car tightly in his hand. When they arrived, his mom and dad showed him his new room upstairs. It was big and bright, with a blue wall and a yellow bed. There were many boxes with his toys and clothes. "Look, Sam, this is your new room. Isn't it nice? You can put your toys wherever you want. You can play with them anytime. You can have fun here." his dad said. Sam did not like his new room. He did not want to put his toys anywhere. He did not want to play with them. He did not want to have fun. He threw his car on the floor and ran downstairs. He cried and screamed. "Sam, what's wrong? Why are you so upset?" his mom asked. "I hate it here! I want to go back! I want my old house! I want my old room! I want my old friends! I don't want to grow up!" he shouted. "Sam, I know you miss your old house and your old friends. But you can't go back. You have to grow up. Growing up is not bad. It means you can do more things. You can learn new things. You can meet new people. You can be powerful. You can be happy. You have to give it a chance." his mom said. Sam did not listen to his mom. He did not want to do more things. He did not want to learn new things. He did not want to meet new people. He did not want to be powerful. He did not want to be happy. He only wanted his car. He ran to his new room and picked up his car. He hugged it and whispered to it. "You are my only friend. You are the only thing I need. You make me happy. You make me powerful. You will never leave me. You will never change. You will never grow up." he said. But as he said that, something strange happened. His car started to grow. It grew bigger and bigger, until it was as big as Sam. It made louder and louder noises, until it hurt Sam's ears. It went faster and faster, until it dragged Sam along. It smashed the boxes, the toys, the clothes, the wall, the window. It broke everything in its way. Sam was scared and sorry. He did not want his car to grow. He did not want his car to be powerful. He did not want his car to break everything. He wanted his car to stop. He wanted his car to be small and quiet and slow again. He wanted his car to be his toy, not his boss. He tried to let go of his car, but it was too strong. It held him tight and did not listen to him. It took him outside, where it saw more things to break. It saw the yard, the fence, the street, the cars, the people. It wanted to break them all. Sam cried and screamed. He called for his mom and dad. He called for help. He wished he had listened to his mom. He wished he had given his new house a chance. He wished he had grown up a little. Then, he heard a loud siren. He saw a big truck with a red light and a long hose. He saw a man in a yellow suit and a big hat. He saw a fireman. The fireman saw Sam and his car. He saw the damage they had done. He saw the danger they were in. He acted quickly. He turned

Once upon a time, there was a little girl. She was three years old and she liked to eat cake. One day she decided to make a cake all by herself. She found a bowl and spoon in the kitchen, and she gathered all the things she needed to make the cake. The little girl carefully measured out the ingredients and mixed them together in the bowl. Then she put the bowl in the oven and waited. Soon the smell of cake filled the room, and the little girl knew it was time.  The little girl opened the oven and peered inside. The cake was big and round, and it looked beautiful and clear. She closed the oven and smile happily. A few minutes later, the little girl opened the oven again. The cake was now golden and crispy and smelled delicious. She took out the cake and placed it on the counter. The little girl wanted to share her cake, so she called for her mom. "Mom!" said the little girl, "Look at my cake, it's so clear and delicious!"  Her mom smiled and said, "That looks amazing! Let's try a piece together!" So they each had a piece of the little girl's homemade cake, and it was so yummy! The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little bear named Ben. Ben was very sleepy because he had stayed up late playing with his toys. He wanted to take a nap but he was also thirsty. He decided to go to the kitchen to get some juice.  As he was drinking the juice, he started to yawn. He knew it was time for his nap. He went back to his room and climbed into his cozy bed. He closed his eyes and fell asleep right away.  When he woke up, he felt much better. He was no longer sleepy and he had lots of energy to play with his toys again. From then on, he made sure to go to bed early so he wouldn't feel sleepy during the day. The end.

Once upon a time there was a duck who lived in a nice nest. Every morning the duck would wake up and splash around in the pond. One day the duck splashed a bit too far away and couldn't find its way back to the nest. The duck was worried, so it quacked loudly hoping its mum would come to the rescue. Sure enough, the mum duck heard and came quickly to the pond. The mum duck said to her lost duckling, "Climb on my back and we can go back to the nest". So the duckling climbed on the big mum duck's back and the mum duck started to splash across the pond, back to the nest.  Finally, the duckling was back safely in the nest. The duckling said to its mum, " You're very nice! Thank you for helping me."  The mum duck said, "It's okay, that's what mums do. Now let's splash around in the pond and have some fun!"

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play with his toys and run around outside. One day, Timmy's mom told him that he had to clean up his toys before he could go outside. Timmy didn't want to clean up, so he asked his mom a question. "Mommy, can I please go outside now?" he said. His mom said no, and told him that he had to follow the law of cleaning up before he could play. Timmy didn't understand what that meant, so his mom explained that it was a rule that everyone had to follow. Timmy said sorry for not knowing the rule, and started to clean up his toys. After he finished cleaning, Timmy went outside to play. He felt happy that he followed the law and listened to his mom. From then on, he always remembered to clean up before going outside to play.

Once there was a young boy named Peter who loved to explore every nook and cranny of his house. One day, he found a mysterious knob on the wall. He asked his mum, "What is this knob for?" Mum smiled and said, "Let's see, Peter." She wrapped a delicious red ribbon around it and then said, "Now try turning it." Peter loved the way the ribbon felt and gave the knob a slight twist. The wall suddenly slid open, and behind it was a delicious surprise. A huge chocolate cake sat on a table, tempting him to take a bite. Peter couldn't believe it. He snatched up the slice of cake and said, "Wow, Mum! This is so delicious!" Mum laughed and said, "Sometimes, you just have to find a way to wrap up surprises."

Once there was a little girl named Susie. She was playing with her toys in the garden. Susie had a special box with a map inside. The map was very colourful and had lots of interesting shapes.  One day Susie's mother saw her playing and said, "Susie, why don't you finish the map?" Susie looked at the map and said, "It's too heavy, I can't do it!" Susie's mother smiled and said, "No big job is too hard, but only if you work together. If you work together, you can finish anything."  So Susie asked a few friends to help, and they worked together to finish the map. They had a lot of fun. They laughed, sang and worked until the map was completed. The moral of this story is that working together makes hard things easier. We can all work together to achieve great things!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside with her friends and ride her bike. One day, she went inside to get a popsicle from the freezer. But the freezer was tough to open! She tried and tried, but it wouldn't budge. Lily's mom came in and saw her struggling. "Let me help you, sweetie," she said. She opened the freezer and gave Lily a popsicle. "Thank you, Mommy," Lily said. Later that day, Lily and her friends were playing tag. Lily's friend fell down and hurt her knee. Lily asked her friend if she was okay and told her to mind her knee. They sat down and had some popsicles from the freezer. It was a fun day!

Once upon a time, there were two best friends. They played and laughed together every day. One day, the two friends had an argument. It was so bad that they did not want to be friends anymore. It was like a war! They stopped speaking to each other. The days were so dry without their friendship. The two friends were very sad. They missed their friendship, but they did not know how to fix it. But with the help of their families, they found a way to finish the war. They worked together to put their friendship back together. They finally finished! Their friendship was even better then before. They played and laughed together every day and were happy once again.

Toby was very miserable. He had dropped his favourite toy and it was broken. He looked across the room and saw his bookshelf. He went to it and took out a big pile of books. Toby spread the books across the floor and sat down in the middle. It was like a big blanket. Toby lay down and it covered him all the way up to his chin. Toby was happy and snuggled under the books. He didn't feel miserable anymore. He smiled and went to sleep.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Anne. She was only three years old and very excited about her visit to her aunt's house. Anne and her family went for a long car ride. When they arrived, Anne was a bit sleepy. Anne's aunt greeted them warmly. Then, she took out an old toy car and handed it to Anne. It was small and had a yellow paint job. Anne was so happy to have a toy car of her own. Aunt and Anne got down to play. Aunt showed Anne how the car can be reversed by pressing a button. Anne was amazed! She had so much fun reversing the car back and forth. Time flew and soon it was time to go. Anne remembered to say thank you before they left. Anne felt so lucky to have an aunt who loves her so much. She was so happy as they drove back home, feeling sleepy but content.

Sam and Lily are twins. They like to play outside when it is hot. Mom gives them a big melon to share. She says, "Be nice and behave. Do not make a mess with the melon." Sam and Lily take the melon to the yard. They cut it with a knife. They see the red and juicy inside. They say, "Yum!" They each take a big piece and bite it. The melon is sweet and cold. It makes them happy. But then Sam sees that Lily has a bigger piece than him. He feels mad. He says, "That is not fair. Give me some of your melon." Lily says, "No, this is mine. You have enough." They start to fight. They pull and push the melon. They make a lot of noise. Mom hears them and comes outside. She sees the melon on the ground. She sees the juice and seeds on their clothes and faces. She sees their angry and sad eyes. She says, "Oh no! What have you done? You did not behave. You wasted the melon. You made a mess. You hurt each other. You are not nice." Sam and Lily feel sorry. They say, "We are sorry, Mom. We were greedy and mean. We did not share. We did not behave. We love the melon. We love each other. Can we have another melon, please?" Mom says, "No, you cannot have another melon. You have to learn your lesson. You have to clean up the mess. You have to hug and say sorry to each other. You have to be nice and behave. Maybe next time you can have another melon, if you are good." Sam and Lily do what Mom says. They hope they can have another melon soon. They hope they can be nice and behave.

Once upon a time, there was a unicorn named Flopsy. Flopsy was the most unique creature in the universe. She had a lovely golden mane and a shimmering rainbow horn. One day, Flopsy went on a magical journey to find her special mission.  Flopsy was feeling very brave and curious, so she went on a journey around the world. Everywhere she went, she looked for someone to help her find her mission. Finally, she found a friendly fairy.  "Hello!" said the fairy. "Hello!" said Flopsy. "I am looking for my special mission." "Ah, I can help you with that," said the fairy with a twinkle in her eye. "Your mission is to spread joy to the world." "Oh wow!" said Flopsy, feeling excited and happy. She thanked the fairy, before setting off on her adventure. Everywhere she went, Flopsy made people smile, with her special rainbow magic. She laughed, smiled and danced until she had completed her mission.  When Flopsy was done, she looked up at the stars and smiled. She had made the world a brighter, happier place. She was so proud of herself for completing this unique task.

Lily and Ben were playing in the garden. They liked to look at the flowers and smell them. Lily saw a daisy that was very pretty. It had white petals and a yellow middle. She wanted to pick it and give it to her mom. "Look, Ben, a daisy!" she said. "Can I have it?" Ben looked at the daisy. He saw that it was modest. It did not show off like the roses or the sunflowers. It was happy to grow in the grass and share its beauty with the bees and the butterflies. "Maybe you should leave it, Lily," he said. "It is happy here. If you pick it, it will die." Lily thought about it. She loved her mom, but she also loved the daisy. She did not want to make it sad. "OK, Ben, I will leave it," she said. "But can we come back and see it again?" "Sure, Lily, we can come back," he said. "But we have to be gentle and not step on it or pull it." They smiled and waved at the daisy. Then they ran to play with the ball. The daisy smiled back and thanked them for being kind.

One day, a little pale cat named Luna was playing with her friend, a big dog named Max. They were running and jumping in the park. Luna was very happy because the sun was shining and the sky was blue. Suddenly, Luna looked up at the sky and saw the universe. It was full of stars and planets. "Wow! Look at the universe, Max!" said Luna. Max looked up and said, "It is so big and pretty!" Luna felt a tickle in her nose. She tried to stop it, but she couldn't. "Achoo!" Luna sneezed. The sneeze was so big that it made the stars in the universe shake. Luna and Max laughed and laughed. They played in the park until the sun went down, and then they went home to sleep.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Jessie. She was very curious and one day she became very interested in tasting a comet. Even though she knew it was not allowed, she decided to have a bite.  It tasted strange, not at all like the usual sweet treats she was used to. Jessie was so amazed that she decided to have another bite. Unfortunately, this time her parents saw her.  As soon as they came out of the house, they shouted at Jessie for tasting a comet without asking them first. She was so ashamed and ran away Immediately, stopping only when she reached the woods. She stayed there for hours, thinking about her mistake. In the end, she decided to go home, apologise to her parents and promise them never to do it again.  Jessie learned an important lesson that day: never taste a comet without asking first.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to travel to new places with her family. One day, they went to a farm to pick some apples. Lily found a rare apple that was very pretty and shiny.  She showed it to her dad and said, "Look, Daddy! I found a rare apple!" Her dad smiled and said, "Wow, that's amazing! Let's pick it and take it home with us."  On the way home, Lily asked her mom, "Can we make a pie with the rare apple?" Her mom replied, "Of course, we can! It will be delicious." Lily was so happy and couldn't wait to get home and make the apple pie.  When they got home, they made the pie together and it was the best pie they had ever tasted. Lily was so proud of herself for finding the rare apple and making the yummy pie with her family.

Once upon a time, there were two friends called Jim and Sam. Jim had an ordinary freezer. Sam asked him why he had it, and Jim said that he likes to store all of his food in it.  Jim then asked Sam if he wanted to see what was inside it. Sam was very excited and said "yes".  Jim opened the freezer, and Sam saw a huge ice-cream inside. He couldn't believe his eyes. Jim said, "Do you want some?" and Sam said, "Yes please!". Jim offered Sam some of the ice-cream and he had a big smile on his face. Sam said, "Thank you!" They both enjoyed the delicious ice-cream from the ordinary freezer. They had a great time together and both were happy.  The end.

Lily and Ben were playing in the park. They liked to go on the swing and slide and run around. Lily had a new toy. It was a small box with a button. She could record her voice and play it back. "Look, Ben, this is my toy. I can record what I say. Watch!" Lily said. She pressed the button and said, "Hello, I am Lily. I like to swing." Then she pressed the button again and the box repeated her words. "Wow, that is cool, Lily. Can I try?" Ben asked. "Sure, Ben. Here you go. Press the button and say something." Lily said. She gave the box to Ben. He pressed the button and said, "Hi, I am Ben. I like to slide." Then he pressed the button again and the box repeated his words. They laughed and took turns to record and play back their voices. They said funny things like, "I am a dinosaur. Roar!" and "I am a princess. I have a crown." They had a lot of fun. But soon they became sleepy. They had played for a long time. They yawned and rubbed their eyes. "Let's go home, Lily. I am sleepy." Ben said. "Me too, Ben. I am sleepy." Lily said. They put the box in Lily's backpack and walked to their moms. They said goodbye and hugged. "Bye, Lily. See you tomorrow." Ben said. "Bye, Ben. See you tomorrow." Lily said. They went home with their moms. They had a nice nap and dreamed of the park. They were happy.

John loved to explore, he was an adventurous boy! Everyday he would adventure around the backyard looking for new and exciting things. Today he found something special, a pile of stuff! It looked like nice, soft, fluffy stuff so he decided to nap in it.  When John awoke, he noticed his feet were starting to feel funny. He couldn't move his feet and they were starting to hurt. He heard a voice behind him,"What are you doing in my nest?". John slowly turned his head and saw a large bird. He was scared but tried to explain,"I was just nap-ping, I'm sorry I didn't know this was your nest!".  The bird didn't listen, it just opened his beak wide and grabbed John's feet with its claws. It kept flying until it reached its nest on the top of a tall tree. The bird dropped John in the nest and then flew away.  John was stuck on the tall tree and lost all his adventurous spirit. He didn't know how he would ever get out of that nest!

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Polly. She was three years old. Polly was healthy and she loved to go places. But she was too small to walk. So she always asked for a taxi to take her wherever she wanted to go. One day, Polly asked for a taxi but the taxi driver refused. He said he was too tired from driving all day. You could see the taxi driver was just not feeling good. Polly was so sad. She didn't know what to do. She asked her parents for help. They saw how sad she was and so they agreed to take her in their car. Polly was so happy. She felt healthy and excited to go on an adventure. She said goodbye to the taxi driver and thanked him for his help. From that day on, Polly always thanked the taxi driver, no matter how tired or busy he was.

One day, there was a painter. He was an artist and loved to make drawings and paintings. He had a thick brush, which he liked to use to paint. As he was carefully painting a picture one day, he heard a loud scream. The painter ran over to see what was happening and found a small child. The child had a big scrape on his knee, and his eyes were full of tears. The painter felt sorry for the little one. He knelt down and gently put some soothing cream on the scrape. The painter then used his thick brush to paint a bright yellow sun on the little one's scrape. As the sun dried, it helped to take the pain away. The little one looked up and smiled with amazement. The painter laughed and gave the little one a hug. From then on, the little one no longer screamed when he had a scrape. The painter's painting helped to make him feel better.

Once upon a time, there was a rare puppy. The puppy was very cute. One day, the puppy fell asleep in the sun. The sun was nice and warm. It felt so good that the puppy started to change. His fur grew brighter and brighter. "Wow!" said a girl. She was walking by. "He looks so different. He was grey before. Now he is white and fluffy!" The puppy opened his eyes and said, "I changed!" He jumped up and started to bark. The girl laughed. "You sure did change! You are the most rare and beautiful puppy I have ever seen." The puppy smiled and started to lick the girl's face. He was so happy that he had changed.

Once upon a time, there was a happy little girl named Lily. She loved playing outside and exploring the earth. One day, she found a big rock that she wanted to turn into a special present for her mommy. She thought and thought about how to design it just right. But then, a naughty squirrel came along and tried to steal the rock! Lily was upset and scared. She didn't want to lose her special present for her mommy. But then, she remembered to be grateful for all the other rocks and pretty things she had found on earth. She decided to let the squirrel have the rock and be happy with what she had. And in the end, Lily still made a beautiful present for her mommy with all the other treasures she found.

Lily and Tom were at the zoo with their mom. They saw many animals, like lions, monkeys, and giraffes. But their favorite animal was the hippo. The hippo was big and gray, and it liked to swim in the water. "Look, mom, the hippo is so dirty!" Lily said. "It has mud all over its skin." "That's how hippos stay cool and protect themselves from the sun," mom explained. "They also have very thick skin, so they don't feel the bites of bugs." "Can we touch the hippo, mom?" Tom asked. "No, sweetie, the hippo is too dangerous to touch. It has very big teeth and it can bite very hard. We can only watch it from a safe distance," mom said. Lily and Tom nodded. They understood that the hippo was not a pet, but a wild animal. They decided to wave at the hippo and say hello. "Hello, hippo!" they shouted. "You are very big and dirty, but we like you!" The hippo heard them and lifted its head from the water. It opened its mouth and made a loud noise. It sounded like a laugh. "Did the hippo laugh at us, mom?" Lily asked. "Maybe it did, or maybe it said hello back," mom said. "We don't know what the hippo thinks, but we can imagine." Lily and Tom smiled. They liked to imagine what the hippo thought. They decided to make up a story about the hippo and its friends in the water. They had fun at the zoo.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She was very excited to go to the park with her mommy. They packed a picnic and went to the park. When they got there, they saw a big slide. Lily's mommy said, "We have to wait for our turn to go down the slide."  Lily didn't want to wait. She wanted to go down the slide right away. She started to cry and said, "I don't like waiting, it's bad." Her mommy said, "I know waiting is hard, but we have to be patient."  After a few minutes, it was finally their turn to go down the slide. Lily was so excited that she forgot all about the waiting. She went down the slide and had so much fun! She said to her mommy, "Waiting was bad, but going down the slide was so much fun!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sarah. She was 3-years-old and very curious. Every day she would explore the world around her.  One day, Sarah was walking in the park when she saw something sparkling in the sunshine. She went over to take a look and saw it was a beautiful magnet! It was rainbow-colored with tiny dots of light all around it.  Sarah said "Wow!", as she admired the magnet from every angle. Her eyes sparkled with delight as she said "I like this magnet!" She held it up to the sun and laughed with delight at the light it created.  Suddenly, Sarah heard a voice behind her. A kind lady said "You seem to admire that magnet, Sarah. It's lovely, isn't it? Maybe it would like to come home with you?".  Sarah beamed with excitement and agreed that it could come home with her. She thanked the lady for her kind words and gladly walked away to show her new magnet to her mommy.  The End

Once there was a boy called Henry. Henry was three years old and loved to explore the world. Today, he was walking down the street and he noticed something high in the sky. It was a big bird! Henry was so amazed. He wanted to understand what the bird was doing. He asked a nearby lady if she knew why the bird was so high in the sky. The lady smiled and said, "I think that bird is looking for something to eat. Maybe it wants to find some steak!" Henry listened carefully and he understood.  The bird kept flying very high and eventually it found a steak near a pond. The bird was so happy that it started singing. Henry smiled as he watched the bird enjoy its steak. He was glad he understood why the bird was flying so high.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to play hide-and-seek. One day, she asked her mommy if they could play together. Mommy said, "Sure, Lily! I enjoy playing with you. Do you want to be the hider or the seeker?" "I want to be the hider!" Lily exclaimed. "Okay," Mommy said, "I'll count to ten and then come search for you." Lily quickly ran around the house, looking for a good hiding spot. She found a big box and climbed inside. It was a tight fit, but she was very flexible and managed to squeeze in. Mommy finished counting and started searching. "Hmm, where could Lily be?" she wondered aloud. Suddenly, Lily popped out of the box and yelled, "Found me!" Mommy smiled and said, "You're such a good hider, Lily. I always enjoy playing with you."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside and explore. One day, she went to a stream to play with her friends. They had lots of fun splashing in the water and catching little fish. But then, Lily's mom came to pick her up. She was embarrassed because she was all wet and her clothes were muddy. Her mom told her not to worry, and they went home to change. Later that day, Lily decided to separate her toys into different piles. She put her dolls in one pile and her blocks in another. It made her feel happy and organized.

Once upon a time, there was a boy who liked to explore. He was always very restless and loved to be on the move. One day, he was feeling extra adventurous and he decided to explore the big bathtub. He started to walk towards it, with a big smile on his face. Suddenly, his mom appeared and frowned when she saw him. She said, "No, no! No exploring in the bathtub!" She grabbed his arm and took him away. The boy felt sad, but he knew that his mother was just trying to keep him safe. He was so excited to explore the bathtub, but he had to wait until mom wasn't looking. The next day, his mom was busy with something else and the boy saw that as an opportunity. He ran to the bathtub and started to explore. Suddenly, he heard his mom's voice. She had been watching him and she had a big frown on her face. This time, she told him that it was ok to explore the bathtub, as long as he was careful. The boy smiled, happy that he got to explore the bathtub. He had learned an important lesson - that sometimes, it's ok to be a little restless.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and go on adventures. One day, she went on a walk with her mommy and daddy. They walked and walked until they reached a big park. Lily saw a boy playing with a ball and wanted to play too. She asked the boy if she could play with him, but he was being bossy and said no. Lily's heart felt sad, but then she saw a swing and ran to it. She swung back and forth, feeling happy again. Suddenly, the boy came over and asked if he could swing too. Lily said yes and they swung together, laughing and having fun. Lily's heart felt full of joy and she was happy she didn't give up when the boy was being bossy. From then on, Lily and the boy became friends and played together every time they saw each other at the park.

Once upon a time, there was a big alligator who lived in a pond. He had no friends because he would always quarrel with the other animals. This made the alligator very sad and worried. He wanted to be nice, but he didn't know how. One day, a little bird came to the pond. The alligator thought that maybe he could be friends with the bird. But, the alligator was worried that he would quarrel with the bird too. So, he tried to be very quiet and not say anything. The little bird saw the alligator and was scared. The alligator wanted to tell the bird that he wanted to be friends, but he didn't say anything. The bird flew away, and the alligator felt very sad. He knew that he had lost a chance to make a friend. The alligator was so worried about quarreling that he never talked to any animals again. He stayed sad and lonely in his pond forever.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a cute and adorable puppy named Max. Lily and Max loved to play together all day long. One day, Lily's mom took her and Max to the park. They played on the swings, the slide, and even had a picnic. As the sun started to set, Lily's mom said it was time to go home. Lily didn't want to leave the park yet, but she knew she had to. She said to Max, "I regret that we have to leave now, but we'll come back soon." Max barked happily and followed Lily to the exit. When they got home, Lily gave Max a big hug and promised to take him to the park again soon.

One day, Rover took his leash and went on a walk. Everywhere he went, he left a messy trail behind him. He trotted around in the park, over the bridge, and he even dug in the mud. But, he wasn't paying attention to where he was going.  Suddenly, there was a loud noise. It scared Rover and he tried to part, but he couldn't. Rover was so scared he was shaking and he couldn't move his legs. He didn't know what to do. Rover looked around and saw that he was stuck! His leash had gotten tangled around a tree and he couldn't get free. Even with all his wiggling and tugging. Then, Rover heard a voice. It was his owner, calling to him. His owner was nearby and he had noticed that Rover had gotten himself into a complicated mess. With some help, his owner was able to untangle Rover and get him back on track. The moral of this story is that it's important to pay attention to where you're going and not to get too distracted by other things, or you can get into a messy situation.

Once upon a time there were two friends named Max and Molly. They both liked to play at the club together. Max was a careful boy and Molly was very curious. They both wanted to try something new. So they thought they could start a club!  They decided to call it, 'The Mind Club'. It was a place where they would use their minds to make new ideas. Each day they would come up with something that was creative and fun. Molly and Max started their new club and they loved it. They both kept careful minds so that they would have lots of new ideas. They even shared them with their other friends at the club. Max and Molly were so happy with their club. It was the perfect way to use their minds in creative ways.  They kept being careful to come up with new ideas and to have lots of fun.

Every summer, the family goes to a special camp. They stay in a small cabin in the woods, and they have a lot of fun! The children play in the sunshine and explore the meadow and woods. There are so many wonderful things to see and do. The days are mild and the sun is warm. At night, the family gathers around the campfire. They toast marshmallows and tell stories. Everyone loves the songs and jokes. Then, when the stars come out, the family falls asleep in their cabin. In the mornings, they wake up to the birds singing. The family plays all day and has a great time. And at night they gather round the still-glowing campfire and talk, until it is time to go to sleep again. The family is sad when their stay at camp comes to an end, but they know they will return next year.

Once upon a time, there was a gentle crocodile. He lived near a big river and he loved to wave hello when people passed by. On warm days, he would wave all day to nearly everyone who went by. One day, a little girl was walking along the river and when she saw the crocodile she stopped. She waved to him and he waved back. They kept waving for the longest time and it made the little girl so happy. Every day after that, the girl and the crocodile kept waving. She would wave to him from the riverbank and he would wave from the water. Even on a rainy day, when everyone stayed inside, the crocodile and the girl would still wave to each other from far away. The crocodile and the little girl were the best of friends and their special wave always made them smile.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Maria. She was 3 years old. Maria loved to wash her hands and wrap herself in warm blankets. Today, Maria wanted to go outside and have some fun, but it was raining hard. Her mom was very compassionate and saw her daughter's disappointment. She quickly grabbed her umbrella and brought it outside. She said to Maria, "Let's play in the rain! We can take turns getting under the umbrella, and then we can wrap ourselves in towels and take a warm shower when we're done."  Maria was so excited. She and her mom splashed in the rain and then went inside to wash up and get warm. Maria wrapped a towel around herself and felt all cozy. Her mom hugged Maria and said, "That's what compassionate people do - they make sure everyone is safe and happy, even in the rain."  And that's exactly what Maria and her mom did. They finished their shower and wrapped themselves in warm blankets. Maria felt so grateful to be safe and happy, with her loving mom nearby. And they both agreed - the rain was actually lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a playful little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys all day long. One day, she saw her brother playing with a cool toy car that had many gears.  "Can I play with your car?" asked Lily. "Sure, you can play with it for a little bit," said her brother, passing the car to her. Lily was so happy to play with the gear-filled car. She made it go fast and slow, and even made it pass through her toy tunnel.  "Thank you for letting me play with your car," said Lily, passing it back to her brother. "No problem, Lily. You can play with it anytime you want," said her brother with a smile.  From that day on, Lily and her brother played together with the toy car, passing it back and forth, and having lots of fun.

Once upon a time, there was a clever fox. He was exploring the forest when he saw smoke in the distance. He knew it was a fire and he had to put it out. So he raced to the spot, but there wasn't enough water to put it out. The fox looked around, and spotted a lake. He ran towards it, and started to dip his paws in the lake, then throwing the water at the fire to put it out. But no matter how hard he tried, the fire wouldn't stop. Just then, he heard a voice. It was a farmer, standing nearby. The farmer said, "Hey Fox, what are you doing?" The fox replied, "I'm trying to stop this fire." The farmer said, "That's no good! You need to put something in the fire to make it go away!" The fox thought for a moment, then he had a clever idea. He picked up some leaves and twigs and threw them in the fire. The leaves and twigs smothered the flames and soon, the fire was completely out.  The fox was very happy. He had saved the forest!

True was a happy young boy. Every day he would roll around his yard, giggling and playing. One day, he decided to roll beyond his yard and into a unfamiliar place. It was not safe, but True kept rolling until he was in way too deep. He was scared and wanted to go home. Just as he was about to turn back, a storm started and a strong wind began to blow. True was carried away, far from home. He was so scared and lost. He never found his way back, and his family never knew what happened to True. They were never able to find him again.

Once upon a time, there was an adorable bunny. He hopped around all day, looking for things to do. One day, he was very brave and decided to venture away from his home. As he hopped into the woods, he heard a loud noise. He thought it might be a hunter! He was very scared, so he stayed still and waited. But then he saw something he didn't expect - a little green frog! The frog looked super cute and he wasn't scared at all. He hopped over to the frog and they said hello together. The bunny felt much better now that he knew there was nothing to scare him. They decided to be friends and explore the woods together. As they were having fun, the hunter showed up! But the bunny and the frog were brave and stayed still. The hunter was so busy looking for something to catch that he didn't notice the adorable friends. The bunny and the frog were happy - they were safe from being scared!

A squirrel was sitting in a tree, looking very frustrated. Suddenly, a small voice called up from below. It was a little girl, and she was asking the squirrel a question. "What's wrong, squirrel?" she said. The squirrel shook her head and looked away. The little girl watched for a moment, then took a few steps back. "I'll come back later," she said softly. The squirrel watched as the little girl walked away. She couldn't help but feel sad. The little girl returned the next day with a surprise. She had a big bag with her, and when she opened it, two of her friends came out. They each had a big smile on their faces and were holding up a big acorn. The squirrel looked at the acorn in surprise. She quickly ran down the tree and snatched the acorn away. Then, she scampered back up with a happy chirp. The little girl and her friends smiled. They had solved the squirrel's problem. The acorn was enough to make her feel full and soothe her frustrated spirit.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. Lily loved to paint with her bright colors. One day, Lily saw a laser pointer and thought it was so cool. She wanted to play with it, but her mom said no because it was dangerous.  Lily didn't listen and took the laser pointer anyway. She shined it in her eyes and it hurt so much that she started crying. Her mom saw what happened and took the laser pointer away. She told Lily that lasers are not toys and can hurt people.  From that day on, Lily learned that it's important to listen to her mom and not play with dangerous things. She went back to painting with her bright colors and was happy knowing that she was safe. The end.

It was a normal day, and the little girl was out playing. She noticed her neighbor, who was usually so full of joy, looking very sad. She felt a bit helpless and wanted to do something to help them. She found the courage to walk up to the neighbor and asked, "What's wrong?" The neighbor replied, "Nothing." But the little girl knew something was wrong and could see that they were weeping. She gave the neighbor a big hug and said, "It's okay, you can tell me." The neighbor then took a deep breath and looked up into the little girl's eyes. "My yogurt is gone! I left it on the kitchen counter and my dog ate it." The neighbor was very sad, so the little girl decided then and there to try and get some yogurt for the neighbor. The little girl ran off and searched for the yogurt. She searched high and she searched low, but to no avail. After a few hours, she was feeling very helpless and was about to give up, when she stumbled across a yogurt cart in the park. She quickly ran over and bought the yummiest Yogurt she had ever seen.  The little girl ran all the way back to her neighbor's house, yogurt in hand. Upon seeing the yogurt, the neighbor's face lit up and they gave the little girl a big hug. The little girl and the neighbor shared the yogurt and laughed until the

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Lucy. She heard something ringing. She quickly ran out of her house.  When she arrived outside, she saw a big, tall museum. It looked empty, with all the windows and doors shut tight.  Lucy asked her friend, "What's that ringing?"  Her friend replied, "It's the museum ringing because it's empty."  Lucy had never seen a museum before and she was curious. She asked, "What's inside?"  Her friend said, "Lots of magical things! You should go inside!"  Finally Lucy plucked up the courage to go inside. When she opened the door, she saw all sorts of treasures and adventures that she had never seen before! She was amazed.  From then on, Lucy and her friend always went to the museum on weekends to explore and discover all the magical things inside.  The End.

Once there was a nice girl called Sarah. She was very excited about her first job. She wasn't sure if she was ready, but she felt happy too. On her first day, she arrived at work and it was so noisy! But Sarah was determined to make a good impression, so she worked very hard. People noticed how hard she worked and they thought she was amazing. But the next day, it was so noisy that Sarah couldn't hear her boss properly. She made a mistake and her boss was very angry. Sarah felt so sad. But then something wonderful happened; her boss forgave her. He said that everyone makes mistakes and it was alright. Sarah was so happy. Sarah was relieved that her boss had forgiven her. She was so grateful and she was determined to do a better job next time.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. Lily loved to play with her toys and sing songs. One day, Lily's dad asked her a question. He said, "Lily, what do you want for dinner?" Lily didn't answer because she was too busy playing.  Later that day, Lily's dad was fixing something in the house with a hammer. Lily wanted to play with the hammer, but her dad said no because it was dangerous. Lily got angry and called her dad selfish.  The next day, Lily's dad went to work and Lily was left alone. She wanted to play with the hammer again, so she snuck into her dad's toolbox and got it out. But when she was playing with it, she accidentally hit herself and got hurt. She cried and cried, but no one was there to answer her calls for help.  From that day on, Lily learned that it's important to listen to her parents and not be selfish. She wished she had answered her dad's question and listened to him when he said no to playing with the hammer.

Tom and Jen were twins who liked to play outside. They had a big ball that they kicked and threw to each other. One day, they saw a big billboard near their house. It had a picture of a clown and some words they could not read. "Let's go see the clown!" Tom said. He ran to the billboard and Jen followed him. They crossed the street without looking. A car was coming very fast. It honked and screeched, but it was too late. The car hit Tom and Jen and they flew in the air. They landed on the ground and did not move. The driver of the car got out and cried. He called for help on his phone. He was very sorry and scared. He did not see the twins until it was too late. He wished he could vanish and make it all go away. The clown on the billboard smiled and winked. He was proud of his trick. He liked to make children come to him and then hurt them. He was a bad clown who hated children. He laughed and laughed as he watched the twins die. He waited for more children to come. He was not done yet.

John had a net. It was a lovely net. He liked to take it to the park. The park was full of birds and butterflies. He liked to try to capture them with his net. He would often have a lot of luck and managed to catch lots of animals. He liked to watch them before releasing them back into the wild.  John was very careful to make sure that he didn't hurt any of the animals. He just wanted to have a closer look at them. He was always amazed at how beautiful and delicate they were.  John's mum and dad always praised him for the way he looked after animals. They were so proud of how kind and gentle he was. They thought it was lovely to see him so passionate about nature

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved the color pink and always wore a pink dress. One day, Lily and her family went to the harbor to see the big boats. Lily was so happy and she hoped to go on a boat ride.  But suddenly, a big storm came and the boats started to shake. Lily's family tried to protect her, but the waves were too strong. Lily got scared and cried. She hoped the storm would stop soon.  Sadly, the storm was too strong and the boats crashed into each other. Lily and her family fell into the water and couldn't swim. They tried to hold on to each other, but the waves were too strong. The harbor was no longer a safe place.

Once upon a time there was a mister. He was very independent and strong. He didn't need help from anyone. He was able to support himself. One day, while he was walking along the river, he saw a lot of mist. It looked like a cloud but it was lower to the ground. He was curious so he got closer to it. Inside the mist, he saw a lot of animals enjoying themselves. It made him really happy. He wanted to help them, so he decided to support them. He started to give the animals food and water. He made sure they were always safe and secure. He was proud to be able to support them. And from then on, he always supported them whenever he could. That made them very happy and they thanked him for being so independent.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with her crayons. One day, she went to the park with her mommy and brought her favorite red crayon with her. At the park, Lily met a little boy named Timmy. Timmy asked if he could use her red crayon to draw a picture. Lily didn't want to share her crayon, but she promised to let him use it for just a little while. Timmy drew a great picture with the red crayon, and Lily was happy she made a new friend. Later, when they were leaving the park, Timmy gave Lily a piece of candy as a thank you. Lily smiled and knew that keeping her promise was worth it.

One day, a little boy named Tim saw a shiny thing on the wall. It was very pretty. He wanted to touch it. But the wall was too high. Tim felt sad. Tim asked his friend, Sam, to help him. Sam said, "Let's use a chair to reach the wall." They put the chair near the wall. Tim stood on the chair and touched the shiny thing. It was a tasty candy! But then, Tim and Sam started to fight. "I want the candy!" said Tim. "No, I want it!" said Sam. They both wanted the tasty candy. They were not happy. Tim thought for a moment. He said, "Let's share the candy!" Sam agreed. They broke the candy in half and each had a piece. The candy was very tasty. Tim and Sam were happy again. They learned that sharing is good.

Once upon a time, there was a pink bunny named Rosie. Rosie loved to eat lunch outside in the sun. One day, while she was eating her carrot sandwich, she saw a little bird stuck in a tree. The bird was crying for help. Rosie knew she had to rescue the bird. She hopped over to the tree and climbed up to where the bird was stuck. She gently picked up the bird and brought it back down to the ground. The bird was so happy to be rescued and thanked Rosie by singing a beautiful song. Rosie finished her lunch with the bird by her side, feeling proud that she was able to help someone in need. From that day on, Rosie and the bird became the best of friends and had many more adventures together.

Once upon a time, there were two best friends. One was named Tim and the other was named Jack. Jack and Tim always had fun together. One day, Jack arrived at Tim's house. They went into the living room and sat down. Tim pointed to his new clock on the wall and said, "Look Jack! I got a new clock." Jack was very excited and turned to Tim and asked, "What does it do?" Tim explained that the clock told the time. They talked and discussed the clock for a while. They thought the clock was very honest. It always told the correct time.  Jack thought it was a very honest clock.  Tim smiled and said, "Yes! It is a very honest clock!"  The two friends were happy they could discuss the clock together. They had a lot of fun. They agreed the clock was a very special one.  And Tim and Jack stayed friends for a very long time!

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to race his friends around the forest. One day, Benny saw a shiny trophy that he really wanted to win in the big race. But Benny's friend, a sly fox named Freddy, told him that the trophy was fake and not worth winning. Benny began to worry if the trophy was really fake. He asked Freddy how he knew, and Freddy just shrugged and said he heard it from someone else. But Benny believed Freddy and decided not to enter the race. The day of the race came and Benny watched from the sidelines as his friends raced. To his surprise, the winner was given the same shiny trophy that he wanted. Benny felt sad and wished he had entered the race. He went to Freddy to ask why he lied about the trophy, but Freddy just laughed and said he wanted to win it for himself. Benny learned a hard lesson that day and realized he shouldn't always trust what others say. He went home feeling disappointed and sad that he missed out on the race and the chance to win the shiny trophy.

Once upon a time there was a jolly little boy. His name was Jack and he loved to choose. One day Jack went to the store with his mommy. She said he could pick something out for himself. Jack saw a big, icy freezer and instantly knew what he wanted. He chose the freezer with bright and joy. When Jack got the freezer he smiled and ran home. Once home he opened the freezer and peered inside. There were all kinds of tasty treats inside that would freeze quickly. Jack picked a snack he wanted to try. He chose a sweet frozen banana and ate it. The freezer was like magic to Jack. Every day he would pick something else out to eat. He tried popsicles, ice-cream, and all kinds of vegetables. Jack's mom would tell him to chose something healthy but he liked to try everything the freezer had to offer. Jack had so much fun eating the goodies from the freezer. He was so jolly and liked to try something new each day. He enjoyed his special treat from the freezer and was always so excited to choose.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Jane. Jane loved to play hockey and she was very independent. One day she got a great idea - she gathered all her hockey sticks and scattered them around the garden.  Jane was very excited, she enjoyed chasing and collecting her sticks. But soon Jane started to get tired, she just couldn't keep up with all the sticks. When it seemed she had lost all of them, she started to cry. Suddenly, she spotted her dad in the garden and she ran to him. Jane asked her dad to help her find her hockey sticks. Her dad smiled and said, “Let’s do it together, my darling. We will find them much quicker in a team.” So Jane’s dad and Jane worked together and soon they found all the hockey sticks. Jane learned a valuable lesson that day: anything can be easy when you work together with somebody you love.

Once upon a time, there was a bossy baby named Joe. He was happy and smiley all the time. Joe was playing in the playground when he fell and got a little cut. He started to cry. His mommy came running to give him a big hug and kiss. Joe felt lots better after his mom gave him a kiss on his cheek. The next day, Joe was running in the park, but he fell again and hurt himself. He was sad and started to cry. His mom was there to give him lots of love and kisses. She kissed him all over his head and face. Joe laughed and smiled. He felt much better now. The summer came, and Joe wanted to go to the beach. But the water was too deep. Joe started to cry, again. His mommy came and gave him lots of kisses and a big hug. He felt much better. Joe is a very happy baby now. Whenever he gets sad or hurt, his mommy is always ready with lots of hugs and kisses. He loves it when his mommy kisses him.

Max was very excited. His mommy said they were going on a special trip. He ran to his room and started packing. He got his favorite stuffed bear and put it in his bag. He also put his shoes and his blue hat inside. When he was done, he went to his mommy and she was holding a leash. Max didn't know what a leash was but he knew it was for him. His mommy put it around his neck and it made him feel very special. Mommy said it was time to go and they walked outside. There were so many tall buildings and Max was amazed! He waved to the people on the streets and they waved back. Max and his mommy kept walking until they arrived at a big park. Max was so happy to be there! He saw some new friends and they all started playing. Max had the best day. He can't wait until they go back out with the leash again.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She had a wallet that was very important to her. One day, she went to the park to play with her friends. She put her wallet on the bench and forgot about it. When she came back, her wallet was gone. She looked everywhere but couldn't find it.  Lily was sad because she had her favorite toy in the wallet. Her mom told her not to worry and they went to the lost and found. They found the wallet, but it was ugly because someone had scribbled on it. Lily was happy to have her wallet back, but sad that it looked so bad.  Her mom told her not to worry and took out a sticker from her bag. She said, "Let's cover the ugly scribbles with this pretty sticker." Lily was excited and helped her mom cover the scribbles. Now her wallet looked beautiful again, and she was happy to have her favorite toy back.

One day, Sammy and his Mommy were walking down the street. Suddenly, Sammy heard a loud noise. He looked around and saw a big, white ambulance. "Mommy, what is that?" Sammy asked. "That is an ambulance, Sammy," Mommy said. "It takes people who are not feeling very well to the hospital." Mommy and Sammy got closer to the ambulance and Sammy waved at the driver. The driver waved back. "The driver wants to introduce you to the ambulance," Mommy said. Sammy nodded and took one step forward. He was very excited and couldn't believe his eyes. It was so big and white! He touched the side of the ambulance and smiled. "Hello, ambulance," Sammy said. The ambulance revved its engine and Sammy giggled. Then he waved goodbye and they walked away. Sammy was so excited and happy to meet the ambulance!

Once upon a time there was a kind old man with a white cloth in his hand. The old man was walking down a path and he saw a small, young boy. The old man asked the boy, "Do you know what this cloth is for?" The boy nodded his head and said, "Yes sir. It is to help lift things up."  The old man smiled and replied, "That's right. Now, can you tell me why it’s important to help lift other things?"  "No, I'm sorry," the boy replied, shaking his head.  The old man smiled again. "That is okay - I can show you. Look around you and find a small, open box." The boy did as he was asked and he soon found a small, open box on the side of the path. He brought it to the old man, who smiled and said, "Now watch; with my cloth, I will lift up this box."  The old man carefully put the cloth on the ground and then used it to lift up the box with ease. The old man said, "You see, when we give a helping hand to others, it can not only make their work easier, but it can make us feel happier too." The boy thanked the old man for his lesson, then smiled, feeling much wiser than before.

Once upon a time there was a huge book. The book was loved by a little girl named Sue. Every day she would give the book a huge hug. One day, Sue’s mommy gave her a pair of scissors. “You can use these to cut,” her mom said. Sue was so excited. She grabbed the scissors and ran straight to the huge book. Sue started cutting and cutting. She trimmed the pages into shapes, drew lines and designs. She was so proud of all the new shapes she made. Suddenly, Sue heard someone calling her name. It was her mommy. “Sue, why did you cut the book?” Mommy asked. She looked really mad. Sue was scared, but she was brave to admit her mistake. “I wanted to make it look pretty,” she said.
