Mommy gave Sue a hug. “I know you meant well, but next time, you must ask permission before you cut anything, okay?”  Sue nodded her head, and she and her mommy hugged the huge book together.

Once upon a time there was a little boy named Bob. Bob really wanted to be a gardener when he grew up. He loved playing in the garden and looking for special things like roots. One day Bob went out to the garden to look for a special root. He saw a big puddle and hoped he could find something special in the wet mud near the puddle. He carefully put his hands in the mud. He felt something squishy and hard. He carefully pulled it out and saw a big, brown root. Bob was so excited. He ran inside to show his mom the special root he found. His mom was very proud of Bob and told him he could be a gardener just like he wanted when he grew up. Bob was very happy. He kept the special root safe and hoped he would someday find more special things in the garden.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the grocery store with her mommy. One day, while they were walking down the aisle, Lily saw a purple grape. She asked her mommy if she could have it, and her mommy said yes. Suddenly, a man with a scary mask jumped out from behind the cereal boxes. Lily got scared and hid behind her mommy. The man took off his mask and said, "Don't be scared, it's just me, your uncle!" Lily and her uncle laughed and continued shopping for groceries. They found some more purple grapes and put them in the cart. When they got home, Lily ate the grapes and told her mommy about how her uncle scared her at the store. They all laughed and had a great time together. The end.

One day Little Jay was feeling very busy. He asked his mum if he could go outside and play. His mum said no, she had a special exam for him to do.  Little Jay was a bit worried because he had never done an exam before. He asked his mum what he had to do. She said to look at the paper and pick the right answers.  Little Jay was very busy looking at the paper. He kept asking his mum for help. She was very patient and explained the questions to him.  Finally Little Jay finished the exam and was very proud of himself. He had done it all by himself and been very busy. He asked his mum if he could go outside and play now, and she said yes.

Once upon a time, there was a little birdie named Tweety. Tweety loved to play with his friends and eat yummy seeds. One day, Tweety found a big, shiny egg. He was so happy and wanted to show it to his friends. But when he tried to carry it, the egg was too heavy and he dropped it. The egg cracked and Tweety was sad. Tweety's friends saw him crying and asked him what happened. Tweety showed them the cracked egg and they all felt sorry for him. But then, one of the friends had an idea. She said they should pray to the birdie gods to help fix the egg. Tweety and his friends closed their eyes and prayed really hard. Suddenly, something amazing happened. The egg started to move and wiggle. It was like magic! The egg hatched and a cute little chick came out. Tweety was so happy and his friends were amazed. They all hugged and played with the new chick. Tweety learned that even when things seem bad, praying can make them better. And the little chick was so flexible, it could even do somersaults!

Once upon a time, there was a man who had an original wife. They were very happy together. Every day, they would fold the laundry together. One day, the man decided he wanted an even better wife, so he went off in search of one.  After a long journey, the man found a much more beautiful wife. He wanted this new wife to be his own, and so he left his original wife and married the new one.  Back at home, the original wife was devastated. She had given the man many years of loyalty, but he returned the favor by leaving her. She decided that she wanted the same justice that he had given her, so she started to plan her revenge.  The next day, the man was just about to fold the laundry when his original wife came in and slashed his face. He was never able to fold laundry again. His bad decision had been paid for by a gruesome revenge from his former wife.  The moral of the story is that actions have consequences. People should not be quick to turn away from their original wife in exchange for something better.

Lily and Ben were best friends. They liked to play in the park every day. They liked to swing, slide and run. One day, they saw a big duck pond in the park. They wanted to feed the ducks. Lily had some bread in her bag. She broke it into small pieces and threw them to the ducks. The ducks came closer and quacked. Lily was happy. She gave some bread to Ben and said, "Here, you feed them too." Ben took the bread and threw it to the ducks. But he threw it too hard. One piece hit a duck on the head. The duck was angry. It flapped its wings and chased Ben. Ben was scared. He ran away from the duck. He dropped the bread and bumped into Lily. Lily fell down and hurt her knee. She cried. Ben felt bad. He said, "I'm sorry, Lily. I didn't mean to hurt you or the duck. Are you okay?" Lily looked at her knee. It was red and sore. She looked at Ben. He looked sad and sorry. She looked at the duck. It was graceful and calm. It had stopped chasing Ben and was eating the bread. Lily thought for a moment. She said, "It's okay, Ben. I forgive you. You didn't do it on purpose. And the duck is fine too. See, it's happy now." Ben smiled. He said, "Thank you, Lily. You're a good friend. Can I help you up?" Lily nodded. She said, "Yes, please. And can we still play in the park?" Ben said, "Of course. Let's go to the swings. They're fun and safe." Lily and Ben held hands and walked to the swings. They forgot about the duck and the bread. They laughed and played. They were best friends again.

Jazz was a hot dog. He loved to run in circles and bark. But, one day Jazz got a little too close to the sun. He was a bit too hot. Jazz started to cry as his fur became very warm. He felt as if he was going to burst into flames! He slowly ran back home, but he knew there was no solution to his problem. When Jazz finally got home, he regretted his mistake. He had learned his lesson. After that, he stayed away from the hot sun. Jazz realized that it's ok to take risks, but that it's also important to be smart. He was happy to have learned this important lesson and never made the mistake of getting too close to the sun again.

Once upon a time, Tiana was walking down the street with Mommy. Tiana wanted to visit the museum. She thought it looked so cool! She wanted to see all the fun and interesting things inside. Mommy said yes, and they passed by lots of different buildings until they reached the museum. When they went in, Tiana was amazed by all of the pretty things she could see. She loved the paintings and statues and ran around trying to see them all.  Mommy bought her a yummy snack that was sweet and warm. Tiana munched on it as she walked around, looking at all the wonderful things in the museum.  Before long, she was so tired from all the exploring that she needed to have a rest. Mommy scooped her up and carried her to the car.  Tiana was sad to leave, but she knew there was lots more to explore at the museum. She promised herself she would come back soon!

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. She had a big box of toys in her room. One day, Sally's mom said, "Sally, your room is very messy. Let's organize your toys and make it nice." Sally and her mom started to organize the toys. They found a pair of sunglasses in the box. Sally put them on and said, "Look, Mom! I have sunglasses!" Her mom laughed and said, "You look very cool, Sally!" While they were organizing, Sally found a toy with a bad wheel. She showed it to her mom and said, "Mom, this toy is bad. It can't roll." Her mom said, "Don't worry, Sally. We can fix it later. Now, let's finish organizing your toys." And they did.

Tommy was a very intelligent little boy. He loved to play video games with his friends. One day his friends were too busy, so Tommy had to play by himself. He was eager to beat the level he was on and he tried his best. But he just couldn't do it! Suddenly, his mom came in and told him it was time to rest. He knew she was right, but he was so determined to beat the level. He started to argue with his mom, but she wasn't budging. No matter how hard he tried he couldn't keep playing. So finally, Tommy had to turn off the video game and rest. He was disappointed, but his mom was pleased. She knew that even intelligent boys like Tommy needed a break sometimes.

Once upon a time there was a wise old bear. He lived in a cave by the sea and he ate fruit every day. One day, he decided to go for a walk in the forest. As he was walking, he came upon a small rabbit. The rabbit seemed scared and was shaking a lot. The bear walked up to the rabbit and asked, "What's wrong?" The rabbit looked at the bear and said, "There is a mean fox in the forest. He is trying to steal all the fruit. Please help me protect the fruit."  The bear smiled and said, "I will help you! We will protect the fruit together."  So the wise old bear and the small rabbit worked together to keep the mean fox away. They watched over the fruit every day until the fox eventually gave up and left. The bear and the rabbit became good friends and they shared the fruit together. From that day on, they vowed to protect the forest and its fruit forever.

Once upon a time there was a boy named Joe. Joe wanted to go for a ride in a taxi, but it was far away. Joe asked his mom if he could go for a ride. Mom said he could if he folded his blankets.  So Joe did exactly what his mom said and he folded the blankets. He was very proud of himself.  Once the blankets were folded, Joe and his mom got into the taxi. The taxi driver drove them a very long way. It seemed like they drove for miles and miles.  When they reached their destination, Joe was so excited. He had never been anywhere so distant before.  The taxi driver let them out and they began their journey. Joe was happy he had listened to his mom and folded the blankets. It had made his trip in the taxi possible.

Anna and Ben love to eat melon. Melon is sweet and juicy and makes them happy. One day, Mom brings home a big melon from the store. She says it is a watermelon. Anna and Ben are excited. They want to try the watermelon. Mom puts the watermelon on the table. She takes a big knife and cuts the watermelon. She splits the watermelon in half. Anna and Ben see the inside of the watermelon. It is red and green and has many black seeds. Mom says the seeds are not good to eat. She scoops out some of the red part and puts it in a bowl. She gives the bowl to Anna and Ben. Anna and Ben take a spoon and eat the watermelon. It is very yummy. They feel the watermelon in their mouth. It is soft and wet and cold. They drink the juice from the bowl. It is clear and sweet and refreshing. They smile and say thank you to Mom. Mom smiles back and says you're welcome. She is happy to see them enjoy the watermelon. Anna and Ben finish the watermelon. They are full and satisfied. They wipe their mouth and hands with a napkin. They ask Mom if they can have more watermelon later. Mom says yes, there is still half of the watermelon left. She puts it in the fridge to keep it fresh. Anna and Ben are happy. They love watermelon. They hug Mom and say they love her too. Mom hugs them back and says she loves them too. They are a happy family.

Once upon a time there was a girl who loved to skip. She had an incredible chain that she wore around her neck. It was her favourite thing in the world. One day, she went to the park to skip with her chain on. She didn't know that it would come off. She skipped and jumped and choreographed leaps through the grass. Before she knew it, the chain was gone. She looked everywhere, but it was not to be found. She became very sad, realising that her chain was lost. But then, something incredible happened. As she looked back at the park, a bright light shone from a chain in the grass. The girl rushed over and couldn't believe her eyes. It was her chain! It was still there!  The girl quickly put it back around her neck and vowed never to lose it again. She was so incredibly happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play in the garden. One day, Timmy saw a beetle crawling on a leaf. The beetle was very colorful and Timmy wanted to touch it. He leaned over to touch the beetle. Suddenly, the beetle flew up and landed on Timmy's finger. Timmy was so excited! But then, the beetle bit him. It was a dangerous beetle and Timmy got very sick. His parents took him to the doctor, but it was too late. Timmy passed away. The moral of the story is that sometimes things that look pretty and harmless can be very dangerous. It's important to listen to grown-ups and not touch things that we don't know are safe.

Once upon a time there was a clumsy village with a secret. All of the villagers would whisper about it together and nobody else knew what it was. One day a three year old child came to the village. Her name was Daisy and she was very curious. She asked the villagers, "What is your secret?" The villagers all looked at each other and laughed. Then one of them said, "Only if you are very brave can you find out our secret!" Daisy was excited, so she said, "I am brave!" The villagers showed Daisy to a big tree in the middle of the village. They said, "The secret is in the hollow of the tree." Daisy was scared, but she was brave. She walked to the tree and whispered, "Hello?" Suddenly, a friendly voice replied from inside the tree, "Hello there! I am a magical fairy. I will grant you three wishes!" Daisy was so happy and she ran around the village, shouting, "I found the magical fairy!"

Once upon a time there was a blue duck. The duck lived in a pond and loved to dive. Every day the duck used to dive into the pond and swim around.  One day, as the duck was diving, he saw something sparkly at the bottom of the pond. He swam closer and closer until he was able to grab it. As soon as he grabbed it he swam to the surface of the pond. The duck was very excited. He had found a sparkly blue stone! He kept it close to him every time he dove.  One day, while he was diving, the duck got into trouble. He was too far down and couldn't get back up! The duck started to worry until he remembered the sparkly blue stone. He held the stone close and it gave him the strength he needed to make it back to the surface.  The duck was very happy when he reached the top. He thanked the blue stone for saving him and vowed never to dive too deep again.

Once upon a time, there was a big apple tree. It had many apples on it. One day, a little girl came to the tree and asked for an apple. The apple tree was happy to give her an apple. The little girl took a bite of the apple and it split in two. She was surprised! She had never seen an apple split like that before. The apple tree told the little girl about its history. It was very old and had been there for a long time. It was famous for giving the best apples in the whole town. The little girl was very happy to hear the story and thanked the apple tree for the delicious apple.

Anna likes to play with her hoop. She can roll it, spin it, and jump through it. She has a big hoop that is red and yellow. She likes to mark it with her crayons. She makes dots, lines, and shapes on it. One day, she takes her hoop to the park. She sees a boy with a small hoop that is blue and green. He also likes to mark it with his crayons. He makes stars, circles, and letters on it. "Hi, I am Anna. Can I see your hoop?" she asks. "Hi, I am Ben. Sure, you can see my hoop. Can I see yours?" he says. They swap hoops and look at each other's marks. They like what they see. They smile and laugh. "Your hoop is big and pretty. I like your shapes," Ben says. "Your hoop is small and nice. I like your stars," Anna says. They decide to play together. They roll, spin, and jump with their hoops. They make more marks on them. They have fun. They are friends.

Tom and Mia are going to the zoo with Mom and Dad. They are very happy and excited. They want to see the lions, the monkeys, and the elephants. They have tickets in their hands. Mom and Dad tell them to hold the tickets tight and not lose them. At the zoo, they see a big sign with a map. Mom and Dad point to the sign and show them where to go. Tom and Mia are curious. They want to know what the sign says. They ask Mom and Dad to read the sign for them. Mom and Dad tell them the names of the animals and where to find them. They walk to the lion enclosure. They see a big lion with a mane and a tail. He is lying on a rock and roaring. Tom and Mia are amazed. They point to the lion and say, "Wow, look at the lion! He is so big and loud!" Mom and Dad take pictures of them with the lion. They walk to the monkey enclosure. They see many monkeys swinging from the trees and playing with each other. Tom and Mia are amused. They point to the monkeys and say, "Look at the monkeys! They are so funny and silly!" Mom and Dad take pictures of them with the monkeys. They walk to the elephant enclosure. They see a huge elephant with a trunk and tusks. He is spraying water from his trunk and eating hay. Tom and Mia are astonished. They point to the elephant and say, "Look at the elephant! He is so huge and smart!" Mom and Dad take pictures of them with the elephant. They have a lot of fun at the zoo. They see many other animals and learn new things. They thank Mom and Dad for taking them to the zoo. They keep their tickets as souvenirs. They can't wait to go to the zoo again.

Once upon a time there was a little girl called Sophie. She was three years old and loved to play. Every day, Sophie would go outside and look for things to add to her collection of toys. One day, she went outside and saw a big pile of leaves. She was so excited! She put her hands in the leaves and added some to her collection.  When Sophie was finished adding the leaves to her collection, she went to get a closer look. She was amazed. The leaves were so colourful and felt so comfortable. She just wanted to keep looking at them.  Then, Sophie went home with her collection of leaves. She was so happy and couldn't wait to show them to her family.  The end.

Once upon a time there was a big, strong elephant. He was working so hard in the hot sun, trying to build his new house with a big tool. Suddenly, he got an itch in his nose and he sneezed! The sneeze was so strong the whole house shook. Frightened, the elephant looked around. In the corner of the room he saw a small mouse. It had run in when the house shook. The elephant smiled and said, "Hello there. What has brought you to my house?" The mouse replied, "I heard your big sneeze and came to make sure you were OK!"  The elephant was very touched by the mouse's kind words. He thanked the mouse and they became friends. From then on, the elephant was never alone while he was building his house.

Once upon a time, there was a track. The track was very attractive. Every day, many little children would come and play on the track.  One day, a group of children were playing a game. It was called "Number Track". They had to count from 1 to 10 and race around the track.  The first little boy had a head start, but the second was very fast. He passed the first little boy and ran all the way around the track.  The group of children cheered for the little boy and hugged him. Together, they all played the Number Track game until it was time to go home.  The children had so much fun on the Number Track, and they went home tired and happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to draw with chalk on the wide sidewalk outside her house. One day, her friend Jack came to play with her. Jack asked, "What are you drawing, Lily?" She shrugged and said, "I don't know yet." Jack said, "Can I draw with you?" Lily smiled and said, "Yes, please!" They drew together for a while, making wide circles and lines. Suddenly, Lily's chalk broke in half. She looked sad and said, "Oh no, my chalk is broken." Jack shrugged and said, "Don't worry, I have more chalk at my house." They ran to Jack's house and got more chalk. They came back and drew until the sun went down. Then they said goodbye, promising to draw again soon.

Once upon a time, there was a girl named Lily. She loved playing outside in the sun. She always wore a hat to keep the sun out of her eyes. One day, she found a pretty palm tree with big leaves. She thought it was very attractive and wanted to climb it. But when she got closer, she saw a spider on the tree. Lily hates spiders! She decided to go play somewhere else instead.

Once upon a time, there were two best friends who loved to play together. One day, the friends got into an argument about which way to go. The first friend said, "Let's go west!" But the second friend said, "No, let's go east!" They both got very mad and started to fight. The first friend felt very nervous. He turned to his friend and said, "Please, don't fight. Let's try to find another way." The second friend thought for a while. Then he said, "Ok, we will go up instead. That way, we can look around and decide which way to go." The two best friends were happy again. They went up to the top and looked around. Then they agreed that it would be fun to go west. And they ran off, hand in hand, in the direction of the setting sun.

Tommy was very excited. He had a big goal to perform today. His mom had told him that if he completed it he would be very rich. Tommy wasn't sure what to do, but his mom said it wouldn't be too hard. She said she was sure he could do it. So, with a smile on his face, he set out to complete his goal. First, Tommy had to find a big rock. He looked all over the grass until he found one. He picked it up and ran back to his mom. She smiled and gave him a big thumbs up. She said he was doing great! Next, Tommy had to build a castle with the rock. He worked hard, pushing and pulling the rock until it was just the way he wanted it. His mom said he was very clever and he felt very proud. Finally, Tommy had to perform a dance. He wiggled his bottom, hopped up and down and shook his hands in the air. His mom and dad clapped and yelled “Well done!” Tommy had performed his goal and he felt very happy. His mom said he was very rich now!  He was so excited that he gave his mom a big hug. He was so proud of himself and he knew he could do anything.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tom. He loved playing in the sunshine. One day, Tom's parents allowed him to go outside and play. He ran around the garden, feeling the smooth grass beneath his feet. But, suddenly, everything changed. Heavy rain clouds filled the sky and a huge flood started to pour down. Tom was scared and ran back inside calling for his parents. "What's wrong? Why are you scared?" his dad asked. "There's a flood," replied Tom. His dad smiled. "Don't worry, it's not a bad flood. We'll stay safe inside, but feel free to look out of the window and watch." Tom ran to the window, looking at the smooth water rising up around their house. But, he was excited by the sight and wasn't scared anymore. He said to his dad. "Wow! That's so cool! Can I go out and play in the flood?" "No," his dad replied firmly. "It's too dangerous. We'll just have to watch from here until the rain stops." Tom nodded. He was sad that he couldn't play in the flood like he wanted, but he understood why he wasn't allowed to. So, he watched the flood until it slowly disappeared and the sunshine came back.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Bob. He was hungry and he wanted to get something to eat. So he went to the kitchen.  He opened the fridge and saw a delicious lemon cake inside. He grabbed it and cut it into slices.  But when Bob wanted to eat his cake, he heard his mom shout:  "Bob! You need to take a shower first!"  Bob did not want to take a shower, he wanted to eat the cake! He started to cry and shout:  "No mommy, I don't want to take a shower!"  But his mom did not listen to him. She said that he needs to take a shower before he eats his cake.  Bob was so sad, but he knew that his mom was right. So he went to the bathroom and took a shower.  When he was done, he came back to the kitchen and saw that his mom had put a plate full of cake on the table. He was so happy and he ate all the cake slices in no time.  Bob was no longer hungry, but he was very happy and his mom was very proud of him too!

Once there was a little girl. She was three years old and liked to read books. One day, she saw a shiny book on the table. She went over and opened it up. Inside, she found lots of helpful words.  The little girl was excited to read all the words in the book. She turned to the first page and began to read. She was so happy to learn new things. With each turn of the page she discovered more helpful stories, pictures and phrases.  The little girl smiled as she read the book. She was so glad the book was helpful and she could improve her reading skills. Reading was so fun! The girl was so proud of herself and thankful for the book that helped her learn.

Once upon a time, there was a wise old bear who lived in the woods. He liked to watch the sun come up each morning and see the trees turning green as summer came near. One day, the wise old bear decided to bring summer to the woods. He went for a long walk and gathered pretty flowers and seeds from the meadows. After he had everything he needed, he put it all together to make a special gift. The wise old bear danced through the woods and spread the gifts of summer everywhere. The flowers started blooming and the trees turned green. All the animals in the woods felt happy and thanked the bear for bringing summer. The woods stayed green and full of life all summer long. Everyone enjoyed the sunshine and warmth, thanks to the wise old bear.

Tommy was very nervous. He wanted to crawl to the pear tree, but he was scared. He could see the pears, but it was a long way away. He took a deep breath and started crawling. He was slow and careful but eventually he made it to the pear tree. His friends were waiting there, cheering for him! They grabbed lots of pears and rushed home. Tommy was proud of himself - he had conquered his fear!

Once upon a time there was a mummy and daddy. They were in a hurry to go somewhere special. They had to turn a special switch. Mummy said, "Hurry up, let's turn the switch!" Daddy said, "Okay, I will try to be quick".  Daddy got to the switch and pushed it. He made a very harsh sound! Mummy jumped and said, "Oh, that was loud!" Daddy said, "Let's go, we don't want to be late!" They both ran out of the room very fast.  At the end of the day, mummy and daddy had a great time. They made it to the special place just in time!

Bob was an obedient little boy. He was walking in the park one day when he saw a big gum tree. He wanted some of the gum, so he started to run towards the tree. He sped up as fast as he could and was soon standing beneath the big tree. Bob was so excited and happy, he couldn't believe how much gum was falling from the tree! He filled his pockets with gum, and then ran back to his house. All the way home, he was so pleased with all his gum and was glad he was so obedient. Bob enjoyed his gum for days afterwards.

Tom and Mia lived in a small village with their mom and dad. They liked to play outside with their friends, but sometimes they had to help with chores. One day, mom asked them to go to the market and buy some bread and milk. "Be careful, and stay together," mom said. "The market is close, but there are many people and cars." Tom and Mia nodded and took a basket. They held hands and walked along the road. They saw some cows, some flowers, and some birds. They said hello to their neighbors. When they reached the market, they saw many stalls with different things. They smelled fruits, cheese, and fish. They heard people talking, laughing, and bargaining. They looked for the bread and milk. "Here they are," Tom said, pointing to a stall. He gave the seller some coins and took a loaf of bread and a bottle of milk. He put them in the basket. "Thank you," Mia said, smiling. "You're welcome," the seller said. "You are very polite and dependable children. Your mom must be proud of you." Tom and Mia blushed and thanked him again. They turned to go back to the village. "Wait," the seller said. "Take this, too." He handed them a small bag of cookies. "For us?" Tom asked, surprised. "Yes, for you," the seller said. "A gift for being such good customers. Enjoy!" Tom and Mia thanked him once more and hugged him. They were very happy and excited. They ran back to the village, holding hands and sharing the cookies. They couldn't wait to tell mom about their adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in her backyard. One day, she saw a swing hanging from a tree. She ran over to it and started to swing back and forth. It was so much fun! As she was swinging, her mom called out to her. "Lily, it's time to come inside and change your clothes for dinner," her mom said. Lily didn't want to stop swinging, but she knew she had to listen to her mom. After dinner, Lily went to bed. She was so excited to wear her new thin pajamas that her mom had bought her. As she was getting ready for bed, she remembered how much fun she had swinging earlier that day. She couldn't wait to swing again tomorrow.

Once upon a time there was a very wealthy man. He owned a lot of things and was very happy. But every day he walked around with a sad face. One day, he passed a sign on the side of the road and he stopped to read it. The sign said, "Life is like ice cream. It melts away if you don't enjoy it!" The man was so moved by the sign that he smiled. He realized that he needed to enjoy his money and his life. He never walked around with a sad face again. Now he spends his days enjoying the nice ice cream and feeling wealthy and happy. The sign reminded him that life is precious and can easily melt away if we forget to enjoy it.

Lily and her mom went to the park. Lily liked to play on the swings and the slide. Mom liked to sit on the bench and read a book. She had a big purse with many things inside. One day, it started to rain. Lily and mom ran to the bench to get the purse. But the purse was not there. Someone had taken it. Mom was very sad and angry. She said, "Where is my purse? Who took my purse?" Lily saw a friendly dog near the trees. The dog had something in its mouth. It was the purse. The dog had found it and wanted to play with it. The dog ran to Lily and mom and wagged its tail. It dropped the purse on the ground. Mom picked up the purse. It was very wet and dirty. The dog had soaked it with its saliva. Mom said, "Oh, no! My purse is ruined. Look at this mess." Lily petted the dog. She said, "Don't be mad, mom. The dog is nice. He did not know. He just wanted to have fun. Can we keep him?" Mom looked at Lily and the dog. She smiled a little. She said, "Well, he is a friendly dog. And he did bring back my purse. Maybe we can give him a bath and a name. What do you think?" Lily hugged the dog. She said, "I think he is a good dog. I want to call him Spot. Can we, mom? Please?" Mom nodded. She said, "OK, Lily. We can keep Spot. But first, let's go home and dry off. And clean my purse."

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play dress-up with her mom's jewelry. One day, Lily's mom gave her a shiny necklace to wear. Lily was so proud of it that she wore it everywhere she went. One afternoon, Lily went to the park to play with her friends. She showed them her pretty necklace and they all admired it. Suddenly, Lily's friend Tommy said, "I have a joke to tell you!" Lily and her friends giggled as Tommy told his joke. Later that day, Lily went home and took off her necklace. She put it on her dresser and went to bed. The next morning, Lily woke up to find that her necklace was gone! She searched everywhere but couldn't find it. Just when she was about to give up, Tommy came over to play. He had a mischievous look on his face and said, "I have a surprise for you!" He handed Lily her necklace and said, "It was just a joke, I took it to play a trick on you!" Lily was so happy to have her necklace back and she learned that sometimes jokes can be fun, but it's important to always give things back to their owners.

John was a 3 year old boy who was very excited. He was going to celebrate his mom's birthday. He was excited because he was going to cast a special spell. John went around the room looking for something to use for his spell. He found a funny hat and he knew it was perfect. He put the hat on and said a special chant. Suddenly, the ground started to shake and the walls started to crack. John was scared by the sight and started to cry. Mom came in and asked John what had happened. John said he was trying to cast a spell to celebrate her birthday. Mom hugged him and said that spells weren't real. John seemed so sad and disappointed. Mom said they would celebrate her birthday in another way.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play outside in the grass and listen to the crickets chirp. One day, she found a cricket that was very slow and couldn't hop like the other crickets. Lily felt sad for the cricket and decided to take care of it.  She brought the cricket inside and gave it some water and food. Then, Lily asked her mom if they could bake some cookies for the cricket. Her mom said yes, so they started to mix the ingredients together. Lily loved to help her mom bake, especially when they got to use the big mixing bowl.  After they baked the cookies, they gave one to the cricket. The cricket loved it and started to chirp happily. Lily was so happy that she could help the slow cricket and make it feel better. From that day on, Lily would always listen to the cricket chirp and smile, knowing that she had helped a little creature in need.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Ellie. She was walking through a field full of beautiful, bright flowers when she came upon a strange sight. There, in the middle of the field, was a man holding a weapon. Ellie was scared at first, but then the man smiled at her and asked her to come closer. She felt a bit better and took a few steps closer to the man. He told her that he just wanted to relax, so Ellie decided to sit down and relax with him. The man's weapon was very big and it was very harsh. Ellie was still scared, but the man was very gentle with his weapon. He showed her how it worked and taught her how to make sure it was safe. Eventually, Ellie stopped feeling scared and started to enjoy her time with the man and his weapon. She learned a lot from her experience and when she went home, she felt a bit more relaxed.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Lucy who loved to chew. One day, Lucy was given a toy iron to play with but she wanted to chew it. Lucy's mom said, "No Lucy, you can't chew the toy iron, it's not food." But Lucy love to chew so much that she just couldn't resist. Lucy chewed the toy iron and it made her mouth very spicy. Her lips started to burn and she could taste the spicy iron in her mouth. She didn't like it and started to cry. Mama heard Lucy's cry and ran to help her. She soothed Lucy's mouth and gave her a yummy treat. Lucy was so happy to have something to chew that wasn't spicy.  From then on, Lucy knew that sometimes things were not meant to be chewed. She vowed to never chew something again that wasn't for eating.

Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a grumpy old man named Mr. Brown. He lived in a little house with his cat, Kitty. Mr. Brown did not like to talk to people. He only liked to count his numbers. One sunny day, a little girl named Lucy came to visit Mr. Brown. She knocked on his door and said, "Hello, Mr. Brown! Can I give you a big smile?" Mr. Brown opened the door and looked at Lucy. He did not say anything, but he showed her his numbers. Lucy liked the numbers and said, "Wow, Mr. Brown! You have so many numbers! Can you give me one?" Mr. Brown thought about it and then gave Lucy a number. Lucy was very happy and said, "Thank you, Mr. Brown!" After that day, Lucy would visit Mr. Brown and his cat, Kitty, every day. They would play with the numbers and laugh together. Mr. Brown was not grumpy anymore. He learned that giving made him happy. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl who was trying to find her way. She was walking along the path and she had a hard time because it was so tricky. She kept getting lost, so she had to struggle to try and find her way. Suddenly, she came across a big sign with a label on it. The label said “Home”. The little girl was so happy to see it! She started running towards the sign as fast as she could, but it was a long way away so she had to struggle to get there. When the little girl was almost there, she heard a loud noise. It was a clown! The clown was very loud, and it made the little girl a bit scared. But she was brave and kept going. Finally, after a lot of struggling, the little girl made it to the sign. When she read the label, she realized that the sign was telling her she was home. She felt so relieved that she was safe and in the right place!

Once there was a little girl who was lonely. She was so lonely that she didn't know what to do. One day, she started walking down the street. She kept walking until she came to a park. As she looked around the park, she noticed that she was the only one there. She felt so lonely, but she didn't want to go home. So she sat down, and she decided to remain. She stayed in the park for the whole day. As the sun went down, other kids started to arrive. They were laughing and playing, and she smiled to herself. She realised that she didn't have to be lonely; she could make friends. She said hello and soon the other kids were playing with her too. She was no longer alone, and she enjoyed the start of a new adventure.

Once upon a time, there was a bunny named Benny. Benny loved to bounce around in the grass. One day, Benny's mom gave him a task to find some carrots for dinner. Benny hopped along, looking for some tasty carrots. He saw a gray rock and thought it was a carrot, but it wasn't. Benny kept searching and finally found some yummy orange carrots. He was so happy that he bounced all the way back home to show his mom. She was proud of Benny for completing his task and finding the carrots. From that day on, Benny knew that if he worked hard and kept looking, he could find what he was looking for.

Once upon a time, there was a fierce bus. The bus always wanted to care for the people around it. Every day, the bus would take people to places they wanted to go. The bus was very friendly and kind to everyone. One day, a little girl walked up to the bus. She was only three years old and she was feeling very scared. But the bus saw her and smiled. It was happy to take care of her and make her feel safe. So the bus opened its doors and the little girl climbed on. Then, the bus drove her to a place that was very special. When they arrived, the little girl saw that all of her family was there to care for her. She felt so happy and she smiled and hugged the bus goodbye. From then on, every time she saw that fierce bus, she would remember how it had taken care of her and taken her to her special place.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy had a favorite blanket that he loved very much. He would take it with him everywhere he went. One day, Timmy's friend dared him to climb up a tall tree to get a toy that had gotten stuck up there. Timmy was scared, but he wanted to impress his friend, so he climbed up the tree. As he was climbing, Timmy's persistent friend kept urging him to go higher and higher. But suddenly, Timmy slipped and fell down from the tree. He hurt himself badly and had to go to the hospital. His favorite blanket was torn and ruined. The moral of the story is that it's not worth risking your safety or your favorite things just to impress others or to do something daring. It's important to be careful and think about the consequences of our actions.

Tom likes to play with his toy cars. He has many cars of different colors and sizes. He keeps them on a shelf in his room. Sometimes he takes them outside and makes roads in the dirt. One day, it rains a lot. Tom wants to play with his cars, but he cannot go outside. He is sad. He looks at his shelf and sees his cars. He has an idea. He takes some of his cars and puts them in the sink. He turns on the tap and makes a big puddle. He pretends that his cars are boats and they sail in the water. Tom has fun with his cars in the sink. He makes waves and splashes. He does not see that the water is spilling over the edge of the sink. The water soaks the floor and the rug. He does not hear his mom calling him for lunch. Mom comes to Tom's room and sees the mess. She is not happy. She turns off the tap and takes the cars out of the sink. She tells Tom that he has to clean up the water and the cars. She says that he cannot play with his cars in the sink anymore. She says that he can have a sweet treat after he cleans up. Tom is sorry. He helps mom clean up the water and the cars. He puts them back on the shelf. He says that he will not play with his cars in the sink again. He says that he loves his mom. Mom gives him a hug and a sweet treat. They go to the kitchen and have lunch. Tom is happy.

Once upon a time there was a little girl named Sophie. Sophie was very loyal to her friends, and would always help them if they were in trouble. One day, Sophie and her friends decided to go to a party at the circus. When they got there, they saw the most amazing clown! He was dressed in a funny hat and jumpsuit, and Sophie begged her friends to let her take a photo with the clown. So they all lined up and took photos with him. Just then, a big wind blew through the circus tent and the clown's hat broke off! Sophie was so sad, she wanted to help the clown. She started to look around for something to fix the hat so that he could look his best again. After searching for a bit, she found a piece of string. She quickly threaded it through the broken hat and tied it in a knot. Then she showed it to the clown and the clown smiled. The clown thanked Sophie for her help and said that she was the most loyal friend he had ever seen. Sophie was so happy and everyone at the circus had a great time for the rest of the day.

Once upon a time, a little girl named Bella went for a walk. She wanted to find something great. Bella walked and walked until she saw a big tree. Under the tree, she saw a box. She opened the box and found a magic wand inside. Bella picked up the magic wand and said, "I want to find more great things!" The wand made a sound and suddenly, Bella saw a big pile of toys. There were dolls, cars, and even a big teddy bear. Bella was so happy to find all these great toys. Bella played with the toys all day. She knew the magic wand helped her find great things. At the end of the day, Bella took the magic wand back to the big tree. She put it in the box and said, "Thank you, magic wand, for helping me find great things today." Bella went home with a big smile on her face, excited to tell her friends about her great day.

Once upon a time, there was a tall duck. He wanted to swim, but there was a wall in his way. He tried and tried to find a way to get over the wall. Finally, he spotted a tall tree. He waddled over and climbed to the top. From there, he could see over the wall. He jumped down and landed on the other side. Then, the tall duck spread his wings and started to swim. He swam and swam until he got tired. Then he hopped onto a big rock to take a rest. He watched the sun setting in the sky and then flew back home. From then on, he went swimming every day.

Today Mummy baked a turkey for lunch. The kitchen filled with the delicious smell of the bird as it cooked. She smiled and nodded when she tasted it - it was perfect. John was so excited. He had been waiting impatiently at the table for the turkey to be served. Mummy placed it in the middle of the table and John grinned. He nodded in approval. Mummy put some vegetables on John's plate but he wasn't interested. He only wanted turkey. He asked for more, and Mummy had no choice but to give it to him. John ate so much turkey that he was feeling a little bit spoiled. He burped and patted his tummy with satisfaction. Mummy smiled and shook her head - it was good to be a kid!

Lily was curious about the big box on the table. It had a red bow and a card that said "Happy Birthday, Lily!" She wanted to open it, but Mom said she had to wait until the party. Lily was sad. She wanted to see what was inside. She saw Dad with a camera in his hand. He was smiling and said, "I'm going to record your birthday, Lily. I want to capture all the fun and happy moments. Do you want to say something to the camera?" Lily nodded and ran to Dad. She looked at the camera and said, "Hi, camera! I'm Lily and I'm three years old today. I have a big box on the table and I don't know what's inside. I'm very curious. Maybe it's a toy or a book or a dress. What do you think, camera?" Dad laughed and said, "That's very good, Lily. You're a natural star. Maybe the camera knows what's in the box, but it won't tell you. You have to be patient and wait until the party. Then you can open it and see the surprise." Lily pouted and said, "But I don't want to wait. I want to open it now. Please, Dad, can I open it now?" Dad shook his head and said, "No, Lily, you can't. It's a rule. You have to wait until the party. Besides, Mom and your friends are coming soon. They want to see you open the box too. It will be more fun that way. Trust me, Lily, it will be worth the wait." Lily sighed and said, "Okay, Dad, I'll wait. But I'm still very curious. Can I at least touch the box?" Dad smiled and said, "Sure, you can touch the box. But don't shake it or tear it. Just feel it and guess what's inside. Maybe the box will give you a clue." Lily ran to the table and touched the box. It was big and heavy and hard. She wondered what it could be. She said, "Maybe it's a bike or a dollhouse or a drum. What do you think, camera?" The camera blinked and said, "Beep, beep, beep. I think you'll love it, Lily. Happy birthday!"

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys and run around outside with her friends. One day, Lily's mommy told her that they were going to have a great meeting with all of their family members. Lily was excited to see her cousins and grandparents, but she didn't know what a meeting was. Her mommy explained that it was a time for everyone to talk and solve any problems they might have. Lily thought that sounded important. At the meeting, Lily saw all of her family members and they talked about things like what they wanted to eat for dinner and where they wanted to go on vacation. They even solved a problem when Lily's little brother accidentally broke a toy. Lily felt happy that everyone was together and that they could solve problems together. She knew that family meetings were great and couldn't wait for the next one.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play pretend with her toys. One day, she pretended to be a doctor and her teddy bear was her patient. She gave him a check-up and found out he was sick.  Lily was worried about her teddy bear, but she knew it was important to take care of him. She gave him medicine and lots of cuddles. The result was that her teddy bear felt much better!  From that day on, Lily knew that pretending to be a doctor was an important job because it helped her teddy bear feel better. She continued to play pretend and help her toys whenever they needed it.

John sat on the furniture. His mom put him there to be quiet. He was bored, so he decided to explore. He saw something dull and brown. He was curious about why it was here and what it was. He asked his mom, "What is this?" His mom replied, "That's my chair. Don't touch it. It's very dull." John began to get frustrated. He wanted to explore, but his mom wouldn't let him. "Why can't I touch it?" he asked. His mom put her hand on his shoulder and said, "It might not look like much, but it's very special to me. It belonged to your grandfather." John was amazed. He sat there and thought about his grandfather and all the stories he heard about him. He knew he had to be careful with the furniture, so he gently touched it. He was glad his mom had let him explore after all.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Aumana. She loved to jump and was always so eager to do it.  One day, Aumana decided to go to the park. She was so excited when she saw the big slide. She jumped and jumped for hours!  Even more exciting was that the park had a yummy muffin stand. Aumana had never seen such big muffins before. As Aumana reached out to get one, she heard a funny noise. It sounded like a funny voice!  "Hey there! Don't forget to share your muffin," the voice said. Aumana turned around and saw a funny looking rabbit. She laughed.  "Oh Hello. Of course, I will share my muffin," Aumana smiled and the rabbit hopped away. Aumana ate her muffin with a huge smile on her face and continued jumping around the park the entire day.

Once upon a time, there was an old musician who wanted to go on an adventure. He began packing all of his belongings in a suitcase. The musician said to himself, "I need to pack my tunic and my guitar for the trip!" Suddenly, a bad rain started coming down outside. The musician looked out the window and said, "Oh no! I cannot go on an adventure in this bad weather!" He quickly packed away his suitcase and decided he would go another time when the weather was better.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Jack. Jack loved animals and he had a cow named Daisy. Daisy was a big and tall cow. One day, Jack couldn't find Daisy. He searched everywhere, but she was nowhere to be seen. Jack asked his mom and dad to help him search for Daisy. They searched the whole farm, but they couldn't find her. Jack was very sad and started to cry. Suddenly, they heard a loud "moo" and saw Daisy walking towards them. Jack was so happy to find his tall cow again and gave her a big hug.

Once upon a time there was a brave little girl. She had a sparkly bracelet with her name on it. One day, she went on an adventure and was having lots of fun. Suddenly, she saw a little puppy in danger. She wanted to help him, so she ran over. She couldn't pick it up, so she put her arms around it and squeezed. The puppy was safe! The little girl was so happy to have helped the pup that she forgot to check her bracelet. It was gone! She realised that when she had squeezed the puppy, her bracelet must have fallen off. She felt ashamed. But luckily, a kind man had seen what happened. He had picked up the bracelet and put it back on her wrist. She hugged him in a thankful squeeze and said goodbye. The little girl was now extra careful not to lose her bracelet ever again. Then she ran off to find more adventures!

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play outside in the sunshine. One day, Timmy's mom suggested that they go on a walk in the park. Timmy smiled and said, "Yes, please!" As they walked, Timmy saw a big black dog. He got scared and hid behind his mom. His mom told him not to be afraid and said that the dog was friendly. Timmy peeked out from behind his mom and saw that the dog was wagging its tail. He smiled and said, "Doggy, you're nice!" They continued their walk and saw a group of children playing. Timmy wanted to play with them, but he was shy. His mom suggested that he go say hello. Timmy took a deep breath and walked over to the children. They welcomed him with open arms and Timmy couldn't stop smiling. He had so much fun playing with his new friends. At the end of the day, Timmy was tired but happy. He hugged his mom and said, "Thank you for suggesting we go on a walk. I had so much fun and made new friends!" His mom smiled and said, "I'm glad you had a good time, Timmy."

Once upon a time, there was a little black cat. He was a very happy cat and he loved to explore. On one of his adventures, he stumbled upon a small heel, lying alone in the grass. He wanted to care for it and make it his own, so he decided to take it home. He brought it into the house and proudly showed it to his family. Everyone was very happy, but they warned him not to leave it lying around too often. They said if he was careful when handling it and put it away in a safe place, it would last longer. At first, the little black cat was a bit sad, but he saw how important it was to care for something he liked. He put away the heel every time he was done playing with it, and soon he was as happy as always. The little black cat learned a valuable lesson that day: when you care for something, it can last a long time.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a small village with her family. One day, Lily saw a new family move into the village. They looked very pale and tired from their long journey. Lily wanted to make the new family feel welcome, so she went to their house with a basket of fresh apples. She knocked on the door and said, "Hello! Welcome to our village! I brought you some apples to eat." The new family was very happy to meet Lily and thanked her for the apples. From that day on, Lily and the new family became good friends and played together every day. The village was now even more special with new friends to share it with.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved playing with his toys, especially his cars. One day, he got a new toy car that was really fast. He was so happy and played with it all day long.  But, Timmy's little sister, Lily, was jealous of his new toy. She wanted to play with it too, but Timmy didn't want to share.  Later that day, Timmy was playing with his toy car near the fridge when he accidentally dropped it. The toy car fell to the ground and broke into pieces. Timmy was sad and didn't know what to do.  Luckily, Lily saw what happened and wanted to help. She remembered that there was a magnet on the fridge that could pick up the broken pieces. She got the magnet and supported Timmy by helping him fix his toy car. Timmy was so happy and grateful for his little sister's help. From that day on, Timmy learned that sharing and being kind to others can make you feel better.

Lily was a little girl who liked to play pretend. She had a toy kitchen and a toy tea set. She liked to make tea and cookies for her stuffed animals. She would put them on a tray and carry them to the table. She would say, "Here you are, Mr. Bear. Here you are, Mrs. Bunny. Enjoy your tea and cookies." She would bow and smile. One day, Lily wanted to try something new. She went to the fridge and found some cheese. She thought cheese would be good with tea and cookies. She put some cheese on the tray and carried it to the table. She said, "Here you are, Mr. Bear. Here you are, Mrs. Bunny. Enjoy your cheese and cookies." She bowed and smiled. But Mr. Bear and Mrs. Bunny did not like cheese and cookies. They smelled the cheese and made a face. They said, "Yuck! This cheese is disgusting. It is old and moldy. We do not want to eat it. We want to eat fresh and yummy cookies." They pushed the tray away. Lily was sad and confused. She did not know that cheese could be old and moldy. She thought cheese was always good. She looked at the cheese and saw that it had green spots. She felt sick. She said, "I am sorry, Mr. Bear. I am sorry, Mrs. Bunny. I did not mean to give you disgusting cheese. I thought it was good cheese. I will throw it away and make you new cookies." She took the tray and went to the trash. She threw away the cheese and washed the tray. She made new cookies and put them on the tray. She carried them to the table. She said, "Here you are, Mr. Bear. Here you are, Mrs. Bunny. Enjoy your new cookies. They are fresh and yummy." She bowed and smiled. Mr. Bear and Mrs. Bunny were happy and grateful. They smelled the cookies and made a face. They said, "Mmm! These cookies are delicious. They are warm and sweet. We want to eat them. Thank you, Lily. You are a good friend." They pulled the tray closer. Lily was happy and proud. She had learned something new. She had learned that cheese could be old and moldy. She had learned that old and moldy cheese was disgusting. She had learned that fresh and yummy cookies were delicious. She had learned that her friends liked fresh and yummy cookies. She said, "You are welcome, Mr. Bear. You are welcome, Mrs. Bunny. You are my good friends. Let us have tea and cookies together." She sat down and joined them. They had a nice tea party.

Once upon a time, there was a bald dad and his beautiful daughter. Everyday, they went on walks together. One day, the dad told his daughter that if he closed his eyes and wished, he would receive a special surprise. The daughter was excited and joined her dad with her eyes closed. Breathlessly, the dad asked, "What do you wish for?" The daughter smiled and replied, "A puppy!" The dad smiled and opened his eyes, and when he looked down, there was indeed a puppy coming up to the daughter. "You can receive your puppy now," the dad said. The daughter and the puppy hugged each other and the dad was delighted. From then on, they went on their morning walks together as a happy bald dad, a beautiful daughter and a playful pup.

Once there was a monkey named Molly. She lived in a tall tree in the jungle. Molly was hungry, so she started looking for food. Suddenly, Molly saw a banana on a high branch. She was excited and quickly climbed up the tree. When she got to the top, she reached for the banana. Suddenly, there was a big roar! Molly looked down and saw a lion walking towards her. The lion warned Molly not to take the banana. It said that the banana belonged to him. Molly was scared and quickly climbed down the tree. She was relieved when she reached the ground safely. From then on, she always remembered to listen to the lion’s warnings.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to eat sweets and candies. One day, she went to the candy store with her mom. Lily looked at all the candies and chocolates with different colors and shapes. Her mom suggested that she should try a candy with a bumpy texture. Lily was not sure, but her mom said it might be tasty. Lily tried the candy and it was delicious! She loved the bumpy texture and the tasty flavor. She thanked her mom for suggesting it to her. From that day on, Lily always tried new candies with different textures and flavors.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sally. Sally liked to help her mom in the kitchen. One day, her mom asked her to carry a big jar of pepper to the table. Sally was very happy to help. Sally picked up the jar of pepper with her small hands. She walked slowly to the table, being very careful not to drop it. She felt so good because she was a big girl now, helping her mom. When she got to the table, Sally put the jar of pepper down. Her mom smiled at her and said, "Thank you, Sally! You did a very good job carrying the pepper." Sally was so proud of herself and gave her mom a big hug.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily went for a walk in the forest. It was very dark and she couldn't see very well. Suddenly, she stumbled over a big rock and fell down.  As she got up, she saw something shiny in the distance. She walked towards it and found a velvet ribbon lying on the ground. It was so soft and pretty, she decided to keep it.  Lily continued walking and soon she saw a little rabbit. It was also dark and the rabbit was scared. But when it saw Lily's velvet ribbon, it came out of its hiding place. Lily was happy to make a new friend and they walked together, enjoying the beauty of the forest.

Once upon a time, there was a young bird. The bird was delicate and had pretty feathers. One day, the bird was playing outside and got very dirty. The bird's mommy told it to wipe its feathers clean.  But the bird didn't listen and kept playing. Soon, the bird got sick because it was so dirty. Its mommy tried to help, but it was too late. The young bird died because it didn't listen to its mommy and take care of itself.  The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Timmy. Timmy loved to play in the park with his friends. One day, Timmy found a big box of cocoa buried in the ground. He was very excited and decided to share it with his friends.  Timmy's wise mother told him that cocoa was a special treat and should be enjoyed in moderation. So, Timmy and his friends shared the cocoa and had a wonderful time.  After they finished the cocoa, Timmy buried the empty box in the ground again. His friends thought he was silly, but Timmy knew that it was important to keep the park clean and tidy.  From that day on, Timmy and his friends always remembered to bury their trash and keep the park beautiful.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to help her mommy cook on the stove. One day, Lily's mommy told her they were going to the fair. Lily was so excited, she clapped her hands and said, "Yay!" At the fair, Lily saw a big, red balloon. She wanted it so badly, but her mommy said they couldn't afford it. Lily started to cry. Suddenly, a kind man walked up and gave Lily the balloon. She was so happy, she hugged him tight. Later that day, they went back home and started cooking dinner. Lily's mommy turned on the stove, but it didn't work. They tried and tried, but it just wouldn't turn on. Suddenly, Lily remembered the kind man at the fair and said, "Maybe he can help us!" They went back to the fair and found the man. He helped fix the stove and they all had a delicious dinner together.

Once upon a time, there was a baby. The baby was very small and cute. The baby loved to play with toys and eat oranges. One day, the baby's mommy wanted to wrap the baby in a warm blanket. The baby felt cozy and happy in the blanket. The blanket was orange and soft. The baby fell asleep in the blanket and had sweet dreams. The end.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved going to the museum with her mommy and daddy. One day, they went to see a big dinosaur exhibit. Lily was so excited to see the big bones, but she was also a little frightened.  As they walked through the exhibit, Lily saw a little boy who was trying to balance on one foot. She went up to him and asked, "What are you doing?" The boy said, "I'm trying to balance like a flamingo!"  Lily thought that was funny and tried to balance on one foot too. She wobbled a little bit, but then she found her balance. "Look, Mommy! I can balance like a flamingo!" she said. Her mommy and daddy smiled and said, "Good job, Lily!"  After they saw all the dinosaurs, they went to get ice cream. Lily told her mommy and daddy all about how she balanced like a flamingo. They were very proud of her. From that day on, Lily loved going to the museum and trying to balance like all the animals she saw there.

Once upon a time, there was a mom and dad who went to the store to buy some food for dinner. They bought some celery and some other yummy things. At home, the mom and dad started cooking dinner. They chopped the celery into small pieces, but some of the pieces were too small. The dad got angry, and he broke the celery into even smaller pieces. The mom said, “Let’s not spend too much time on the celery. We still have other food to cook.” So the dad put the pieces of broken celery into the pot. When dinner was ready, the family sat down and ate all the yummy food, including the celery. It was all delicious! The family had a happy dinner and everyone was satisfied. The mom and dad said, “Next time, let’s spend more time on the celery!”

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a doll named Rosie. Lily loved Rosie very much and played with her every day. One day, Lily went to the park with her mommy. She was playing on the swings when she heard a loud noise. It was an emergency! The ambulance came and took a lady to the hospital.  Lily was scared and didn't know what to do. She prayed for the lady to be okay. Her mommy told her that praying can help when you are feeling scared or sad. Lily felt better knowing that she did something to help.  When they got back home, Lily saw her friend playing with a new toy. She felt jealous because she wanted a new toy too. But then she remembered how she prayed for the lady and felt happy that she helped someone in need. From that day on, Lily learned that helping others is better than being jealous of them.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. One day, Lily was eating a yummy cookie when she felt a strange pain in her tooth. She screamed and her mommy came running to see what was wrong.  Lily's mommy looked at her tooth and saw that it was just a harmless little cavity. She told Lily that she needed to brush her teeth every day to keep them healthy.  Lily learned her lesson and started brushing her teeth every day. She never wanted to scream again because of a toothache! The end.

Once upon a time there was a mom and a dad who had a naughty little boy. He loved to run around and shout and that was not allowed. So one day the mommy told the boy not to do that anymore. But he did not listen. So the daddy got really mad. He said that the little boy must be punished. He gave the naughty boy a pipe. He said if he runs around and shouts again he will have to play this pipe for a whole day. The little boy was so sad. He said he would never do it again. But one day he forgot and ran around and shouted. So the daddy said he must play the pipe for a whole day. The little boy was very sad. He knew he had been naughty, but the punishment was too hard. He started to cry and the dad started to feel bad. That night, the mom and dad said they loved him and wouldn't punish him again. The little boy was very happy and he promised he'll never shout again. He played his pipe everyday, but now it was just for fun. He was happy again.

Once upon a time, there was a little seed. The seed was very small and brown. The seed was sad because it wanted to be a flower. One day, the seed was planted in the ground. It was covered with dirt and watered with rain.  Soon, the seed began to grow. It grew taller and taller until it became a plant. The plant had leaves and a stem. One day, the plant bloomed into a beautiful flower. The flower was pink and had a sweet smell.  The flower was happy, but then a grumpy bug came along. The bug wanted to eat the flower, but the flower had a shield. The shield was made of strong petals that protected the flower. The bug tried and tried, but it couldn't eat the flower. The flower was safe and happy once again.

One day, a little boy named Tim found a great big hat. It was so big that it was ten inches wide. Tim thought it would be fun to wear the hat. So, he put it on his head and went outside to play. While playing, Tim met his friend, Sue. Sue saw the hat and said, "Wow, Tim! That hat is great! Can I wear it too?" Tim smiled and said, "Sure, Sue! Let's take turns wearing the hat." So, they played together, taking turns wearing the big hat. As they played, more and more friends came to join them. They all wanted to wear the great big hat. They laughed and played, each taking a turn with the hat. At the end of the day, they were all happy and tired. Tim and his friends had so much fun wearing the great big hat together.

Once upon a time, there was a naughty little monkey called Jim. He lived in the jungle with his family. One day, Jim wanted to play with metal. He asked his mom, "Can I play with metal?". His mom said, "No, Jim. Metal is very dangerous and you could get hurt". Jim felt sad, but he was a good boy and he respected his mom's request.  Later, Jim's brother Billy came to play. He saw the metal and asked to play with it. Letting out a big sigh, Jimmy's mom said, "No Billy. I already told Jim that metal is very dangerous and you must not play with it".  But suddenly, the naughty Billy laughed playfully and ran off with the metal. Jimmy was shocked! He chased after his brother and said, "Billy, you have to put down the metal and listen to Mommy's request".  In the end, Billy heard his brother's request and put down the metal. Jim was so happy that his brother was now safe. He hugged Billy and smiled.

Once upon a time, a small boy was walking through the forest. Suddenly he heard a loud scream. He became scared and looked around for danger. He spotted a man with a spear, preparing to attack. The small boy shook and felt so scared. He could not move. The man with the spear stepped forward and said ‘What are you doing here?’ The small boy said ‘I’m looking for help!’ The man smiled and spoke kindly. ‘I can provide help’, he said. He put away his spear and led the small boy back to his village. Everyone in the village was so happy to see the small boy safe and sound. The man with the spear was welcomed as a hero. They thanked him for providing help and protection. The small boy smiled and felt safe again. He was no longer scared.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She lived in a house with her mommy and daddy. One day, Lily's mommy said, "Lily, today we will decorate our house for Easter." Lily was very excited and asked, "What is Easter?" Her mommy explained that Easter is a special day when we celebrate with eggs and bunnies. Lily and her mommy started to decorate the house with colorful eggs and cute bunnies. But then, they found a disgusting spider on the wall! Lily was scared, but her mommy said, "Don't worry, we'll take care of it." After they got rid of the spider, they continued to decorate the house. When they finished, Lily's house looked so beautiful and ready for Easter. Lily was so happy and couldn't wait for the Easter bunny to come and visit her.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved playing outside in the sunshine. One day, she went to the park and saw a big pile of filthy clothes. She wanted to help, so she started to fold them.  Suddenly, a mean dog came out of nowhere and scared her. She ran away and forgot her favorite toy. When she went back to get it, the dog was there again. This time, he bit her and she had to go to the hospital.  Lily was very sad and her parents were too. They wished they had gone to the park with her that day. From then on, Lily always made sure to have someone with her when she played outside.

Once upon a time, there was a little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to play outside in the meadow. One day, while playing, he saw a big, disgusting spider. Benny was scared and tried to escape, but he tripped and fell.  The spider started to crawl towards Benny, but then Benny had an idea. He rubbed his paws together really fast and made a loud noise. The spider got scared and ran away. Benny felt very proud of himself for being so clever.  From then on, whenever Benny saw something scary, he would rub his paws together and make a loud noise to scare it away. Benny never forgot how he escaped from the disgusting spider and always felt brave.

Once there was a little girl. She was always very flexible and loved to lay on the ground. One day, she saw something very interesting. It was a way that was just for her.  She decided to lay down on the way and have a rest. She was flexible enough to fit perfectly. She moved her body around to get comfy and relaxed.  She stayed there for a while with her eyes closed, feeling at peace. When she opened them, she noticed something very special. It was a beautiful rainbow. It filled the sky above her.  The little girl smiled and thanked the bright way for showing her such a beautiful sight. Then she lay there patiently to take in the beauty around her. When it was time, she got up and said goodbye to the way.  The little girl was glad that she had chosen to lay down on the way and was thankful for the beautiful rainbow she had seen.

Lily liked to play with her trumpet. It was a smooth toy that made loud noises when she blew into it. She liked to pretend she was in a band with her friends. She would march around the room and make music. One day, she took her trumpet to the park. She wanted to show it to her friends and play with them. But when she got there, she saw a big boy with a real trumpet. It was shiny and had buttons and a long tube. The boy was playing it very well. He made beautiful sounds that everyone liked. Lily felt sad. She thought her toy trumpet was not good enough. She thought the boy's trumpet was better. She wanted to have a real trumpet too. She walked up to the boy and asked him if she could try his trumpet. The boy looked at her and said no. He said it was his trumpet and he did not share. He said her toy trumpet was silly and she should go away. Lily felt angry. She did not like the boy. She thought he was mean and rude. She grabbed his trumpet and ran away. She thought she could keep it and play with it. She thought it belonged to her now. But the boy was faster. He chased after her and caught her. He took his trumpet back and shouted at her. He said she was a bad girl and a thief. He said she should never touch his trumpet again. He said it belonged to him and only him. Lily felt scared. She did not like the boy. She did not like his trumpet. She did not like the park. She wanted to go home. She ran to her mom and hugged her. She told her what happened and cried. Her mom comforted her and said it was okay. She said she was sorry the boy was mean to her. She said she was proud of her for playing with her toy trumpet. She said it was a special toy that belonged to her and only her. She said she loved her and her trumpet. Lily felt better. She liked her mom. She liked her toy trumpet. She liked to play with it. She did not care about the boy or his trumpet. She knew her toy trumpet was good enough. She knew it was smooth and loud and fun. She knew it was hers and she was happy.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She loved to play with her toys, especially her shiny magnet. One day, Lily's mom brought home a big box from the store. Lily was so excited to see what was inside. When they opened the box, Lily saw a beautiful glass vase. Her mom warned her that it was fragile and could break easily. Lily decided to put her magnet on top of the vase to make it look pretty. But as she walked away, she accidentally bumped into the table. Suddenly, the magnet flew off the vase and stuck to the fridge. Lily was sad that her plan didn't work out, but she was happy that the vase didn't break. From then on, Lily decided to be more careful with fragile things and found new ways to use her magnet.

Once upon a time there was a bald man who loved change. He was always looking for something new and exciting. One day he heard about a special event happening soon. He was so excited! He decided he must go to the event.  So, he packed his bag and made some food for the journey. He said goodbye to his family and started off on his way.  When the bald man arrived at the event, he was amazed. Everything had changed. There were so many new things to see and do. He met lots of new people and had an amazing time.  On the way home, the bald man thought about all the wonderful changes he had experienced. He was so happy and excited about everything he had seen.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl called Gina. She was so excited, because today she was going to the beach. On the way, she was looking for something to unlock. She passed a garden with a playful little rabbit, hopping around. Suddenly, she found a key, lying on the ground. Gina picked up the key and ran to the beach. She was so happy that she could unlock something there. On the beach, she saw lots of little shells and colourful fish swimming around in the sea. She quickly ran to the sea, ready to unlock an adventure.  Gina started exploring the beach, splashing in the water, building fun little castles and eating some delicious ice-cream. She had a very playful day at the beach and made lots of wonderful memories.  When the day was over, Gina went home with all of her new treasures. She was very excited to come back and have another fun adventure at the beach.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily who loved to explore. One day, she went for a walk in the forest and found a path that she had never seen before. She followed the path and soon came across a grumpy old man. "Hello, sir," said Lily. "Can you teach me about this path?" The grumpy old man replied, "I don't have time to teach you anything. This path is mine and you shouldn't be here." Lily was sad and didn't know what to do. She wanted to explore, but the grumpy old man wouldn't let her. Suddenly, she had an idea. "Sir, if you show me the way, I promise to be careful and not disturb anything," said Lily. The grumpy old man thought for a moment and then agreed to show her the way. As they walked, he taught her about the different plants and animals that lived in the forest. By the end of their journey, the grumpy old man wasn't so grumpy anymore and Lily had learned so much about the path she had discovered.

Once upon a time, there was a cute little bunny named Benny. Benny loved to eat apples. One day, he decided to invite his friends to a picnic in the park. He wanted to share his apples with them. Benny hopped to his friend Timmy's house and invited him to the picnic. Timmy was excited and said yes. Then, Benny went to his friend Sally's house and invited her too. Sally was happy and said she would bring some carrots. At the picnic, Benny and his friends ate apples and carrots. They played games and had fun. Benny was happy that he invited his friends to the picnic. He realized that sharing his apples made him feel good inside.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Lily. She had a pet cat named Mittens. Every day, Lily would feed Mittens some yummy cat food.  One day, Lily saw an ambulance driving down the street. She wondered where it was going. Her mom told her that sometimes when people get hurt or sick, the ambulance takes them to the hospital.  Later that day, Lily and Mittens were playing in the yard when they saw an ordinary bird fly by. Mittens tried to catch the bird, but it flew away too fast. Lily giggled and said, "Silly Mittens, you can't catch a bird!"
